This will reduce the prevalence of stunting, wasting and underweight by at least 4% over the 6 year period. This will contribute towards our MDGs targets by achieving a 43% reduction in childhood mortality (220/1000 live births to 125/1000 live births) in Nigeria.

The long term impact of this programme will increase access to reliable sources of clean energy for up to 100,000 households, 500,000 people and 100,000 small businesses

This contributes to our MDGs by helping developing countries to design more effective national policies that will better contribute to national development goals and poverty reduction.

title: GLOBAL OPEN KNOWLEDGE HUB (GOKH)
description: To contribute to the UK Governments Open Data initiative by developing a digital data hub, established by the Institute of Development Studies (IDS), that will make international development research more available, accessible and re-usable. Three knowledge and information services managed by IDS -  British Library for Development Studies, Eldis online portal and BRIDGE gender services - will input to, and draw content from, the hub so that it can be communicated to a variety of audiences across the world (e.g. researchers, policy-makers, development practitioners, journalists). Editorial support and technical innovations will enable partners (particularly those in the global South) to source and upload content into the hub and to draw out and present relevant content on their own websites. Success indicators include: increased use of IDSs knowledge and information services; the amount of content contained in the hub; and the number of partners uploading or drawing content

title: Reducing Maternal and Neonatal Deaths in Rural South Africa Through the Revitalisation of Primary Health Care
description: To reduce the Maternal Mortality Ratio, Child Mortality Ratio and Infant Mortality Ratio by strengthening the provision of Primary Health by the South African National Department of Health. This will contribute to a reduction of the 2009 baseline mortality ratios from 310 per 100,000 live births to 270 per 100,000 live births for maternal mortality,  56 live births per 1000 to 40 per 1000  live births for child mortality, and 40 per 1000 live births to 32 per live births for infant mortality in South Africa by April 2015. This contributes towards our MDGs by reducing the deaths of mothers and young children.

title: ICRC 2011 Appeal for Sudan
description: To address the needs of IDPs and host communities in the remote area of the Sudan-Chad border, through provision of emergency relief assistance (in the form of shelter and household items) where needed, but also includes early assistance for the re-establishment of livelihoods, water points and health facilities.

title: RedR: Improving the Effectiveness of Delivery of the Humanitarian Programme in Sudan
description: Humanitarian organisations able to operate safely in Darfur

title: Darfur Community Peace and Stability Fund (DCPSF II)
description: to create conditions to enable local-level stability, security, justice and social equity

title: Monitoring and analysis of the effect of protectionist policies on developing countries
description: To increase awareness of the impact of protectionist measures on Least Developing Countries, and increase their capacity to develop mitigating actions.

title: Trade Experts Group
description: To assess the current environment for trade and to recommend the priority political and regulatory steps needed to increase global trade flows in the short and medium term.

title: Iraq: Support to UNHCRs 2011 Refugee Response Plan in Syria
description: To provide vulnerable Iraqi refugees with life saving assistance.

title: Transforming Political Parties and Democratic Institutions
description: To achieve more effective, accountable and representative parliaments and political parties in the countries in which Westminster Foundation for Democracy works

title: Violence Against Women and Girls Overseas Champion
description: The Violence Against Women and Girls Champion will enhance the UK's bilateral and multilateral engagement on tackling violence against women and girls overseas.  The overarching focus of the role is to provide policy coherence and co-ordination across Whitehall departments on this important issue, and to represent the UK overseas.

title: Executive Masters Programme in Security Sector Management
description: To educate key Senior Civilian, police and military staff in Security Sector Management

title: Environmental Technology Innovation Prizes for Development
description: Conduct research into the potential of an innovation prize platform to create significant breakthrough in the sphere of the environment and development

title: Southern Sudan Education Programme
description: To increase access to primary and secondary education with a special focus on girls

title: Cyclone Giri Early Recovery Response
description: To resume livelihood security for the poorest and most vulnerable households affected by Cyclone Giri

title: Multi-agency response to Ivorian Refugee Crisis in Liberia
description: The UK will make an allocation of 8 million for humanitarian agencies to respond to the refugee crisis in Liberia.

title: Evidence Review of Environmental Innovation Prizes for Development
description: To conduct an independent review of the evidence base underlying innovation prizes, to anlaysetheir potential effectiveness and value for money as a tool to encourage innovation in environmental technologies for development.

title: DFID Secondees to the European Union (April 2011 to  March 2015)
description: To enhance the capacity of the European Union in policy analysis and programme management in key areas.  In addition it will provide support for stronger overall Evaluation and Monitoring of EU spend. The Programme will second 25-30 high calibre DFID staff to the European Commission and related organisations in Brussels and Luxembourg, EU delegations in developing countries, EU Presidencies, and to the European External Action Service (EEAS).

title: Tracking trends in Ethiopia's Civil Society Sector
description: Evidence-based dialogue concerning civil societys role, contribution and impact that informs policy and programming decisions of Government, the civil society sector and development partners

title: Khyber Pukhtunkhwa Education Sector Programme
description: To improve primary and secondary education in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa by providing up to 283.2 million in technical assistance, financial aid and infrastructure support which aims to benefit all primary and lower secondary children in the province by 2021. This programme targets primary enrolment specifically girl child enrolment and female literacy which contributes towards Sustainable Development Goals 4 and 5. The programme has supported on average 155,837 children (including 69,702 girls) since 2016 to gain a quality education, and indirectly benefits all 3.4 million  primary school children enrolled in public schools in the province. The programme also provided solar panels to public girls schools in some of the most underserved districts of southern KP, aiming to improve the learning environment of 67,500 school children in 620 primary and middle public schools in rural areas.

title: Match Funding for Comic Relief 2011
description: Greater numbers of poor and disadvantaged Africans are able to access health and education services

title: UN Women Transitional Funding
description: To provide initial transitional funding to UN Women management in advance of a strategic plan and budget being agreed by September 2011.

title: Libya Humanitarian Situation
description: To provide assistance for humanitarian needs arising from civil unrest in Libya.

title: Intensifying HIV Prevention in Zambia Programme
description: To prevent HIV infections and unwanted pregnancies by providing couples and women with integrated HIV and family planning counselling services. This will benefit 168,000 couples and 83,000 women by improving reproductive health.  This contributes towards Millennium Development Goal 6 by averting of 11,600 adult HIV infections, 2,300 perinatal HIV infections and 100,000 unwanted pregnancies by the end of 2016. (Nutsen)

title: Support for the establishment of Girl Hub
description: Girls at the centre of decisions, dialogue and action for development, equipped with resources and self-belief to achieve their potential (self-belief, knowledge, support networks, justice, services, livelihoods, assets) .

title: Scaling Up Access to Family Planning Services in Zambia
description: To improve access to family planning to reduce maternal mortality and enable women and girls to have choice and control over their sexual and reproductive health.  To support over 400,000 women to access contraception for the first time.  The programme emphasises working within the Government of Zambia system in provinces where unmet need is particularly high to ensure sustainability of results and embed improvements within existing systems.

title: Food and Agriculture Organisation: Support to the Emergency Food Cluster
description: To support FAO and WFP to successfully establish the Emergency Food Security Cluster, thus strengthening coordination of food security responses in humanitarian crisis situations.

title: Adolescent Girls Empowerment Programme
description: To improve sexual and reproductive health for poor and vulnerable adolescent girls in ZambiaTo improve gender equality by providing adolescent girls with social, financial and sexual and reproductive health knowledge and skills.  This will contribute towards MDG 3 and will result in 10,000 girls being empowered in rural and urban Zambia by 2017

title: Sanitation and Hygiene Programme in Zambia
description: To increase coverage of improved hygiene and sanitation for an additional 3 million people (NutSen)To increase use of toilets and handwashing by providing rural communities with hygiene and sanitation promotion.  This will benefit 5 million people and reduce water borne diseases. This programme aims to achieve MDG 7 target on sanitation coverage for Zambia by increasing use of improved toilets and will result in a 3% reduction in diarrhoea in children under 5 by 2015

title: End Child Marriage Programme
description: Preventing Child Marriage for at least 38,500 adolescent girls, and indirectly many more, in the East and West Gojam Zones of the Amhara Region of Ethiopia while supporting the Government of Ethiopia to develop a sustainable model to end Child Marriage that can be scaled up by government and development partners.

title: Strengthening Citizen Engagement in Mozambique
description: To increase citizen influence on the quality of health and education service delivery in four target provinces

title: World Health Organization (WHO) Consultative Expert Group on Research and Development Financing
description: Indentification of priority funding mechanisms to support health technology R&D focused on developing country health needs

title: Pro poor Growth Programme - Zimbabwe
description: To improve access to financial and business development services for small and medium sized enterprises and entrepreneurs working in agriculture, particularly through support to production, logistics, sales and marketing, capacity development and distribution.

title: Mobilisation for Development (M4D) Programme
description: To ensure service providers, particularly local governments are more accountable and responsive to citizens by improving the quality, accessibility and relevance of economic and social services to 650,000 people (of which at least 30,000 are adolescent girls) by 2018

title: Stabilisation Support to the Middle East Region
description: SU support to HMG Middle East Response

title: Yellow Fever Epidemic Response in Northern Uganda
description: Reduction of Case Fatality rate & interruption of the transmission of Yellow Fever in Uganda

title: Japan Earthquake and Tsunami response January 2010
description: To provide relief and support to the Japanese authorities in their response to the earthquake and tsunami.

title: St Helena Budgetary Aid from April 2011 through July 2011
description: To provide the Government of St. Helena with the minimum contribution possible to their budget in order that they may provide public services that meet the reasonable needs of the islanders, including maintaining maritime access, and to stimulate economic growth from April through July 2011.

title: UN Joint Programme on Gender Equality and Womens Empowerment
description: Greater institutional capacity of GOE and UN gender agencies to mainstream and work effectively on gender issues, such as violence against women and girls

title: Annual Assessed Contribution to Commonwealth Fund for Technical Cooperation - 2010-11
description: To enable the Commonwealth Fund for Technical Cooperation to play a more effective role in strengthening democracy and supporting development across the Commonwealth

title: Growth and Transformation Plan: Monitoring & Evaluation Pooled Fund
description: Improved capacity of the Central Statistical Agency (CSA) and Ministry of Finance and Economic Development (MOFED) to produce, analyse and disseminate evidence on poverty and other welfare outcomes

title: Kasumbu and Mpando Safe water supply, Sanitation and Hygiene Promotion Project
description: To improve poor people's health and development in Kasumbu and Mpando areas, Malawi

title: Sub National Governance (SNG) - Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Punjab
description: The Sub-National Governance programme (SNG) is DFID Pakistans flagship programme supporting public financial management, planning and local government reform in the provinces of Punjab and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP). It is a 38.1 million, 5 year programme from April 2013 to 2018.  It works in 12 districts, 6 in each province [Buner, Haripur, Nowshera, Dera Ismail Khan, Karak and Lakki Marwat in KP & Hafizabad, Mandi Bahuddin, Sheikhupura, Bahawalnagar, Sahiwal, and Vehari in Punjab]. This programme focuses on consolidating and embedding key reforms and building the capacity of government systems to take evidence-based decisions and improve health and education outcomes.

title: Peacebuilding Support to PCNA (PSP)
description: People benefitting from a more stable environment for achieving Millennium Development Goal (MDG) targets in KP and FATA

title: Assessed contribution to the United Nations Industrial Development Organisation to fund its 2011 and 2012 activities
description: Assessed contribution to the United Nations Industrial Development Organisation to help it to promote industrial development for poverty reduction, inclusive globalization and environmental sustainability

title: Voices for Change: Empowering Women and Adolescent Girls Programme
description: To strengthen the enabling environment for adolescent girls and womens empowerment in Nigeria by 2017.This will improve the lives of 120000 adolescent girls and women, resulting in greater inclusion of adolescent girls and women issues in political and governance processes and improved use of evidence in policy and practice.

title: Girls' Education Challenge (GEC) - help 1 million disadvantaged girls go to primary and secondary school
description: The Girls' Education Challenge will help up to a million of the worlds poorest girls to have an opportunity to improve their lives through education. The initiative calls on NGOs, charities and the private sector to find better ways of getting girls in school and ensuring they receive a quality of education to transform their future.

title: Montserrat Power Generation Improvement
description: Government of Montserrat  to provide an efficient secure and reliable electricity to the citizens of Montserrat

title: Support to improve Food Security for people living in Gaza in the Occupied Palestinian Territories
description: To reduce household poverty and improve food consumption for vulnerable Gazans

title: Promoting Low Carbon Development in Indonesia
description: A pipeline of projects developed that will demonstrate the viability of low carbon investment in Indonesia and which will then be funded by international and domestic capital.

title: Rwanda Education Sector Program
description: Equitable access to quality education that provides opportunities of livelihoods for all Rwandans

title: Education Fund for Sindh
description: To provide children in Sindh Province, Pakistan, with a minimum standard of literacy and numeracy through innovative and cost effective way to provide quality education at scale

title: Cotton Sector Development Programme
description: To raise the income of 360,000 small holder farmers in the rural lake zone of Tanzania by providing support to farmers and the Tanzania Cotton Board to increase cotton yields each year

title: Crown Agents Bank - Provision of Management, Administration and Banking Services for the Disbursement of Development Aid Funds.
description: Crown Agents financial aid banking

title: Rwanda East Africa Tertiary Scholarships
description: Increase in the number of university graduates (targeting young women and the disadvantaged) with critical skills available to join the Rwandan labour market

title: Civil Society Strengthening Programme
description: To enable local organisations and individuals to work cooperatively in order to address the needs and aspirations of Burmese people

title: National Statistical System Strengthening Tanzania
description: To enable Government of Tanzania to produce quality statistics that can be used to improve decision making and allocation of resources

title: Assistance to United Nations Access Coordination Unit in the Occupied Palestinian Territories.
description: Improved access and movement of humanitarian staff and goods throughout the Occupied Palestinian Territories

title: Increasing Access to Antimalarial drugs in Uganda
description: Increased number of people receiving appropriate malaria treatment within 24 hours

title: Family Planning Outreach Programme in Tanzania Phase I
description: To increase poor womens use of family planning through rural outreach

title: Delivering Reproductive Health Results Programme
description: To improve reproductive health and enable women in Punjab, Sindh, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) to exercise their right to choose whether, when and how many children they have.

title: VSO Strategic Grant Arrangement
description: To provide strategic mutually agreed funding to Voluntary Service Overseas in support of agree outcomes as identified in their Strategic Grant Performance Framework.

title: Governance of national responses to undernutrition - six case studies
description: This research will contribute to DFIDs effort to help government officials and decision makers in partner countries to effectively tackle the problem of maternal and child malnutrition. The study will look at the political economy of reducing malnutrition in six priority and strategic countries that feature medium and high levels of nutrition governance (the proposed countries are: Bangladesh, Brazil, Ethiopia, India, Peru and Nigeria).

title: Supporting peace and stability in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo
description: To promote peace and stability in eastern DRC and support the implementation of the regional Peace, Security and Cooperation Framework (PSCF)To promote peace and stability in eastern DRC and support the implementation of the regional Peace, Security and Cooperation Framework (PSCF). It will support national, multilateral and bilateral efforts over the next three to five years to end the cycles of conflict and build lasting peace at local, provincial, national and regional levels in the DRC.

title: International Committee of the Red Cross response to crisis affected people in the Ivory Coast
description: To reduce the impact of violence and the armed conflict on civilians and non-combatants in the Ivory Coast

title: Accelerating the Rise in Contraceptive Prevalence in Uganda
description: To increase the use of modern methods of contraception in Uganda through proven non-state sector family planning service delivery channels such as outreach services, social marketing and social franchising. This will enable over 430,000 additional Ugandan women to access family planning services between 2011 and 2015.

title: UN System Wide Evaluation
description: To generate constructive, evidence based discussions on options for new system-wide evaluation arrangements at UNGA 66.

title: Public Financial Management and Accountability in the Democratic Republic of Congo
description: To improve the use of public resources to deliver services that benefit the poor and make the Government of Democratic Republic of Congo more accountable by making the national expenditure process more efficient, enhancing external and internal controls on the use of public funds, and supporting four (pre 2015) provinces in managing their funds more effectively. This will benefit Democratic Republic of Congo citizens as a whole, and in particular the provinces of Equateur, Kasai Oriental, Kinshasa and North Kivu.

title: World Food Programme Emergency Assistance to Displaced Populations in Response to the Political Crisis in Cte dIvoire
description: To save lives and protect livelihoods in emergencies through provision of emergency food assistance to displaced populations and host communities in Ivory Coast, including nutrition programmes for malnourished children, women, and Anti-Retroviral Therapy clients.

title: UK Support to Increase Resilience to Natural Disasters in Nepal
description: UK support will build resilience in Nepal by strengthening national systems for disaster risk management and response, increasing community-based earthquake readiness and improving preparedness for a national and international emergency response.

title: Save the Children UK Emergency Assistance to Conflict Affected Children and their Families in Cote dIvoire
description: Humanitarian needs met of children and their families affected by the crisis in Ivory Coast

title: Caribbean Inclusive Growth Programme
description: Enhanced economic opportunities for disadvantaged groups (youth and women).

title: Guyana Agricultural Sector Diversification Programme
description: Increased aquaculture and (non-traditional) agricultural exports (into Caribbean, Europe and USA).

title: Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC): Legal Assistance to prevent demolitions and displacement in the OPTs
description: To provide legal aid to Palestinians in Area C, East Jerusalem and Gaza so that they are better able to uphold their Housing, Land and Property rights.  This will benefit some 14,600 people and reduce the number of demolitions of Palestinian property and displacement from East Jerusalem and Area C. This contributes towards our goals of maintaining the viability of a two state solution and reducing poverty and vulnerability of Palestinians.

title: Montserrat Budget Aid 2011/12
description: The minimum budget contribution to meet reasonable needs and stimulate economic growth is provided for 1 April 2011 to 31 March 2012

title: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs emergency response in Ivory Coast
description: To provide a timely, effective and principled humanitarian response to the situation in Ivory Coast

title: Action Against Hunger UK Emergency Assistance to the populations affected by post electoral violence in the West of Ivory Coast
description: Treat and prevent a degradation of the nutritional situation, and its underlying causes in the population affected by post electoral violence in Ivory Coast

title: DFID Nepal - Community Management of Severe Acute Malnutrition Evaluation
description: Measuring the Impact and Operational Feasibility of Community Management of Severe Acute Malnutrition Pilot in Nepal

title: Decentralisation Research in Sierra Leone
description: To assess whether District Councils have provided a more effective means of delivering development outcomes and responding to the needs of the poor.

title: Business Enabling Environment Programme  - Private Sector Led Growth
description: To improve service delivery of targeted government institutions by providing them with the capacity to streamline administrative procedures. This will transform the business environment nationwide and reduce the time and cost of doing business in Ghana This contributes towards our MDGs by increasing private investment and will result in the creation of economic opportunities for the poor by 2018.

title: Core Support to the UN Office of the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) 2011-2015
description: Core funding will help OCHA to provide leadership, co-ordination and strategic direction to international humanitarian responses. OCHA is the agency mandated to lead and co-ordinate international responses to humanitarian crises.

title: Support to the UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) 2011-2015
description: UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) responds effectively to the humanitarian needs of its persons of concernTo ensure that the UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) responds effectively to the humanitarian needs of its persons of concern

title: Core Support to the Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and  Recovery (GFDRR):  2011-2014
description: Provide Core Support to the Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR)To ensure that Communities at risk from natural disasters in GFDRR's 31 priority countries benefit from implementation of comprehensive disaster risk reduction programmes integrated into national strategiesProvide core support to the Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery to provide technical and financial assistance to developing countries to build their capacities to manage disaster risks, and to recover and reconstruct when a crisis hits.

title: Support to Vulnerable Children and Girls' Education in Mozambique
description: To increase the number of girls and vulnerable children in primary and secondary education

title: Health Sector Development Programme 2012 -2016
description: To increase the utilization of health services particularly by the poor; to accelerate the Health related MDGs by supporting the Ministry of Health with 33million  and two complimentary pilots with 3.5 from 2011/2 to 2015/16 . This will increase the number of women who give births with the assistance of a nurse or midwife by 55,000 and the number of women on family planning by 130,000 in 2015/16.

title: Support to the Public Procurement System in Mozambique (Central Procurement Agency)
description: To strengthen the Public Procurement System in Mozambique in order to achieve improved transparency and integrity

title: INTRAC M&E conference
description: Shared costs of INTRAC with CSD

title: General Budget Support 2012 - 2015 -UK support to the Government  of Ghanas Budget  to strengthen public institutions delivery of  improved services
description: To strengthen public institutions to deliver improved services which will benefit all Ghanaians. This contributes to the range of MDGs by supporting central government to finance and better manage public services by 2015

title: 2011/2 United Nations Humanitarian funding for Yemen
description: To provide life saving humanitarian assistance for Internally Displaced Persons, host communities and conflict affected populations in Yemen

title: Family Planning Commodities Programme
description: To increase uptake of injectables and implant contraceptives

title: Prevention of Malaria through the Procurement and Distribution of Insecticide Treated Bednets
description: Increased coverage of Long Lasting Insecticide Treated Nets in one or more regions of Ghana

title: Western Region Coastal Foundation
description: To establish a Coastal Foundation to provide a neutral body to facilitate and manage a structured dialogue between communities, government, and industry in the six coastal districts to build trust and address tensions caused by natural resource exploitation. The forum serves to increase transparency and to deepen accountability between stakeholders. The programme is also designed to make effective use of Corporate Social Responsibility funds of oil companies for development, conflict-prevention and growth. WRCF supports pilot and scaling-up of interventions and provides technical assistance and related services to industry-led corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiatives as well as government, development partner and donor funded socio-economic development initiatives.

title: Ghana Electoral Support Programme
description: To help Ghana's Democratic Institutions deliver free, fair and peaceful elections

title: KENYA HUMANITARIAN INTERVENTIONS 2011
description: To save lives, alleviate suffering, maintain dignity and enhance resilience

title: SOMALIA HUMANITARIAN INTERVENTIONS 2011
description: To meet the most urgent humanitarian needs of conflict and disaster affected populations. To save lives, maintain dignity and support the lives of vulnerable people in Somalia

title: National Food Fortification Programme
description: To reduce the prevalence of micronutrient deficiencies among the target population in Tanzania

title: Support for Malaria Control Programme
description: To provide long life insecticide treated bednets to ensure that Malaria is kept under control in Tanzania

title: Millennium Villages in Northern Ghana Evaluation
description: Improved understanding of the effectiveness of the MV integrated rural development model to reduce poverty and achieve the MDGs in Africa

title: Millennium Villages in Northern Ghana Accountable Grant for Implementation
description: Accelerated progress towards the Millennium Development Goals for up to 30,000 people in the Millennium Village site in West Mamprusi and the Builsa districts of Northern Ghana

title: Pitcairn Budgetary Aid 2011/12
description: The minimum budget contribution to meet reasonable needs and stimulate economic growth is provided for 1 April 2011 to 31 March 2012

title: Disaster Risk Reduction
description: To assist communities effected by natural disasters through providing a timely, well-co-ordinated and quality emergency response.

title: To increase security for Libyans with access to accountable justice through strengthening of the Ministry of Interior and the Police
description: To provide stabilisation support to Libya

title: Provincial Health and Nutrition Programme
description: To improve reproductive, maternal, new born and child health services to the population of Punjab (Pb) and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP), which comprises 70% of the total population in Pakistan.

title: Savannah Accelerated Development Authority Institutional Strengthening
description: To help ensure that SADA becomes a fully functional Regional Development Agency with the intellectual capacity, expertise and ability to mobilise resources to drive development and accelerate poverty reduction in the northern savannah.

title: Transforming Education in Pakistan
description: Transforming Education in Pakistan (TEP) uses political influence to increase the chances of a young boy or girl in Pakistan attending and staying in a good school and learning more.  TEP seeks to make education more politically relevant so that the elite, politicians and decision-makers prioritise education reform, acknowledge the education crisis and take meaningful steps to tackle it. These commitments help to secure DFIDs strategic investment in Pakistani education and in the long run, this will contribute to improved stability, governance and growth in Pakistan.

title: Contribution to UNICEF for urgent Measles control vaccination response in (Maniema) DRC
description: To contribute in reduced mortality and morbidity from measles among the under five and adolescent population

title: Girls - Participatory Approaches to Students Success (PASS) in Ghana
description: To increase participation and the quality of secondary education by providing disadvantaged girls with secondary level scholarships and Colleges of Education with targeted support to improve teacher education and management. This will benefit 81,000 girls and 38 Colleges of Education and improve gender parity and quality of teaching and learning. This contributes towards our MDGs by improving better access and gender parity by 2015

title: Enterprise and Assets Growth Programme
description: Improved Micro Small and Medium Enterprise access to appropriate financial services translating into higher economic benefits for state, and poor and marginalised groups, in Pakistan. EAGR programme will also contribute to the UK government commitment to respond to the challenges and opportunities of climate change by making green investments in SMEs within Pakistan which is an ODA eligible country.

title: Africa Regional Programme for Improved Empowerment and Accountability in Africa
description: To achieve stronger national and regional policy making and implementation through the influence of citizens and non state actors.

title: Progressio Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Progressio in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Malaria and Child Health Programme 2011 - 2015
description: To reduce child mortality by increasing availability of preventable malaria commodities, essential medicines and malaria treatment, and strengthen epidemic responseTo improve the survival of pregnant women and children under-5 years by providing key malaria prevention and treatment measures and strengthening the drug supply chain.   This will benefit 786,000 children and 180,000 pregnant women by reducing malaria prevalence. This will avert the deaths of 32,850 children under 5 by 2015 and contributes towards the achievement of Millennium Development Goals 4 and 5.

title: Transparency International Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Transparency International in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Operational Research Capacity Building
description: The overall impact of the project is to improve the health outcomes of poor people in the low income countries where the project is implemented. The long term outcomes are improved health programme performance and health service delivery. The medium term outcomes are increased use of research in health policy and practice, increased incorporation of operational research (OR) conducted by national personnel in programmes and a sustained capacity to mentor and retain skilled OR personnel. The short term outcomes are the increased amount of independently conducted, policy relevant operational research, the implementation of the findings of this research and improved routine monitoring and evaluation in health systems.

title: Caribbean Development Bank General Capital Increase
description: To Contribute to economic and social development in CDB developing member countries by providing loans for projects and programs that promote economic growth across the Caribbean region.

title: Improving Community Security Programme
description: To support the  police and conflict management in Kenya, to improve safety and security for women, girls, boys and men and their communities.

title: 2011 DAC/Arab High Level Forum
description: Effective and coordinated international support to political and economic change in north Africa and the wider region.

title: Girls' Education in South Sudan
description: To increase access and the capacity for Girls in South Sudan to stay in school and complete primary and secondary education by providing them with a broad package of support. This will benefit 240,000 girls, 300,000 boys and 2,600 schools. This contributes towards our MDGs by allowing more children to complete a full course of education and will result in improved learning outcomes, completion rates and a decrease in drop-out/repetition rates in all 10 states of South Sudan by the end of 2018.

title: South Sudan Textbook Project
description: Increased retention and reduced drop out of children in primary schools and clear policy direction for regular textbooks printing and distribution.

title: Custom Development & Trade Facilitation Support in  South Sudan
description: To provide an effective and transparent customs service at the border with Uganda and improve associated trade related institutions in South Sudan (Ministry of Trade, Bureau of Standards, as well as private and civil society organisations). The impact of the work is expected to be felt in an increase in the volume and value of dutiable trade, an increase in business confidence and investment and a decrease in the number of harmful products entering the country. This will benefit the people of South Sudan and will directly contribute to the 8th Millennium Develop Goal (Developing a Global Partnership for Development).

title: Overseas Development Institute Fellowship
description: To improve Government of South Sudan's capacity in executing its economic policy

title: ICRC 2012 Appeal for Sudan
description: To preserve the lives and dignity of victims of armed conflicts.

title: Water for Three States (Red Sea, Gadarif and Kassala)
description: To provide the people of Eastern Sudan with access to sustainable clean drinking water sources, improved sanitation facilities, and hygiene promotion by 2018. This will be achieved by implementing water and sanitation projects in selected rural areas of Gadaref, Kassala and Red Sea States and by designing a comprehensive and feasible plan for rehabilitation and expansion of Port Sudan water and sanitation systems. The programme contributes to the seventh Millennium Development Goal that is to ensure environmental sustainability by reducing the proportion of people without sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation. 40% ICF funding.

title: South Sudan Food Security and Livelihoods
description: Sustained increases in food security for up to 50000 households through increased food availability, access to food, improved nutrition and utilisation of food, stability of supply and fully functioning markets

title: UN Department of Political Affairs (DPA) - Multi-Year Appeal 2011-13, Libya and Yemen
description: To ensure timely responses to situations of potential violent conflict; effective and timely support to political missions in the field; enhanced capacity of Regional and sub-Regional Organizations; strengthened DPA capacity and expertise to address peace and security challenges more effectively; and enhanced capacity of stakeholders requesting electoral assistance to strengthen their democratic processes and prevent election-related violence

title: Malawi Agriculture Programme
description: To increase food security, reduce hunger and malnutrition and accelerate agricultural output growth in Malawi by providing affordable high quality maize and legume seeds to 1.4 million households (across the whole Government  programme, of which 945,000 households supported by DFID)To achieve a sustainable increase in agricultural productivity and production in Malawi (focused on maize, legumes and dairy).

title: Voluntary Services Overseas Programme in South Sudan
description: Support to the health and Education sectors

title: Elections Management and Security - Kenya
description: Election management, conflict and security institutions deliver transparent, inclusive elections, manage most disputes peacefully and reduce scale should violence occur

title: South African Partnership on Global Economic Governance
description: To strengthen the ability of the Government of South Africa (GoSA) to engage effectively on issues of global economic governance and development in international fora including the G20.To strengthen the ability of the Government of South Africa (GoSA) to engage effectively on issues of global economic governance and development in international fora including the G20.

title: Sudan Multi-Partner Trust Fund
description: To improve policies and mechanisms which protect the poor from the effects of an unstable macro-economic environment and reduce its impact on private sector growth in Sudan

title: Common Humanitarian Fund 2012
description: To ensure that critical humanitarian needs under 2012 UN Work plan are met

title: Evidence for HIV Prevention in Southern Africa (EHPSA)
description: To decrease the number of new HIV infections by providing policymakers in the Southern African region with improved evidence on effective means for HIV prevention. This will contribute towards our MDGs by reducing the burden of new HIV infections through strengthened evidence by end 2018.

title: Annual assessed contribution for 2011 and 2012 to the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO)
description: Delivery of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO) medium term strategy 2008-13.

title: Democracy and Stability Programme in Kyrgyz Republic and Tajikistan
description: Contribute to the greater stability of the region through encouraging democracy and combating conflict

title: Tanzania Climate Change Institutional Strengthening Programme
description: To improve Tanzania's access to climate finance and use it effectively to support climate change resilience and low carbon sustainable growth by securing international climate change funds both from multilaterals and bilaterals and by assessing targets annually which have been set in the National Climate Change Strategy.

title: Scaling up of the Energy and Environment Partnership with Southern and East Africa
description: Greater access to clean energy services achieved through fast tracking of renewable energy project demonstration and deployment, including through technology learning, donor coordination and private sector investment

title: Regional Transboundary Water Resources Programme - Phase 3
description: To improve governance of shared water resources in Southern Africa, by sustainably improving local water-management capability and supporting development of key water infrastructure. This will indirectly benefit populations in the 13 shared river basins of the SADC region, in which 95 million people reside, through more equitable sharing of water resources, reduced vulnerability to flooding, improved access to drinking water, as well as reducing risk of conflict and better food security. These outcomes will contribute to MDG 1 (Eradicate Extreme Poverty and Hunger) and MDG7 (Ensure Environmental Sustainability).

title: Climate Smart Agriculture in Africa
description: Improved knowledge, policies and longer-term incentives to drive increased uptake of Climate Smart Agriculture (CSA) in Eastern and Southern Africa member states.

title: Scaling up Renewable Energy Generation in South Africa

description: To provide strategic funding to Restless Development in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Sightsavers Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Sightsavers in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Delivering Increased Family Planning Across Rural Kenya
description: To increase the use of family planning in Kenya, especially to young and rural women, contribute to the countrys achievement of Millennium Development Goals and reduce maternal deaths.

title: Womankind Worldwide Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to Womankind in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Reducing Maternal and Newborn Deaths in Kenya
description: To avert 4000 maternal deaths and 5500 neonatal deaths through nationwide life saving skills training for health professionals, uninterrupted and sustainable clean energy systems, climate resilient water supply and infrastructure, and integrated health system strengthening in selected counties, 2013-2023

title: Private Sector Innovation Programme for Health
description: To improve the for-profit health market in Kenya, so that poor people get better value for money they spend on health.

title: Overseas Development Institute (ODI) Budget Strengthening Project
description: To support budget Strengthening initiative for the improvement of  Public Financial Management in South Sudan

title: Addressing Gender Based Violence in South Africa
description: At the outcome level, the programme will deliver a strengthened national response to prevent violence against women and children.

title: Strategic Climate Change Policy Fund
description: The purpose of the project is to enable the Government of South Africa to prioritise cost effective and beneficial climate-change mitigation policy measures and interventions that contribute to and support the country's positive deviation from the Green House Gas emission ''business as usual trajectoryThe purpose of the project is to enable the Government of South Africa to prioritise cost effective and beneficial climate-change mitigation policy measures and interventions that contribute to and support the country's positive deviation from the Green House Gas emission ''business as usual trajectory

title: Private Sector Energy Efficiency
description: To reduce energy consumption, avoid greenhouse gas emissions and increase investment in companies benefitting from the programme by providing remote advice and funding energy audits and strategies for South Africa businesses by 31 March 2015

title: Article 19 Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Article 19 in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework

title: International HIV/AIDS Alliance Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to International HIV/AIDS Alliance in support of the agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: 2011/2 International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) funding for Yemen
description: To reduce the number of deaths and the impact of violence, as well as to facilitate the return of IDPs to places of origin

title: Justice for Vulnerable Groups in Malawi
description: To provide support of up to 16m between December 2011 and November 2016 to Malawi through the Justice for Vulnerable Groups (JVG) programme, to community and district mechanisms that aim to  prevent violence against women and children and to strengthen the traditional and formal justice systems. This is to enable them to be more accountable and responsive to women, children and detainees.

title: Chatham House - Yemen Forum Phase II
description: To provide research and analysis of policy towards, and in, Yemen

title: ADD International Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to ADD in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Service Delivery Monitoring by Civil Society Programme
description: Healthcare and education improved as a result of citizens holding service providers to account for their performance

title: Statebuilding and Service Delivery Grant to the Palestinian Authority in the Occupied Palestinian Territories
description: To improve the Palestinian Authority's management of its financial systems and to provide better access to services for the Palestinian public.

title: 2011/2 Humanitarian Funding for International NGO Consortium in Yemen
description: To provide life saving humanitarian assistance for Internally Displaced Persons, host communities and conflicted affected populations in Yemen

title: HelpAge International Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to HelpAge International in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Gender, Growth and Labour Markets in Low Income Countries G2LM|LIC
description: The Gender, Growth and Labour Markets in Low Income Countries (G2LM|LIC)  programme aims to address the research gaps and generate and disseminate high-quality knowledge on the dynamics and opportunities for greater female participation in labour markets in Low Income Countries (LICs). This will lead to more informed policy debates and better evidence-based policy making on how to maximise employment opportunities for both men and women in LICs. In the long run, this will lead to more socially and economically empowered women, more efficient labour markets and more inclusive growth in LICs.

title: Livelihoods Resource Centre.
description: To advise and facilitate disemmination of research and experience on livelihoods and rural development, to developing countries, other donors and DFID.

title: Growth Dialogue - between senior policy makers in developing countries
description: The purpose of this project is to enable greater growth in DFIDs partner countries. The outcome of this programme will be that good economic policy ideas willl be spread and practiced among senior policy makers from developing countries.

title: Support to the Global Agriculture and Food Security Programme (GAFSP)
description: To improve agricultural productivity in developing countries and to increase farmers' access to markets whilst increasing the economic resilience of poor people  globally

title: Externally Funded Output (EFO) for Financial and Legal Sector Technical Assistance Programme (FLSTAP) restructuring
description: To accelerate the pace of implementation of the FLSTAP building on momentum gained since the mid-term review and initial extension of 18 months

title: Community Security and Justice - Part-Suspended
description: To deliver improved access to security and justice for men and women across in Ethiopia, building on existing government programmes and working with state institutions and local communities, resulting in 1.1 million women with improved access to security and justice

title: Market Shaping for Access to Safe, Effective and Affordable Health Commodities
description: To contribute to better access to essential commodities, improved health outcomes and greater value for money for priority health areas including HIV, TB, malaria, family planning, and vaccines. This is achieved by making health commodity markets work better to bring more low-cost, high-price manufacturers into markets and deliver greater competition, lower prices, faster rollout of new medicines, increased supply security, clearer demand visibility and enhanced incentives for innovation.

title: Gender Links Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Gender Links in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: West Africa Regional Food Markets Pilot Programme
description: The aim of the programme is to improve how regional food markets function by increasing the volume of food staples traded across two West African trade corridors (Ghana to Burkina Faso and Nigeria to Niger) so increasing food security, jobs and livelihoods in the region, and decreasing reliance on imports and susceptibility to food shortages and famine.

title: Regional Infrastructure Programme for Africa
description: To improve the quality of electricity, transport, water and telecommunications infrastructure for households and businesses across Africa.

title: Eastern and Southern Africa Staple Food Markets Programme
description: The programme  known as the FoodTrade Eastern and Southern Africa - aims to stimulate cross-border regional trade of staple food from surplus to deficit areas in Eastern and Southern Africa in order to benefit producers and consumers. The programme works with private sector and policy makers to improve the predictability of the rules regulating cross border trade in staple food, stimulate investments and support farmers to benefit from participation in regional supply chains.

title: Technical Advice to Government of Montserrat for management of the Clico International Life Insurance Limited (CLICO) insolvency
description: To provide technical advice in how best to manage the insolvencies of regional insurance companies, and in particular that of Clico International Life Insurance Limited (CLICO).

title: Increasing Economic Opportunities for Marginalised Youth in Northern Nigeria
description: The purpose of the project is to increase the economic opportunities available to marginalised groups in Northern Nigeria, increasing their productivity and earning power through skills training and addressing other constraints.

title: Market Development in the Niger Delta
description: The programme aims to increase the incomes of 150,000 poor people in the Niger Delta region of Nigeria, through improvement in performance and inclusiveness of key market sectors; raising beneficiaries incomes by between 40  50% by September 2018, of which 50% will be women

title: Montserrat 2011 Population and Housing Census
description: To provide accurate demographic and socio economic data for MontserratTo provide accurate demographic and socio economic data for Montserrat

title: Penal Reform International Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Penal Reform International in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Improving the Effectiveness of Budget Support in Tanzania
description: To strengthen the capacity and systems of the Government of Tanzania to ensure that spending delivers intended results, including that provided as budget support by development partners including DFID

title: Support for priority actions to operationalise the "Implementation Plan for Development Resilient to Climate Change in the Caribbean"
description: To increase regional, national and local climate adaptation measures for the vulnerable poor in the Caribbean.

title: Private Enterprise Programme Ethiopia
description: To support access to finance for small and medium sized businesses, especially those owned and run by women, and to support productivity and growth in the horticulture, leather and textiles sectors in order to raise incomes and create jobs.

title: Climate High-Level Investment Programme
description: To invest in activities which will build climate resilience and promote low carbon growth in Ethiopia. This will help 1.5 million people to cope with the effects of climate change by 2015, help Ethiopia to protect livelihoods, services, infrastructure and energy supplies from the effects of climate change, and establish its green growth path

title: Voluntary core funding to United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) 2011-15
description: To support the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) improve its results focus, efficiency and effectiveness and to successfully deliver programmes in countries. At the end of the 4 year funding period DFID expects UNFPA to be able to show evidence of progress being made against MDG 5, particularly in terms of improving access to sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR); a reduction in the number of women and adolescent girls dying as a consequence of pregnancy or childbirth complications; and, an increase in the availability of modern contraceptives for those couples and women who express an unmet need for family planning.

title: Voluntary Core Funding Support to the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) 2011-2015
description: Increased efficiency and effectiveness in the United Nations Development Programme for it to be able to successfully deliver results against the key areas of its mandate, e.g. on poverty reduction and governance as set out in its Strategic Plan by providing technical expertise and capacity-building. This will benefit the most vulnerable and impoverished people by the end of the funding period.

title: UNDP - Bureau for Crisis Prevention and Recovery (BCPR) - 2012-13
description: To improve UNDP delivery of crisis prevention and recovery activity.

title: Funding to Humanitarian Dialogue Centre
description: To improve the capacity of the Humanitarian Dialogue Centre to enable them to provide an  enhanced mediation service that will be able to respond more readily to  opportunities for brokering peace and to  increase the likelihood of preventing and resolving violent conflict through the enhanced provision of conflict mediation

title: UN Department of Political Affairs - core funding to Multi-Year Appeal (Phase 2)
description: To ensure timely responses to situations of potential violent conflict; effective and timely support to political missions in the field; enhanced capacity of Regional and sub-Regional Organisations; strengthened UN Department of Political Affairs (DPA) capacity and expertise to address peace and security challenges more effectively; and enhanced capacity of stakeholders requesting electoral assistance to strengthen their democratic processes and prevent election-related violence

title: Global Innovation Fund
description: To identify and support innovative solutions to development challenges which show proven, cost effective impacts that vastly exceed current practice.

title: Association for the Development of Education in Africa (ADEA) Support
description: Shared understanding, alignment and harmonisation of effective and coordinated action for tackling major challenges facing educational development in Africa

title: Enhancing Transparency, Accountability and Open Government 2012-14
description: The intended purpose is to increase the political and financial support globally for open government, transparency and accountability work.

title: Weather Risk Insurance for Small Farmers in the Caribbean
description: Establish the first parametric micro-insurance mechanism in the Caribbean to protect farmers against hurricanes and severe weather events

title: Independent Verification and Evaluation of a Pilot Project of Results Based Aid in the Education Sector in Ethiopia
description: Lesson learning and improved evidence base on how/whether Results Based Aid can increase aid effectiveness and results

title: Support to improve access to education in Gaza in the Occupied Palestinian Territories
description: To ensure improved access to United Nations human rights-based education for vulnerable refugee studentsTo ensure improved access to United Nations human rights-based education for vulnerable refugee students

title: Smart Health Care Facilities in the Caribbean
description: To improve the design and management of health care facilities in the Caribbean to reduce the impact on the environment and make it more resilence to then impact of climate change.To incorporate climate smart and disaster safety standards in health care facilities of the Caribbean.

title: CARE International UK Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Care UK in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Support for Indoor Residual Spraying in Malaria Endemic Areas in Kenya
description: To protect over 3.5 million people from malaria by conducting indoor insecticide spraying in high malaria transmission zones in Kenya. This will reduce deaths from malaria thus contributing to achievement of the Millennium Development Goals on reduced child mortality and reduced incidence of major diseases by 2015

title: Arid Lands Support Programme
description: To improve the coping strategies for over 500,000 of the poorest people in Northern Kenya (Turkana, Wajir, Mandera and Marsabit counties) to help them to adapt to climate change and improve their livelihoods.  The programme will also provide opportunities to support the poorest during drought, provide benefits for livestock insurance, increase average real value of assets owned by households, and will allow 64,000 beneficiaries to become less poor relative to non-beneficiaries in the four counties.

title: Ethical Trading Initiative Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Ethical Trading Initiative in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA logframe

title: WaterAid Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to WaterAid in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Support to WFP Emergency Relief Operations 2011
description: Provide relief food distributions for 1.38 million people and supplementary food for 329,000 children and pregnant and lactating mothers

title: Keeping Girls in School
description: Tackling the key factors causing girls to drop out of school and enabling more marginalised girls to stay in school longer and complete secondary school.

title: FARM-Africa Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic mutually agreed funding to FARM-Africa in support of agreed outcomes as identified in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Marie Stopes International Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Marie Stopes International in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Karonga Integrated Recovery Project
description: 'Provide improved housing, water and sanitation for the earthquake affected population

title: Evaluation of Empowerment & Accountability work and design stage only of evaluation of Gender work
description: Evidence-based programme design and implementation and policy development by DFID and other development organisations in the areas of  Girls and Women and Empowerment and Accountability.

title: Making All Voices Count: A Grand Challenge for Development Programme
description: To increase transparency and accountability between citizens and governments by improving relationships and making more opportunities for dialogue between them so that up to 6 million people in up to 14 DFID priority countries are directly helped to articulate their demands to government supported by technological innovations and scaled up interventions.

title: Support towards meeting the information and communication needs of people living in poverty with a particular emphasis on fragile states
description: To assist individuals, communities and governments in 14 target countries (with a focus on fragile states) be better informed and more engaged in tackling challenges in governance, health and coping with crises.

title: Making better use of Survey Data
description: Improve the accessibility and usability of existing survey data and to provide data producers with improved technical and methodological guidelines related to data collection and analysis.

title: Tax Gap Analyses in Kosovo
description: Clearer overview of existing tax regimes, the effectiveness of current revenue collection systems and procedures

title: Public Financial Management Technical Advisory Support Programme through World Bank Trust Fund
description: A DFID & World Bank Trust fund to provide technical advisory support to selected states of Nigeria for better public financial management systems through a World Bank Development Policy Operation Trust Fund.

title: Improved Trade Policy and Facilitation in Nigeria
description: To reduce barriers to non-oil trade by facilitating reforms in trade policy and administration. These will lead to lower prices of tradable goods leading to higher real incomes and economic development leading to job creation

title: Which programmes have worked best to improve incomes and food and nutrition security of African smallholders and how best to implement these approaches elsewhere on a large scale
description: To identify African smallholder programmes which have been successful in increasing incomes and improving food and nutrition security, can be increased in size and impact, and to promote their implementation at a large scale

title: Conflict Pool Funding
description: Support to the Government of Nepal and political parties through broader and sustained inclusive dialogue to finalise the policy documents on integration and rehabilitation, democratization of the army and national security policy and implement them by providing logistic, expertise and facilititation support to establish sustainable peace by resolving conflict.

title: Maternal and Newborn Child Health Zimbabwe
description: To improve the  health of women and children in Zimbabwe through increasing access to quality maternal,  neonatal and child health and nutrition services and reducing barriers to access for women and children.

title: DFID membership of the OECD Development Centre
description: UK Membership of the OECD Development Centre in 2011, 2012 and 2013

title: DFID voluntary contibutions to the DAC
description: DFID support to the 2011-2012 Programme of the OECD Development Assistance Committee

title: Sexual and Reproductive Health and HIV Prevention in Zimbabwe
description: To improve sexual and reproductive health among the poorest and most vulnerable population (in particular women and adolescent girls) and decreased HIV incidence

title: Zimbabwe Education Development Fund Phase II 2012 - 2019
description: To improve equitable access to good quality primary and secondary education for all children in Zimbabwe, by providing the education sector as a whole with technical and financial support. This will benefit over 3 million primary school pupils and over nine hundred thousand secondary schools pupils and will support the recovery of education sector from the near collapse in service delivery experienced during the economic crisis period of 2008-9. This contributes to the realisation of Global Goal 4 (all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education).

title: World Vision Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to World Vision UK in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Girls Education Project (GEP) Phase 3
description: Improved social and economic opportunity for girls

title: Practical Action Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Practical Action in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: LASER - Legal Assistance for Economic Reform
description: LASER works in 8 DFID partner countries to identify and help solve problems in commercial legal systems.  This should support improvements in the business environment and investment.  It will build an evidence base to inform how legal interventions to strengthen the business environment are done in future.

title: Investment Facility for UK Specialist Expertise (iFUSE)
description: To facilitate the mobilisation of specialist expertise from Other Government Departments (OGDs) to support DFID's objectives for improving investment climate in developing countries.  The project will do this by delivering high quality advice in a range of specialist investment climate reforms in response to partner government requests and by facilitating knowledge exchange activities.

title: Infrastructure Knowledge Programme
description: To invest  in processes to improve the quality and availability of infrastructure data.  A second set of activities will be to commission discrete workstreams in identified policy areas, to include: infrastructure in fragile states, value for money in infrastructure programmes, gender and infrastructure to support and inform donor infrastructure programmes.

title: Christian Aid Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Christian Aid in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Voices of the Poor
description: Post 2015 development framework is informed and shaped by the views and experiences of the world's poorest people

title: Cash Transfer Participatory Study
description: Cash transfer policy and programme design able to draw on robust qualitative research on the views and experiences of programme recipients in low income countries

title: Support to Family Planning in Malawi
description: To increase the coverage and use of effective family planning in Malawi by increasing access to family planning services to the rural, poor and young women;  and by procurement of family planning commodities. This will benefit 3.0 million people and  increase the national contraceptive rate (CPR) from 42% to 55% by 2018. This contributes towards our Global Goals by reducing Maternal mortality.

title: Kenya Essential Education Programme
description: To increase access, retention and improve the quality of education of 300,000 children in primary schools.  Contributing to 38,000 more children enrolled and staying in schools within the arid lands and urban slums, a 3% improvement in learning achievements in the early grades and a 10% reduction in teacher absenteeism by 2015. Activities will contribute to the MDGs of universal primary education and gender equity through improvements in the accessibility, affordability and quality of education for Kenyan children.To support  980,000 Kenyan children improve their reading and writing skills and 200,000 of the most marginalised children in Kenya to access better quality schools and to improve their ability to cope with the effects of climate change. Activities will contribute to the MDGs of universal primary education and gender equity through improvements in the accessibility, affordability and quality of education for Kenyan children

title: Reducing the Cholera Risk in Turks and Caicos Islands
description: Improved preparedness and  response capacity for cholera

title: Bangladesh Humanitarian Preparedness and Response
description: To save lives, alleviate suffering, maintain dignity and reduce risk amongst people affected by disasters in Bangladesh through direct humanitarian assistance and a better prepared humanitarian system.

title: WWF-UK Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to World Wildlife Fund UK in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Save the Children Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to Save the Children UK in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: ActionAid Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to ActionAid in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework

title: St Helena Budgetary Aid 2011/12
description: To provide the minimum budget contribution necessary to meet reasonable needs in St. Helena, including maintaining maritime access, and to stimulate economic growth from 1 August 2011 to 31 March 2012

title: ACCESS TO FAMILY PLANNING COMMODITIES
description: To ensure that women and men have access to a mix of quality contraceptives.

title: CAFOD Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to CAFOD in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Promoting Change and Value for Money in EU Development Policy
description: EDCSP will support DFIDs ability to make progress on improving the EUs focus on demonstrating results from its development programmes, delivering better value for money, greater transparency and clearer lines of accountability by providing a strong evidence base which will allow us to influence countries and organisations that do not share our results-focused agenda

title: Reducing Community Risk and Strengthening Disaster Response - Support to British Red Cross Working with Uganda Red Cross Society.
description: Increased effectiveness of Uganda Red Cross Society in disaster management

title: International Crisis Group (ICG)
description: To contribute at the international level to the prevention of potential conflicts, the settlement of current conflicts and the promotion of governance based on democratic values, human rights and the rule of law.

title: Framework for nutrition technical assistance (MQSUN)
description: This project aims to harness the specialist skills and capacity of non-government experts to maximise the quality and impact of programmes being scaled up to reduce undernutrition.

title: Nutrition Embedding Evaluation Project
description: To ensure that high-quality impact evaluation is integrated into nutrition programmes implemented by the Department for International Development and our partners

title: Developing Effective Private Education - Nigeria (DEEPEN)
description: To support improved learning outcomes for almost 1.5 million girls and boys in Lagos by providing technical assistance and supporting innovation for the private education market to improve the quality of education it provides to children, especially to poor children. This support will deliver the DFID 2012-2015 Business Plan commitment to expand access to and educational outcomes for poor children, including through low-cost private schools, in at least four countries.

title: UN Systems Evaluation
description: Independent, high quality review of UN System-wide evaluation, which facilitates dialogue and consensus on the best options for new arrangements

title: International Alert Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to International Alert in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Norwegian Refugee Council Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to Norwegian Refugee Council in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Support to improved water and sanitation in rural areas - Zimbabwe
description: Contribute to the reduction of morbidity and mortality due to water, sanitation and hygiene related diseases. To reduce burden of water collection on women and girls; to improve basic education and gender equality. The programme target areas where effects of climate change and variability such as droughts and floods have affected community access to safe drinking water. Specifically, the programme is (i) Increasing the number of water sources in affected areas through rehabilitating and drilling high yielding and perennial water sources, (ii) Installing more energy efficient and clean solar powered Piped water systems with water storage facilities to ensure constant water supply and efficient water demand management during periods of water stress, (iii) Promoting water conservation through constructing waste water collection troughs at water points for livestock and (iv) Working with district water and sanitation technicians to construct climate resilient infrastructure.

title: Financial Service Inclusion Programme
description: To improve access to Financial Services such as credit, savings accounts and insurance for 680,000 people in Uganda. This will contribute to MDG1 by enabling poor people to increase their incomes by investing in their businesses and to save or take insurance to protect themselves in the face of emergencies. The programme will work directly with banks, mobile operators and other financial institutions as well as with the Government to improve regulation

title: Women for Health (W4H) Programme
description: To improve the number and capacity of female health workers in six states in Northern Nigeria (Kano, Katsina, Jigawa, Zamfara, Yobe and Borno) while at the same time contributing to womens empowerment and gender equality in communities and institutions in the North. In the extension phase between April 2018 and October 2020, the programme is focusing on a building back better approach in the conflict and humanitarian areas in Yobe and Borno states and ensuring sustainability of the progress achieved over the last five years in Katsina, Kano, Jigawa and Zamfara. The extension is also facilitating institutionalisation of commitment by Federal agencies.

title: Support for the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC)
description: The United Nations Global Compact is an initiative for businesses that are committed to aligning their operations and strategies with ten universally accepted principles in the areas of human rights, labour, environment and anti-corruption. Through DFID support businesses will increasingly behave in ways which deliver financial success and development benefits

title: Health Insurance Programme
description: Poor women and children in Nigeria enabled to secure access to basic life saving maternal and child health services free at the point of use.

title: Punjab Education Support Programme II
description: Increased enrollment and improved learning outcomes, including literacy and numeracy, for girls and the most marginalized in primary and secondary schools of Punjab Province in Pakistan. All government school children (6 million primary, 4 million secondary) and children attending school through the Punjab Education Foundation (around 2.2 million), including 50% girls, will have benefited from UK support in Punjab by March 2021.

title: Kenya Market Assistance Programme (MAP)
description: To reduce poverty in Kenya by enabling poor people to benefit from better functioning markets, and by building greater awareness among influential decision makers of how markets can work better for the poor. This will increase household incomes of 148,000 small scale farmers and entrepreneurs - of whom 33% are women - by an average of over 20% by 2018. 36,000 jobs for women and 73,000 for men and male youth will also be created.

title: KOSOVO STATISTICAL AND ANALYTICAL CAPACITY BUILDING
description: The purpose is to foster open and evidence-based policymaking via regular interaction with government policymakers, civil society organizations, and the public

title: Malaria Consortium Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Malaria Consortium in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Conciliation Resources Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Conciliation Resources in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Asia Foundation Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Asia Foundation in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: South Sudan Rural Feeder Roads Project
description: To increase incomes and reduce food insecurity and malnutrition of the population in Northern and Western Bahr-el Ghazal and Warrap States of South Sudan by constructing 363km of feeder roads. This contributes towards our MDG of eradicating extreme poverty and hunger by increasing access to markets and state services for up to 28,000 households by 2018.To increase incomes and reduce food insecurity and malnutrition of the population in Northern and Western Bahr-el Ghazal and Warrap States of South Sudan by constructing 363km of feeder roads. This contributes towards our MDG of eradicating extreme poverty and hunger by increasing access to markets and state services for up to 28,000 households by 2018.To increase incomes and reduce food insecurity and malnutrition of the population in Northern and Western Bahr-el Ghazal and Warrap States of South Sudan by constructing 363km of feeder roads. This contributes towards our MDG of eradicating extreme poverty and hunger by increasing access to markets and state services for up to 28,000 households by 2018.To increase incomes and reduce food insecurity and malnutrition of the population in Northern and Western Bahr-el Ghazal and Warrap States of South Sudan by constructing 363km of feeder roads. This contributes towards our MDG of eradicating extreme poverty and hunger by increasing access to markets and state services for up to 28,000 households by 2018.
