title: Review of Impact of Sierra Leone Free Health Care Initiative
description: To produce evidence on the impact of the Free Health Care Initiative in decreasing illness and death in mothers, newborns and children.

title: Global Health Support Programme
description: To provide an effective contribution to global health policy and outcomes in line with international evidence based practice whilst promoting  better global health governance at strategic and policy level  by fostering a more effective working  partnership between the UK and  China.

title: Saferworld Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Saferworld in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: GlobalGiving: Mobilising UK public support to assist in the development of non-government organisations across the developing world
description: To enable GlobalGiving UK to establish a self financing model for mobilising ongoing public support for the work of developing world NGOs, using online technology and partnerships with the business sector.

title: Support to UNAIDS - 2011 to 2015
description: To support UNAIDS to improve its efficiency and effectiveness so that it can sustain global and country level progress in reducing HIV infection rates , increasing access to treatment and in addressing discrimination.To support UNAIDS to improve its efficiency and effectiveness so that it can sustain global and country level progress in reducing HIV infection rates , increasing access to treatment and in addressing discrimination.To support UNAIDS to improve its efficiency and effectiveness so that it can sustain global and country level progress in reducing HIV infection rates , increasing access to treatment and in addressing discrimination.

title: Voluntary Core Funding Support to the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) 2011-2015
description: To support United Nations Childrens Fund to improve its efficiency and effectiveness in the delivery of its development programmes and humanitarian assistance so that it can deliver results for children in more than 150 countries. This will contribute to the achievement of the MDGs relating to education, gender equality, child and maternal health, combating HIV / AIDS and malaria, and water and sanitation.

title: Support to the World Health Organisation (WHO) - 2011 to 2015
description: To support the World Health Organisation to improve its efficiency and effectiveness so that it will play a leadership and co-ordination role in global health and development, and will support country level efforts to improve health.

title: Developing a range of new designs and methods for impact evaluations
description: To produce a set of approaches suitable for impact evaluations of complex development projects

title: Strategic Impact Fund for the Occupied Palestinian Territories
description: To improve the quality of DFIDs and partners work in the Occupied Palestinian Territories by ensuring that resources are used to deliver high quality programmes, which improve the lives of Palestinian people and contribute to a two state solution.  To achieve this DFID will fund at least 12 small projects over 4 years until March 2015.  These projects will generate new evidence, new pilot studies and new ways of working which will strengthen the evidence base for DFID and partners programmes, improve DFIDs influencing ability with donors and the wider community and support innovation to drive improvements in project delivery and value for money.

title: Technical Assistance to Improve Efficiency of Health and Education Services to Palestinians' in the Occupied Palestinian Territories.
description: To improve the efficiency of the Palestinian Authority and the United Nations Relief and Works Agency's spending on health and education

title: Improving Reproductive, Maternal and Newborn Health in Sierra Leone
description: To improve awareness of, access to and uptake of family planning, reproductive maternal and newborn health services across Sierra Leone with a focus on young people.

title: Improving Access and Equity to the Basic Package of Essential Health Services in Sierra Leone
description: To reduce maternal and child mortality through improved equity and access to quality health care services for women and children in Sierra Leone

title: Voluntary core funding to the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN Women) - 2011 to 2015
description: DFIDs investment helps UN Women support partner countries to make greater progress on gender equality and womens empowerment. The agency plays a key role in our collective drive for womens rights, gender equality and  womens empowerment. Specific results which UK funding should help UN Women achieve include: 15 additional countries will adopt domestic violence laws and 12 new countries will adopt legislation on sexual violence by 2015; 75% of the countries in which the UN is providing support to national planning will include agreed gender equality priorities and budgets by 2017.

title: Support to the annual production of the Human Security Report Project
description: To improve access to evidence-based, human security related data and analysis by the policy and research communities, the media and the interested public.

title: Support to the extractive industries sector in Sierra Leone
description: To strengthen the regulatory and licensing framework in the extractive industries sector in Sierra Leone, and to establish the key institutions needed to improve governance of the sector

title: Jobs Measurement - assessing private sector contributions to job creation and poverty reduction
description: To develop meaningful indicators to assist in the measurement and impact of Wealth Creation programmes and to provide a stronger evidence base on job creation measurements including the widespread dissemination of results.

title: Supporting access to primary education for vulnerable children in Sierra Leone
description: To increase access to primary education by providing children in the most vulnerable communities in Sierra Leone with school feeding.  This will benefit 97,500 children each year for three years and improve enrolment and retention in school, particularly for girls.  The programme will contribute towards the MDGs by improving attainment in primary education and will contribute to the Operational Plan target of 24,200 children supported directly by DFID completing primary school by 2015.

title: Access to Health Care in the Democratic Republic of Congo
description: To provide increased coverage with essential reproductive, maternal and child health services in DFID-supported health zones. To increase coverage with essential health services in 52 DFID-supported health zones in five provinces (Nord Ubangi, Kasai-Centrale, Kasai, Maniema, Tshopo). This will benefit over 9 million Congolese citizens, and contributes towards achievement of MDGs through the delivery of services to improve reproductive, maternal and child health

title: Orissa Support to Urban Infrastructure (OSUI)
description: To improve the capacity of Urban Department and credit worthy municipalities to leverage private investments for improved and equitable urban basic services

title: Green Climate Fund
description: To increase the scale of climate change finance and support low-carbon, climate resilient growth in developing countries. The Green Climate Fund will finance projects and programmes in a range of developing countries, including the poorest and most vulnerable, through a range of financial instruments and terms designed to meet country priorities and needs. It will also leverage private finance in support of low-carbon, climate resilient development.

title: Avocats Sans Frontieres Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Avocats Sans Frontieres in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: ASSISTANCE FOR SOMALI REFUGEES AT DADAAB REFUGEE CAMP, KENYA
description: The most urgent humanitarian needs of the conflict and disasters affected populations are met, lives saved, dignity maintained and livelihoods protected

title: DFID Humanitarian and Emergency Operations Support Service
description: To enable DFID to deliver immediate humanitarian support that saves lives in response to countries afflicted by disasters and conflicts, and increase preparedness and resilience for potential humanitarian crises.

title: Mozambique Poverty Reduction Budget Support Technical Assistance
description: Budgetary resources adequate and used to support PARP (Poverty Reduction Action Plan) priorities ensuring better services and broad and sustainable inclusive economic growth for the people of Mozambique

title: DFID India - Programme for Strengthening Evaluation
description: To strengthen the impact of DFID's work in India by learning lessons from past projects and generating evidence for design of new work.

title: Investments in Forests and Sustainable Land Use
description: To support public-private partnerships that demonstrate how companies, communities, smallholders and governments can work collaboratively to reduce deforestation and benefit forest dependent communities

title: Uganda Budget Support - This project has been indefinitely suspended
description: To improve the delivery of public services by providing general and health sector budget support needed to help attain growth and poverty reduction, and to deliver quality health services to 940, 600 people (102,700 more births attended by skilled workers, 124,700 children immunised and 713,200 children receive malaria treatment) in Uganda.  This will contribute to the achievement of the MDGs by increasing efficient and equitable use of oil and domestic revenues especially those related to health, education and water by 2015.

title: Support to International Agriculture Research Centres that benefits Poor People
description: Following a process of prioritisation of support to International Centres, we will move from annual allocations to 3 year funding to support the provision of public goods that benefit poor people.

title: Zoonoses and Emerging Livestock Systems: reducing the risk to livestock and people
description: ZELS will reduce the impact of zoonotic diseases on poor people in developing countries and build the capacity of the research community to respond to emerging threats globally.  This will be achieved through improved and/or new rapid fields tests, drugs, vaccines, and control interventions (i.e. reporting, surveillance, disease control), including identification of policies (e.g. animal health, public health, and environment) and institutional changes with the potential to decrease the risk of zoonoses both developing in animals and being transmitted to humans.

title: Water supply, sanitation and hygiene in rural schools, clinics and communities in 6 districts of Sierra Leone
description: To enhance key sustainable practices of sanitation and hygiene behaviours in six targeted districts in Sierra Leone.  This will reduce morbidity and mortality rates associated with incidence of water and excreta-related diseases.

title: Water supply, sanitation and hygiene in Freetown, Sierra Leone
description: To increase sustainable access to improved water, sanitation and hygiene services for residents in 51 city sections, including improving hygiene facilities in 200 schools, community health centres and peripheral health units in targeted areas in Freetown and the Western Area Rural District contributing to local and national pro-poor water, sanitation and hygiene development planning and policy framework.

title: Plan UK Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Plan UK in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Essential Water Treatment Chemicals
description: Reduce the number of people at risk from cholera by providing access to safe water

title: Oxfam Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to Oxfam in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Addressing Drug Resistant Malaria in Burma
description: To improve access to high quality treatment for malaria by replacing sub-standard drugs in the private sector

title: Supporting Indian Trade and Investment for Africa
description: This project will support increased African exports to the large and growing emerging market of India. It will also help African businesses to strengthen their productive capacity and competitiveness, thereby moving away from unprocessed primary commodities, which dont earn much. The project will operate in Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda and Rwanda. Together with African and Indian businesses, the implementer International Trade Centre (ITC) will carefully select a number of labour-intensive goods  for example leather, textiles, cotton, pulses  and tackle the problems that are holding back these goods from being sold in the Indian market. The project will be flexible and address the problems that are holding back exports to India: for example, it will provide market information, technical support, skills training, branding and investment. The project will tap into the large pool of Indian technical expertise and transfer some of this expertise to Africa.To support increased Afric

title: Knowledge Partnership Programme (KPP)
description: To deliver better results on global public goods and development priorities in low income countries though evidence-building and knowledge-sharing on development issues with IndiaTo generate evidence to inform policy on climate change and resource scarcity; growth and trade; health and disease control; and women; in order to improve the lives of the poorest people in India, South Asia and globallyAnalysis / Knowledge Products generated by the programme are used in designing / improving / enhancing development policy / programmes / practices in India & Developing CountriesTo strengthen development policies, programmes and practices in developing countries through generation and dissemination of knowledge using Indian expertise.

title: Global Research Partnership Programme (GRP)
description: To build a new UK-India research partnership with developing country researchers to deliver evidence-informed solutions for global development challenges on health, food and women.

title: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research Bangladesh (ICDDR,B Grant 2012-17)
description: To develop and deliver through research, cost effective solutions to major health, population and nutrition problems of poor people, both in Bangladesh and internationally.

title: Alliance for Health Policy and Systems Research 2011 - 2016
description: To improve maternal/child health services and reduce the burden of HIV/AIDS malaria and other diseases, by increasing the generation and use of health policy and systems research

title: Strengthening Tanzania Anti Corruption Action - STACA
description: To improve the performance of Tanzanian Institutions most directly involved in tackling corruption, to help them to work more effectively together on the identification and handling of corruption risks and cases, and to address corruption in the police and judiciary.To improve the performance of Tanzanian Institutions most directly involved in tackling corruption, by helping them to work together more effectively on detection and handling of corruption risks and cases, and to address internal corruption issues, especially in the Police and Judiciary. By 2015, the programme intends to reduce the impact of corruption both on poor households and on national revenue and growth.

title: South Asia Water Governance Programme (SAWGP)
description: To improve the management of water within and between South Asian countries, reducing poverty by enabling adaptation to climate change and reducing the risk of conflict over water resources. By 2018, 500 million people living in river basins will benefit from improved water management by reducing their risk of exposure to flooding and drought and enhancing regional security by improving cooperation between governments

title: International Standards for Mining
description: To ensure that UK engagement on international standard setting for mining represents value for money - by doing an assessment of the likely impact of implementing different standards so that we focus resources on supporting international standards which can best help deliver economic growth and poverty reduction in developing countries.

title: Medicines Transparency Alliance (MeTA)
description: Medicines procurement, pricing, distribution and other policies and practices are changed on the basis of a multi-stakeholder review of robust evidenceTo improve access to medicines by providing medicines stakeholders with guidance on medicines procurement, pricing, distribution and other policies and practices. This will deliver efficiency savings of 5-10% per annum, in public expenditure on medicines, estimated to be 18m to 36m across the 7 pilot countries. We estimate that access to medicines could increase by up to 105 in participating countries over 4 years. This contributes to our MDG 8 target 17 to provide access to affordable essential drugs in developing countries.

title: GAIN Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to GAIN in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: ASIA REGIONAL ANTI-TRAFFICKING  PROGRAMME - PILOT PROGRAMME
description: To reduce the incidence of people trafficking for garment and domestic work among adolescent girls and women from Bangladesh, India, and Nepal

title: World Bank Economic Governance Programme
description: Increase Value for Money from Procurement practices in Public Financial Management

title: British Red Cross Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to British Red Cross in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Working in Partnership to Accelerate Agriculture Technology Transfer
description: To increase food production enhance capacity of agricultural practitioners in low income countries to develop creative solutions to affordable, adequate and safe food supply

title: Anti-corruption Strategic Fund
description: Active and aware stakeholders bring pressure by working together with a more responsive Government to better tackle corruption

title: Developing a coherent humanitarian and resilience framework
description: Developing a coherent humanitarian and resilience indicator framework

title: United Kingdom National Commission for UNESCO (United Nations Educational,Scientific and Cultural Organisation)
description: To enable Her Majesty's Government to maximise the potential value for money of UNESCO's work.

title: Assessment of Learning Outcomes
description: Assessment of Learning Outcomes in DFID Supported Basic Education in China.

title: MapAction Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to MAP Action in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: LOW BIRTH WEIGHT IN SOUTH ASIA TRIAL
description: To generate evidence of effective approaches to reducing maternal and neontal malnutriotion that can be used to improve nutrition policies and programming

title: Improving governance of Land Use, Land-Use Change and Forestry in Indonesia
description: To improve governance of land use, land use change and forestry in Indonesia

title: Bridging Support between Multi-stakeholder Forestry Programme 2 and Multi-stakeholder Forestry Programme 3
description: Credible Timber Legality Assurance System (TLAS) that is recognised by the market as a contribution to meeting  an overall goal in which all traded Indonesian timber can be demonstrated legal, as a precondition for effective forest governance, sustainable forest management.

title: Support to Preparatory Process for UN Framework Convention on Climate Change Conference of Parties 17
description: Reduction in global emissions as result of deal agreed at Durban

title: Supporting Integrated Water Resource Management in Developing Countries
description: Improved water resources management and water saving practices in selected developing countries through improved South-South cooperation using Chinese expertise

title: Democratic Governance Facility- Deepening Democracy Phase II component
description: More pluralistic, representative and accountable governance based on democratic values, institutions and processes in Uganda

title: Protecting the progress on the Millennium Development Goals against the threats of a changing climate and ensuring DFID capitalise on opportunities
description: Climate smart is an organisational wide change programme (under design ) in DFID to ensure that all DFID  investments and operations in all sectors are climate resilient and consider climate mitigation opportunities. This will be underpinned by strong leadership and aligned business processes.

title: Support to Somali Refugees in Ethiopia
description: Provision of life saving support to refugee population in South East Ethiopia

title: Nutrition Assistance to Karamoja 2011-2012
description: To reduce the number of preventable deaths among children under 5 in Karamoja region of Uganda

title: Joint Health and Nutrition Programme
description: To increase utilisation of reproductive, maternal and child health and nutrition services in Somalia by strengthening the national health systems. This will benefit around 3.4 million people, including 700,000 children <5yrs, 200,000 pregnant women, 135,000 breastfeeding women. This contributes towards our MDGs by improving human development outcomes and will result in reduced; maternal mortality (10%), child mortality (15%) and underweight children (10%) by March 2016.

title: Overseas Development Institute - Provision of thematic analysis and advice
description: The purpose of the project is to generate improved evidence and analysis for managing risk and resilience from The Overseas Development Institute over the period of the grant. This both represents a Global Public Good and will inform better policy - making.

title: Inter-American Development Bank (IADB) Fund for Special Operations
description: Reconstruction assistance and debt relief to Haiti following the earthquake in January 2010.

title: Adaptation for Smallholder Agricultural Programme (ASAP)
description: To provide knowledge and best practices to help over 6 million smallholder farmers in up to 43 countries adapt to climate change. Grants will be made to: build small scale water-harvesting, water storage and irrigation systems for farmers; provide farmers with improved seeds that are drought tolerant; help farmers access markets to sell their crops; to plant trees on farms and introduce soil and water conservation practices; and, enable farmers to access daily and seasonal weather forecasts (e.g. using text messages) so they know when best to plant and harvest crops.

title: Coordinated Country Case Studies - Innovation and Growth
description: To strengthen the evidence base and policy making on productivity and innovation issues in low-income countries

title: Adolescent Reproductive Health in Ghana
description: To improve the knowledge and behaviour around reproductive health of adolescents in Ghana by providing reproductive health information to young people in and out of schools. This will benefit approximately 400,000 of the adolescent population, generating evidence that will allow scale up of cost-effective adolescent reproductive interventions.

title: Centre For Global Development -  Provision of thematic analysis and advice
description: The purpose of the project is to secure high quality policy support and advice from The Centre For Global Development, resulting in improved effectiveness in the international aid system. This will better inform policy - making in DFID and be of use, more broadly, to the global development community.

title: Community Security and Small Arms Control (CSAC) Extension
description: To provide improved security, governance and Rule of Law in South Sudans most conflict prone counties. Specifically, these funds will be invested in: A) Design and delivery of Conflict Sensitive Development Projects (CSDPs) in Lakes State, B) Consolidation of peace-building and conflict resolution in Jonglei and Lakes States, C) Building of state and national level capacity for the Southern Sudan Bureau for Community Security and Small arms Control (SSBCSSAC), D) Development and implementation of a national small arms policy framework.To improve community security in Jonglei State, establish partnerships between local and traditional authorities to address disputes in Lakes and Jonglei States and support the Bureau of Community Security and Small Arms Control to roll out a nation-wide public information campaign.

title: Support effective monitoring and evaluation of the International Climate Fund
description: To effectively monitor and evaluate the work of the International Climate Fund (ICF)

title: Unlocking the Geothermal Potential of Montserrat
description: To support the development of geothermal energy in Montserrat, by undertaking the exploratory drilling and testing of 3 geothermal wells.

title: Quality Reproductive Health Medicines
description: Improving reproductive health commodity security in less developed countries with the majority of the impact taking place in Sub Saharan Africa.

title: Strengthening the evidence base for the Rio+20 UN Conference on Sustainable Development
description: To ensure that developing country issues and interests form a key strand of the message from the scientific community to the Rio+20 UN Conference on Sustainable Development, with special emphasis on what it will take to make food, energy and water accessible to an expected world population of 9 billion people.

title: Somalia Aid Enablers Programme
description: To Strengthen Aid Effectiveness and Co-ordination for SomaliaTo strengthen Aid Effectiveness and Co-ordination for SomaliaTo strengthen Aid Effectiveness and Co-ordination for Somalia by supporting the UN, thereby improving results, monitoring and the impact of the humanitarian response and development assistance to Somalia

title: Development Initiatives Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic  funding to Development Iniatives in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: CDA Collaborative Learning Projects Project Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to CDA Collaborative Learning Projects in support of agreed outcomes in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Institute Of Development Studies   Provision of thematic analysis and advice
description: Provision of thematic analysis and advice by The Institute Of Development Studies.Provision of thematic analysis and advice by The Institute Of Development Studies.

title: Inter-American Development Bank - General Capital Increase IX
description: To enable the IADB to increase its loans to countries and private sector organisations in the Latin America and Caribbean region, supporting economic growth

title: Programme Design for Spatial Planning and Low Carbon Development in Papua
description: To improve Papua government capacity to implement spatial planning and low carbon development by providing technical assistance, while designing the comprehensive programme. This contributes towards the protection of 35,000 hectares forest in Papua province by 2015.

title: Rapid Response Facility on Climate Change
description: To influence climate change policy in Indonesia by providing technical expertise to a range of government and non-government partners who are directly responsible or play a role in shaping policies and practices to help Indonesia meet its emission reduction targets.

title: International Institute For Environment and Development: Provision of thematic analysis and advice
description: The purpose of the project is to secure high quality policy support and advice from one of the world's leading think - tanks on climate, environment and development. This will better inform policy making in DFID and be of use, more broadly, to the global development community.

title: Private Enterprise Development in Low Income Countries (PEDL)
description: To improve economic policy-making in Low Income Countries (LICs) by providing policy-makers with a body of high-quality evidence about private enterprise development. (There is currently little good-quality evidence on this theme which is relevant to LICs.)  Policies based on this evidence are expected to improve the business environment for private enterprise, leading to the emergence of more and larger firms, thus creating more and better jobs.

title: Integrated Community Case Management (Child Survival)
description: To support to the roll out and extension of the Ministry of Healths (MoH) community based management of malaria, pneumonia and diarrhoea programme

title: Private Sector Development 2
description: To contribute to establishment of a sustainable dialogue on private sector policy and business environment reforms between the Government of Kosovo and the Kosovo private sector

title: Tanzania Land Programme
description: Implementing commitments made jointlty by the G8 and the United Republic of Tanzania  to deliver a detailed road map for land reforms in Tanzania

title: Southern Agriculture Growth Corridor Programme in Tanzania
description: To raise rural incomes and increase food security by contributing to the improvements in the business environment for commercial agriculture in Tanzania(especially the southern corridor), as well as growth in number and scale of commercial agribusinesses and substantial improvement in the market operations of a number of agricultural commodity markets. The programme is expected to benefit 100,000 rural households by March 2015 and over 230,000 households by end of the Programme in 2017

title: Exploring the cost effectiveness of investments in disaster resilience
description: To develop evidence based resource that can support effective policy development which can be used to inform the investment decisions on Disaster Risk Reductions and resilience of other donors, partner governments, multilaterals and implementing agencies

title: Africa Enterprise Challenge Fund (South Sudan)
description: To improve the livelihoods of at least 50,000 farmes/ out-growers and clients who will directly benefit from the provision of Africa Enterprise Challenge Fund support for around 11 innovative private sector initiatives in agricultural, agribusiness and other enterprises impacting on the rural areas of South Sudan

title: South Sudan Humanitarian Response Programme
description: Humanitarian coordination and interventions in South Sudan address acute and chronic relief and protection needs efficiently and effectively, and build resilience against future needs.Humanitarian coordination and interventions in South Sudan address acute and chronic relief and protection needs efficiently and effectively, and build resilience against future needs.Humanitarian coordination and interventions in South Sudan address acute and chronic relief and protection needs efficiently and effectively, and build resilience against future needs.Humanitarian coordination and interventions in South Sudan address acute and chronic relief and protection needs efficiently and effectively, and build resilience against future needs.Humanitarian coordination and interventions in South Sudan address acute and chronic relief and protection needs efficiently and effectively, and build resilience against future needs.Humanitarian coordination and interventions in South Sudan address acute and chronic relief and protection needs efficiently and effectively, and build resilience against future needs.

title: Security Sector Development and Defence Transformation (SSDDT)- Phase II
description: To assist  Government of the Republic of South Sudan to professionalise and right size its military, with stronger civilian oversight and accountability, contributing to improved safety and security for the citizens of South Sudan.To assist the Government  of the Republic of South Sudan  to ensure that the  military are held accountable to stronger civilian oversight contributing to the improved safety and security for the citizens of South Sudan

title: Rural Water Supply Programme in Tanzania
description: To increase the number of people in rural areas using improved sources of water and sanitation

title: Climate Asia: Evidencing public understanding of climate change to enable effective action
description: Create an evidence base for knowledge and attitudes on Climate Change across seven countries in Asia

title: World Bank Governance Partnership Facility Programme
description: To improve management of public finances, by working to improve their transparency, increasing citizen engagement in their use, and on better service delivery. It will work with the Federal Government of Nigeria, selected State Governments and civil society by providing technical assistance and support. This contributes towards meeting the MDGs by improving the developing impact of public finances in Nigeria by 2020.

title: World Bank Growth & Private Sector Development Research
description: Improved evidence-based World Bank policies and interventions on the financial and private sectors

title: Improving Schooling in Sierra Leone
description: Improving Learning Outcomes and Sustainable Capacity Development in Education in Sierra Leone

title: Commonwealth Scholarship and Fellowship Programme 2011/12 - 2016/17
description: To enhance the numbers of well qualified post-graduates, academics and professionals working in development relevant fields in Commonwealth developing countries, with an appropriate gender balance

title: Skills for Jobs programme
description: To increase and strengthen vocational training capacity by improving access and quality of skills training in India. This will lead to directly or indirectly support 1 million people with quality training by 2023.

title: Financing Liveable Habitat for Poor in Low Income States
description: The project, in partnership with National Housing Bank, will stimulate the growth of the affordable housing market by providing loans to build 17,000 housing units and 10,000 home loans for low income families. This will result in 27,000 construction jobs for the poorest people in low income states in India by 2020. This programme is predominantly in the form of Development Capital Investment, which generates a return to the UK. The technical assistance will support policy and system strengthening for the scetor as well as promote innovative models and technologies.

title: India: Infrastructure Loan Fund - Small loans to bridge the infrastructure gap for the poor
description: The Programme is expected to directly result in access to new/import infrastructure services such as electricity, sewage and transport to an estimated 280,000 people.To  improve access to better quality transport, clean energy and basic urban services for households and businesses, by providing loans to private sector-led infrastructure projects. This will benefit an estimated 280,000 people with improved infrastructure services.

title: Core Funding to the Foreign Investment Advisery Service (FIAS)
description: To strengthen the Investment Climate through improved policy making and reform.  This is fundemental to securing DFID's goals of reducing poverty through economic growth.  The beneficiaries are partner governments receiving investment climate advice from Foreign Investment Advisery Services (FIAS)

title: DFID support to Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Programme  for Madhya Pradesh & Odisha
description: To strengthen the demand and use of  Water Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) services by poor and excluded communities; so that there are maximum benefits for health especially child health in underserved districts of Madhya Pradesh and Odisha.

title: Adolescent Girls Initiative - Kenya
description: To improve the lives of at least 6500 adolescent girls in Kenya between the age of 10 and 14, by improving their access to health, education, economic assets and protection from violence. Evidence from research will influence national policy and support scaled up, cost-effective interventions for adolescent girls in the future.

title: People in Aid Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to People in Aid in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework.

title: Stock-take of Innovative Service Delivery mechanisms in Fragile and Conflict affected States
description: To lead a stock-take of 4-5 examples of innovative service delivery mechanisms in fragile and conflict affected states, to help ensure that this work links and builds on existing and on-going studies in this area, and to draw out key lessons learned

title: Emergency Deployment Team (EDT) Programme
description: To train and deploy emergency response personnel (Medical, Search and Rescue and Mapping  experts) at short notice to countries affected by sudden onset humanitarian emergencies

title: Rwanda Budget Support Evidence Facility (BSEF)
description: To improve effective delivery and value for money by providing evidence(through assessments and analysis) to inform design and delivery of DFID-Rwanda interventions.

title: Leadership For Change: making it work for girls and women
description: To help girls and women in a number of DFID's 28 focus countries to have greater leadership, decision-making and participation opportunities at all levels of society, and in all aspects of their lives.

title: International Citizen Service 2012 - 2015
description: 7,000 young people from across the UK contribute to development through international volunteering placements in selected developing countries. UK volunteers will work directly alongside local volunteers on health, education, livelihoods, environmental and civic participation projects with evidence generated to inform future youth volunteering programmes

title: The Water Security Programme
description: To increase the resilience of poor people to climate change through secure and sustainable access to water resources.  We will work with the Global Water Partnership, World Bank Water Partnership Programme and GIZ International Water Stewardship Programme to support increased investment in the information, institutions and infrastructure required to deliver water security.

title: United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA):  basic services and protection for Palestinian refugees
description: To provide basic services (education, health, and social services) and protection for Palestine refugees

title: Supporting Stability and Promoting Democracy in the Occupied Palestinian Territories (SSPD)
description: Palestinians are better able to hold their authorities to account through a more inclusive and effective civil society.Palestinians are better able to hold their authorities to account through a more inclusive and effective civil society.Palestinians are better able to hold their authorities to account through a more inclusive and effective civil society.

title: Support to the work of the Office of the Quartet (OQ) in the Occupied Palestinian Territories
description: Improved trade flows and strengthened business and security environment through the work of the Office of the Quartet (OQ) on easing restrictions in the West Bank and Gaza.  A cumulative of 180m in trade are expected by the end of the project.

title: Accelerating reductions in under nutrition in Ethiopia
description: To improve the nutritional status of women and children below five years of age by increasing coverage and uptake of high impact nutrition and childcare interventions and strengthening evidence based multi-sectoral response to under nutrition in Ethiopia. This will benefit 3.5 million children below five years of age to receive nutritional interventions, 24,000 Pregnant and Lactating Women receive iron supplementation, 5.5 million mothers, fathers, and Pregnant and Lactating Women receive nutrition related information, and 500,000 new-borns and mothers receive two home visits in the first week after birth. This contributes to the MDG goals of eliminating extreme poverty and hunger and will reduce underweight from 35% to 28% in the program regions.

title: Peace and Development Programme
description: To improve access to basic services, rule of law and livelihoods for the population in Somali region of Ethiopia through funding from DFID and working with Government and people of the Somali Region. This will benefit over half a million people. This contributes towards our MDGs by improving access to improved water for 341,000, access to education for 56,000, access to health services for 75,000, employment opportunity for 300,000 more people, and access to safety and justice for 500,000 women and girls by end of 2015

title: Reducing barriers and Increasing Demands for Reproductive Health Services in Ethiopia
description: To increase demand for and use of quality, acceptable reproductive health services by poor and excluded communities, specifically prevention of unintended pregnancies and assurance of safe pregnancy and childbirth. These changes will be measured by using indicators on: Contraceptive Prevalence Rates (CPR); Contraceptive Acceptance Rates (CAR); proportion of births delivered by a skilled birth attendant; and teenage pregnancy rates.

title: Support to Africa Security Sector Network (ASSN)
description: support of capacity building activity within the African Security Sector Network

title: Public Sector Capacity Building II
description: To improve public service delivery by the Government of Ethiopia at all tiers of administration

title: Civil Society Support Programme
description: To improve implementation of pro-poor government policies and more inclusive public services for poor and marginalised women, men, girls and boys through productive engagement of civil society sector with regional governments

title: Land Investment For Transformation (LIFT)
description: To support the Government of Ethiopia in the provision of map based land certificates to farmers in four regions and assist them to fully benefit from increased investment and productivity through the development of the rural land market and its supporting operations. The project will be a driver to increasing income by 20% for over 500,000 households.  It will also secure land ownership for 6.1 million households, of whom around 70% will be women

title: Livelihood Enhancement Through Agricultural Development (LEAD) Programme
description: Income increased for small holder farmers supported by the programmeTo enhance the economic wellbeing of maize, vegetable and poultry, this will increase income to 100,000 small holder farmers supported by the programme by 2017.

title: To build urban resilience in 35 cities in Asia through an Asia Development Bank administered Trust Fund
description: Validate the design of a partnership around building urban climate change resilience with the Asian Development Bank,Rockefeller Foundation and DFID and understand what other donors, knowledge partners are doing around urban resilience

title: Malawi Rural Unpaved Roads Programme
description: To increase rural connectivity and reduce rural transport costs by rehabilitating the earth road network.

title: Strategic Grant supporting BOND Consortium
description: To provide strategic level funding to BOND in support of agreed outcomes identified in their logframe to cover 3 areas:  a) strengthening the effectiveness of the UK development NGO sector, to b) increase transparency efforts in line with IATI and to c) better engage with the EC.

title: Support to the Adaptation Fund for developing countries to build climate resilience
description: The Adaptation Fund provides support for priority adaptation projects identified in national plans. It also provides support through National Implementing Entities that meet fiduciary standards, building country institutions and experience of direct access

title: Humanitarian assistance to the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC)
description: To reach 2.1 million people in the Democratic Republic of Congo ( DRC) every year with timely emergency assistance in response to population movements, conflict, epidemics and nutrition crises, working to reduce their vulnerability and their future dependence on humanitarian aid

title: Support to the  Least Developed Countries Fund (LDCF), which aims to increase climate resilience by funding priority interventions in National Adaptation Programmes
description: To increase climate resilience in Least Developed Countries by funding priority interventions in National Adaptation Programmes. This will benefit over 860,000 people and make them less vulnerable to the impacts of  climate change.

title: Girl Hub Ethiopia
description: To change the lives of approximately three million Ethiopian girls by inspiring and equipping them to improve their own lives and deliver social and economic change in their communities by 2030

title: Elections Response Fund Kosovo
description: To strenghten and entrench democracy in Kosovo and improve ownership of democratic processes that will lead towards greater citizen trust in the Kosovo political systems

title: Support to Water and Sanitation Collaborative Council (WSSCC) 2011-2013
description: To support the Water & Sanitation Collaborative Council (WSSCC) in their aim of informing, advising and inspiring organisations working in sanitation to do their work better, to persuade more governments and agencies to become involved in sanitation, and to enhance the cost-effectiveness and impact of their field programmes.  Through this support, WSSCC will be better able to provide improved leadership, enhanced levels of coordination and expanded reach, which will contribute to millions of unserved people in 10 to 25 developing countries using toilets and improving personal hygiene.  Vulnerable and marginalised groups will also receive specific support and attention.

title: Rwanda Social Protection Implementation Plan Support
description: Interim support and capacity building to provide strategic direction for the Sector and ensure the efficient and effective implementation of Rwandas National Social Protection Strategy (NSPS) and Social Protection Implementation Plan (SPIP)Interim support and capacity building to provide strategic direction for the Sector and ensure the efficient and effective implementation of Rwandas National Social Protection Strategy (NSPS) and Social Protection Implementation Plan (SPIP)Interim support and capacity building to provide strategic direction for the Sector and ensure the efficient and effective implementation of Rwandas National Social Protection Strategy (NSPS) and Social Protection Implementation Plan (SPIP)Interim support and capacity building to provide strategic direction for the Sector and ensure the efficient and effective implementation of Rwandas National Social Protection Strategy (NSPS) and Social Protection Implementation Plan (SPIP)Interim support and capacity building to provide strategic direction for the Sector and ensure the efficient and effective implementation of Rwandas National Social Protection Strategy (NSPS) and Social Protection Implementation Plan (SPIP)Interim support and capacity building to provide strategic direction for the Sector and ensure the efficient and effective implementation of Rwandas National Social Protection Strategy (NSPS) and Social Protection Implementation Plan (SPIP)

title: Improving countries health financing systems to accelerate progress towards universal health coverage
description: To help countries develop and implement health financing strategies aimed at achieving universal health coverage based on the best available evidence.

title: Support to the Water and Sanitation Programme - WSP
description: To support developing country Governments' efforts to scale up improved water supply and sanitation services and hygiene programs for poor people.

title: Building Resilience and Adaptation to Climate Extremes and Disasters
description: To help up to 10 million people, especially women and children, in developing countries cope with extreme climate and weather events such as droughts, cyclones and floods (climate extremes). This will be achieved by doing three things. By making grants to civil society organisations to scale up proven technologies and practices in the Sahel, sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia that help people withstand, and more quickly recover, from climate extremes. By identifying the best ways of doing this, and share this knowledge globally to increase the programmes overall impact. By supporting national governments to strengthen their policies and actions to respond to climate extremes. These will all contribute to the Millennium Development Goals on the eradication poverty and hunger, and environmental sustainability, and also respond to the Humanitarian and Emergency Response Review recommendation that DFID should integrate the threat from climate change into a Disaster Risk Reduction.

title: Improving the impact of the UK's Tuberculosis (TB) -related investments
description: To help foster greater collaboration, cohesion and integration within the global tuberculosis control movement and as a result improve prioritisation and the efficiency and effectiveness of the global response.

title: Malaria: Improving the Global Response
description: To improve the effectiveness of the global response to malaria by developing a more integrated, efficient and evidence based global response to malaria control and malaria control programmes, which will contribute to at least halving malaria deaths in at least ten high burden countries by 2014/2015 and to support action to sustain and expand gains into the future.

title: Innovative Ventures & Technologies for Development (INVENT)
description: To encourage innovation amongst the private sector by provision of investment capital and business development services. To innovative enterprises in low income states of India  for enterprises in developing countries by 2024. This will contribute to MDGs by benefitting 1 million individuals with improved access to affordable and efficient services in the Low Income States of India and  Developing Countries.

title: United Nations Development Programme- Strategic Partnership Programme Phase II South Sudan
description: strengthen democratic governance and equitable delivery of public services through capable, accountable and responsive government, at Federal, State and local levels resulting in a reduction in poverty.

title: Improving Statistics for Food Security, Sustainable Agriculture and Rural Development
description: The Global Strategy for improving Statistics for Food Security, Sustainable Agriculture and Rural Development will target 40 African and 20 Asian-Pacific countries. This will develop the capacity of countries to provide better data on improved agriculture and rural statistics. This will allow decisions about investments to boost agricultural growth to be based on sound information and achieve their full potential as drivers for environmentally sustainable growth and poverty reduction.

title: SME - Small Medium Enterprise Initiative
description: Support through the International Finance Corporation scaling up of commercial banks' lending to Small and Medium Enterprises in DFID targeted developing countries in Africa and Asia, with a focus on FCAS.  The Initiative will support scaling up of lending to small and medium enterprises through partnership with mainstream commercial banks, leasing companies and other non-banking finance companies in DFID priority countries. The Initiative will provide banks with risk sharing mechanisms, technical assistance and advisory services as well as  improved credit history information and referencing in support of scaling up their financing to small and medium enterprises.

title: JVP (Joint Ventures for Prosperity)
description: Increase the involvement of poor people in the value chains creating jobs, raising incomes and generating local economic growth. Increase the extent to which poor people are targeted with products or services that enable them to be more economically productive and deliver health and education benefits

title: IMPACT -  Investment to fund innovative solutions for development and help develop sustainable investment markets
description: Investment to fund innovative solutions for development and help develop sustainable investment markets that work for the poor.  FCDO is aiming to catalyse the market for impact investment in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia. Impact investments are those which have both a financial and social return by benefiting poor and low-income people through improved access to affordable goods and services and income generating opportunities. The Impact Programme aims to promote solutions to the barriers and constraints that are preventing Impact Investing from scaling up in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia. The programme seeks to foster a significant increase in the volume and distribution of impact investment, reaching the underserved as consumers, suppliers, distributors or employees, in hard to reach, difficult geographies, and through innovative business models.

title: UK Support to Measles Initiative
description: To provide funds to the Measles Initiative for its fight in controlling measles child mortality in developing countries and therefore making further progress towards Millennium Development Goal 4

title: TEACHER DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME
description: To improve student learning in six states in Northern Nigeria over 6 years. This will be achieved through creating a cohort of 66,000 more effective teachers of Mathematics, Science and Technology and English. For every year that these 66,000 teachers continue in service, they will improve the learning outcomes of up to 2,000,000 students in primary and junior secondary schools. In the Colleges of Education, a total of 816 lecturers, working in Primary Education and Junior Secondary School Departments, will be trained. In turn, 4,000 student teachers will benefit from improved training through pre-service methods in Colleges of Education.

title: Support to Civil Society Organisations work on Gender and Sexual Based Violence
description: To increase knowledge of the consequences of gender based violence and increase the availability of services for survivors of gender based violence

title: Malawi Water and Sanitation Programme
description: To improve peoples lives by providing increased access to water and sanitation facilities.This will benefit 850,000 people (of which 442,500 are women) having access to improved water and sanitation facilities and 1 million people (of which 510,0000 are women) adopting key hygiene practices.

title: Making it Happen Ph2 - Training health professionals to expand and improve emergency obstetric care services
description: To  improve facility based obstetric and neonatal care by improved training to enable health professionals to improve performance.

title: Somaliland Development Fund aligned to the priorities of National Development Plan
description: To improve governance, accountability and public service delivery (e.g. in health and education) by the Government of Somaliland. This will promote long-term stability in the region and improve the lives of poor Somalilanders. This programme contributes to our MDGs by delivering public services, and building core government capacity and functions and will result in improved planning and delivery for development priorities by 2016.

title: The Commonwealth Local Government Forum
description: To support the programmes of the Commonwealth Local Government Forum (CLGF) in Southern Asia, Western Africa and Southern Africa, and strengthen CLGF's capacity to promote effective, responsive and accountable delivery of local government services to poor and disadvantaged communities across the Commonwealth, thereby improving growth prospects in supported areas

title: Strengthening knowledge and tools for climate change adaptation
description: To help people adapt to the impacts of climate by strengthening knowledge on what works best, and to use this knowledge to develop new adaptation programmes and maximise the effectiveness of the UK's International Climate Fund (ICF) and its investments to help over 25 million people in developing countries cope with the impacts of climate change by 2015

title: Sharing and Learning on Community Based Disaster Management in Asia
description: To increase resilience to disasters of poor communities in developing countries in the Asia region through improved regional cooperation on community based disaster management

title: Vietnam Empowerment and Accountability Programme
description: Increased opportunities for Vietnamese citizens to engage in decision making processes affecting their lives and to hold the decision makers to account

title: Support for Energy Sector Analysis that influences global energy decision makers
description: Develping countries have adopted pro-poor low carbon development pathways in line with trajectories for a 2 degree world by 2020

title: Global Network of Climate Technology Innovation Centres
description: The purpose is to build a global community of practice of entrepreneurs and innovators dedicated to develop and deploy climate smart technologies providing clean, safe, reliable and sustainable access to energy, water and other natural resources to poor communities in developing countries

title: Results Based Financing for Low Carbon Energy Access
description: To increase access to clean energy through the creation of an expanding market of green mini-grid installations in Africa serving rural villages unconnected to the main grid. This is expected to benefit around 1.3m people by 2018, while reducing carbon emissions by around 260,000 Tonnes of carbon dioxide, through supported private investment in the installation and operation of over 110 renewably-powered mini-grids (figures to be updated after Business Case completion). Electricity access for lighting, communications and productive uses creates jobs, enables studying at night and enhances public services (such as clinics) and public safety (eg through streetlighting). This project also addresses the post-2015 High Level Panels recommendation on a development goal entitled Secure Sustainable Energy, which includes energy access and renewable energyThe Results-Based Financing for Low Carbon Energy Access Programme aims to accelerate access to sustainable energy services in developing countries. The funding generates and tests different forms of Results-Based Financing (RBF) mechanism, which aim to stimulate decentralised energy markets and to leverage private investment to increase access to clean energy products and services.

title: Creating Opportunities for the Poor and Excluded in Bangladesh (COPE)
description: To work with the most poor and marginalised people in Bangladesh to make them aware of their rights, and provide advice, advocacy support and organisation to claim those rights in practice.  As a result of the programme, by March 2017, people who would otherwise be excluded from the benefits of development will gain access to services, assets and economic opportunities, and be given a greater say in decisions affecting their lives.

title: Reproductive and Maternal Health Supplies in Tanzania
description: To ensure that family planning and maternal health commodities are available in Tanzania throughout the health system

title: Macroeconomic Research in Low-Income Countries
description: Deeper understanding of, and better engagement by, IMF policymakers on macroeconomic issues specifically relevant to low income countries, leading to improved policy-making in thematic areas.

title: Labour Force Survey of Kosovo, 2012
description: To undertake an effective Labour Force Survey in 2012 and provide baseline information on employment levels and patterns in Kosovo

title: Yemen Emergency Food Security Programme
description: To provide emergency food assistance to food-insecure households in Yemen.

title: 2012 Humanitarian Interventions
description: To meet the most urgent humanitarian needs of conflict and affected populations. To save lives, maintain dignity and support the livelihoods of vulnerable people in Somalia.

title: UN Policy Influencing in Vietnam
description: To deliver concrete outcomes in governance, gender and HIV/AIDS through providing financial, policy and technical support to the UN in Vietnam.

title: Turkey Earthquake 2011
description: To provide immediate humanitarian assistance to the victims of the  earthquake which occurred in eastern Turkey in October 2011

title: Addressing Climate Change in the Overseas Territories
description: Design a programme to address climate change by promoting low carbon climate resilient development in the UK Overseas Territories.

title: International Development Association Sixteenth Replenishment (IDA16)
description: To reduce poverty by enabling the World Bank to provide grants and low-interest loans that enhance economic opportunities and tackle poverty in poor countries.

title: Strengthening Government Social Protection Systems for the Poor (SGSP)
description: Supporting the Government of Bangladesh through provision of technical assistance and advocacy to establish policies, budgets and plans for a more effective and efficient social protection system. This is expected to benefit around 78 million poor Bangladeshis through design and implementation of programmes which are better targeted to the poor and more focused on helping them lift themselves out of poverty.  As a whole, this will support reform of the social protection system and improve the impact and sustainability of the Governments own expenditure on social protection in Bangladesh. This contributes to Millennium Development Goal 1 ( ie eradication of extreme poverty and hunger) and will result in the reduction of number of people living in extreme poverty in Bangladesh but currently excluded  from social protection schemes, by 2017.

title: British Red Cross Disaster Resilience Capacity Building in the Caribbean Overseas Territories
description: Reduce the scale of losses and disruption caused by disasters in the Caribbean Overseas Territories

title: Core State Functions Programme - CSFP
description: To deliver better security, access to justice and service delivery for poor Somalis by strengthening public administrations

title: Accelerating Improved Nutrition for Extreme Poor in Bangladesh
description: To reduce undernutrition in extreme poor household in Bangladesh. Improved nutrient intake and health status of adolescent girls, pregnant and breastfeeding women and young children.

title: Providing Clean Energy to the Rural Poor of Bangladesh
description: Climate change mitigation and access to clean energy to improve the livelihoods of rural poor in off- grid areas in Bangladesh

title: SANITATION, HYGIENE & WATER IN NIGERIA, PHASE 2
description: To scale-up water, sanitation and hygiene coverage in Nigeria by providing 4.68 million new beneficiaries plus continued support to 2.32 million covered under Phase 1, with access to appropriate and safe sanitation facilities, hygiene education activities and  a sustainable safe and reliable water supply to reduce exposure to public health risks and disease transmission. This contributes to our Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) by helping to sustain and embed improved sanitation, water and hygiene practices. Phase 2 of the Sanitation, Hygiene and Water in Nigeria Programme (SHAWN) will benefit 7 million people in total, in six northern states in Nigeria by December 2018.

title: Child Development Grant (CDG) Programme
description: To prevent stunting in children under 5 by providing monthly cash transfers with nutrition education to 110,000 mothers giving them the resources and knowledge to provide their young children with a balanced and healthy diet. The project will benefit a total of 770,000 people over 6 years in Jigawa and Zamfara states by July 2019.

title: SUPPORT TO NATIONAL MALARIA PROGRAMME PHASE 2
description: The programme will improve the planning, financing and delivery of sustainable and replicable pro-poor services for malaria in supported states by working with the Nigerian government, the Global Fund, DFIDs other programmes and other donors to: (i) Strengthen government stewardship, including planning and budgeting for malaria control, strengthening financial management and expenditure tracking as well as Nigerian government funding for malaria control; (ii) Strengthen procurement and supply systems to ensure the sustainable availability of malaria commodities;  (iii) Support local health authorities to develop and scale up delivery systems for highly effective interventions such as Integrated Community Case Management;  (iv) Support local health authorities and civil society to engage individuals and institutions to use malaria control measures and advocate for more domestic funding; and (v) Support local malaria control agencies to improve their use of research and evidence.

title: Increasing Access to Reproductive Health Commodities
description: To reduce unmet need for family planning and incidence of HIV infection, particularly in women and men most at risk of infection

title: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development General Capital Increase (IBRD GCI)
description: IBRD delivers poverty reduction and development in its client countries and enhances its efficiency and effectiveness by undertaking key reforms

title: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development Selective Capital Increase (IBRD SCI)
description: IBRD delivers poverty reduction and development in its client countries and enhances its efficiency and effectiveness by undertaking key reforms

title: Somalia Monitoring Programme
description: To improve the impact of the UK and the wider development communitys development programmes by improving the tracking of results, generating better data and information, making data more widely available thereby helping the poor people of Somalia to improve their living standards and rights.

title: Core Support to the International Organisation for Migration (IOM)  2012 - 2015
description: UK core support to IOM contribute to the orderly management of migration, vulnerable groups and societiesUK core support to International Organisation for Migration ( IOM)  contribute to the orderly management of migration, vulnerable groups and societies

title: Uganda Humanitarian Funding - Landslides and Floods Response 2011
description: Immediate needs of households affected by landslides and floods in Uganda are met

title: Maximising Benefits of Extractives for Sustainable Growth
description: This scoping exercise will (i) identify how extractives affect governance arrangements and economic decisions, and vice-versa, in countries and regions (particularly Africa) (ii) learn from how some DFID programmes have addressed these issues, including working with other cadres and partners (iii) collate key questions for further elaboration on the issues that DFID needs to consider to ensure  extractives deliver sustainable growth and development. (BC Quest doc ref. 3272981)

title: Kenya Accountable Devolution Programme
description: The programme will contribute to a transitional process in which new county governments are established resulting in greater confidence in local government and the services it delivers.

title: Pilot Project of Results Based Aid in the Education Sector in Ethiopia
description: Result Based Aid aims to deliver up to 132,500 more girls and 58,200 more boys sitting the grade 10 examinations and up to 102,600 more girls and 74,500 more boys passing themTo improve lower secondary education participation  and performance in Ethiopia by providing result based aid with measuring the number of  girls and boys sitting the grade 10 examinations and passing them. It is aimed to deliver up to 126,403 more girls and 87,552 more boys sitting the grade 10 examinations and up to 108,503 more girls and 59,222 more boys passing them. This contributes towards MDG targets by improving quality of education and will result in increased secondary education completion rates for both boys and girls by June 30, 2015.

title: Support for the Ethiopian Health Sector Development Programme
description: Increased access to and improved quality of health services.

title: Protection of Basic Services programme Phase III-no further payments
description: To increase access, quality and accountability of five basic services to 80 million Ethiopians by funding block grants that ensure adequate staffing and operations; this together with our other parallel interventions will by 2017 support 2 million children to go to primary school, provide 7.5 million people with access to basic health care, help half a million women give birth safely, provide an additional three quarters of a million women with access to family planning and provide an additional 1.4 million people with clean drinking water.To increase access, quality and accountability in five basic services ( Education, Health, Water and Sanitation, Agriculture and Roads) to 80 million Ethiopians by funding block grants that ensure adequate staffing and operations; this together with our other parallel interventions will by 2017 support 2 million children to go to primary school, provide 7.5 million people with access to basic health care, help half a million women give birth safely, provide an additional three quarters of a million women with access to family planning and provide an additional 1.4 million people with clean drinking water

title: Maternal and Newborn Child Health Programme
description: To improve maternal and newborn child health in Northern Nigeria through increased skilled birth attendance, antenatal care attendance, immunisation rates, newborns receiving low-cost, live-saving interventions, and pregnant women and children protected from vaccine-preventable diseases. This will save the lives of 60,000 children, 42,000 newborns and 2,000 pregnant women in the six programme states; and provide 6.3 million high quality MNCH services to women and children of Northern Nigeria. This contributes toward MDG 4 and 5 by reducing maternal and child mortality; improve health system coordination through health sector planning and financing and improve demand for and access to high quality health services by 2019.

title: Wealth Accounting and the Valuation of Ecosystem Services (WAVES)
description: To support 5 developing country governments to quantify and value their priority natural resource assets, and to incorporate this information into decision making, by 2015

title: Enhancing  Nutrition Surveillance, Response and Resilience (ENSuRRe): 2012-2016
description: Addressing acute malnutrition in arid and semi-arid lands to reduce the mortality and morbidity of malnourished women and children in KenyaTo provide lifesaving nutrition interventions to children under the age of five and pregnant and lactating women; by providing nutritional interventions through health systems. This will benefit over 45,000 children under the age of five and over 8,400 pregnant and lactating women. This contributes towards our MDGs by reducing the mortality and morbidity of children under the age of five and women in Kenya and will result in healthier communities by March 2016

title: Support for Refugees in Kenya (2012-2016)
description: Provide essential humanitarian assistance to save lives, relieve suffering, and maintain the dignity of Somali refugees in KenyaTo provide essential humanitarian assistance for up to 415,000 refugees in Kenya by ensuring improved access to clean water, sanitation, nutrition, health and protection services (e.g. police, secure accommodation for unaccompanied minors and victims of gender based violence). This will help save lives, relieve suffering, and maintain the dignity of refugees in Kenya.To provide essential humanitarian assistance for up to 535,000 refugees in Kenya by ensuring improved access to clean water, sanitation, nutrition, health and protection services (e.g. secure accommodation for unaccompanied minors and victims of gender based violence) and sustainable climate change interventions. This will help save lives, relieve suffering, and maintain the dignity of refugees in Kenya in a sustainable way.

title: Further Maintenance Calshot Harbour, Tristan da Cunha
description: To provide Tristan Da Cunha with a means of maintaining Calshot Harbour until its breakwaters can be strengthened on a more permanent basis.To provide Tristan da Cunha with on island capacity to maintain its harbour and breakwater thus allowing reasonable access

title: Annual Contribution to the Commonwealth Secretariat in respect of the Commonwealth Fund for Technical Co-operation and the Commonwealth Youth Programme
description: The Commonwealth Secretariat efficiently and effectively delivers results through focused programmes in areas of comparative advantage, promoting peace, democracy, pro-poor growth and sustainable development across the Commonwealth

title: Development of Agricultural Rural Markets Project in Zambia
description: To develop sustainable agricultural markets in Zambia in which poor people and enterprises can actively participate. This will benefit 250,000 people and contributes to MDGs by improving the livelihoods of the rural poor by 2016.

title: Financial Sector Deepening Programme- Zambia
description: To facilitate the development of inclusive financial markets in Zambia particularly in rural areas. This will benefit 664,000 people and contribute to SDG 8 by improving the livelihoods of poor Zambians by 2021.

title: Zambia Education Sector Budget Support Programme
description: To have more and better quality education and skills training from pre-primary to tertiary education in Zambia.  This will benefit  75,356 primary level and 12,603 lower secondary level boys and girls and contributes to our MDGs by improving access and equity of education by 2016. (Nutsen)

title: Religion, Change and Development
description: To improve the policy and practices of faith groups and the UK govt by working more effectvely together in order to  bring together leading development thinkers and representatives from faith groups to examine how to engage with the issue of religion as a dynamic in development, address tension points between secular and faith-based development organisations and identify ways of engaging as effectively as possible with communities / countries where faith has a pivotal role.

title: Measuring Fraud and Abuse in Overseas Development Aid
description: To create a tool kit to measure fraud at country and project level. DFID other Government Departments and Aid Partners will benefit by being better able to apply appropriate fraud loss measurement techniques to different aid modalities

title: Fertiliser Procurement for the 2011/12 Farm Input Subsidy Programme
description: To increase food security, reduce hunger and malnutrition and accelerate agricultural output growth in Malawi by providing 300,000 households with 15,000 tons of affordable NPK (Nitrogen, Phosphorus and Potassium) fertiliser and providing 200,000 households with 10,000 tons Urea, jointly with Norway.

title: Improving the clarity of laws in the Caribbean Overseas territories
description: To support economic growth in Montserrat, Anguilla and Turks and Caicos through maintaining transparent, accessible and up to date laws

title: Climate Change and Health Conference, Durban
description: To source internatonal experts to give current evidence on the health impacts of climate change and the health co-benefits of greenhouse gas mitigation measures.  This will help to create a platform that wil initiate knowledge sharing, debate and collaboration between South Africa, the UK ad other countries who are engaged in similer work

title: Public Financial Management Reform Programme Phase 4
description: To deliver Strengthened and Improved Public Financial Management systems in Tanzania by 2016/17, the outcome will be a more effective, transparent and accountable national budget and improved Government revenues

title: Improving Value for Money from EU Development Aid
description: The puropse of the programme is to improve the effectiveness and value for money of UK aid channeled through the EU  including through a strengthened EU approach to conflict and fragile states; a greater focus on results; stronger links to developing countries, and greater coherence between development and issues like trade and climate change.

title: Support to Development Assistance Committee Network on Development Evaluation
description: DFID support will enable the full implementation on the agreed 2011/2012 development assistance committee network on development evaluation work programme

title: Joint Trade Policy Unit Policy Research Fund
description: Assessing the impact of EU sugar reforms

title: Vietnam Business Challenge Fund
description: Provide catalyst funding to the private sector for innovative and pro-poor projects to create jobs and improve income for the poor in three sectors: agricultural value chain, low-carbon growth and infrastructure development.

title: Life Saving Medicines : Improving Access and Quality
description: To improve medicines regulation by providing support to regionally developed and approved plans to (i) strengthen the capacity of national medicines regulatory agencies to carry out their core functions, such as the effective registration of new products and monitoring of quality and (ii) work more collaboratively together to increase efficiencies and reduce transaction costs (for countries and pharmaceutical companies alike) in the regulation of medicines by 31 March 2015. This contributes to our MDG 8 target 17 to provide access to affordable essential drugs in developing countries

title: Partner Capacity Development for Evaluation
description: To support partners capacity development to enable them to develop their own evaluation agenda and undertake effective development monitoring and evaluationTo support up to 6 Evaluation Conferences, e.g. African Evaluation Association, to take place (in the UK, Europe, Africa and Asia), 2 international evaluation training events and up to 20 leading developing partner country evaluators (or commissioning managers) to attend and contribute actively to the conference/event proceedings and thereby strengthen the developing country relevance of evaluation recommendations emerging from the conferences/events. Their active participation will also ensure that they and the countries they represent are better placed to engage in other critical international negotiations and processes, and that these take better account of developing country perspectives/requirements and evidence.

title: Health Strategic Support Programme
description: To support strategic capacity building, technical assistance, studies and operational research of Federal Ministry of Health and decentralised Health Offices
