title: Strengthening the international aid architecture for water and Sanitation through - Global Analysis and Assessment of Drinking Water and Sanitation (GLAAS) and Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP)
description: To strengthen global aid architecture for water and sanitation, built on a strong information base.  Resulting in better coordination and partnership between donors, enhanced cooperation and increased funding for low income countries, targeted to the poorest and most vulnerable.

title: Essential Medicines Malawi
description: To provide basic essential medicines and health supplies to a total of 620 primary health care facilities in all 28 districts of Malawi for 18 months

title: Support to the International Security Advisory Team (ISSAT)
description: To deliver expertise for the development of security and justice programmes overseas and a forum for policy and programme coordination across the international communityTo deliver expertise for the development of security and justice programmes overseas, with the aim of increasing the effectiveness and coherence of the international community's support for the delivery of security and justice services to poor people in conflict-affected and fragile states. More effective security and justice services are expected to contribute to conflict prevention, building sustainable peace, and establishing an enabling environment for achieving the MDGs

title: Support for Survivors of Acid and Burns Violence
description: To achieve the prevention of violence againsr women and girls (VAWG), specifically acid and burns violence, as a contribution to DFID's 'Strategic Vision for Girls and Women'. The outcome of the work will be the collection and analysis of data and evidence to inform the development of a new innovative project to tackle acid and burns violence with the UK-based non-governmental organisation, the Acid Survivors Trust International (ASTI).To achieve the prevention of violence against women and girls (VAWG), specifically acid and burns violence, as a contribution to DFID's 'Strategic Vision for Girls and Women'. The outcome of the work will be the collection and analysis of data and evidence to inform the development of a new innovative project to tackle acid and burns violence with the UK-based non-governmental organisation, the Acid Survivors Trust International (ASTI).

title: Health: Toward Ending Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting in Africa and Beyond
description: This programme combines targeted action with communities in 17 countries with support for legislative and policy change and effective implementation of laws and policies. It includes a robust international research component to build the global evidence base on the most effective strategies to end FGM/C. It will work with others to support a movement within countries and globally to raise awareness and understanding of FGM/C and build support for efforts to end the practice. This programme aims to work towards ending the practice in one generation.

title: Practical guidance on preventing violence against women and girls
description: A practical guide for country offices which sets out the key programme entry points and approaches to takling violence against women across a range of sectors

title: 'Pakistan National Cash Transfers Programme'
description: To reduce poverty and improve living standards and educational attainment in the poorest families by providing regular payments to the female head of household. This support also helps in reducing vulnerability to shocks such as flooding due to climate change. 315,000 additional beneficiary families will benefit by 2020. This programme will contribute to 1.05 million primary school children being supported in school and directly contribute to Millennium Development Goals 1 Eradicating extreme poverty and hunger; and Millennium Development Goals 2 Achieve universal primary education.

title: Support to the interim presidential election
description: To provide support to Yemen's interim presidential election (2012)

title: Ongoing support to UNICEF's Water and Health programmes in Eritrea 2012
description: To accelerate progress towards the MDG drinking water and sanitation target and strengthen and improve child and maternal health

title: International Forestry Knowledge (KnowFor)
description: Uptake of international forestry knowledge, evidence and tools for international forestry policy and practice

title: SOUTH ASIA REGIONAL TRADE AND INTEGRATION PROGRAMME
description: Improved intra-regional trade and investment through increased regional electricity connectivity, reduction in border transit time, streamlined cross border regulations, and broader policy and institutional development

title: GACC - Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves - Transition to Clean Cooking
description: Our support will contribute to the Global Alliances goal to catalyse a global market for clean cookstoves that will see 100 million homes adopt clean and efficient cooking stoves and fuels by 2020; and our active engagement will help influence the partnership and encourage a solid, evidence-based approach. Specifically, DFIDs 18 months contribution will trigger an initial package of priority research on: the business models, social marketing and consumer finance that could deliver clean stoves at scale; and a step change in the understanding of the health (indoor air pollution) and climate change impacts of clean cookstoves.The second phase of the programme allows GACC to expand their research portfolio and continue to deliver the high quality research outputs needed to build the evidence base for continued investment in the sector.

title: To support the global activities of the Partnership for Maternal Newborn and Child Health (PMNCH) Phase 2
description: To support the global Maternal Newborn and Child Health partners to align programmes and increase resources to achieve universal access to comprehensive, high quality maternal, newborn and child health care.

title: Working with UNDP on " China in the world"
description: To advance the process of China engaging with the international community on global development issues, to maximise China's beneficial impact on poverty reduction and the Millenium Development Goals in other developing countries

title: Supporting Electoral Reform in Pakistan
description: Stable, inclusive and tolerant democracy in Pakistan

title: Vietnam Governance, Economic Management & Social Protection Programme
description: Significant reforms adopted by the Government in the policy spheres of governance (openness and transparency), macroeconomic stability and social protection

title: Africa Capacity Building Initiative: Strengthening capacity in African Higher Education to support development through science
description: This pilot programme is designed to increase the research capacity of Universities and research institutes in sub-Saharan Africa, develop well trained staff able to help shape the future of the research and academic communities in their country and to help identify the skills gap in African Higher Education Institutions in order to produce policy recommendations to address this shortage in the longer term.

title: Donor Committee for Enterprise Development
description: To support the Donor Committee for Enterprise Development

title: The Disaster and Emergencies Preparedness Programme (DEPP)
description: To significantly improve the speed and delivery of humanitarian assistance to disaster affected communities in high risk countries by improving the knowledge and understanding of national civil society organisations staff and their counterparts, so they can be better prepared for emergencies and better able to deliver an effective response when disasters strike

title: Shifting our focus closer to home - the public health and social benefits of at-house water supplies PRF
description: To research health benefits of household water supplies

title: Short Term Support to St Helena Government to build capacity and systems for a programme approach for infrastructure
description: To provide focused capacity building to the St Helena Government to manage its infrastructure projects as a strategic, prioritised programme of works while at the same time enabling the implementation of on-going projects. This contributes to St Helenas Sustainable Development plans by enhancing its ability to facilitate growth.

title: St. Helena Budgetary Aid 2012/13
description: To deliver efficient and effective public services that meet reasonable assistance needs in St Helena with the minimum budget contribution from the UK Government.

title: Improved Rural Roads and Transport Services for Communities in Low Income Countries.
description: To develop knowledge and evidence with up to 17 partner Governments for 1) planning, designing, constructing and maintaining cost effective and reliable low volume roads and 2) planning and delivering appropriate rural transport services. At least 110,000km low volume rural roads influenced by project research by 2030 which  will improve the livelihoods of poor men and women through providing increased access to markets and services.

title: Policy Analysis for Growth & Employment (PAGE)
description: To provide reliable evidence, through locally-led analyses, to support improved policies promoting inclusive growth and female empowerment, focussing on labour markets, social protection and entrepreneurship in developing countries.

title: Jobs and Incomes for Women Research Programme
description: To test new approaches and rigorously evaluate programmes on what works in giving women and girls control over their economic lives in sub-Saharan Africa. This will result in robust evidence for decision-makers to design programmes and policies that will improve economic opportunities for women and girls in sub-Saharan Africa and contribute towards gender equality.

title: Economic Development and Institutions (EDI) research programme
description: To produce a body of research evidence and analysis indicating practical ways of changing institutions so as to increase economic growth in poor countries. This will enable a better understanding of how institutions improve and change economic performances, and by 2020 developing countries will be able to use this understanding to improve their economies through developing better institutions.

title: AgResults: Innovation in Research and Delivery
description: The overall objective of the AgResults Initiative is to enhance smallholder welfare and food security for the poor and vulnerable in developing countries through increased investment in agricultural innovation and adoption.  It aims to do so by developing financial incentives (i.e. pull mechanisms) for private and public sector players to research, develop, and deliver products and services that will improve smallholder agriculture.  AgResults consists of a number of pilot projects across the developing world focused on either the adoption of existing technologies or the development and adaptation of new research and technologies.  The UK leads on a high quality research and evaluation component.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Support to African Development Bank (AfDB) to establish a Secretariat for a Private Sector Development Coordination Partnership for Middle East and North Africa (MENA)
description: To ensure better targeted international financial institutions technical assistance and investment for private sector development.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Support to World Bank/International Finance Corporation technical assistance to expand access to Micro, Small and Medium Sized Enterprise (MSMEs) finance in Middle East and North Africa (MENA).
description: To increase access to micro, small and medium sized enterprise (MSME) finance in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Region.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Support to the African Development Bank (AfDB) to Pilot Social Entrepreneurship in Tunisia
description: To stimulate enterprise growth and innovation.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) Cooperation Fund in Middle East and North Africa (MENA).
description: To increase investment, private sector growth and job creation in Egypt, Jordan, Morocco and Tunisia.

title: Support to public financial management reforms in Kosovo 2011-12
description: To support to the Government of Kosovo's Public Financial Management reform and strengthen the Ministry of Finance's ability to lead the reform process

title: UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund) Humanitarian Thematic Fund 2012 - 2015
description: Core Support towards UNICEF's Humanitarian  Thematic Fund to help UNICEF respond better to emergencies

title: Prevention of Gender Based Violence  Programme
description: To improve Gender Based Violence response and prevention through provision of support services to survivors and advocacy in Coordinated Response Center districts

title: World Health Organisation's Department of Neglected Tropical Diseases for capacity Building
description: To support WHO's Department of Neglected Tropical Diseases for capacity strengthening and Visceral Leismaniasis (VL) Programme Coordination

title: AGRI- TECH CATALYST- Supporting Agricultural Innovation for International Development
description: The Agri-Tech Catalyst aims to accelerate the development of new agricultural innovations to address food security challenges in developing countries by supporting research /private sector partnerships.  The programme will benefit farmers and organisations involved in agriculture value chains through the development and adoption of agricultural innovation.

title: Strategic Evaluation Fund
description: The funding will support a range of evaluation activities to improve the focus and rigour of development evaluation practise in priority policy areas, and inform evaluation practise in DFID,  contributing to global communities of practice

title: More Health for the Money- Programme for Aid Effectiveness and Accountability for Health
description: To support greater effectiveness and accountability in global aid for health through implementation of  i) the work plan of the International Health Partnership (IHP+) and ii) the work plan of the Commission for Imformation and Accountability.

title: Multi-year support to World Food Program emergency response
description: To improve access to food to vulnerable and disaster affected populations through food aid and nutrition support. This will benefit 3.24 million acutely food insecure people, 215,000 malnourished under 5 children and 58,000 pregnant and lactating women by preventing them from hunger and malnutrition. This contributes to our MDGs by preventing loss of lives and livelihoods in emergencies and will results in reduction of national rate of acute malnutrition from 9.7% to 7% by the end of 2015

title: Medium term assistance to refugees in Ethiopia
description: To save lives and alleviate sufferings of refugees in Ethiopia

title: World Health Organisation Special Programme for Research and Training in Tropical Diseases (2013-18)
description: To translate infectious disease knowledge, solutions and implementation strategies into policy and practice in disease endemic countries.

title: The Special Programme of Research, Development and Research Training in Human Reproduction (HRP)
description: To foster and facilitate sustainable changes in national and international policy and public health programmes.

title: DFID-Medical Research Council Concordat 2013-18
description: To produce high quality outcomes in biomedical and health research, designed to tackle the priority health problems of developing countries. In the long-term the research will contribute to improved health of the poorest people.

title: Neglected Tropical Diseases Implementation Research Programme (NIRP)
description: This investment will contribute towards the ultimate goal of achieving the World Health Organisation 2020 Neglected Tropical Disease (NTD) control and elimination targets through the conduct of implementation research alongside the delivery of Integrated NTD Control Programmes on the ground. The research will inform the on-going and future design of cost-effective, sustainable NTD control programmes and their integration within the wider health system at scale.

title: Research to Improve Health Systems in Developing Countries
description: To support research into health systems in developing countries in partnership with Wellcome Trust, the Medical Research Council and the Economic and Social Research Council. This research will improve our understanding of the most effective health interventions that contribute to reducing the burden of disease in developing countries, and how these can best be implemented to ensure that expected improvements in health are actually delivered. This will support a number of the UK Governments international commitments and help to advance the health related MDGs.

title: Measuring the impact of research
description: To increase the impact of DFID funded health research by providing improved data on research outputs and outcomes

title: Humanitarian Assistance to support 2011 Malawi Vulnerability Assessment Results
description: Contribute to increased household food security for people affected by localised food shortages in 10 districts in Malawi

title: UNICEF/DFID Equity Programme in Southern Kyrgyzstan
description: Raising of Living Standards, increased employment opportunities and reduced alienation among the poorest children, youth and families in the conflict affected areas of Southern Kyrgyzstan

title: Deepening Democracy in the Kyrgyz Republic
description: Improved service to the interests of the poorer citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic through the role of Parliament

title: Democratic Governance in Ethiopia
description: To strengthen engagement between Her Majesty Government and Government of Ethiopia on governance challenges through strategic interventions and pilots to improve governance institutions and support accountability mechanisms. This will increase the sustainability of Government of Ethiopias development model and contribute to its growth and transformation goals.

title: Family Planning Project
description: To address unmet need for family planning among excluded and vulnerable women in Nepal by reducing  unwanted pregnancies and unsafe abortion through increase access to and use of modern methods of contraception.

title: Women Wealth and Influence
description: The project will result in improved wealth and influence of 65,000 women in 17 rural districts in Tajikistan

title: Islamic Relief Programme Partnership Arrangement
description: To provide strategic funding to Islamic Relief in support of agreed outcomes  in their PPA Performance Framework

title: Growth in Rural Economy and Agriculture in Tajikistan
description: Economic growth in rural areas increases and is more inclusive.The programme will focus primarily on the agricultural sector (including agro-processing, marketing and transport) and the energy-efficient housing sector by improving links between the different market actors and increasing the value of products and services.

title: Central Asia Investment Climate Programme
description: To  attract greater investment and  improve wealth creation in Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan by the private sector by reducing the administrative burden faced by businesses through simplifications of regulations and tax administration and development of Private Public Partnership investments

title: Queen Elizabeth Diamond Jubilee Trust
description: To deliver development results for individuals and communities across the Commonwealth by enabling the Trust to plan and design projects and raise funds.

title: South Sudan Health Pooled Fund II
description: To provide a government led effective health system that will deliver improved access to quality health services across six states in South Sudan with a specific focus on reducing maternal and child mortality.

title: Zoonoses (diseases naturally transmitted from animals to people) and risks to the poor
description: To provide evidence where (globally) the risk to the poor from zoonoses is greatest and identify gaps for future research planning related to zoonoses

title: Degraded Land Mapping for Kalimantan and Papua provinces
description: To make decision makers (in  public and private sector) implement policies to support socially equitable oil palm expansion onto low-  carbon degraded land and reduce conversion of forested areas

title: IFPRI study on aflatoxin and child stunting links
description: The purpose of this reserach is to extend the evidence base on the association between dietary exposure to aflatoxin (highly posionous moulds found in maize and other crops) and child growth. The research uses a randomised controlled trial methodology to study the impact of an intervention aimed at lowering aflatoxin exposure among children from birth to 2 years of age in eastern Kenya.  Evidence of a causal relationship would be expected to catalyse significant additional funding to control aflatoxin as a strategy for tackling childhood undernutrition.

title: Support to the OCHA Emergency Response Fund in Yemen 2012
description: To provide support the OCHA's Emergency Response Fund (ERF) in order to meet immediate humanitarian needs across Yemen.

title: Support to International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) in Yemen - 2012
description: To provide support to International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) in Yemen - 2012

title: Yemen Nutrition Programme 2012-2015
description: To improve nutrition for 1.65 million women and children in Yemen

title: Yemen Emergency Food Security Programme 2012/13
description: To provide emergency food assistance to vulnerable households in Yemen in 2012-13

title: Effective Support to Yemens Political Transition through the Friends of Yemen Forum
description: Ensure effective international support to Yemens political transition via the Friends of Yemen forum and other key international meetings, over the period September 2012 to March 2014.

title: Support to the INGO Consortium in Yemen 2012-13
description: To provide humanitarian assistance, through a consortium of international non-governmental organisations, to people affected by conflict, disaster and economic decline in Yemen in 2012-13.

title: Low Carbon Support to the Ministry of Finance
description: Supportive environment for low carbon investment established in Indonesia

title: Macro-evaluation of the Strategic Vision for Girls and Women
description: To improve the lives of girls and women by providing credible and rigorous evidence of what development aid models and strategies work and ensuring evidence directly impacts on improving future policy and programme designs.

title: World Bank Trust Fund on Agricultural and Firm-Level Productivity Data
description: High quality research on economic growth in Lower Income Countries using expanded firm/household - level productivity datasets.

title: Green Growth/Environmental Sustainability Accounting and Indicators investigatory work
description: To summarise and provide an understanding of the pros and cons of a range of accounting and indicators frameworks relevant to monitoring sustainable/green growth and development, including wellbeing (subjective and objective) accounting.

title: Haiti Evaluation and Learning Support Office
description: DFID will provide money to Groupe URD over three years to help the Haitian aid community

title: Support to ALNAP synthesis papers and humanitarian evidence portals
description: DFID will support the development of two new lessons learned papers and the updating and revision of three existing lessons learned papers and also improved access to humanitarian evidence through the development and maintenance of a shared platform

title: Low Carbon Studies - research projects to support the development of the International Climate Fund
description: This knowledge work will ensure the preparation of evidence based business cases and maximise results from low carbon ICF spend

title: Pitcairn Budget Aid 2012/13
description: Effective and efficient management of Pitcairn's public services provision.

title: Tristan da Cunha technical co-operation and capacity building
description: Provision of technical assistance and funding for capacity building for Tristan da Cunha

title: Tristan da Cunha Health Facility
description: The project will provide new hospital facilities enabling the delivery of improved health provision to all the inhabitants of the island.

title: Short-term Technical Co-Operation to support the St Helena Government deliver public services and prepare for air access 2012/13 - 2013/14
description: To support the St Helena Government through technical co-operation or "know-how" in the form of personnel, expert advice, training and research when these needs cannot be met from local resources and human capacity already on the island.  The impact of this intervention is to strengthen the St Helena Government's provision of core public services and accelerate the island towards self-sufficiency.

title: Support to Enterprise St Helena 2013/14 to 2016/17
description: To support private sector development and tourism-led growth in St Helena by part funding the St Helena Governments development agency, Enterprise St Helena.  Increased private sector capacity will help deliver the islands national goal of sustainable economic, social and environment development and will, in the longer-term, reduce reliance on UK budgetary aid.

title: Eliminating Blinding Trachoma
description: To contribute to the global effort to eliminate blinding trachoma. The UK is providing 50m over 5 years to support the implementation of Surgery, Antibiotics, Facial Cleanliness and Environment improvements (SAFE) activities to prevent , control and treat trachoma in a number of high-burden countries in Sub-Saharan Africa, with up to 455,000 people receiving surgical procedures to prevent blindness and up to 22m people protected from blinding trachoma through antibiotic distribution

title: Nigeria: Tackling Neglected Tropical Diseases through an Integrated Approach
description: An Integrated Programme Approach to Control a range of Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTDs) in Nigeria

title: Wilton Park Futures Conference 2012: Middle East and North Africa Department
description: To assist senior officials to consider international perspectives on the Middle East projecting 20 years from the Arab Spring.

title: Tackling Visceral Leishmaniasis (VL) in Asia & Africa Lot 1 and Lot 2
description: To tackle Visceral Leishmaniasis (VL) also known as Kala Azar, in South Asia and East Africa, this disease is spread by sandflies and when untreated leads to death in 95% of cases.  The programme will increase access to effective prevention and prompt treatment for VL and will  accelerate progress towards the elimination of VL in South Asia.

title: Poverty Impact Of Changing The Graduation Threshold In The Generalised System Of Preferences (GSP) Trade Scheme PRF
description: Poverty Impact Of Changing The Graduation Threshold In The Generalised System Of Preferences (GSP) Trade Scheme

title: Carbon Market Finance for Africa (CMF-Africa)
description: The project will transform the use of Clean Development Mechanism and other carbon market finance in Africa, for increased access to small scale, low carbon energy applications in rural areas. This will be through demonstrating the practical use and financial viability of innovative "standardised baselines" and new approaches to bundle small scale CDM projects (programmatic approaches)

title: East Africa Geothermal Energy (EA-Geo)
description: The programme aims to increase investment in geothermal energy in East Africa, contributing to economic development and growth, by addressing market failures which hinder the very early stages of geothermal market development, including: 	reducing the risk of exploratory test drilling, leading to increased investor confidence in under exploited East Africa geothermal energy; and, 	improving geothermal strategy, policy and regulations that facilitate investment.

title: UKAID-USAID ACCELERE! Improving access, quality and governance of primary education in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
description: Jointly funded and managed by UKAID and USAID, ACCELERE! is the name of our joint flagship education programme in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). By working together, we can support more children to access high quality education and have a shared policy voice with more influence.    ACCELERE! supports the Government of DRC better to deliver universal primary education through increased access to education, and by improving learning outcomes for girls and boys. The project aims to reduce barriers to primary education by providing access to alternative/accelerated learning programmes. It will also improve the quality of primary education through teacher training and the provision of new learning/teaching materials. To build sustainable sector improvements for the long term, ACCELERE! supports better governance of the education sector at all levels.  ACCELERE! targets eight provinces across DRC including those which are affected by conflict and displacement.

title: Strengthening the use of data for malaria decision making in Africa.
description: The Regional Malaria Programme is helping national Governments across Africa to pull together information on malaria to demonstrate progress, identify better use of resources and achieve the greatest long term impact across the continent. At least 22 African countries where there is malaria transmission will be directly supported.In Kenya, this kind of work can save $US50 million by targeting bed nets to people in need of protection from malaria. DFID has supported Tanzania and Nigeria map their epidemic. There has been a tremendous decline in malaria, in part, as a result of UK taxpayers investments. But progress is uneven and fragile. Both countries are using the data to fully understand the determinants of the decline in disease and better target future interventions to get the best value for money and sustain the gains.

title: NEADM - Creating New Energy Applications and Delivery Models for Developing Markets
description: The UK will provide 4.485 million to support a four year programme to develop new, innovative clean energy products and business models specifically for poor people in Africa and Asia. It is anticipated additional funding will be raised from the private sector and other foundations.

title: Ensuring Food and Nutrition Security in a time of volatility
description: To strengthen the evidence of policy and programme responses to food price volatility

title: Strengthening of food security analysis & decision making through support to the Integrated Phase Food Security Classification
description: To strengthen information gathering and analysis, evidence and impact of programmes aiming to improve food and nutritional security

title: Caribbean Export Promotion Initiative
description: This project will enable Caribbean Export Development Agency to refresh its export promotion strategy and kick off its implementation by supporting an investment forum and its associated "Break Points" competition.

title: Private Sector Development programme in the Democratic Republic of Congo
description: Foster sustainable economic activities to support the private sector to be an engine of green growth, job creation and poverty alleviation thus improving the lives of 1 million poor people in DRC by 2023..

title: Roads in the East in the Democratic Republic of Congo Phase II
description: Economic activity and service provision catalysed by building/upgrading secure, all-weather, climate resilient roads in North and South Kivu in the Democratic Republic of CongoTo improve the access of conflicted people to economic activity and service provision by building/upgrading secure, all-weather, climate resilient roads in North and South Kivu in the Democratic Republic of Congo

title: Jonglei Peace Process Project in South Sudan
description: To Prevent violence and promote peace in Jonglei State in partnership with communities, civil society, and government. The project will lay the foundations for the resumption of a more credible peace process to address intercommunal violence in Jonglei.  It will enhance the capacity of the Sudan Council of Churches (SCC), to support a complex peace process in Jonglei state. It will also support the co-ordination of the donor and NGO community with the SCC to ensure a more coherent approach to building peace in Jonglei, including in the delivery of peace dividends in the medium to long term.

title: Strategic Partnerships for Higher Education Innovation and Reform (SPHEIR)
description: To build on the achievements of Development Partnerships for Higher Education (DelPHE) phase 1 to design a dynamic and innovative higher education partnerships programme that: meets the needs of DFID priority countries and helps to progress development outcomes, strengthens the capacity of Higher Education Institutions in DFID priority countries to act as catalysts for poverty reduction and sustainable development, enables capacity strengthened higher education institutions in DFID priority countries significantly influencing MDG-related policy and practice.

title: Shelter, Sanitation Recovery and Resilience, Bangladesh
description: Households and individuals affected by waterlogging in South West Bangladesh able to protect themselves and their assets through access to and ownership of secure, disaster resilient shelter, sanitation and improved hygiene

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Support to Egyptian Integrated Development Network (ENID)
description: To support policy making in Egypt which promotes inclusive growth and strengthens voice and accountability.

title: Contribution to the global Emergency Response Fund evaluation
description: The UKs contribution will enable us to influence the scope of the evaluation as well as subsequent strengthening of the Emergency Response Funds (ERFs). Support for this evaluation is also in line with the UK evaluation policy. Furthermore, support to the evaluation will also enable us to work with new / emerging donors to build their awareness of pooled funds.

title: Identifying Common Principles in Aid for Building Resilience
description: To examine the way in which principles are being applied in International assistance  and whether a set of common principles shared between humanitarian and development actors could be identified to guide operations particularly to support work directed at building resilience to shocks and disasters.

title: International Development Support Project
description: To engage with China on developmental issues on international poverty reduction in order to  develop a shared agenda on innovative activities that expose aid practitioners to new and effective approaches to international development, including addressing demand from other developing countries for lessons from China's development experience.

title: Supreme Audit Organisations Capacity Building
description: The Capacity Building Committee of the International Organisation for Supreme Audit Institutions better serves the needs of its developing country membersTo better connect Supreme Audit Institutions (SAIs) in developing countries to capacity building initiatives being led by the INTOSAI Capacity Building Committee (CBC). By enabling representatives from developing countries SAIs to attend CBC committee meetings and through capacity building activities to improve the professional and organisational capacities

title: To update Estimates of Global Unmet Need and Costs of Providing Universal Reproductive Maternal and Neonatal Health (RMNH)
description: Guttmacher Institute is a leading research and policy organization committed to advancing sexual and reproductive health and rights. DFID is supporting the Guttmacher Institute to carry out a programme of research, evidence generation and dissemination for examining the costs and benefits of meeting unmet needs for reproductive, maternal and neonatal health (RMNH) in developing countries. The intended impact of this programme is to increase financing and policy commitments for reproductive, maternal and neonatal health (RMNH) in developing countries. The programme aims to achieve this by making an evidence-based case for increased investments and improved policies. The UKs investment in Guttmacher supports the institute to produce research and evidence to inform the provision of better quality services in developing countries.

title: Support to the International Financial Institutions to conduct work on the economic opportunities and challenges for Burma
description: To increase evidence-based discussion between the UK, donors and key Burmese stakeholders on economic opportunities and challenges for Burma

title: Multi-agency response to the food crisis in the Sahel 2012
description: The impact of the intervention will be that the most urgent humanitarian needs of affected populations are met, lives saved, dignity maintained and livelihoods protected.

title: CSO action on Nutrition
description: To support a global programme with country-led civil society initiatives in Scaling Up Nutrition countries to generate political commitment and leadership, to tackle undernutrition: improving nutrition policies and programmes; leveraging increased finance for nutrition; and strong monitoring and accountability mechanisms.

title: Asia Regional Resilience to a changing climate (ARRCC)
description: a regional partnership in South Asia among the research community, its funders, and users foster a more coordinated and interactive climate research environment that supports good decision making

title: Rural Access Programme 3
description: To improve road access for 800,000 members of rural communities in the Western Region of Nepal, thereby improving economic opportunities and increasing access to markets and social services throughout the year. The project will lift 20,000 people out of poverty through access to work, skill trainings, and will promote equal opportunities for women. The project aims to contribute towards sustainable poverty reduction through investments in high value crops and will lay the foundations for private sector led development in the poorest region in the country. Climate variability and climate change are integrated in building new roads and maintaining existing roads through the programme.

title: Rural Water and Sanitation Programme Phase V
description: To deliver improved water and sanitation services for the poor and excluded in remote rural areas of Nepal.

title: GALVMED PHASE 2
description: Make available and accessible animal health products to poor livestock keepers in low income countries that are affordable and technically suitable.

title: Disaster Resilience into Regional, Country and Sector Plans
description: Provide a Guidance Note/Best Practice Guide on how to embed Disaster Resilience into regional, country and sector plans

title: Montserrat Disaster Preparedness Repairs
description: To improve the safety of the population of Montserrat through strengthening disaster preparedness

title: Professional Evidence and Applied Knowledge Services
description: PEAKS will provide knowledge services to improve the professionalism of the four technical "families in DFID:Climate, Environment, Infrastructure & Livelihoods Economics & Private Sector Governance, Social Development, Conflict & Humanitarian Health (including nutrition) & Education

title: Centres for Learning on Evaluation and Results (CLEAR)
description: Five-year global programme to help strengthen developing countries capacities in monitoring, evaluation and resultsbased management.The immediate purpose is to develop the capacity of five regional centres, two in Africa, and one each in East Asia, Latin America, and South Asia to provide demand-based capacity-building and knowledge services in Monitoring & Evaluation. The centres will be supported in existing academic/training institutions (potentially a consortium of institutions in each region to respond to geographic and language needs) for a period of five years.

title: Specialist Evaluation and Quality Assurance Service
description: To support DFID through a transitional period during which the organisation will experience a surge in Evaluation and Monitoring  activity

title: Asia Regional Research Fund
description: To develop better research and evidence on emerging issues like urbanization, migration, resource scarcity, womens economic empowerment, and violence against women that have cross-border relevance in Asia or are common in multiple countries in the Asia region

title: Systematic review and research mapping programme South Asia
description: The programme aims to improve the quality of policy and effectiveness of development programmes by making high quality evidence more accessible to decision-makers in South Asia by commissioning and disseminating Systematic Reviews and similar evidence product on themes relevant to DFID Country Offices in the region.

title: Global Open Data for Agriculture and Nutrition (GODAN)
description: To coordinate international activities in agricultural/nutritional open data that will help to ensure governments and businesses are more transparent and accountable to citizens and that entrepreneurs are able to innovate with data to find better ways of doing things or to create new products, services and data-driven businesses in the agricultural/nutritional sectors. The project will sart in Nov 2014 and end in Nov 2019.

title: Basic Education Assistance Module (BEAM) 2012 in Zimbabwe
description: Strengthened provision of educational services to orphans and vulnerable children so that they acquire useful learning at schoolStrengthened provision of educational services to orphans and vulnerable children so that they acquire useful learning at school

title: Safe and Inclusive Cities
description: This project is expected to help developing country and international researchers and institutions strengthen their understanding of the relationship between urban inequalities, poverty and violence, as well as the most effective strategies for tackling these challenges.

title: Transparency and Accountability Interventions
description: Purpose:  To enable policymakers, donors, practitioners and expert to access new evidence for improving health policies from transparency and accountability interventions, through generation of high quality research and evidence on impact, generalizability and scalability of interventions; dissemination of results; and strengthened capacity.  This will benefit populations by 2017 particularly in Tanzania and Indonesia where the research will be implemented -  as well as other developing countries, through more robust and accountable health policies and interventions.

title: ODI Fellowships Scheme Accountable Grant 2012-2020
description: To provide skilled junior economists to work in developing country governments and organisations that need themTo provide up to 150 skilled junior economists over the 3 year period, each to work for 2 years providing technical economic advice to enable sound economic management and service delivery to the governments that are posted to in at least  20 developing countries, principally in sub-Saharan Africa,

title: Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability Programme
description: To support governments in planning and delivering public finance management reform through assessments of performance, promoting transparency and open measurement of results leading to improved public financial management and value for money of a countrys own resources and aid money delivered through government systems.

title: The Global Road Safety Facility
description: To reduce the number of road deaths and serious accidents in developing countries by supporting a World Bank Multi-donor trust fund (MDTF) to improve the evidence on what works to improve road safety outcomes and underpins GRSF key focus areas around safe infrastructure; safe speed; safe road users and emergency medical services and post-crash care. The MDTF provides funding, knowledge, and technical assistance to scale-up the countries efforts to build their scientific, technological, managerial and delivery capacities for road safety.

title: Growth and Poverty Reduction and Education Development Grant  Budget Support
description: To increase the use of better quality government services, including a higher number of births occurring in health facilities, more children passing exams, improving the condition of Tanzanias roads and more people using clean water

title: U4 core support 2012 - 2015
description: Better knowledge and training on anti-corruption related issues, leading to improved analysis of corruption risks in all DFID programmes and anti-corruption strategies (and those of other U4 partner countries)

title: To provide humanitarian assistance to those affected by the Syrian conflict in Syria and the neighbouring countries
description: To save lives, reduce suffering and maintain dignity amongst those affected by the Syria crisis, including the provision of medical assistance, shelter and food aid

title: Disadvantaged Girls Incentive Programme for Secondary Education in Odisha
description: To develop cost-effective systems for efficient implementation of  the  New Government of India's Pre- matric scholarship programme.  Aim is to improve secondary school enrolment, attendance and completion rates for 650000 dalit and tribal students in Odisha. Financial Assistance support will end in December 2015. Technical Assistance via  an  international competitive tendering will end in July 2016.

title: Global De-mining Meta Evaluation
description: To understand the effectiveness of the 2010 - 2013 Mine Action Strategy

title: Human Rights Programme
description: To support protection of key human rights by providing legal aid services to women in hard-to-reach areas, building civil society capacity to track civil and political rights and achieving greater recognition of issues of human rights in business. This will benefit over 30,000 women and 1,000 workers directly, and millions of ordinary citizens indirectly, through a nationwide tracking of civil and political rights in the build up to, during and after the 2015 elections, thereby reducing human rights abuses in the country. This will contribute towards the Millennium Development Goals by achieving more equitable growth and development in Tanzania by 2017.

title: Core Contribution 2012 - 2013 Food and Agriculture Organisation
description: A renewed Food and Agriculture Organisation delivering high quality services effectively and efficiently to developing countries in support of their plans to achieve food security and sustainable agricultural development.

title: Improving the Links between Disaster Resilience and Conflict Prevention
description: To provide better guidance to DFID and external audiences on improving the links between disaster resilience and conflict prevention.

title: Strategic Health and Nutrition Partnership
description: To support Indian policy and planning systems to promote an evidence based package of essential health and nutrition services through public and private channels

title: Promoting energy efficiency amongst Indonesia small and medium enterprises
description: In partnership with Germany's development bank (KfW), the purpose of the project is to establish a revolving fund and build capacity in financial institutions to promote investments in energy efficiency to reduce the growth of emissions in Indonesia

title: Access to Justice through Paralegal and Restorative Justice Services in Bangladesh
description: To improve access to justice for the poor by reducing the inflow of cases into the judicial system, reducing the remand population in prisons, and increasing diversion of cases out of the formal criminal justice system. Covering 40 of Bangladeshs 64 districts, it has already benefitted over 3 million poor people with improved access to accountable, efficient and effective justice services and paralegal service activities. Important response to COVID-19 in line with Business Case supporting health tracking of prisoners and health equipment in prisons.

title: Underprivileged Children's Education and Skills Programme
description: Ensure that underprivileged children are provided with quality general and technical education, skills development, employment support, and rights awareness

title: Katalyst Phase III - Agribusiness for Trade Competitiveness Project
description: Katalyst is a market development programme that aims to increase the productivity and incomes of small farmers and micro and small enterprises by facilitating access to information, skills, services and market linkages.

title: Evidence, Analysis and Coordination programme in the DRC
description: To take a structured approach to enhancing donor coordination and collaboration, undertaking analysis, accessing expertise and developing an evidence base to inform the delivery of its country operational plan and to inform the design of future strategies and programmes as well as to inform and influence other donors, Congolese and international partners

title: Transforming learning outcomes through learner centred teaching in Ghana
description: Research to enable the Ghanaian Ministry of Education and the Ghana Education Service to better leverage the existing body of knowledge and experience with new learner centred teaching approaches and with this knowledge make informed decisions about how to systematically improve the quality of teaching and learning in basic education.

title: PIDG: Core Support to Private Infrastructure Development Group
description: Increased responsible private sector participation in sustainable infrastructure in poorer developing countries through increased flows of private capital & expertise.This will benefit an additional 105.1 million people by the end of 2015.

title: Baseline Study to Identify Variables of Political Settlements and Confidence Building
description: Research into the role of political settlements and confidence-building as the essential foundation for recovery in fragile states, especially into identifying the role of international actors.

title: The Impact of Organised Crime on Governance in Developing Countries
description: Research to provide evidence to inform decisions on whether DFID's approach to governance and security in focus countries should specifically take organised crime into account.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility - Education for Employment Programme for Middle East and North Africa Region (International Finance Corporation/Islamic Development Bank)
description: To provide technical assistance to improve and expand the provision of education for employment services in the Middle East and North Africa region (Morocco, Tunisia, Egypt, Jordan) especially through the design and implementation of improved Qualifications and Competencies Frameworks (QCFs) in target sectors.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Country Impact Fund (CIF)
description: The Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) Country Impact Fund (CIF) will provide grant funding to support inclusive and sustainable economic growth in the Middle East and North Africa region.  Grants will support a range of local projects to: i) strengthen workplace skills that increase employability for up to 2,000 people; ii) support economic governance reforms; iii) create around 1,500 jobs through support to enterprise innovation; iv) strengthen the economic and social evidence base to inform national policy debates; and v) support at least 10 specific knowledge sharing and development coordination mechanisms.To support inclusive and sustainable economic growth in the Middle East and North Africa region by supporting a range of local projects to strengthen workplace skills to increase employability for up to 2,000 people; create up to 1,500 jobs through support to enterprise innovation; strengthen the economic and social evidence base to inform national policy debate; support

title: Assessment of The Capacity of Business Schools and Other Institutions to Support the Development of Entrepeneurship in East Africa
description: Research to assess the capabilities of Business Schools and other vocational training organisations, and Stakeholder needs, for the deilvery of business skills to support Entrepeneurship in Eastern Africa

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - World Bank MENA Trust Funds
description: Strong, effective and well coordinated World Bank assistance to reforming countries in Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region.

title: Measuring Absorptive Capacity in the Security and Justice Sectors
description: Research to develop the evidence base required for more sophisticated measures of absorptive capacity in developing countries, with an emphasis on improving the scale and design of programmes aimed primarily at improving security and justice.

title: Research on Future Proofing Cities
description: Research into climate compatible urban development - To provide good practice guidance and recommendations on effective, efficient, equitable and inclusive strategies and interventions for promoting "future proof"  urban growth for different typologies of citites in developing countries.

title: Research on energy return on investment ratio for major energy resources
description: Research into the global Energy Return on Investment (EROI) ration and how it has changed over time.The research will deliver a vital piece of new evidence to help partner countries make well informed decisions on their choice of energy trajectories, and to enable policy makers to better make a case for some renewable energy investments on strategic/economic grounds, strengthening the existing case made on climate grounds.

title: Global Mine Action Programme
description: Long after a conflict finishes, landmines and ERW continue to devastate peoples lives. Around the world today, millions of people live alongside land littered by landmines, grenades, rockets and ammunition. This is a major threat to the physical safety of communities. In 2011, it was estimated that more than 4,000 people were killed or injured by landmines and ERW. The threat that landmines and ERW pose to development is even more far-reaching. Millions of people are prevented from using agricultural land and accessing essential services, such as health and education, because of landmine and ERW contamination. Their presence hampers freedom of movement, prevents the safe and voluntary return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and refugees and obstructs the delivery of humanitarian aid. The goal of our mine action work is to build peace and security and support development in countries affected by landmines and ERW.

title: Security and Justice Innovation Fund
description: To fund and evaluate innovative approaches to the provision of security and access to justice which have the potential to make real differences to the lives of poor people.

title: Violence Against Women and Girls: Country Support
description: To contribute to a reduction in incidents of violence against women and girls in UK Government priority countries through ensuring effective, relevant and coordinated programming.

title: National School of Government - International (NSGI) - 2012 -2015
description: To help NSGI strengthen its governance and security work in capacity development, and thereby help partner governments achieve the Millennium Development Goals across all DFID country programmes.

title: Production of independent conflict analysis by International Crisis Group
description: To support International Crisis Group with the production of robust analysis and recommendations to contribute to the prevention or containment of deadly conflict around the world

title: Disaster Resilience Catalytic Fund
description: To embed disaster resilience to a minimum standard in DFID country programmes; generate evidence innovation in disaster resilience programming; accelerate work under Political Champions for Disaster Resilience

title: Funding support to key stakeholders for implementing the New Deal for Engagement in Fragile States
description: To improve engagement with fragile states by providing support to members of the g7+, the donor community and civil society, to take forward initiatives in a manner agreeable to and supported by fragile states. This will contribute towards a reduction in conflict and an increase in sustainable development for over 1.5 billion people in fragile and conflict affected states. This contributes towards our MDGs goals in reducing poverty.

title: Montserrat Budget Aid 2012/13
description: To deliver efficient and effective public services that meet reasonable assistance needs in Montserrat with the minimum budget contribution from the UK Government.

title: Short-Term Technical Cooperation to Support the Government of Montserrat Deliver Public Services
description: To support the Government of Montserrat through technical co-operation or "know-how" in the form of personnel expert advice, training and research when these needs cannot be met from local resources and human capacity already on the island

title: World Food Programme Operations in Darfur.
description: To improve food consumption for people recently displaced in Darfur, Sudan, by providing food vouchers to 440,000 beneficiaries (for seven months) and distribute food to 980,000 people (for three months) in sufficient quantity, quality and in a timely manner. This will contribute to the Millennium Development Goal n.1 that is eradicate extreme poverty and hunger by reducing the proportion of people without food.

title: Building Disaster Resilience in Pakistan
description: The programme aims to build resilience in communities and households in Pakistan to manage the impact of disasters by maintaining or transforming living standards in the face of shocks and stresses without compromising their long-term prospects.

title: Repairs to Calshot Harbour, TdC
description: To provide safe access to Tristan da Cunha for inhabitants and visitors by strengthening the structure of the breakwater and harbour to withstand winter storms.

title: Policy Analysis and Advice in Support of Economic Governance and Inclusive Growth
description: To increase the use of evidence and sound analytical work in policy making and implementation in the areas of economic governance and growth

title: Strengthening Health Facilities in the Caribbean
description: To provide safer, greener health facilities in Belize, Dominica, Grenada, Guyana, Jamaica, St Lucia and Saint Vincent and the Grenadines to deliver care in disasters, generate operational savings and reduce disaster losses and build climate resilience.

title: Integrated Programme for Strengthening Security and Justice
description: To achieve better security and access to justice for at least 1.85 million people, including over 1 million women and girls.

title: Public Financial Management and Accountability
description: To improve efficiency, transparency, and integrity of public finances at the national, sectoral and sub-national level in Nepal by providing support to Nepal government departments to foster more effective financial management that will benefit all Nepali citizens (more than 26 million) by 2017.

title: Strengthening Road Safety in Nepal
description: To improve road safety in Nepal by constructing 62 kilometres of road crash barriers along 620 kilometres of national highways in western Nepal; and improving road safety management capacity within the Government of Nepal.

title: CCMCC Promoting cooperation and avoiding conflict in managing the impacts of climate change
description: The aim of this project is to maximise benefits to poor people from international climate change finance. It will do this by generating evidence on the links between climate change and its impacts, and the likelihood of such impacts leading to either conflict or collaboration between and within communiteis.  It will help find ways for policies and programmes to foster collaborative rather than conflictual approaches to managing the impacts of climate change at local, national and global levels.

title: IPBES - Building the evidence base for effective policy making on biodiversity, ecosystem services and wealth generation
description: The  aim of this project is to ensure that international and national policies on biodiversity and ecosystem services are based on a solid evidence. The project supports the establishment and initial functioning costs of the Intergovernmental Panel on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES), a mechanism that was set up recently to inform policies on biodiversity and ecosystem services in the same way the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) informs international policy making on climate change. Our support complements a contribution from Defra and will help facilitate stronger developing country participation in decisions made by IPBES.

title: Comprehensive Programme on Spatial Planning and Low Carbon Development in Papua
description: Strengthened spatial and development plans and government supported actions on low carbon investment which will contribute towards ensuring environmental sustainability (MDG 7) and improved awareness among civil society about LCD and spatial planning.

title: Promoting Low Carbon Development with Returnable Capital in Indonesia
description: The DFID-AFD Partnership facilitates low carbon investment (in renewable energy, energy efficiency, forestry and transport) that results in GHG emission reductions and supports the regulatory reform process.

title: Pakistan Alternate Dispute Resolution Project Phase II (IFC-ADR)
description: Increased use of mediation as an efficient and reliable commercial dispute resolution mechanism

title: International Growth Centre (Phase 2)
description: To improve economic growth policies and programmes in 15 DFID focus countries to increase economic development for poverty reduction. This is done through country programmes that provide growth policy advice based on demands from policy makers in partner governments. New policies and programmes from the IGCs policy advice and research work are expected to improve growth for poverty reduction in all partner countries by March 2017.

title: Water, sanitation and hygiene service delivery in conflict-affected and fragile states
description: This research will examine Water, Sanitation and Hygiene programmes to identify the ways they impact on Peace Building and State Building. Based on this analysis, it will make recommendations for how future Water, Sanitation and Hygiene programming can be designed and delivered to maximise their positive contribution to Peace Building and State Building.

title: UK Evaluation Society/DFID Training Courses
description: to develop staff skills through a combination of training, mentoring and practical expertise

title: Improving climate change resilience in Caribbean communities
description: To build climate change and disaster resilience of vulnerable communities, by implementing safer building, flood and health protection measures in three states.

title: Engagement in national processess to form stable and effective state administrations
description: To improve community-government relationships in each of the 16 districts of Mogadishu.To support community-based stabilisation efforts in Mogadishu, improving community-government relationships across 16 districts including through basic service provision

title: Zimbabwe Girls Secondary Education 2012 - 2023
description: To strengthen scope and quality of educational service by issuing bursaries, enhance student access, retention and achievement in the secondary cycle with special attention to disadvantaged girls and boys in 1046 schools across 29 districts to complete 4 years secondary education by 2023.  This contributes to the realisation of Global Goal 4.

title: Community Disaster Risk Reduction Fund
description: To help the poorest and most vulnerable communities in the Caribbean adapt to the effects of climate change by implementing participatory, cost-effective community projects.

title: Better Education Statistics for Improved Learning (BESt)
description: This programme supports UIS (UNESCO Institute of Statistics), GMR (Global Monitoring Report) and PISA for Development (Programme for International Student Assessment) to enable the monitoring and use of key education indicators and data, in order to improve systems and learning outcomes

title: The Punjab Education Sector Reform Roadmap
description: Sustained political will for the implementation of education sector reforms to improve access, retention and the quality of education for primary school children in Punjab Province, Pakistan

title: Competition Reforms for Enhanced Welfare (CREW)
description: To develop better tools that governments, business and consumer groups  can  use to  capture the benefits that accrue to poor consumers and entrepreneurs from greater market competition in priority DFID countries in African and Asian markets. Key stakeholders will use these tools to push for competition reforms in at least 3 DFID countries (Zambia, Ghana and India) that will reduce prices of certain goods and/or services for all poor consumers and entrepreneurs by the end of 2016. This contributes  towards our MDGs by increasing poor peoples ability to buy more goods and services thus enhancing their well- being.

title: Graduation Response Fund
description: To support implementation of Civil Service Law and strategically led development of legal framework for non-civil servants in an effective way

title: English Language Training programme for Burundi
description: Support and develop an English Language Training (ELT) programme to boost Burundis competitiveness in the East African Community (EAC)

title: Working with RedR (a humanitarian NGO) to improve the effectiveness and delivery of the South Sudan humanitarian programme
description: Humanitarian organisations are able to operate effectively and safely in the identified programme areasHumanitarian organisations are able to operate effectively and safely in the identified programme areas

title: Regional East Africa Integration Programme Phase II
description: To increase trade, growth and poverty reduction through greater regional integration and trade competitiveness.

title: Releasing the Transformational Potential of Extractives for Economic Development
description: To improve transparency and accountability for oil, gas and mining and build skills of governments, companies and civil society to manage extractives to deliver growth and reduce poverty. To both raise global standards for transparency to drive accountability, including using technology tools and building capacity to use the data and also provide capacity support to resource-rich countries to manage extractives responsibly and accountably.

title: Support to Anti-Corruption Initiatives
description: To support a more conducive environment for longer-term anti-corruption reforms.

title: Mining and Gas Technical Assistance Project(MAGTAP)
description: To strengthen capacity and governance in key public sector institutions for improved management of the mining and gas sectors in Mozambique over the period 2013 to 2017.

title: Strengthening the administrative capability of Mozambiques Revenue Authority  - Tax Common Fund
description: To strengthen tax administration in Mozambique by providing support to Mozambiques Revenue Authority. A more effective, efficient and fair tax system will contribute to enhance Mozambiques domestic revenue mobilisation and gradually reduce aid dependency over the duration of the programme (2013-2019). This will indirectly benefit the wider population of Mozambique.

title: Center for Education Innovations
description: To create a global, public database and related tools to improve  access to quality non-state education provision for the poorest, women and girls

title: Support to HIV Strategic Investment Framework
description: Pilot scoping programme in upto 3 target countries to develop greater effectiveness and efficiency of National HIV responses

title: Access & Beneficiary Feedback Pilots Programme: Pilot programme to test mechanisms of seeking feedback by people directly affected by aid projects
description: To increase transparency, accountability and responsiveness of DFID to beneficiaries on the implementation of targeted DFID programmes

title: Deepening and Broadening Access to Financial Services in Mozambique
description: Through active engagement with a range of public and private stakeholders working at the macro, meso and micro levels, deepen and broaden the Mozambican financial sector contributing towards the Government of Mozambiques target of increasing financial inclusion to 35% (over 2 million beneficiaries) and supporting the provision of financial services to over 650 Micro, Small and Medium sized Enterprises (SMMEs) over 6 years.

title: Support for development of an Index to capture the social, economic and political impact of the World-Wide-Web, and increase Web access through regulatory reform.
description: To ensure better information on readiness, access, use and development impact of the Web is available to inform effort towards reducing the costs of accessing the internet through policy and regulatory reform

title: Developing Evidence Base for Delivering Sustainable and Value For Money Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Services.
description: To improve the evidence base for delivering sustainable and value for money water, sanitation and hygiene services through operational research to improve performance of DFID funded programmes; collaboration with partner organisations to develop innovative new approaches to providing sustainable urban sanitation services; and support of the international data and normative system for water, sanitation and hygiene.

title: Robert Carr Civil Society Network Fund
description: To provide support to the Robert Carr Civil Networks Fund in order that civil society networks, working at global and regional levels, have sufficient and predictable resources to enhance the quality, effectiveness and gender equity of the HIV response [universal access to prevention, treatment, care and support without stigma or discrimination], especially in reaching inadequately served populations at local level.

title: To estimate maternal and newborn lives saved using Lives Saved Tools (LiST)
description: The provider to design and implement a model to measure maternal and newborn lives saved as part of the UK Government's commitment made under Choices for Women.

title: Complementary Basic Education (CBE) in Ghana
description: Provide high quality nine-month flexible complementary basics education access to 120,000 out-of-school children in Ghana

title: CAFEF  Conflict-Affected and Fragile Economies Facility
description: To increase growth, jobs and incomes in fragile and conflict-affected states globally by providing political risk insurance to facilitate more foreign investment, leading to reduced poverty and increased stability. This will result in up to $180 million of additional foreign direct investment and the creation of up to 1800 direct jobs.

title: Integrated Agricultural and Nutrition Research: Identifying Gaps in Current Research Initiatives
description: To undertake a gap analysis of research at the interface of agriculture, nutrition and health, relevant to international development, being undertaken over the next 5 years, based on a rapid but detailed mapping exercise of major research activities.

title: Education evidence products
description: UK global leadership to synthesise evidence on the Best Buys and convene global decision makers to ensure evidence based policy making in education. This will support urgent reforms required in teaching at the right level, curricula and teacher reform to support learning across DFID countries. This programme responds to the manifesto commitment on girls' education.

title: Emergency Medicines Fund for South Sudan
description: To improve the procurement, distribution, and storage of emergency medicines in South Sudan by providing the most vulnerable, pregnant women and children under 5, with increased access to essential medicines. This will benefit an estimated 500,000 mothers and children and help reduce maternal and child deaths. This contributes towards our MDGs by improving both maternal health and child mortality rates and will result in a reduction of both by the end of 2014.To improve the procurement, distribution, and storage of emergency medicines in South Sudan by providing the most vulnerable, pregnant women and children under 5, with increased access to essential medicines. This will benefit an estimated 500,000 mothers and children and help reduce maternal and child deaths. This contributes towards our MDGs by improving both maternal health and child mortality rates and will result in a reduction of both by the end of 2014.To improve the procurement, distribution, and storage of emergency medicines in South Sudan by providing the most vulnerable, pregnant women and children under 5, with increased access to essential medicines. This will benefit an estimated 500,000 mothers and children and help reduce maternal and child deaths. This contributes towards our MDGs by improving both maternal health and child mortality rates and will result in a reduction of both by the end of 2014.

title: Inclusive Business Challenge Fund
description: To stimulate private sector led development, promotion and scaling up of innovative product and service solution to address the needs of poor people in Bangladesh.

title: Averting a Growing Crisis: Additional Humanitarian Support to South Sudan
description: Reduction in severe food insecurity and effective response to deterioration in humanitarian situation particularly for vulnerable populations

title: Evaluation of DFID Sudan Humanitarian Funding to NGOs
description: Lessons learned on strengths and weaknesses of longer-term strategic partnerships with INGOs to feed into future programming.

title: Building a Reliable Investment Climate in Kenya (BRICK)
description: To transform the business environment by lowering regulatory burdens for businesses and private sector in Kenya, and creating a competitive economy with improved infrastructure in order to contribute to increasing incomes and job opportunities for the poor

title: Provide effective security and justice advice and support (including policing) to fragile and conflict-affected states
description: Provide effective security and justice advice and support (including policing) to fragile and conflict-affected states

title: Support to Elections in Phase 2 of Yemens Transition
description: To provide support to Yemen's political transition including elections, civil society accountability and empowerment.

title: Supporting reform of the Caribbean Community (CARICOM) Secretariat
description: A more effective Caribbean Community (CARICOM) Secretariat which is better able to deliver social and economic benefits for Caribbean citizens.

title: Citizen Service Engagement Programme
description: To strengthen citizen influence on publicly provided health and education services and decentralised funds, by providing grants to civil society organisations in 9 districts. The grants will be used to increase citizens' understanding of their rights and generate support for the inclusion of women in decision making. This will benefit over 300,000 citizens by improving their influence over local decision makers and service providers, increasing the number of women in decision making at councillor and local association levels and improving basic services for women and girls by 2018.

title: Kenya - Strengthening Regional Economic Integration
description: To improve the pace of infrastructure development and enhance regional trade competitiveness, by delivering improvement to the managerial capacity and physical layout for cargo handling at the Port of Mombasa, and improved regulatory framework for trade. This will contribute to increased exports and regional trade in East Africa benefitting the regional population.

title: Research to assess the impacts on developing countries of measures to address emissions in the international aviation and shipping sectors
description: Research to understand how market based measures to address CO2 emissions in the international aviation and shipping sectors would impact on developing countries.

title: Education Quality Improvement Programme  Tanzania (EQUIP-T)
description: To support the improvement of the quality of education in primary schools in Tanzania and to increase the number of children, particularly girls, able to transfer to secondary education by improved teaching of early grade reading and numeracy.

title: Private Sector Development Programme - Design Phase
description: This is the design phase that will inform the design and implementation of our support to the private sector development in Malawi

title: Further Strengthening of Commission for Oversight of Public Finance
description: To improve the Committee for Oversight of Public Finance's ability to effectively scrutinise  budget organizations work

title: Development and dissemination of evidence and policy tools to support the Middle East Peace Process
description: Better informed and more effective policy engagement on Middle East Peace Process issues by UK government and key international partnersBetter informed and more effective policy engagement on Middle East Peace Process issues by UK government and key international partnersBetter informed and more effective policy engagement on Middle East Peace Process issues by UK government and key international partners

title: Monitoring and Evaluation of the UK's Framework for Results for Malaria in the Developing World and Choices for Women: Planned Pregnancies, Safe Births and Healthy Newborns.
description: The UK will provide up to 4.5m to evaluate the implementation and outcome of (i) Breaking the Cycle: Saving lives and protecting the future: The UK's Framework for Results for malaria in the developing world and (ii0 Choices for women: Planned Pregnancies, safe births and healthy new-borns. The UK's Framework for Results for improving reproductive, maternal and new born health in the developing world.

title: Funding to Rapid Social Response (RSR)
description: Strengthened capacity of social protection systems to protect at least 1 million more poor people from the negative impacts of shocks, including at least 500,000 women. Social Protection will enable more poor people to continue to buy enough food to eat and access basic services such as education, health and clean water even when faced with shocks such as drought or floods.
