This will reflect an increase in spend on social protection of at least $427million through the International Development Association and $474 million through domestic funding by 2018

title: Assets to Adolescent Girl's Programme
description: Aims to support around 80 businesses and reach up to 200,000 girls with physical and tangible products that contribute to their economic empowerment. The programme will support early-stage, innovative business ventures with grant funding and intensive technical assistance, to ensure that their products reach girls directly and at scale. It will support ventures with operations in East Africa and South Asia.

title: Connecting Classrooms: supporting links between UK schools and schools in developing countries
description: To support partnerships between schools in the UK and developing countries and to enable teachers to teach young people about global poverty and international issues and to improve their teaching in other curriculum areasTo support partnerships between schools in the UK and developing countries and to enable teachers to teach young people about global poverty and international issues and to improve their teaching in other curriculum areasTo support partnerships between schools in the UK and developing countries and to enable teachers to teach young people about global poverty and international issues and to improve their teaching in other curriculum areasTo support partnerships between schools in the UK and developing countries and to enable teachers to teach young people about global poverty and international issues and to improve their teaching in other curriculum areasDFID funding is supporting partnerships between schools in the UK and developing countries and training for teachers so they can use these partnerships to teach young people about global poverty and international issues and to improve their teaching in other curriculum areas

title: Somalia Stability Programme
description: DFID support will build a greater number of areas of stability in Somalia, benefiting approximately 4 million Somalis.  Specifically, 900 communities will receive improved infrastructure, 72,000 people will feel safe from armed violence, 87 communities will have stronger and more legitimate local administrations and 72 existing peace agreements will be upheld with an additional 44 new peace agreements secured.

title: Accountability Programme - To support interventions that strengthen government accountability in Somalia
description: To improve government accountability from the local level up by building the capacity of citizens to better understand, articulate, and call for their needs to be met.  It will also provide support to government bodies in order to respond to this demand.

title: Support to Emergency Measles Vaccination Campaign and Polio Elimination Efforts in Uganda
description: To contribute towards a reduction of morbidity and mortality related to measles  and polio diseases in Uganda

title: Evidence for Development
description: The Evidence for Development (E4D) programme aims to strengthen the data and evidence ecosystem in Nepal. It focuses on federal, provincial, local government and non-government actors to promote use of data and evidence for more effective and efficient programmes and policies and longer-term strategic portfolio design and management. It also aims to foster a culture of learning in the British Embassy Kathmandu (BEK), among other Development Partners and in the Governments of Nepal.

title: SHARP-Sudan Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Programme
description: To respond to suffering resulting from conflict and natural disasters by providing lifesaving assistance and helping people rebuild their livelihoods. 1.5 million people will benefit from interventions (health, water, and sanitation, nutrition, food security and protection) and the provision of shelter and non-food items. This contributes towards our Millennium Development Goals by providing humanitarian assistance and will result in a reduction in loss of life and suffering.

title: Urban Health: Strengthening Care for Poor Mothers and New-borns in Bangladesh
description: To improve maternal, new-born and reproductive health services for the urban poor in Bangladesh by unifying and expanding quality clinical and community outreach services which will benefit over a million couples with modern family planning methods and will  contribute to over 98,000 births attended by skilled providers by April 2018.

title: Growth Analysis in Sierra Leone
description: To assist the Government of Sierra Leone (GoSL) prepare a prioritised Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP) that promotes economic diversification and inclusive growth

title: Financial Support to the International Committee of the Red Cross(ICRC)  in the Occupied Palestinian Territories
description: Support the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) to enhance the protection of civilians in the Occupied Palestinian Territories (OPTs), to provide immediate humanitarian assistance, and to improve the capacity of medical services

title: To Support the General Education Quality Improvement in Ethiopia
description: Building on the successful completion of phase I to improve learning conditions and education institutional capacity by providing teaching and learning materials, teacher training and school grants designed to improve the quality of teaching and learning in schools. DFID support will help enhance learning outcomes for over  21.6 million children (of which 10.54 million will be girls). This contributes towards MDG 2 by ensuring every child attends primary school and increasing the number of children who stay in school by 2017.

title: To deliver 50% of the costs of a World Bank (WB) Public Financial Management (PFM) Expert to Improve PFM in the Occupied Palestinian Territories
description: To provide the World Bank with the capacity to influence the Palestinian Authority (PA) to make progress on Public Financial Management (PFM) in the Occupied Palestinian Territories

title: Power and Infrastructure Technical Assistance
description: To support Power and Infrastructure development in Bangladesh by providing Technical Assistance to relevant public and private institutions.

title: Rwanda Growth and Poverty Reduction Grant (GPRG)
description: To enhance the Government of Rwanda (GoR)s ability to reduce poverty and inequality, provide better essential services to poor Rwandans (especially education, health, water and sanitation, social protection) and increase equitable, pro-poor economic growth through increased investment in infrastructure, energy and agriculture

title: Support for Conflict Affected People and Peacebuilding
description: Meet more of the basic humanitarian needs of Burmese refugees and displaced and persons in conflict-affected border areas in Burma; and equip them with the knowledge and skills for return and reintegration to Burma.

title: Economic development in the municipality of Zubin Potok
description: To increase the opportunity for entrepreneurs to attain economic growth in northern Kosovo

title: Crisis and Recovery Mapping and Analysis Project (CRMA) Phase II
description: To build capacities of the Government of Sudan, state authorities, and local institutions;  and international and national NGOs are able to manage information on drivers and triggers of conflict and use this evidence-base for strategic planning.

title: Rwanda Peacebuilding Support Programme (PSP)
description: To support the Institute of Research and Dialogue for Peace to conduct research and facilitate informed political and social debate (at local and national levels) to influence policy reforms, by 2016, thereby enabling citizens increased engagement on issues that affect their lives.

title: Sudan free of Female Genital Cutting.
description: To decrease the prevalence of Female Genital Cutting in Sudan thereby promoting gender equality and empowerment of women (MDG 3).

title: Transition and Recovery of Nepal's Health System
description: To improve the health of the Nepalese people, through an increase in the access to and quality of health services with a particular focus on equity, protecting the poorest and the changing burden of disease and priorities after the Nepal earthquake

title: Humanitarian Emergency Procurement Project
description: To enable the UK to respond quickly, effectively and appropriately to humanitarian crises by drawing on equipment and materials that enable us to meet the needs of up to 17,500 beneficiaries and to support the field deployment of DFID and key partners teams for up to three simultaneous events

title: Business in the Community: Private Sector Engagement Programme
description: To improve the effectiveness and coordination of the UK private sector in its response to major humanitarian emergencies. By 2018, the results of this investment will be that UK businesses are better prepared to respond to humanitarian emergencies quickly, effectively and appropriately. The increased awareness that this support will provide of the case for greater corporate engagement in humanitarian response, as well as practical advice and brokering, will see a more routine application of their skills, expertise, products and services leading to more lives saved.

title: Humanitarian Emergencies Secondment Facility
description: To improve humanitarian emergency responses by providing the United Nations humanitarian agencies and other partners with humanitarian expertise.  This will benefit people affected by disaster and conflict and improve the capacity of the international community to mount an effective response.  This contributes towards our MDGs by supporting assistance to vulnerable people.

title: United Nations Disaster Assessment and Coordination (UNDAC) Support Programme
description: To ensure a more informed, better assessed, better coordinated and more effective response to sudden onset humanitarian emergencies.

title: Development of Humanitarian and Leadership Academy
description: Development of Humanitarian and Leadership Academy

title: United Kingdom International Search and Rescue (UKISAR) Deployment Support Programme
description: To support training of, and stand-by costs for, the United Kingdom International Search and Rescue teams to enable rapid and effective deployment in response to sudden onset emergencies.

title: Humanitarian Accreditation and Certification Support Programme
description: To improve the certification and accreditation of non governmental organisations and other actors in the humanitarian sector, enabling decision-makers and funders of humanitarian responses to make more informed choices about the organisations they support.

title: Access to Finance Programme
description: To improve the provision of loans and other financial services for 32,441 small enterprises and 677,000 households in Nepal

title: Accelerating Investment and Infrastructure in Nepal
description: To accelerate private investment and economic growth in Nepal by providing technical expertise to help Nepalese institutions develop major infrastructure; improve the business climate for domestic and foreign investors; improve the implementation of economic policy and test new approaches for local economic development. This will result in at least 600 million of private investment into growth-boosting sectors and a reduction by at least 10% in time or cost for at least five regulatory processes perceived as burdensome by the private sector.

title: Programme for the Promotion and Protection of Women and Childrens Rights
description: To  increase gender equality in Zambia  by providing capacity building support to the Ministry of Gender and Child Development (MGCD).This will contribute to MDG 3 by strengthening capacity to coordinate and implement gender responsive policy planning and budgeting including increased collection of sex-disaggregated data by 2016

title: Zimbabwe Livelihoods and Food Security Programme
description: To improve the food and nutrition security of 350,000 small holder farmers in 11 rural districts of Zimbabwe by raising farm productivity through training of farmers and introducing improved agricultural practices, linking the farmer groups to input and output markets, facilitating access to rural finance and promoting production and consumption of nutritious foods including bio-fortified and fortification of maize.

title: Agricultural Inputs Provision Programme 2012-14
description: Improved food and nutrition security of vulnerable households in 20 districts in Zimbabwe

title: Creation of the National Fund for Climate & Environment (FONERWA)
description: To help the Government of Rwanda achieve low carbon, climate resilient growth by providing technical assistance to help them manage FONERWA  a national fund for environment and climate change. This will help build national capacity for managing the fund by September 2015 and ensure that contributions to the fund are well-spent.

title: Yemen Micro, Medium and Small Enterprises Support
description: Scoping study to inform support to small and medium enterprises in Yemen

title: Yemen Economic Growth Analysis Project (YEGAP)
description: To undertake analysis and policy development aimed at supporting economic growth in Yemen.  The project will produce four studies in the following areas, i) addressing the binding constraints to economic growth, ii) development and reform of the extractives sector, iii) addressing weaknesses in the public financial management system and iv) support for other critical economic analysis as required until September 2015.

title: Emergency Food Assistance to the Food Insecure and Conflict-Affected People in Yemen (2015-16)
description: To provide emergency food assistance (in-kind, cash and voucher) to at least 580,000 food insecure and conflict affected people in Yemen until March 2016, delivered through the World Food Programme.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF): Carnegie Middle East Centre Research Programme
description: Provide grant funding to Carnegie's Middle East Research Centre to strengthen research capacity in the Middle East and North Africa region for better public policy making

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF): G7 Deauville Transition Fund
description: To Contribute to Inclusive and Sustainable Growth through Governance and Economic Reforms in the six Arab Countries in Transition (ACT): Egypt, Jordan, Libya, Morocco, Tunisia and Yemen.

title: Social Protection Programme Phase II
description: To help 40,000 households to protect orphans and vulnerable children in the family from hunger and under-nutrition and enable those children to get an education and be more healthy.  This will be achieved through cash payments until 2017.  By this date there will also be a better national social protection system, led by the Government of Kenya.The programme contributes to Millennium Development Goals 1(Reduce Extreme Poverty), 2 (Universal Primary Schooling), 3 (Promote Gender Equality and Empower Women).

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF): Shell Foundation/GroFin Enterprise Development Programme
description: To implement a locally managed, financially viable, scalable and integrated solution to support the growth of Small and Medium Sized Enterprises (SMEs) and job creation in Jordan and Egypt. This will create jobs for 5,000 people by 2018.

title: Contributions to the Poverty Reduction and Growth Trust of the International Monetary Fund
description: To make a financial contribution to the International Monetary Fund Poverty Reduction and Growth Trust to support Low Income Countries facing balance of payment difficulties avoid sharp adjustments in incomes and living standards in the short term and improve their macroeconomic environment in the medium term.

title: British International Investment (BII) Programme of Support in Africa, South Asia, Indo-Pacific & Carib (2015-2027)
description: To enable BII to scale up its activity of investing and lending to support the building of businesses in developing countries, to create jobs and make a lasting difference to peoples lives in some of the world's poorest places. BII is FCDOs main vehicle for investing in private companies in Africa, South Asia, Indo-Pacific and the Caribbean. BII encourages capital investments from other private investors by being a first mover, demonstrating to other investors that commercial returns are possible in these frontier markets, and by sharing risk and expertise. The additional equity from FCDO will enable BII to meet demand for capital in its target markets and allow BII to sustain a higher volume of more developmental investments across priority regions and business sectors

title: Increasing sustainable access to water sanitation and hygiene in the Democratic Republic of Congo
description: To reduce the rate of diarrhoeal morbidity in children under five by increasing access to water, sanitation and hygiene for 3,755,000 people in the Democratic Republic of Congo

title: Responsible Accountable and Transparent Enterprise  - RATE
description: DFID will provide 30.3m from July 2014 to March 2020 to help multinational and local businesses manage the social and environmental implications of their actions, and be accountable for the consequences for poor workers and communities who may be affected by them. This programme will engage with partners across a range of responsible business approaches, such as voluntary standards, company reporting, and human rights and gender impact assessments, in order to improve enterprises social and environmental risk management, and their accountability, transparency and openness to participation. In particular, the programme will work with the private sector to implement a mix of influencing and international coordination initiatives which tackle the root causes of modern slavery and child labour and support its victims.

title: Support to Business Networks
description: To use Business Networks as a conduit to promote DFID's objectives. To encourage the private sector to promote sustainable, inclusive and responsible business in developing countries and inform and strengthen wider DFID links to corporate partners.

title: Building statistical evidence base in Yemen
description: To improve the quality and accuracy of statistical data in Yemen for improved policy and programme design

title: Support to Palestinians at Risk of Displacement in Israeli Controlled Area C of the West Bank and Gaza
description: This programme invests up to 3.77m (revised budget 2013/16) to help Palestinian farmers in Area C support their families through increased incomes from agricultural production. The programme also helps Palestinians produce spatial plans (also known as master-plans) as a means to engage the Israeli planning system to prevent properties being demolished. The lack of spatial plans is one of the reasons that demolitions are carried out by the Israeli authorities. In July 2015, the programme extended its support from Area C to Gaza, to develop a community-led master plan that will provide the basis for reconstruction and strengthen the Palestinian Authority statebuilding effort in Gaza. In December 2015, UK Ministers agreed to fund the EU managed Access to Essential Social and Public Infrastructure in Area C that provides basic infrastructure within the boundaries of master-plans.

title: Improved Family Planning and Reproductive Health Services in India
description: To increase use of family planning methods to reduce maternal deaths,  improve birth spacing practices and prevent unsafe abortion in Bihar and Odisha.

title: Support to Malaria Control in the Democratic Republic of Congo .
description: To reduce the burden of malaria in the Democratic Republic of Congo by providing essential prevention and treatment services and strengthening disease surveillance. The programme will help to protect approximately six million people from the disease, and will contribute towards the MDGs by reducing malaria deaths in Democratic Republic of Congo

title: Policy Development Fund, Tanzania
description: To provide support to both the Government of Tanzania and development partners to develop high-quality policies, strategies and analysis in critical areas of emerging need.To provide support to both the Government of Tanzania and development partners to develop high-quality policies, strategies and analysis in critical areas of emerging need including oil and gas, Somali piracy, anti-corruption in Zanzibar and use of geographic information system (GIS) data

title: Agriculture Census of Kosovo, 2012-2014
description: Government of Kosovo is able to produce a range of new, reliable statistics on the agricultural sector

title: Multi-year Humanitarian Programme 2013 to 2017
description: To meet the most urgent humanitarian needs of conflict and disaster affected populations through provision of life-saving assistance which will benefit up to 200,000 people per year and provision of livelihood assistance which will benefit up to 300,000 vulnerable people per year and help them increase their level of resilience.   This contributes towards our commitment to follow recommendations made in the Humanitarian Emergency Response Review and will result in fewer Somalis in need of humanitarian assistance and living in dignity with improved resilience by 2017.

title: Public Private Partnership Support Facility
description: To support the Government of Vietnam in developing and implementing the Public Private Partnership policies, institutional and legal framework to achieve high quality and equitable infrastructure services

title: Support to Statistics in Zimbabwe
description: To improve the knowledge of the social, demographic and economic characteristics of the people of Zimbabwe by strengthening the capacity of the Zimbabwe National Statistics Agency (ZIMSTAT) to develop, manage and coordinate the national statistical system effectively; to produce and disseminate quality data and statistics including key economic and social statistics; and the delivery of a successful census, by 2015. This will provide relevant, timely and reliable statistics needed to inform the design and implementation of key policies and programmes by Government of Zimbabwe, development aid partners and civil society organisations. This in turn contributes towards the MDG of poverty alleviation in Zimbabwe by 2015.

title: Support to Accountability Institutions in South Sudan, 2012-2014
description: To support the South Sudan Anti-Corruption Commission to be able to effectively discharge its anti-corruption mandate in terms of countering corruption and enhancing accountability to the South Sudan population and the international donor community

title: Skills Improvement Programme (SKIP)
description: To have higher incomes for TEVET graduates in Zambia by providing greater numbers of women and men with skills beneficial to gainful employment. This will mean the national TEVET systems are strengthened and more graduates will have relevant, quality technical/vocational skills, with more equitable access to skills development for disadvantaged groups. This contributes towards our MDGs by supporting girls to complete higher levels of education by 2019

title: Access to Justice Programme in South Sudan
description: To enhance the effectiveness of essential justice services for 250,000 women by reducing impunity and increasings access to justice for them.  This will by 2019, contribute towards reducing conflict and building a more stable South Sudan at peace with itself and its neighbours.

title: Risk Pools Programme (RPP)
description: To support a parametric (index-based) weather risk insurance pool that will provide participating African countries with predictable, quick-disbursing funds with which to implement pre-defined contingency response plans in the case of a drought.

title: Productive Social Safety Net Programme
description: To support the scale up of the Productive Social Safety Net which will reach  1 million households, and these households are the poorest 15%.  through the provision of conditional Cash Transfers, Green Public Works and Livelihood Enhancement.  This programme will aim to improve the opportunities available to the poorest communities by reducing the depth of income poverty, improving food consumption and increasing their resilience to climate-related shocks.  DFID will also support central government to develop and strengthen systems and institutions to deliver more comprehensive social protection provision that can respond to any future economic, food or climate shocks in Tanzania

title: Support to the Africa Progress Panel (APP)
description: Support to the Africa Progress Panel to track and encourage social, economic and political progress in Africa and promote the shared responsibility of African leaders and their international partners to achieve this progress for the benefit of all Africa.

title: Caribbean Criminal Assets Recovery Programme
description: To strengthen the capability of 11 Caribbean jurisdictions to recover the assets of criminals by providing technical assistance and mentoring support. The project will provide the authorities with updated legislation and expertise to seize and forfeit cash and other criminal assets. It will strengthen the authorities capability to investigate those who facilitate money-laundering (lawyers, accountants and property developers) as well as criminal bosses. The project will deliver an increase in the number of prosecutions and will increase the volume of money confiscated from criminals. This will benefit the people of the Caribbean by reducing the corrupting influence of money-laundering on small local economies and governments, by creating a disincentive to criminal behaviour, and by reducing crime.

title: Teacher Education through School-based Support in India: Improving the Quantity and Quality of Teacher Education in India
description: To reach 1 million teachers across India with classroom focused instructional materials collaboratively produced by the UK Open University and Indian specialists and distributed using the internet and mass media  thereby transforming teacher competence and enhancing learning for the poorest children. Delivery through DFID support to UKs Open University as a charitable trust  DFID support to Teacher Education through School based Support in India will cease as of March 2016.

title: Support to the Public Private Infrastructure Advisory Facility (PPIAF), a multi donor facility aimed at supporting governments attract private sector investment in infrastructure (water and sanitation, energy, telecommunications and irrigation)
description: DFID supports two components of the programme, the Multi Donor Trust Fund II (MDTF II) and the Sub-National Technical Assistance Programme (SNTA). The MDTFII  works with governments to improve the enabling environment to support great private sector investment in infrastructure. The Subnational Technical Assistance Programme (SNTA) helps sub-national authorities access market-based financing, without sovereign guarantees by  a) providing financial and legal technical assistance to help structure and finance infrastructure projects and b) strengthening their creditworthiness (credit rating) so they are able to raise funds to fund their own infrastructure needs.

title: African Institute for Mathematical Sciences
description: To enhance the mathematical science capacity of Africas workforce to develop innovative solutions for economic growth and development challenges.

title: Madhya Pradesh Urban Infrastructure Investment Project
description: To provide sustained and equitable access to basic services and infrastructure by March 2015  thereby reducing by one third the disease burden in children in urban areas in Madhya Pradesh. Financial Assistance ends by December 2015.

title: Saving Lives at Birth
description: To identify and support transformational approaches to womens and newborns health that can be scaled up to reduce deaths and poor birth outcomes for millions of women and newborns in the hardest to reach communities of the world.

title: Strengthening Political Participation phase 2
description: To increase public understanding of and engagement in political processes, with a focus on women and young people, to improve the way the political process supports development, poverty reduction and stability in Bangladesh. Strategic fund with the FCO. In line with Business Case, responds flexibly to conflict and political instability risks brought on by to COVID-19.

title: Transparency and Right to Information
description: Increased transparency and accountability, and reduced corruption in Bangladesh through smart advocacy and adaptive programming for policy, system and community change. Critical policy areas include - addressing health sector corruption and social safety net corruption (Transparency International Bangladesh); support to returnee migrants; increasing Bangladesh's access to climate finance and supporting poor people facing climate migration (British Council).

title: Support to Bangladeshs National Urban Poverty Reduction Programme (NUPRP)
description: Improvement in the integration of poor communities into municipal planning, budgeting and management, with a particular focus on women and girls and climate resilience; piloting of options for scale up and lesson learning at national level to inform overall urban policy and poverty reduction

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Support Services-International Climate Fund financing
description: DFID (and DECC and DEFRA) for International Climate Fund Programmes can demonstrate robust procedures for monitoring and evaluating value for money across its development programmes

title: Clinton Health Initiative - Pilot demand-driven Impact Evaluations
description: The purpose of the pilot is to test whether the findings from impact evaluations that are generated by national Ministry of Health officials and that address operational questions in a timely manner are more likely to be accepted and implemented than from traditional impact evaluations

title: CARIAA - Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative in Africa and Asia
description: Research to identify what works and what doesnt in terms of cost-effective and sustainable ways to improve the resilience and capacity to adapt to climate change of the poorest and most vulnerable people and communities in three climate change hot spots  semi-arid regions of Africa and Central and South Asia; low-lying heavily populated deltas of Africa and South Asia and; densely populated river basins dependent on snow-pack or glaciers.

title: Support to St Helena Government Short Term Technical Cooperation Assistance 2014-2015
description: To support St Helena Government through funding short-term international technical cooperation expertise (know-how in the form of personnel, technical advice, targeted training and research) where their needs cannot be met from local resources and human capacity.

title: Poverty and Growth Programme
description: To increase public and political support for economic reform by improving the communication of evidence to target audiences on the constraints to growth.  This will benefit the people of Pakistan and improve economic policy development. This contributes towards our Sustainable Development Goals  by using policy and practice to achieve transformative change and understanding of the need for macroeconomic stability and growth to reduce poverty.

title: Executive Masters Programme in Security Sector Management Cohort 3-5
description: To increase a better informed Ethiopian Security Sector transformation by providing Security Sector Management course for 75 Security Sector Officials and to create a cadre of highly educated senior and mid ranking official, able to develop and implement a coherent approach to security sector management.

title: Monitoring , Evaluation and Learning from  the International Climate Fund
description: The purpose of the programme is to provide the evidence and learning to increase the effectiveness and measure the impact of the UKs international climate funding.

title: St Helena Budgetary Aid 2013/14
description: Efficient and effective public services maintain coverage of reasonable needs with minimum budget contribution from the UK GovernmentTo maintain efficient and effective public service coverage of reasonable needs to the peoples of St Helena within a minimum budget contribution from the UK Government.

title: Development lessons from successful emerging economies for Low Income Countries
description: This project will capture evidence based on the development lessons from successful emerging economies. The evidence will be promoted and used to influence policy and practice in Low Income Countries.

title: Support to International Centre for Trade and Sustainable Development (ICTSD) 2012-2014
description: Empowering stakeholders: the international trade system is influenced to advance the goal of sustainable development through enabling, supporting and facilitating effective stakeholder engagement, particularly from LDCs and other developing countries.

title: Investment and sustainable development programme.
description: Improved quality of developing country participation in international investment processes, including in negotiations and arbitrations.

title: World Bank Multi-Donor Trust Fund for Trade and Development Phase 2
description: to support the implementation of the WB Trade Strategy by building up the analytical base for targeted policy action to address barriers to trade and enhance greater trade liberalisation, in particular in low income countries.

title: Adolescence Research Programme GAGE (formerly GGRI)
description: The UK will generate new evidence on what works to transform the lives of poor adolescent girls to enable them to move out of poverty.  Results will directly inform FCDO and other international and national actors to develop or revise policies and programmes to effectively reach adolescent girls.  It will enable girls to have increased voice, choice, and control over their lives in at least 4 FCDO priority countries and lead to reduction in early and forced marriage, reduction in violence, and improved economic wellbeing. Evidence will lead to an increase in donor and national investments for girls.

title: Trade Transparency Project
description: To  improve global consumers understanding of how trade affects them by making complex trade data more transparent and easy to understand.  This will lead to greater citizen engagement with government on trade policy issues, resulting in more effective trade policies which will underpin future economic growth and poverty reduction.

title: Trade in global value chains initiative
description: Achieve social upgrading in targeted regions/sectors through investment in skills, communities, and government policy gaps.

title: Ghana Health Sector Support Programme - 2012 - 2018
description: To improve the health system in Ghana, by providing the Ministry of Health and its agencies with financial aid, materials, goods and technical assistance. This support will improve coverage and quality of primary care services and create a sustainable health system, supporting Ghana to reduce child and maternal mortality and make progress towards universal health coverage.

title: Human Development Innovation Fund for Tanzania
description: To support innovative approaches to improving the quality, value for money and sustainability of basic services in the education, health and water and sanitation sectors in Tanzania

title: Safety and Access to Justice Programme in South Sudan
description: To increase capacity of South Sudan Police Service improving coverage, accessibility and effectiveness of security arrangements for citizens.To increase capacity of South Sudan Police Service improving coverage, accessibility and effectiveness of security arrangements for citizens.To increase capacity of South Sudan Police Service improving coverage, accessibility and effectiveness of security arrangements for citizens.

title: Human Resources for Health Programme-Phase II
description: To strengthen the Zambian health system through the support of training, deployment and supervision of 3543 government health workers including community health workers, skilled birth attendants, biomedical engineering technicians and medical specialists as well as broader health system strengthening technical assistance.  This will contribute to the achievement of MDGs 4 and 5 through bringing life- saving interventions and prevention information closer to mothers and children (Nutsen)

title: United Nations Secretary General's Action Agenda on Climate Change-Support in 2012-2014
description: Climate Change Support Team delivers its planned workplan and outputs help the Secretary General in making the political space and the essential case for countries to support a Global Legal Agreement by 2015

title: DFID ESRC Joint Fund For Poverty Alleviation
description: To provide funding for social science research to generate new knowledge that will contribute to poverty alleviation in developing countries, which will facilitate achievement of MDGs

title: African Development Fund 13th Reple...
description: Contributing to economic and social development of Africa's 38 poorest countries  across the period 2015-2017.  The thirteenth replenishment of the African Development Fund aligns itself with the African Development Bank's Ten year Strategy and will focus on two objectives to improve the quality of Africas growth: inclusive growth, and the transition to green growth. It will focus on the five core operational priorities of infrastructure development, regional integration, private sector development, governance and accountability and skills and technology with special emphasis given togender, fragile states, agriculture and food

title: Asian Development Fund XI Replenishment. The United Kingdoms contribution to the 10th replenishment of the Asian Development Fund for the period 2013 to 2016. Asian Development Fund is the concessional loans and grants arm of the Asian Development Bank
description: Contributing to economic and social development in Asian Development Fund developing countries through investments in core sectors: transport, energy, water/sanitation, education and climate change. This will benefit the poorest people in the Asia-pacific region across the period 2013-2016. Expected development results by 2016 will include: 576,300 new households connected to electricity, 562,000 new households served with water supply, 363,600 new households served with sanitation, 20,852,000 people benefiting from road projects and 2.57 million students benefiting from school improvement programmes, or direct support to, primary and secondary education.  The Asian Development Fund will make a difference through the outcomes of the tenth replenishment to the impact of accelerating progress on the Millennium Development Goals in Asia. It has a track-record of providing substantial, effective support to the poorest countries in Asia and is well placed to help partner countries on the de

title: Start Up! programme  to improve the financial, commercial and technical support provided to entrepreneurs in low income countries to encourage the development of high growth and high impact businesses
description: To strengthen the entrepreneurial ecosystem in up to 7 sub-Saharan African countries to create business that create jobs, deliver innovative products and contribute to economic growth

title: Caribbean Development Bank Special Development Fund 8th Replenishment (SDF 8)
description: To contribute to economic and social development in the Caribbean regions poorest countries through investments in core sectors: Transport, education, water and sanitation, agriculture and climate change/environment across 2013-2016. Expected development results will include: 237,000 students benefitting from improved classroom conditions, 569,000 beneficiaries of road improvements and 1,962 km of roads built or upgraded, over 20,000 households with access to sanitation and water supply, 4,800 hectares of land irrigated or improved through drainage, flood and irrigation works, and projects contributing to climate change and disaster risk management through adaptation, mitigation and strengthened community infrastructure. The outcomes of the eighth replenishment will contribute to accelerating progress on the Millennium Development Goals in the Caribbean as they support wealth creation and include elements of climate change and gender equality (improving the lives of girls and women).

title: Tackling Maternal and Child Undernutrition Programme- Phase II
description: To contribute towards improved health and nutrition status for children under two years measured primarily by a reduction in stunting by 2023.

title: Pitcairn Budgetary Aid 2013/14
description: HMG's obligation to maintain Pitcairn's reasonable assistance needs cost-effectively met.

title: Pitcairn Budgetary Aid 2014/15
description: To maintain HMG's obligation to provide the Pitcairn Islands assistance needs in a  cost effective manner, ensuring value for money to the UK tax payer

title: Humanitarian Response to Food Insecurity in Malawi 2012-13
description: At least 500,000 vulnerable individuals protected against hunger, malnutrition and use of negative coping strategies

title: UK Aid Match 20132016: giving the public a say in how a portion of the aid budget is spent
description: UK Aid Match allows the UK public to have a say in how an element of the aid budget is spent. DFID will match fund, pound for pound, public donations to appeals made by selected not-for-profit organisations, enabling them to increase their poverty reduction and development work in DFID priority countries.

title: World Food Programme Emergency Assistance to Ivorian Refugees and Host Population in North-Central and South-Eastern Liberia phase 2
description: To provide school feeding for host communities and camps and general food in Liberia

title: Strengthening Anti-Money Laundering Systems in Developing Countries
description: To contribute to more effective anti-money laundering systems by providing expertise to strengthen laws, improve assessment of money laundering risks and put in place better supervision of financial transactions in developing countries and important regional financial centres. This will result in a lower likelihood of countries losing funds through illicit means.

title: Supporting Tax transparency in developing countries
description: The purpose of this programme is to enable partner countries to engage with, and benefit from, the international tax transparency agenda. Through funding the World Bank, The Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) and the Global Forum on Tax Transparency and Exchange of Information (Global Forum). The programme aims to enhance partner countries capability to tackle multinational tax avoidance and evasion and  1) supports developing countries to adopt and effectively implement transfer pricing rules in accordance with international principles 2) supports developing countries to participate effectively in international exchange of tax information  in line with the international standards of the Global Forum 3) assists developing countries to engage in, and benefit from the G20/OECD Base Erosion and Profit Shifting (BEPS)  project 4) enables the Global Forums Africa Initiative, which seeks to promote and expand the take up of exchange of information  standards.

title: United Nations Poverty and Environment Initiative (UNPEI)
description: A joint 'One UN' UNDP-UNEP programme to strengthen institutional and technical capacity within developing country governments to more effectively manage and address natural resource values, environmental risks and opportunities with national and local planning in targeted countries.

title: Institutional Support to the Electoral Process
description: To provide up to 7.8 million between November 2012 and March 2017 to support long-term institutional strengthening of the electoral process in Malawi, as outlined in the DFID Malawi Operational Plan. 6.1 million of this will be focussed on supporting the lead up to the event and immediate aftermath of the 2014 Presidential, Parliamentary and Local Elections. Post-election support (2015/16 onwards) will be subject to the results of a post-election strategic review in DFID Malawi and the new UK HMG spending round.

title: Mbuji Mayi Feasibility Studies Project
description: Determine if feasible technical options exist and, if so, their scope, to deliver drinking water to 175,000 people in the peri-urban areas of Mbuji Mayi, Kasai Oriental.

title: Centre of Excellence for Development Impact and Learning (CEDIL)
description: The project will establish a Centre of Excellence for Impact Evaluation. The Centre  will provide a range of services to strengthen the evidence base for what does or does not work in international development. It will address gaps in existing evaluation practice  areas, and  maximise the effectiveness of UK funded international development by delivering high quality policy relevant studies of specific programmes and themes and by providing technical and policy advice to FCDO and developments partners on better use of impact evaluation as well as developing and testing new and innovative approaches to impact evaluation.

title: Support to United Nations International Childrens Emergency Fund (UNICEF) to accelerate Sanitation and Water for All in countries currently unlikely to achieve the Millennium Development Goal targets.
description: To accelerate access to sanitation, hygiene and water for all by providing sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation in up to 12 countries which are currently unlikely to reach the Millennium Development Goal (MDG) targets.  This will result in improved access for at least 5 million people to sustainable Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) services.  This will help achieve progress towards meeting MDG target 7c (to halve by 2015 the proportion of the worlds population without sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation) in those countries where progress has been slow and to complement related MDGs in boosting child survival.

title: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene results programme to support scale-up efforts
description: To support poor people to access improved water and sanitation, and to introduce improved hygiene practices, to support the UK Government's targets of reaching 60 million people with improved water, sanitation and hygiene initiatives, in line with millennium development goal 7c by 2015.

title: Strengthening Adaptation and Resilience to Climate Change in Kenya Plus (StARCK+)
description: To achieve transformational change by helping Kenya to scale up private sector innovation and investment in low carbon and adaptation products, services and assets (e.g. clean energy, sustainable agriculture, water management, weather forecasting). Enabling this change will require targeted support to critical aspects of climate change governance, and stimulation of civil society demand. This contributes to the UK Governments International Climate Fund (ICF) commitments and will benefit 828,000 people able to cope with the effects of climate change and 17,600 people with improved access to clean energy.

title: Mobile and web technology roles in open and transparent government
description: Dissemination of current and developing mobile and web technologies so that they are readily available as new tools in developing open and transparent government

title: Provision of finance to the Rwanda Fund for Climate Change and Environment
description: To improve climate adaptation and low carbon development by providing finance to the Rwanda Fund for Climate Change and Environment from the UK International Climate Fund. This will benefit 15 000 people to cope better with climate change impacts, 2000 people gain access to clean energy especially in rural areas, protect 1200 hectares of land against soil erosion, create 2000 green jobs as well as mobilise 8 million of additional finance from the private sector by July 2015. This contributes towards the MDG on environmental sustainability and ensuring an effective response to the impacts of climate change,  thus securing current and future development gains as well as protection of the livelihoods of the poorest people.

title: Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor (WSUP)
description: To improve health and living standards targeted at men, women and children living in low income urban areas of Bangladesh, Ghana, Kenya, Madagascar, Mozambique and Zambia.

title: Poverty Reduction Budget Support to the Government of Sierra Leone 2013-2015
description: To improve the effectiveness of the government budget as the principle instrument to reduce vulnerabilities to shocks, maintaining stability  and improving delivery of basic services objectives

title: PROJECT created in error: HANSHEP African Health Markets for Equity (AHME)
description: No purpose; ARIES project created in error as a stand alone project

title: Trade Mark East Africa Burundi Phase II
description: To increase trade, growth and poverty reduction in Burundi through greater regional integration and in addition by 2016 the programme is expected to increase exports to Burundi by 10% above trend, increasing economic growth and contributing to our MDG on eradicating extreme poverty.

title: Supporting the International Response in South Sudan 2013
description: Both chronic and sudden onset humanitarian needs are prepared for and responded to in a coordinated, effective and efficient manner, while improving the resilience of communities to deal with future crises.Both chronic and sudden onset humanitarian needs are prepared for and responded to in a coordinated, effective and efficient manner, while improving the resilience of communities to deal with future crises.Both chronic and sudden onset humanitarian needs are prepared for and responded to in a coordinated, effective and efficient manner, while improving the resilience of communities to deal with future crises.Both chronic and sudden onset humanitarian needs are prepared for and responded to in a coordinated, effective and efficient manner, while improving the resilience of communities to deal with future crises.

title: Local Content Utilisation Study
description: Design of interventions aimed at promoting local content and linkage well informed and effectively targeted

title: Disaster Resilience in a post- MDG (Millennium Development Goals) Framework
description: To gather evidence and ideas on the relevance of disaster resilience for post - MDG discussions to help us formulate our own thinking

title: Research on Growth and Urbanisation in Low Income Countries
description: To produce improved research evidence on urbanisation, to interpret it and to communicate it to policy-makers, so that policies in urban areas of developing countries are more helpful for poverty reduction and economic growth. By 2018 there will be at least ten instances of urban policies in developing countries being influenced by the projects evidence and interpretation.

title: Achieving Water Security in the Southern Agricultural Growth Corridor
description: To ensure economic growth and poverty eradication resulting from investment in agriculture is sustainable in the context of climate change

title: Improving Rural Access in Tanzania
description: To provide support to the local government infrastructure development by improving access to markets by reducing transport costs. This will lead to an increase in rural income to 45,000 households by 2015.  This contributes towards MDG by providing agricultural growth and underpinning strong economic development in Tanzania.

title: Strengthening Economic Governance (SEG) in South Sudan
description: To enable Ministries and key institutions in South Sudan (Ministry of Labour, Public Service and Human Resources Development , Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning, National Bureau of Statistics) to strengthen their knowledge, skills and systems, and their ability to improve policies and decision-making.  This will assist the Government of South Sudan to acquire the technical capacity necessary to improve governance and strengthen the countrys economy.

title: Urban Food Security, Livelihoods and Markets
description: To build urban communities resilience to food insecurity by building their skills, physical assets, knowledge and urban rural market linkages.  This will increase food security for a minimum of 15,500 urban households, benefitting  108,500 of the  poorest and most vulnerable by December 2015.To build urban communities resilience to food insecurity by building their skills, physical assets, knowledge and urban rural market linkages.  This will increase food security for a minimum of 15,500 urban households, benefitting  108,500 of the  poorest and most vulnerable by December 2015.

title: Building adaptation to climate change in health through resilient water, sanitation & hygiene
description: To support the development of effective plans for climate change adaptation in the health sector in low and low-middle income countries. This project will involve both work at an international level to develop guidance with country level pilot projects focused on water, sanitation and hygiene to test and demonstrate practical examples of adaptation in the health sector.

title: Microfinance Services for Poor and Vulnerable People in Burma
description: To improve the food security and income levels for up to 234,500 of the most vulnerable and poor in rural communities across Burma by providing over 46,900 households with access to an expanded rural credit and savings scheme

title: Accelerated Reform Facility (ARF)
description: To strengthen long term reform by supporting short term results in the following areas: good governance and public financial management; promoting responsible investment; improving transparency and the rule of law; strengthening the work of parliament; and helping the process of ethnic reconciliation. Three components of this project will assist Burmas application to join the EITI (Extractive Industry Transparency Initiative) by April 2014. This will help to ensure that the countrys own resources are used to benefit the people of Burma

title: Enhancing resilience in Karamoja Uganda
description: To increase the resilience of targeted communities to climate extremes and weather events. The programme will support 700,000 people to cope with the effects of climate change, this includes: 200,000 people with improved food security through participation in public works programmes; 6,000 agro-pastoralists and pastoralists with access to improved animal nutrition; and 175,000 children under five and pregnant and lactating women treated for malnutrition and with improved access to water by March 2017

title: Social Impact Bond Pilot -Sleeping sickness in Uganda
description: To investigate whether a payment by result mechanism (a social bond) can deliver (i) greater benefits so as to significantly reduce the risk of sleeping sickness; and (ii) provide an incentive to innovate area livestock treatment to manage prevalence of sleeping sickness in people.

title: Support to political transition in Yemen
description: Help Yemen implement its democratic transition in a peaceful and inclusive manner, through support to the Yemeni National Dialogue and Constitutional Revision, and technical assistance to the Office of the Prime Minister.

title: Commonwealth of Learning 3 Year Plan 2012-2015
description: To support the Commonwealth of Learning in its work to help governments expand the scale, efficiency and quality of learning by using appropriate technologies, particularly those that support open and distance learning.

title: Understanding the nature and scale of urban risk in developing countries and its implications for humanitarian preparedness, planning and response
description: To inform our understanding of the scope and quality of the current evidence base, identify the knowledge gaps on how multiple hazards and vulnerabilities overlap to generate risk in cities of the developing world and inform the development of a new programme of research under the Humanitarian Evidence and Innovation Strategy

title: Fisheries Research Scoping Project
description: 1.  To undertake a Literature Review to identify the key gaps in research;2.  To conduct a mapping exercise in order to identify what other research programmes and initiatives are currently on-going or being launched in this area and identify potential partners for collaboration/co-funding of a DFID funded research programme;3. Convey a panel of experts to peer review and  validate the results of the abovementioned paper.

title: Review of agriculture and environment metrics and indicators
description: to collate existing information through: 1)Commissioning a review of existing evidence and a gap analysis exercise.2)  Convening an external expert group, to validate the mapping and review of evidence, and identify next steps in terms of both DFIDs role in supporting relevant current and future research as well as how other stakeholders, including the CGIAR, could build on the review in developing a strong scientific basis and appropriate methods to underpin the measurement of ecosystem related variables, and to analyse the tradeoffs between productivity, ecosystem and welfare outcomes from agricultural R and D.

title: Development of generic oil shock mitigation strategies for developing countries
description: Research intended to equip developing countries with the basic knowledge and methodolgies they need to construct detailed and country specific national oil shock mitigation strategies, which could help to avert economic turmoil in the event of future oil price spikes.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Strengthening Libyan Private Sector Development (PSD) Institutions
description: Strengthen the capacity of key Libyan institutions to support the development of a competitive private sector

title: Cholera Outbreak in Sierra Leone - Rapid Response Facility
description: To activate the Rapid Response Facility, making 2m available to pre-qualified partners in Sierra Leone to allow them to rapidly scale up their response to the cholera outbreak. Sierra Leone is experiencing its worst outbreak of cholera in more than two decades, with 12,000 cases reported already, and more than 250 deaths.

title: South African Partnership for Effective Development Cooperation
description: To support the transformational impact of South African development cooperation on poverty, under-development and marginalisation in Africa. We will contribute to this change by working with South African partners to put in place the institutions, skills and knowledge needed to implement successful development programmes and policies

title: On and off Grid Small Scale Renewable Energy in Uganda
description: To improve the environment for private investment in Ugandas renewable energy sector by accelerating the market for off grid solar energy and supporting the construction of at least 17 on-grid small scale power plants. This will increase Ugandas energy production by approximately 20%, improve access to clean and modern energy for over 200,000 households and businesses or 1.2m people;  mobilise up to 240 million in private finance and  stabilise Ugandas power sector finances by saving approximately $260m to 2.7bn during the period 2013-35, and lead to greenhouse gas emission savings of between 1 and 10 MtCO2e.

title: Public Sector Performance Programme
description: Simpler, quicker and more effective human resource management (recruitment transfers, disciplinary proceedings and terminations) in the public service and the establishment of a government-wide management information system so the Zambian Cabinet Office and Ministry of Development Planning can monitor the performance of line ministries.

title: Public Financial Management and Anti-corruption Initiatives in Zambia
description: To improve the Government of Zambia's financial management and revenue generation by reforming and modernising core financial management and tax systems. Increased revenue and improved public financial management will lead to improved service delivery and therefore will contribute towards the MDGs thus benefitting the poor by 2017.

title: Addressing Stunting in Tanzania Early (in the under 5s): ASTUTE
description: To support interventions designed to invest in human capital by improving early childhood development and reducing the prevalence of stunting (low height for age) in Tanzanian children under 5 years old, by focusing on the first 1000 days of life from conception.

title: Water Sanitation and Hygiene Support for Refugee Affected Areas in East Liberia
description: The programme aims to reach over 400,000 people in Liberia. Its purpose is to increase child survival in Liberia through increased sustainable access to safe water, sanitation and improve hygiene practices.  It aims to contribute towards the achievement of the MDG 4, by reducing infant deaths from water-borne diseases, and MDG 7, by increasing access to water and sanitation, leading to a more healthy population by 2015.

title: Mineral Support Liberia
description: To increase the capacity of the Ministry of Lands, Mines & Energy and the Liberia Oil Company by supporting the Liberia Geological Survey with Technical and material resources. This will benefit the Government of Liberia and improve mineral and Hydrocarbon mapping and value assessment. It will also improve negotiation position of the Government of Liberia with extractive trading partners and improve transparent tax and related income revenue streams from the extractive sector.

title: Expanding Access to Water & Sanitation
description: To increase sustainable access to safe water and basic sanitation in rural areas, and to develop a comprehensive national framework for rural water supply and sanitation investments.

title: Improving Solid Waste Management
description: To improve the environmental surroundings and health risks for about 250,000 people in Sierra Leones second city, Bo through improved management of solid waste.  In addition to reducing incidences of diarrhoea, malaria and other water borne diseases by an estimated 15% by 2018, the project will create employment for up to 500 people, many of whom are unemployed youth.

title: mNutrition- Business models for mobile phone based delivery of nutrition services in Africa and South Asia
description: The impact of mNutrition will be improved livelihoods, food security and nutrition of 3 million poor people, especially women, in 14 countries in Africa and Asia. This will result from the greater involvement of mobile phone companies in providing improved access to mobile-phone based health, nutrition and agricultural-based information services to poor farmers, including women and adolescent girls, who are often unable to access conventional extension systems. In this way, poor farmers will be supported in improving their food production, income and nutrition practices within their families. This contributes towards our MDGs by reducing rural poverty, hunger and child mortality and improving maternal health in South Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa by 2017.

title: Scaling up the 12+ Programme-empowerment of 12 year old girls in Rwanda.
description: To deliver empowerment of 10-12 year old girls in Rwanda. By 2016 the programme will improve the health, social and economic assets  and increase the self-esteem of 114,500 girls. It will result in less tolerance for gender based violence amongst girls, community support for girls participation in the programme and implementation of girl focused policies at national level. This will contribute to improving the quality of life for women and girls in Rwanda and delivering the MDGS, specifically it will contribute to reduced maternal mortality, reduced proportion of girls and young women who have ever experienced sexual or physical violence and increased proportion of girls completing lower secondary school.

title: Investing in Human Capital through Partnerships Beyond Aid in the Social Sectors Programme
description: To improve governance and accountability in education, health and social protection sectors and contribute to policy and research which will inform interventions to improve equity and reduce poverty.

title: Social Protection Support to the Poorest in Rwanda
description: To increase the coverage of social protection and to strengthen social protection systems for the poorest  by providing financial aid to the Rwanda Local Development Support Fund (RLDSF) and technical assistance to RLDSF and the Ministry of Local Government. This will benefit an additional 55,000 poor households (approximately 217,680 individuals) each year with social cash transfers, helping them to meet their basic needs and to better manage risks.

title: Citizen Security and Justice Programme 3
description: To deliver targeted interventions aimed at improving safety, security and prosperity to 400,000 people in 50 of the most violent communities in Jamaica, over a five year period (2014-2019). The interventions will: (1) increase economic and employment opportunities; (2) improve access to community justice services and alternative dispute resolution methods;  (3) strengthen non-violent conflict resolution skills amongst individuals and groups within communities; and (4) improve the Government of Jamaicas capacity to deliver essential services to vulnerable communities.

title: Liberia Road Maintenance EU
description: The purpose is to contribute towards improving maintenance of roads by building the capacities and preparedness of the Liberia Ministry of Public Works. This will benefit over 33.3% of the population and resolve transportation challenges. This will improve transportation infrastructure on the entire coast of the Liberian section of the coastal corridor between Sierra Leone and Cote d Ivoire.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF): Libya Public Financial Management (PFM) Programme
description: To improve transparency and effectiveness of Libyan public financial management through targeted technical assistance.

title: Support for malaria control in Ghana
description: To reduce the number of Ghanaians being ill with or dying from malaria through better prevention and diagnosis and the improvement of Ghanas national malarial control strategy. Key results by 2016 include increasing the proportion of pregnant women sleeping under a bednet by 33% and reducing the number of malaria specific deaths amongst the general population from 2815 (2012) to 2252. This contributes to our MDGs by tackling malaria and maternal health.

title: 3ie Impact Evaluations of Agricultural Innovation
description: To increase agriculture productivity of poor farmers  by using evidence to identify the most cost effective agricultural interventions; by increasing the uptake of innovation; and, by providing evidence on mechansims that can help to mitigate farming risks.

title: HarvestPlus Programme Delivering Nutritionally Enriched food Crops
description: To have 3 million small farming households growing biofortified crops on their farms by 2015.

title: AFRICA HEALTH MARKETS FOR EQUITY PROGRAMME
description: Effective provision of quality health care by private providers and uptake by the poor in Ghana, Kenya and Nigeria.  The project will work with around 2,750 healthcare providers in Kenya, Nigeria and Ghana to prevent over 12,000 maternal deaths and 31,500 deaths in children under five.

title: Advocacy for Primary Health Care Reform
description: To reduce maternal and child mortality by advocating implementation of new reform policies passed and enacted to reorganise health services, strengthen management, increase funding, address inequities and respond better to the needs of the population in more States. Advocate for  six additional States to pass Primary Health Care (PHC) Under One Roof legislation which meets NPHCDA (National Primary Health Care Development Agency) standards; six additional States pass appropriately costed policies or legislation guaranteeing free maternal and child health care at the point of use; and National health bill passed and signed into law to improve health services. This contributes towards MDGs 4 and 5 by providing more people, particularly the poorest and most vulnerable access to quality health services by end 2016.

title: Developing guidance for the use of pooled funds to support service delivery in fragile and conflict-affected situations :
description: Research to identify a set of principles and approaches which can inform the design of pooled funding mechanisms to support service delivery in fragile and conflict affected situations, with the aim of highlighting how best to work with partner governments and other agencies to achieve maximum impact.

title: Literature Review of the relationship between property rights and development
description: The objective of this research is to take a fresh look at the evidence in this area, with a view to incorporate the most recent developments and especially lessons from Africa strategically into DFIDs work on property rights

title: Security Sector Accountability Programme
description: To increase the accountability and capability of the Nigerian security forces in tackling internal instability by helping to build human rights into policy and training, as well as by strengthening oversight from statutory and civil society bodies. This will reduce the negative impacts of conflict on the most vulnerable among the Nigeria population, and contribute to longer-term stability in the country, thus helping create an environment that promotes achievement of the MDGs.

title: Partnership for supplies security to support to the Reproductive Health Supplies Coalition Secretariat
description: To enable Reproductive Health Supply Coalition to increased availability of a broad range of affordable, high-quality reproductive health supplies.  This contributes towards reducing maternal mortality (MDG 5) and ensuring universal access to reproductive health by 2016.

title: Social Enterprises For Economic Development.
description: To contribute to the delivery of UK Government Priorities on economic development, empowering women and girls and working with the private sector. Through the provision of information it will help catalyse further investment. This programme will complement UKs international commitments on hunger, notably through support for the New Alliance on Food Security and Nutrition which aims to reach 50 million people in Africa with improved food security and nutrition.

title: Zimbabwe Business Enabling Environment Programme (BEEP)
description: To improve the business environment in Zimbabwe by providing the private sector with 1) increased access to finance by engaging in financial infrastructure support 2) capacity development for micro and small enterprises using a value chain approach 3) improved regulation of the PPP sector by supporting public-private-partnerships and 4) a more vibrant public private dialogue process. This will benefit the Zimbabwean private sector overall by improving the business environment and investment climate. This contributes towards our MDGs by stimulating economic growth and will result in 1) business advocacy support in the completion of at least 4 dialogue sessions (resulting in an additional 2 new /amended laws or regulations in Zimbabwe); 2)the arrangement of a cumulative $2.5m worth of financing for Zimbabwean SMMEs; and 3)ensure that the business climate reforms that are undertaken as a part of the BEEP are sustainable by building the capacity of key public and private stakeholders.

title: International Budget Partnership Work Programme
description: To increase budget transparency, accountability and participation in order to facilitate the achievement of the key development goals DFID is committed to. Increased transparency is now appreciated to be an essential component of development conditions that enable open economies and open societies to thrive. Improved budget transparency, accountability and participation will be achieved by providing the International Budget Partnership (IBP) with core funding for their 5 year programme. The expected outcomes of the IBPs work are: a) more transparent budget processes: timely, accessible, useful budget information is available to citizens and Civil Society Organisations (CSOs), b) CSOs analyse and participate in government budget processes, and work with formal oversight institutions to hold government to account, c) international policy community actively promotes budget transparency, participation, and accountability.

title: Pilot project on creating jobs in small and medium enterprises
description: To provide information on the constraints to job creation by small and medium enterprises, and specifically the extent to which financial constraints cause delays in hiring staff.  The information will be used to help design targeted support aimed at promoting job creation by local businesses

title: Increasing coverage of Long Lasting Insecticide Nets in Uganda
description: To increase use of Long Lasting Insecticide Treated Nets (LLINs) among children under 5 years of age and pregnant women.  This support will fill the 5 million LLINs critical gap needed to achieve universal coverage in Uganda in 2013. UKs support will protect at least 1.8 million children against malaria, avert at least 30,000 child deaths and contribute to reducing  malaria related morbidity and mortality in Uganda  between 2013 and 2015.

title: Democracy and Rule of Law Programme to inform and influence more evidence-based, effective policies in developing countries
description: To improve policy effectiveness in developing countries, international policy makers in developed and developing contexts need a better understanding of how governance change happens, and how to respond to an complex international policy environment.   This project aims to inform and influence international policy makers (including non-traditional actors such as military and business communities, traditional donors, and significant NGOs), by producing accessible policy products, based on the latest evidence. The key policy aims to include helping policy makers to strengthen democracy support, address closing civic space, tackle corruption - with a view of understanding how these issues underpin instability and lack of inclusion, including for women. The project is characterised by an innovative research agenda and an active approach to direct policy outreach, and as such its makes an essential contribution to Global Goal 16 to achieve peace, justice and strong institutions by 2030.

title: Solar Nigeria Programme
description: To improve the welfare outcomes of the currently underserved communities in Lagos state and Northern Nigeria by making a significant financial contribution towards the solar power electrification of public institutions, such as schools and hospitals.  The intervention is expected to, by year 2020,  ensure improved welfare outcomes for more than 2.8 million people using domestic solar photovoltaic (PV) systems, with 190,000 school pupils and 4.7 million clinic patients benefiting from public institutions with PV systems, create more than 3000 jobs and ensure greater effectiveness of DFID's other health and educational sector intervention in Nigeria.

title: Embedding the role of the private sector in humanitarian preparedness and emergency response
description: Haitian private sector is intergrated into disaster preparedness and response for future potential emergencies.  Wider international (and UK) responses incorporate these lessons in other urban emergency responses.

title: AgDevCo Ghana Greenfields Investment Programme
description: To support the development of Agricultural Schemes in Tono and Bamboi to a stage deemed commercially viable by investors.To support the development of Agricultural Schemes in Tono and Bamboi to a stage deemed commercially viable by investors.To support the development of Agricultural Schemes in Tono and Bamboi to a stage deemed commercially viable by investors.

title: Identifying the evidence base for the design and management and evaluation of practical protection strategies
description: The purpose of this research is to establish what is known regarding the relative effectiveness of different humanitarian interventions to provide protection to civilians, and how we measure them. The aim is to inform DFID and other Government departments on implications for policy and practice and to help shape a further, larger piece of research that will look at this subject both operationally and at policy level.

title: Livestock & Food Security Humanitarian Programme
description: To address food insecurity and provide rapid nutritional assessments and to protect livestock in Zimbabwe.

title: Support to World Food Programme Food Appeal for Refugees in North-western Tanzania
description: To provide humanitarian food assistance to over 100,000 refugees in Nyarugusu and Mtabila camps in Kigoma region of North-western Tanzania until June 2013.

title: Support for National Health Weeks in Mozambique
description: Support for two National Health Weeks (NHWs) that will take place in Mozambique in November 2012 and April 2013. It will consist of delivery of a package of cost-effective health interventions to 3.7m children under 5 years of age, and 340,000 women.

title: Humanitarian Assistance in Rakhine State
description: To improve access to safe water, sanitation, hygiene and nutrition treatment services, amongst the population affected by violence in Rakhine State.

title: Tracking progress against Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper III
description: To provide technical assistance to the Government of Sierra Leone to develop a national system for the management of the country's third Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper 2012-2017

title: UK Contribution to International Fund for Agricultural Development 9th Replenishment
description: To support IFADs work in enabling poor rural people to improve their food security and nutrition and increase their incomes.  IFAD loans and grants will reach 90 million people in the 2013  2015 replenishment period, helping them to create economic opportunities through: increasing agricultural productivity; improving infrastucture; reaching markets; accessing financial services; adapting to climate change and empowering women. This will contribute, in particular, to achieving the first Millennium Development Goal of eradicating extreme poverty and hunger.  IFAD aims to lift 80 million people out of poverty by 2015.

title: Strengthen the Montserrat Development Corporation to attract public and private sector investment in Little Bay/Carr's Bay (Interim Support 2012/13)
description: The Montserrat Development Corporation is supported to implement the agreed master plan to facilitate sustainable socio-economic growth and private sector development.

title: Safeguarding Livestock and Food Security
