description: To address food and insecurity of 683,000 households by way of Livestock Protection through emergency rations, vaccinations and borehole rehabilitation and providing rapid nutritional assessments through Food and Cash assistance for the Security and Resilience of Vulnerable Households in in Zimbabwe Target Areas by March 2014.

title: Rule of Law Literature Review
description: To help DFID to strengthen its' policy & programming on the rule of law. It will survey various aspects of the rule of law and signpost their implications for future cost effective programming in international development.To identify and assess evidence on the importance of rule of law to development in order to strengthen DFIDs policy and programming work in this area.

title: Humanitarian innovation and evidence programme: improved analysis of disaster risk and increased capacity to deliver humanitarian assistance
description: This is one of three business cases which implements the DFID Humanitarian Innovation and Evidence Strategy. This programme will commission research which will make it easier for decision-makers to use risk analysis; improve understanding of risk in urban areas; improve disaster risk modelling and analysis; establish the most effective ways to deliver aid in insecure environments; and identify ways to strengthen national and local capacity to respond to disasters.

title: Humanitarian Innovation and Evidence Programme: greater use of evidence and innovation in humanitarian responses
description: This is business case 2/3 which implements the DFID Humanitarian Innovation and Evidence Strategy. This programme will develop and test innovative approaches to humanitarian practice; provide evidence of the cost effectiveness of investments in disaster risk reduction; provide new evidence on the scaling up of cash-based approaches; support better evidence on insurance as a risk management tool; and create new evidence on the best intervention to improve health and nutrition in emergencies.This is one of three business cases which implements the DFID Humanitarian Innovation and Evidence Strategy. Between 2000-2009, more than 2.2 billion people were affected by 4,484 natural disasters. Vulnerability to hazards is increasing as a result of demographic, political and environmental changes. Demand for humanitarian assistance is likely to rise while economic constraints are also increasing. In this context it is important to ensure that the most effective and cost efficient approch

title: Humanitarian Innovation and Evidence Programme: improving the evidence base for humanitarian practice
description: This is one of three business cases which implements the DFID Humanitarian Innovation and Evidence Strategy. This programme will commission research to improve the quality of humanitarian evaluation; ensure evidence is accessible to humanitarian practitioners; and ensure the sector is prepared to respond to new challenges.

title: Africa-Brazil Partnership on Climate-Smart Agriculture and Food Security
description: The programme aims to increase the uptake of Brazils climate-smart practices in Africa which reduce food insecurity by: improving agricultural productivity; improving access to domestic agricultural markets for smallholder farmers; and improving access to food for at-risk populations. The programme does this by facilitating research collaboration between Brazilian and African institutions and by testing and adapting Brazilian technologies in selected African countries.

title: Mid Term Evaluation of the International Climate Fund (ICF)
description: To provide an assessment of the alignment of the International Climate Fund's portfolio to the Fund's stretegic objectives, its expected results and the anticipated delivery of Value for Money, and the effectiveness of its monitoring and evaluation processes. This will inform planning for future UK climate finance and provide lessons to guide the shape and scope of any future climate finance by the UK or others. This will ultimately help poor people in partner countries through improved programmes and projects; and contribute to reducing the impact of climate change across a range of sectors which are crucial to attaining the Millennium Development Goals

title: Prevention of Violence against Women and Girls: Research and Innovation Fund
description: To deliver ground-breaking evidence of what works to prevent and respond to violence against women and girls in developing countries, including in conflict and humanitarian emergencies. This evidence will improve policies, programming and expand investment to reduce the prevalence of VAWG and increase the number of women and girls receiving quality response services in at least ten DFID priority countries. This will contribute to other UK priorities including the Foreign Secretarys Preventing Sexual Violence Initiative, implementation of UN Security Council Resolution 1325 (Women, Peace and Security) and the UKs Building Stability Overseas Strategy, and will inform other donors policies and operations and underpin international standards and targets, including achievement of the dedicated VAWG targets in the Global Goals.

title: Skills Programme
description: Skills Programme

title: Support for the Government of Tanzanias Big Results Now delivery programme
description: To support the Government of Tanzania to establish a transformational Big Results Now programme to identify and resolve constraints to results delivery, initially in the following six key priority areas: energy / oil & gas, water, transport, agriculture, education and resource mobilisation. In each of these six areas the programme will run an intense eight week, heavily focused problem-solving lab, produce a concrete action plan with clear milestones and targets, and then ensure that it is incorporated into the 2013/14 annual budget of the Government of Tanzania. This will improve the performance of Government programmes and increase the efficiency of Government spending, including the UKs contribution.To support and increase the Government of Tanzanias efficiency and performance in their six key priority areas of energy / oil & gas, water, transport, agriculture, education and resource mobilisation, through the establishment of the Big Results Now programme

title: Support to the Sierra Leone Audit  Service 2013-2015
description: To further improve public sector auditing by providing technical assistance and equipment to Audit Service Sierra Leone. Providing this support until December 2015 will improve use of the countrys resources and reduce poverty, benefiting the entire population.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF): AfDB Trust Fund for Transition (North Africa)
description: To improve the capacity for the Governments of Egypt, Tunisia and Morocco to undertake economic and institutional reforms.

title: Public Financial Management Improvement and Consolidation Project
description: To improve public financial management by providing the Government of Sierra Leone with technical assistance and equipment. This will benefit the Government and wider population of Sierra Leone by improving budget planning and credibility, financial control, accountability, and oversight in government finances. This will support the Government to deliver a multi-year budget in-line with the countrys poverty reduction strategy and be more accountable for doing so.

title: Market Development Programme, Sierra Leone
description: To improve the participation of approximately 30,000 households in environmentally sustainable economic growth, through increased agricultural incomes and manufacturing opportunities. This will be achieved by supporting government, small businesses and financial institutions in Sierra Leone.

title: Humanitarian Support for Refugees from Democratic Repulic of Congo (DRC)
description: Supporting the needs of refugees from the Democratic Republic of Congo arriving into Uganda since the outbreak of renewed conflict in April 2012

title: Malawi Emergency Budget Support 2012/13
description: To achieve poverty reduction through support to macroeconomic stability, service delivery and public financial management reform

title: Yemen Independent Monitoring Programme
description: To provide independent monitoring of DFID development programme in Yemen by an external organisation who will undertake field visits, verify project activity and collect views from beneficiaries. This will strengthen DFIDs work in Yemen through improving all our other projects. Approximately 100 communities benefitting from DFID aid projects will be visited each year for three years.

title: Delivering humanitarian assistance in insecure environments: a critical review of the evidence
description: To provide advisers with a robust analysis of what is known about how to deliver aid in the most insecure environments, such as Somalia and Syria.  This analysis will be used to inform the design of country programmes and to engage with international partners as to how to improve humanitarian outcomes and reduce diversion of aid in these settings.

title: Support for the Food & Agriculture Organisation (FAO) Voices of the Hungry Project
description: To establish a global monitoring system of food insecurity based on data from a world survey of peoples experience of food insecurity. This will lead to improved methods and tools for the analysis of food insecurity data and an increased understanding of the conditions that lead to food insecurity, who and where the food insecure are and their coping strategies. This will give better evidence upon which DFID and other development organisations can base their decisions and target assistance.

title: Build Enabling and Accessible Markets (BEAM)
description: A contribution of 3m over three years to support the improvement of market-led approaches to development programming. The multi-donor funded Market Systems Development Platform (MSDP) will work with donor agencies, project managers, businesses and communities to deliver more efficient markets that will contribute to sustainable, private sector-led growth that benefits the poor. By supporting the design of programmes that better understand the role of the poor as consumers, producers and entrepreneurs, the MSDP can help build economic resilience and support poverty reduction.

title: Growth and Economic Opportunities for Women
description: To increase policy makers uptake of evidence-based policies and programmes that improve economic opportunities for poor women in Low Income Countries; by providing them with robust evidence on the barriers that lock women out of economic opportunities and by strengthening the ability of southern researchers to undertake rigorous research and engage with policy makers.

title: Public Policy Information Monitoring and Advocacy Phase II (PPIMA 2)
description: To increase Rwandan civil society and citizens influence on the formulation and implementation of national and local policies and plans by 2016, through supporting: skills development in at least 15 Rwandan Civil Society Organisations; and the roll out of a community scorecard approach in four districts enabling citizens (specifically including women, youth, people with disabilities and historically marginalised people) to advocate more effectively for changes and improvements to the public services that they receive.

title: UK Contribution for 2012/13 European Report on Development (ERD)
description: To improve European Union (EU) development and to stimulate debate amongst policy makers, professionals and academics to heop the EU refine its development policies Post 2015

title: Support Somaliland Development Corporation to stimulate private investment and trade in Somaliland
description: To facilitate increased long term economic investment by providing greater access to international quality investment in Somaliland improving the lives of communities within Somaliland

title: Humanitarian Response to Food Insecurity in Lesotho 2012/2013
description: To improve food security and climate resilience of 82,450 drought affected vulnerable people in Lesotho by the provision of cash assistance and asset transfers and livelihoods recovery support

title: Evaluation of Global Mine Action Programme (2011-2013)
description: To examine whether the CHASE mine action programme delivered development benefits to mine affected communities, as laid out in the DFID Mine Action Strategy 2010.To evaluate whether the centrally delivered CHASE programme is the most effective and sustainable mode of delivery to enable national mine action agencies to prioritise and deliver mine action programmes in their own countries.

title: Research into multi-year approaches to humanitarian crises
description: To develop an evidence base for guiding DFID and other donors on how to improve efficiency in the timing and allocating of humanitarian resources and 	Incentivise donors, partner governments, multilaterals and implementing agencies to invest in and work more on resilience to disasters

title: Anti Corruption Evidence ' ACE' Programme
description: ACE delivers new practical research about what works to tackle corruption, illicit financial flows and serious organised crime. The approach is problem-led, not starting with preconceived ideas about the right solutions, it focuses on real world priorities, and it takes politics seriously, developing politically viable reforms and approaches.

title: UK Contribution to the Queen Elizabeth Diamond Jubilee Trust
description: To provide up to 50m in 'matched' funding over the lifetime of the Queen Elizabeth Diamond Jubilee Trust, from 2013/14 to 2018/19. The matched funding will come from a variety of governmental, non-governmental and private sector corporate sources from across the Commonwealth (including the UK), offering a unique opportunity for a diverse and collaborative partnership with global reach. Department for International Development (DFID) support is intended to be channelled mainly into the programmes to tackle avoidable blindness  a significant cause of disability worldwide. Visual impairments affect 285 million people worldwide, of whom 39 million are blind. There is strong coherence with the Global Goals, and with a range of other DFID work streams.

title: UK Support for Countries worst affected by Hurricane Sandy
description: To provide urgent humanitarian support to Haiti and Cuba to help save lives and reduce suffering in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy.

title: Improving aid impact in Yemen
description: To improve delivery of aid commitments and policy reforms by supporting the establishment of an agency which will help to increase the delivery of basic services and increase jobs and economic growth, delivering results to the Yemeni people up to 2014 and beyond.

title: Madhya Pradesh Strengthening Performance in Govt Phase 2
description: To support the Government of Madhya Pradesh to effectively undertake governance reforms to strengthen public financial management systems, facilitate increased private investment and enhance monitoring and evaluation of programmes and schemes for more effective pro-poor service delivery. The Financial Assistance will end by December 2015.

title: Evaluation of DFID's Security and Justice Policy and Programmes
description: To undertake a 2 step evaluation process for DFID programming and policy work on the security and justice portfolio. The first step will be an evaluability assessment which will lay the ground work for the ensuing macro-evaluation.

title: Nepal Local Governance Support Programme
description: To improve governance and services at the local level in Nepal, benefitting 2 million households. This includes introducing simple anti-corruption measures (e.g. public audits)  and providing the poorest and most excluded with tools to build their confidence to voice demands and hold officials to account. Parts of the programme will also ensure that Local Government's awareness and capacity on climate change adaptation, disaster resilience and environmentally friendly governance is improved.

title: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (One WASH) Programme
description: To support the implementation of the Government of Ethiopia (GoE) One WaSH National Programme (OWN P) over five years (2013/14  2017/18) to increase the number of people in rural and small/medium towns using improved sources of water and sanitation facilities. This will benefit additional 1.7 million people and improve access to clean water, sanitation and hygiene facilities. This will contribute towards the MDG target by halving the proportion of people without sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation and will result in improved household health and socio-economic status of 2.8 million people by 2018.

title: Strengthening Emergency Preparedness and Response in Kenya (2014-2018)
description: To enhance Kenya Red Cross capacity to prepare and respond to disasters, through providing a timely and effective response to small and medium disasters; ensuring overall response effectiveness is improved; maintaining the dignity of people affected by disasters in Kenya by providing direct support to over 3,400 men, women and children per year.

title: Improving sexual and reproductive health of women and young people in Eastern and Southern Africa
description: To increase utilization of sexual and reproductive health services in at least 12 countries averting 63,500 unintended pregnancies and 8,800 unsafe abortions, and providing over 136,000 Couple Years of Protection

title: Provision of Lifesaving Humanitarian Assistance to vulnerable individuals and households affected by violence in Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC)
description: To reduce morbidity and mortality in populations affected by conflict in eastern DRC by providing timely emergency assistance including shelter, water, food and healthcare to more than 130,000 people

title: Bioenergy/Biofuels Scoping Review: a review, mapping and analysis and analysis of key research and evidence
description: DFID will provide funds to conduct a review and analysis of key research and evidence relating to the biofuels sector in developing countries, its validity as a commercially viable energy supply and its impact on a number of issues such as economic growth, energy efficiency, poverty reduction, and food security.   The proposed intervention will also provide a detailed mapping of current research against a list of key issues relevant to DFID priorities.

title: UPGRO - Unlocking the Potential of Groundwater for the Poor
description: Deliver robust and accessible evidence on the physical, social and economic opportunities and constraints to sustainable, long-term groundwater use by the poor in Africa

title: UK humanitarian response in the Sahel 2013
description: Early action and Preparedness in response to the Mali crisis and food insecurity across the Sahel, followed by Response and Recovery in event of military intervention in Mali and wider humanitarian needs in the Sahel. This 2013 phase of bilateral humanitarian assistance aims to support critical UN, Red Cross  and International Non-Governmental humanitarian agencies to scale-up their responses inside Mali and the Sahel.Early action and Preparedness in response to the Mali crisis and food insecurity across the Sahel, followed by Response and Recovery in event of military intervention in Mali and wider humanitarian needs in the Sahel. This 2013 phase of bilateral humanitarian assistance aims to support critical UN, Red Cross  and International Non-Governmental humanitarian agencies to scale-up their responses inside Mali and the Sahel phase 5.

title: Estimating the Economic Impact on developing countries of a Potential  Trade Initiative between the European Union and the United States
description: The purpose of this research is to better understand the impact of a possible EU-US trade and investment initiative on developing countries. The findings will be used to inform the UKs approach to the negotiations. They may also allow EU Member States, the Commission and the US, as well as other donors and developing countries to take steps to mitigate any negative impacts and maximise benefits from this trade initiative.

title: USES - Understanding Sustainable Energy Solutions in Developing Countries
description: High quality research that improves our understanding of the opportunities and challenges associated with scaling up clean energy for development

title: Financial assistance for the conflict-affected population in Gaza
description: To improve conditions for the conflict affected population in Gaza by supporting the International Committee of the Red Cross, to provide (for example) medical care, materials for repairs to damaged houses and emergency repairs for water infrastructure. The International Committee of the Red Cross provides approximately 85,000 conflict-affected people in the Occupied Palestinian Territories with direct assistance, and supports approximately 1.6 million indirectly through its protection activities (which include monitoring adherence to international law including access to humanitarian assistance

title: United Nations and Commonwealth Reform study
description: Research to identify what does and does not work in achieving organisational change in United Nations and Commonwealth organisations.The findings will be used to inform DFID's approaches to engaging with and influencing United Nations and Commonwealth agencies on organisational change issues. The research findings will be made publicly available to other stakeholders.

title: Philippines Typhoon Bopha (Pablo) emergency response
description: To ensure that the specific needs of women, girls and boys are mainstreamed into all areas of the emergency response, providing a safer and more secure environment for the most vulnerable, allowing them to rebuild their lives more rapidly .

title: Emergency Assistance to Internally Displaced Persons in Conflict-Affected Areas of Pakistan
description: Save lives, reduce suffering and maintain dignity of People Internally Displaced  by conflict  in Northern Pakistan

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF): Libya Technical Assistance Facility (TAF)
description: To support transition in Libya to a stable and accountable state

title: Deauville Partnership - Small and Medium Sized Enterprise (SME) Mentoring Initiative for the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Region
description: To support Small and Medium sized Enterprise (SME) growth in Egypt, Jordan, Libya, Morocco, Tunisia and Yemen by providing a mentoring scheme to 250 entrepreneurs to boost inclusive growth and employment, especially for women and youths.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Support to the IMF Capability Assessment Programme (CAP) in Tunisia and Libya
description: To improve the capability of Tunisian and Libyan authorities to formulate and implement economic reforms; contributing to better macroeconomic policies

title: Yellow Fever vaccination campaign in Darfur
description: This will ensure  2 million people are vaccinated in all affected and high risk localities in Darfur in order  to contain the outbreak of yellow fever.

title: Amplify Open Innovation for Development
description: To apply human-centred design to persistent development challenges in order to source early-stage ideas, especially from small community-based organisations or social enterprises.  This will contribute towards the Global Goals by facilitating open collaboration amongst innovators and by benefitting user groups in low-and middle-income countries to meet their most pressing daily needs (e.g. basic services, personal security, health, employment). The programme will address 8 different development challenges over 6 years.

title: Corporate Volunteering Hub (CVH) Seed Funding
description: The Corporate Volunteering Hub will mobilise business skills through corporate volunteering at a scale that will drive improvements in the performance of development programmes and in the lives of poor and marginalised people, through: sustained improvement in the delivery of services and products to poor and marginalised groups by partner organisations; changes in the behaviours of business in ways which benefit poor and marginalised groups; and greater understanding in the private sector of the challenges and opportunities of working in a development context.

title: Bulawayo Emergency Water Augmentation Programme (BEWAP)
description: To improve the health and wellbeing of the residents of Bulawayo, particularly the vulnerable, disabled, elderly, and those in unserved areas, by increasing the availability and improving the use of water and sanitation resources. This will benefit 140,000 people by September 2014.

title: M4D - Mobile for Development Strategic Partnership
description: To work jointly with the industry group representing mobile phone operators worldwide, the GSMA, and its subsidiary Mobile for Development, to identify and support the development and use of new, innovative ways in which mobile phone technologies and mobile network infrastructure can be used to improve the reach, delivery and affordability of life-enhancing services to poor people in Africa and Asia. As a result of this work some 14 million poor people are expected to benefit from improved access to life enhancing services by 2020.

title: Donor Approaches to Risk in Fragile and Conflict-Affected States: Identifying and Understanding Good Practice
description: This research will identify and analyse a preliminary set of practical examples of donor experience in risk taking and risk management in fragile and conflict-affected states. The research will analyse the effectiveness of different risk management models in fragile and conflict-affected environments and gather evidence around good practice which can then be applied to other contexts. The findings will be made available to the international community and DFID country offices with the aim of helping donors to better understand risk practices and to develop more sophisticated and conflict-sensitive risk management systems.

title: Innovative Metrics in Agriculture and Nutrition
description: To generate high quality evidence linking agriculture and nutrition by undertaking research which will help drive more effective investments by DFID and others and contribute to DFID's efforts to prevent stunting in 20 million children by 2020 in Africa and South Asia.

title: Reform and Service delivery by Special Police Protection Units in Somaliland and Puntland
description: Support given for improved management and performance of Special Police Units, enabling aid and development programmes to operate in Somaliland and Puntland

title: HiFi - Harnessing Innovation for Financial Inclusion
description: To provide access to poor people to a broad range of financial services such as payments, savings, loans, and insurance by continuing to support piloting new ideas and approaches, and to support technical assistance regulators and commercial players for enhancing industry knowledge and practice about business models, pricing and design of financial products. Access to these services enables consumers to acquire productive assets, invest in health and education and make other purchases that enrich their lives.

title: Disaster Risk Insurance
description: To improve the resilience of the private sector in poor countries to natural disasters by improving access to insurance products. By supporting the development of a market for private sector disaster risk insurance in developing countries, the project will sustainably help strengthen resilience, mitigate the effects of climate change and supporting economic development through private sector growth.

title: Humanitarian assistance to people in the most conflict-affected parts of Yemen
description: To provide humanitarian assistance to people in the most conflict-affected parts of Yemen, including Abyan, Saada and Aljawf, between 31 March 2013 and March 2015.

title: HIV Prevention Project
description: To support the government of Malawi's 5 year HIV/AIDS Strategy (2011-2016) by scaling up prevention of mother to child transmission (PMTCT) with a special focus on male involvement, increasing HIV Counselling & Testing(HTC) and increasing availability and access to condoms especially among discordant couples. These interventions will avert 5932 new HIV infections by 2016;163800 couples will take HIV Testing and Counselling by 2016 and an extra 1,031,885 clients will test for HIV and receive counselling by 2016;17920 pregnant women will be counselled and tested for HIV through PMTCT and 23,155,629 million condoms will be distributed by 2016.

title: Application of Complex Systems Tools to Development
description: This study aims to use the concepts, theories and practices of complex systems research to deepen our understanding of the strengths and limitations of current aid delivery models given the operational contexts that aid practitioners face when pursuing development objectives. It will seek to identify whether new tools  and concepts from this emerging new discipline can enhance aid delivery and identify its related policy implications to help inform the aid community in decision-making, design and delivery of aid.

title: Investor Perspectives On Emerging Market
description: This research is aiming to improve our understanding on investor decision making within DFIDs countrys of focus and specifically fragile states. It will aim to identify the strengths and weaknesses of a number of diagnostic tools in determining investor behaviour. More broadly it will investigate the other tools investors use when determining whether or not to invest.The audience for this work is both within DFID and externally. The key users will be DFID staff, country governments, members of Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, and eventually multilateral partners.

title: Humanitarian assistance in Yemen through a pooled Emergency Response Fund
description: To ensure that humanitarian agencies are able to deliver life-saving assistance to those affected by the complex humanitarian crisis in Yemen and respond to acute vulnerabilities arising from rapid onset emergencies caused by natural disasters or conflict.

title: Integrated Resilience Programme in Haiti
description: To assist  crisis-affected communities in the Department of Grand Anse, Haiti,  better anticipate, cope with and recover from natural disasters. This will be achieved though improved: risk assessment, community based disaster preparedness, village saving and loan schemes, minor infrastructure, protection of women and girls, strengthening the emergency health system g and climate resilient agriculture. The programme will be implemented in partnership with UN agencies and NGOs in support of national priorities and in coordination with other donors.

title: Zambia Accountability Programme
description: The programme has three components: (i) the first component seeks to facilitate credible and inclusive elections, increase voter turnout, enhance women representation in politics and put concerns of ordinary Zambians at the heart of the political debate; (ii) the second component seeks to help ordinary  Zambians articulate their concerns and expectations about the education received by their children, and engage bureaucrats and politicians to improve it; (iii) the third component support think tanks in producing and publishing influential high quality research to make a case for economic reforms that will benefit all Zambians, and helps them engage effectively with politicians, bureaucrats and the media on the findings.

title: Public Private Partnership Unit Support in Sierra Leone
description: To attract private investments in infrastructure and public services by providing technical assistance to improve the design and implementation of public private partnership agreements. This will benefit the population of Sierra Leone and promote inclusive green growth by December 2015.

title: Supporting Voice and Accountability and Transparency of public funds
description: To support Civil Society Organizations strengthen their capacity to engage constructively with the State and better hold the GoT to account for public expenditure

title: La Pepiniere: Programme for adolescent girls in the Democratic Republic of Congo
description: To increase the economic empowerment of women and girls, and in particular adolescent girls, in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) by supporting projects that pilot new approaches to economic empowerment. This contributes towards Millennium Development Goal 3 (Promote gender equality and empower women)To increase the economic empowerment of women and girls, particularly adolescent girls, by supporting pilot approaches with potential to transform social norms and developing an evidence base about what works. This contributes to Millennium Development Goal 3 (promote gender equality and empower women)

title: Private Sector Development Programme in Malawi
description: The programme aims to build capacity to support key public sector institutions that shape the regulatory environment for business, help the oil seed sector reach its full potential through the establishment of sustainable market structures supported by government, and provide financial and technical support to business adopting pro-poor business models.

title: UK Support to Polio Eradication 2013  2019
description: The UK will provide support for global polio eradication over six years for the interruption of polio transmission in the remaining endemic countries (Pakistan, Afghanistan and Nigeria), to outbreak control , to strengthening routine immunisation coverage rates , and the establishment of legacy planning to ensure eradication is sustained resulting in health gains beyond polio.  The UKs support will enable the full vaccination of more than 360 million children, so contributing to the achievement of child mortality and maternal health MDGs.

title: Future Proofing African Cities for Sustainable Growth
description: The UKs 4.915 million will fund a project to support at least 8 cities in Africa to become future proofed to climate, environment and natural resource challenges, so that they are inclusive and resilient, and have growing economies.  It will help make cities work for the urban poor. It will conduct an in depth feasibility and scoping study and develop innovative tools to enable rapidly growing African cities to realise their potential as centres of growth and job creation; use research and evidence to develop targeted urban action plans; and will deliver research new research to fill data and evidence gaps to maximise sustainable economic growth.

title: Research into effective poverty reduction strategies in Yemen
description: To address the lack of Yemen-specific evidence of the impact of projects to graduate ultra-poor households out of extreme poverty by providing Innovations for Poverty Action with 140,000 to carry out a survey to evaluate the impact of a pilot project to help some of the poorest households in Yemen move out of extreme poverty. This will be critical in helping to determine whether the graduation model is effective in Yemen, ultimately helping to improve the quality and effectiveness of future poverty alleviation projects in Yemen

title: FCFA - Future Climate For Africa
description: The Future Climate for Africa programme supports world-leading science and technology to enhance understanding and prediction of sub-Saharan African climate and, through working closely with African stakeholders, bring this knowledge into use in informing major decisions, such as infrastructure investments, urban planning and national policy.    The programme has three main objectives: firstly, to produce world-leading science to advance knowledge of African climate variability and change and enhance prediction of future African climate; secondly, to drive improved knowledge, methods and tools on how climate information and services can be better designed for, delivered and integrated into major decisions today and thirdly, to support international collaboration and the development of scientific capacity in Africa.

title: UK Humanitarian response to the Solomon Islands Earthquake and Tsunami
description: To provide emergency relief to people affected by the earthquake, meeting their basic needs for emergency shelter, houshold items and improved access to safe water.

title: Building Yemen's Investment Climate 2013-16
description: To improve the business and regulatory environment and access to finance for micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in Yemen by providing i) support to Government of Yemen to improve business regulation and tax systems, ii) assistance to financial institutions to improve access to finance for MSMEs and iii) business training to entrepreneurs and small firms. This will result in: 174,000 loans provided to micro enterprises; 5,500 loans provided to small and medium enterprises; 3,133 firms benefitting from reformed registration requirements; 2,500 individuals with improved financial and entrepreneurial skills; and 10% reduction in the average cost of complying with business regulation, helping to overcome government and market failures in business regulatory and tax frameworks, and labour and capital factor markets. This contributes towards our MDGs by supporting an increase in Yemens employment rate and will result in increased investment and job creation

title: Enhancing Nigerian Advocacy for a better Business Environment II (ENABLE II)
description: This second phase of ENABLE aims to improve business enabling environment by supporting Business membership organisations, media, research institutions and state actors to improve policies and regulations that will benefit 4 million micro-enterprises, 50% of which will be women.

title: Improving service delivery for children in basic education and people with disabilities through VSO Rwanda
description: Improved delivery of quality services for children in basic education and people living with disabilities

title: Establishment of Early Childhood Development Services in Rwanda
description: 10 Early Childhood Development Centres constructed

title: Managing Climate Risks for Urban Poor
description: This programme will help cities plan for and invest in reducing the impacts of weather-related changes and extreme events, through a partnership with the Rockefeller foundation and the Asian Development Bank, on 2 million urban poor and vulnerable people in 25 medium-sized cities in 6 Asian countries (initially Pakistan, Bangladesh, India, Vietnam, Indonesia) by improving planning processes so that they consider climate change risks, for developing and funding new investment and infrastructure opportunities, and for knowledge and lesson sharing by 2022.

title: Research on Growth and High Volume Transport in Low Income Countries
description: To generate robust evidence on the role that different forms of high volume transport play in promoting growth in Low Income Countries in both a rural and urban setting. The research programme will have four themes carrying out engineering and technical research around road and rail strategic corridors, urban transport, low carbon transport and inclusive transport

title: Yemen Humanitarian Resilience Programme
description: To improve food security and increase community resilience to shocks by providing an estimated 500,000 Yemenis with food assistance, safe water, emergency livelihoods support, shelter and protection services over two years.   This will benefit chronically vulnerable communities affected by political instability, widespread conflict and deterioration in the economy to withstand future shocks.   This contributes towards our MDGs by tackling extreme hunger (MDG1) and will result in improved food security and greater access to livelihoods by 2015.

title: Deepening Democracy in Nigeria 2 (DDIN2)
description: To strengthen the democratic character of Nigerian political processes and outcomes by providing support to key electoral bodies, other relevant arms of government (such as the Legislature) and civil society organisations.  Credible elections, an efficient legislature and the scrutiny of government performance by an informed society will motivate government to perform better and be more responsive to the needs of citizens.

title: Pathways to Prosperity for Extremely Poor People in Bangladesh (PPEPP)
description: Enable 1 million people to exit extreme poverty and access a sustained pathway to prosperity, while actively promoting public and private provision of the core services required to eradicate extreme poverty.

title: Improving links between disaster resilience and conflict prevention
description: To date academic research, policy and practice have tended to follow distinct streams with little interplay between those working on conflict and fragility and those concerned with disaster risk reduction (disaster resilience).The purpose of this research study is to provide a first important and practical step to providing evidence to inform  whether and how these two approaches can be better linked, so that support to disaster resilience can potentially contribute to statebuilding and peacebuilding, and vice versa .

title: UNFPA Supplies
description: To ensure that a reliable supply of contraceptives and life-saving medicines is available to improve reproductive, maternal and sexual health in the poorest countries. This support will enable girls and women to prevent unwanted pregnancy or sexually transmitted infections such as HIV and help ensure safe pregnancy and childbirth. It will contribute to achieving universal access to reproductive health.   This programme was formerly known as 'Multi-country Support for Increased Access to Reproductive Health, including Family Planning'.

title: Support to UNHCR and UNICEF for the emergency preparedness for refugees arriving into Rwanda from Democratic Republic of Congo
description: To enable the UNHCR and UNICEF to be  prepared, in terms of professional capacity and pre-positioned supplies, to respond within 72 hours to the influx of up to 20,000 additional refugees in 2013/14

title: Work in Freedom
description: To deliver a programme that helps prevent 100,000 women and girls from India, Bangladesh and Nepal from being trafficked through economic, social, and legal empowerment by 2017. This programme will help deliver DFIDs Strategic Vision for Girls and Women in two priority areas - Preventing Violence against Women and Girls; and increasing Direct Assets for Girls and Women through better wages, working conditions and remittances from safe labour migration.

title: Citizen Engagement for Delivery of Accountable Public Services
description: To improve the delivery of public services (health, education and WASH) in response to the needs of the poor and marginalised by providing local communities with the information and tools to lead advocacy and build partnerships with public authorities for accountable service delivery. This will  benefit 2.2 million people in selected districts and improve the quality, accessibility and responsiveness of public services particularly for the poor and marginalised.  This contributes to our MDG support to Sierra Leone, particularly MDGs 1-5, by delivering critical public services to the poorest and most marginalised and contribute to a reduction in poverty by 2018.

title: Special Adviser to National Revenue Authority
description: To strengthen National Revenue Authority governance arrangements and revenue collection by providing the National Revenue Authority with technical assistance. This will ultimately benefit the Government and citizens of Sierra Leone and will contribute towards more effective revenue mobilisation by December 2013

title: Better Health in Bangladesh (BHB) Programme
description: To deliver more and higher quality services, contributing to better health through technical assistance and policy engagement. The programme is contributing to ending preventable deaths of mothers, babies and children, tackling antimicrobial resistance and addressing climate change impact on health.

title: Family Planning in Bangladesh  improving quality and access
description: To improve uptake of quality family planning services among underserved women especially adolescents and women in special circumstances. Ipas along with five downstream partners is implementing this project mainly in government health facilities to ensure quality post abortion and postpartum FP services.   Ipas Bangladesh, in partnership with the Directorate General of Health Services, the Directorate General of Family Planning, and local stakeholders, is poised to implement a five-year project to cultivate an environment that supports women in accessing a full range of family planning services. The programme will increase the availability of high-quality contraceptive services; train and empower service providers; and advocate at the local and national level for improved reproductive health services. Ipas Bangladesh will focus comprehensive interventions in Sylhet, Chittagong, Barisal, and Dhaka, where unmet contraceptive need is greatest.

title: Youth Education and Skills programme for economic Growth - YES4Growth
description: To deliver manifesto commitments on education and contribute to the global goal of inclusive and equitable quality education for all. To ensure underprivileged youth, especially females, have improved opportunities for basic education, vocational skills and formal employment. To contribute UK government's commitment to women's economic empowerment. To provide basic education and skills development training to over 27000 including 45% girls disadvantaged adolescents and youths.

title: Energy Security and Resource Efficiency in Somaliland
description: To support Somaliland in diversifying its energy mix, enhancing resilience and facilitating an enabling institutional and regulatory environment for the expansion of access to electricity.

title: Fund for Impact Evaluation
description: To transform the demand for, use and practice of impact evaluation amongst the development community, particularly in areas that are currently under-evaluated. The programme will work simultaneously across multiple sectors and multiple geographies on 125 impact evaluations.  This coordinated, large scale approach will provide evaluation evidence, training and technical support across government and donor portfolios (up to 16 technical workshops with 36 teams participating in each workshop; 1080 people trained and at least 75 dissemination events held) and will drive forward the use of evaluation evidence in policy making as a whole.

title: Comic Relief Red Nose Day 2013  improving the lives of women and girls in sub-Saharan Africa
description: Targeted women and girls benefit from improvements in one or more of the following five areas: health, education, agriculture/trade, leadership and advocacy for women's rights and violence against women and girls.

title: Support to the 2018 electoral cycle in Sierra Leone
description: To support the delivery of free and fair Presidential, Parliamentary and Local Government elections in Sierra Leone in 2018, with effective citizen oversight and participation. Support will be delivered through a contribution to two UNDP-managed multi-donor projects for the elections, and via a DFID-managed Accountable Grant to a consortium of Civil Society Organisations.

title: Support to Anti-Corruption in Sierra Leone
description: To improve citizens ability to challenge petty corruption in health, education, water and sanitation and national power services delivery in Sierra Leone by 2018

title: Support to 2014 Population and Housing Census
description: To increase the robustness and validity of the 2014 Population and Housing Census process by providing Statistics Sierra Leone with key technical assistance and equipment. This will benefit the government and citizens of Sierra Leone by improving the accuracy of Census statistics that can be used with confidence for planning future development outcomes over the next ten (10) years.

title: Child Safeguarding in the UK Overseas Territories
description: Through this project DFID will build on the success of the previous projects to further support child safeguarding in the OTs. The work we have supported so far has improved political will and a collective OT government voice on the issue: at the Joint Ministerial Council (JMC) of the OT Governments in 2012, territory leaders signed a joint Communiqu that included the commitment to improve strategies to ensure the safeguarding of children, based on a strong belief in zero tolerance to child abuse in whatever form it comes. This commitment from OT leaders provides a firm basis on which to build further child safeguarding progress in the OTs.

title: Geothermal Surface Developments
description: Undertake the necessary infrastructure for the development of a new Geothermal power plant and the connection of the plant to the Montserrat Power Grid

title: Montserrat Infrastructure Plan
description: To support Government of Montserrat's delivery of effective, adequate, sustainable, resilient and well maintained economic infrastucture, utilities and public services to its citizens.

title: Improving Montserrats economic development through improvements to their transport infrastructure sea access
description: To develop the economy of Montserrat and boost local businesses by increasing tourist numbers and increasing tax revenue and GDP for the country. This will be achieved through improvements to the countrys transport infrastructure by the provision of a new fast, safe, reliable and more economical ferry crossing.

title: Strengthening the Montserrat Development to Attract Private Sector Investment 2013/14 - 2015-16
description: To support improved economic self-sufficiency in Montserrat by strengthening the capacity and capability of the Montserrat Development Corporation to stimulate local and international private investment in Montserrat's economic development

title: Montserrat economic development programme
description: To support the Government of Montserrat in implementing measures that can make the economy more competitive, private sector driven and productive with a view to create jobs, attract investment and decrease the dependence on aid. This includes support in developing Montserrat's key growth sectors such as tourism.

title: Montserrat Budget Aid 2013/14
description: Efficient and effective public services, maintain coverage of reasonable needs with minimum budget contribution from the UK Government

title: Montserrat Budget Aid 2014/15
description: Provide efficient and effective public services and maintain coverage of reasonable assistance needs with minimum budget contribution from HMG

title: Achieving Universal Coverage of Long lasting insecticide treated nets in Sierra Leone
description: To reduce the malaria burden in Sierra Leone, particularly in pregnant women and children under five years, by contributing 1.3million long lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs), communication and monitoring and evaluation activities to the nationwide LLINs mass distribution campaign to achieve universal coverage of households with LLINs.  This contributes towards our MDGs by improved health outcomes at scale, particularly for pregnant women and will avert 13,514 additional child deaths by 2016.

title: Cross-Government Seconded National Experts (SNE) Unit
description: To support the setting up of a cross Government Seconded National Experts (SNEs) Unit to help support and manage the increase in secondments to the European Union institutions and support Government departments in meeting their current secondment objectives.

title: India Infrastructure Policy Fund
description: To help the Government of India to improve the policy and regulatory framework, and to create financing solutions for infrastructure projects, including by leveraging foreign investment in infrastructure. This will lead to at least 8 Public Private Partnership studies to enhance leveraging of private investment in the sector.

title: Malawi Policing Improvement Programme
description: To support the Malawi Police Service with 3m with the aim of improving the public's satisfaction of police responsiveness and accountability. The overall outcome will be a Malawi Police Service that is better able to deal with public order issues while protecting constitutional rights and enforcing internal accountability of officers.

title: India: Infrastructure Equity Fund - Investment in small infrastructure projects in India's poorest states
description: To improve access to better quality transport, clean energy and basic urban services for households and businesses, by investing in equity to private sector-led infrastructure projects.  This will benefit an estimated 280,000 people with improved infrastructure services.

title: Malawi Rural Roads Improvement Programme
description: To upgrade 149 kms of rural unpaved roads in 5 districts of rural Malawi which will benefit up to 158,000 farming families.  Improved transport will provide inhabitants of these districts with access to markets, health and other services.  A total of 45 kms of rural roads in the beneficiary districts will by 2015 be re-habilitated and upgraded while a further 104 kms of rural roads will be made passable all year-round by occassional spot improvements.  The programme also expects by 2015 for (a) 10% of land to be planted to cash crops; (b) 10% improvement for women to access better health care and (c) 830,000 days of work opportunities in improving roads. The programme will close by December 2015

title: Caribbean Financial Resilience Project
description: To improve the delivery of public services to the people of the Caribbean and to support the sustainability of  public finances  by strengthening macroeconomic policymaking, public financial management, revenue mobilisation  and by helping to avert a financial sector crisis in the region.

title: Enhancing Programme Effectiveness Fund
description: To improve the Monitoring and Evaluation and Value for Money systems in targeted DFID Nigeria programmes.   This contributes to improving the effectiveness and impact of DFID Nigerias programmes.  DFID Nigerias programme portfolio includes programmes which contributes towards MDGs in health, education, nutrition, water, sanitation, increasing incomes, and improving gender equality

title: Policy Development Facility Phase II
description: This second phase of Policy Development Facility will continue improving economic and social policy in Nigeria by providing technical support to reformers within Nigerian Government to increase both capacity and use of evidence in policy formulation and implementation.

title: Support for the Genocide Research and Reconciliation Programme in Rwanda
description: To increase the use of research and evidence to inform reconciliation and social cohesion processes in Rwanda by 2016, by supporting Aegis Trust to develop an accessible archive, to strengthen research on the Rwandan Genocide and to develop and roll-out a peacebuilding education programme to schools and communities in Rwanda.

title: Scaling Up Nutrition in Malawi
description: To treat and prevent under-nutrition and acute malnutrition amongst under five aged children in 15 districts in Malawi. This will benefit 12, 700 children with severe and acute malnutrition treated, 320 , 000 women and caregivers provided with nutritional counselling to help improve infant and young child feeding practices, training of 6, 090 community and health workers and 2 900 pregnant and lactating mothers reached with effective nutrition interventions. This contributes towards MDGs 1-6 and will result in increased uptake and adoption of intergrated Community Based Management of Acute Malnutrition by 2015.

title: Reducing maternal mortality through supporting in-country initiatives to tackle unsafe abortion and improve access to services
description: To enable locally led initiatives for improving services delivery, undertaking research, and addressing barriers to safe abortion, through small grants to non-governmental organisations.

title: Rwanda Multi-Donor Civil Society Support Programme (2015-2021)
description: Strengthened civil society engagement on critical social cohesion, reconciliation and governance issues in Rwanda.  DFID will provide funding and technical support to Rwandan civil society organisations to support the design and implementation of governance and reconciliation focused initiatives, and to support more effective engagement (influencing) with government on these issues.

title: Local Partnership and Dialogue Programme
description: To improve the capacity of women and men and groups who represent them to collaborate on issues of concern to their communities at the local, state and national level in Sudan

title: St Helena Interim Infrastructure Programme
description: The purpose of this project is to provide funding to the St Helena Government to contribute to the cost of delivering infrastructure projects critical to meet the islands basic infrastructure needs, to enable airport licensing and operations, to improve tourist sites and health and social care facilities

title: Global Health Workforce Alliance:Global review on the Cost Effectiveness of Community Health Workers
description: The overall purpose of the research study is to build on the available evidence of Community Health Workers costs and effectiveness to determine the relative cost-effectiveness of Community Health Worker programmes, and the most efficient, feasible and sustainable models of Community Health Worker practices. This proposed research would be a significant step toward providing vital evidence in the limited research available concerning Community Health Workers cost effectiveness to aid decision makers in influencing future policy decision, and will contribute toward enhancing the universal access to the skilled health workforce at community levels.

title: SIEF Strategic Impact Evaluation Fund
description: To strengthen the impact of global aid by learning lessons and generating evidence for design of new programmes. The Strategic Impact Evaluation Fund (SIEF), over 2011/12-2021/22, will be channelled through a World Bank executed Trust Fund. It is expected that SIEF will deliver a minimum of 54 high quality impact evaluations of key development interventions focusing on human development outcomes. In addition, SIEF will deliver 20 capacity building workshops and events to improve understanding of impact evaluation techniques.

title: Establishing a centre of excellence for Security and Justice activity related to fragile and conflict affected states.
description: To provide a centre of excellence for Security and Justice related activity, to enable the UK to deliver more integrated and effective results in Fragile and Conflict Affected States (FCAS).To provide a centre of excellence for Security and Justice related activity which will enable the UK to deliver more integrated and effective results in Fragile and Conflict Affected States (FCAS) by:Strengthening HMG security and justice activity in high and medium priority countries.Providing evidence and lessons to develop more coherent and effective security and justice activity and policy.Advising and influencing key international policing stakeholders to support more effective delivery of HMG objectives in this area.Improving HMGs ability to deliver effective and coherent defence engagement activity.Improving HMG staff skills and understanding in support of security and justice activity overseas.

title: Establishing a centre of excellence for Conflict and Stabilisation activity related to fragile and conflict affected states.
description: To provide a centre of excellence for stabilisation and conflict related activity, enabling the UK to deliver more integrated and effective results in Fragile and Conflict Affected States (FCAS).To provide a centre of excellence for Conflict and Stabilisation related activity which will enable the UK to deliver more integrated and effective results in Fragile and Conflict Affected States (FCAS) by: Strengthening HMG conflict and stabilisation activity in high and medium priority countries. Providing appropriate training and technical support to HMG staff and Deployable Civilian Experts enabling effective operation in priority fragile and conflict affected states and improved use of Conflict Pool resources.Establishing a pool of Senior Conflict and Stabilisation Advisers.Providing expertise, best-practice and lessons to develop more coherent and effective conflict and stabilisation policy, strategy, programming and training.

title: Rapid support for HMG intervention in crises in fragile and conflict affected states.
description: To provide immediate access to appropriately skilled and equipped personnel and logistical support ensuring a more rapid and integrated delivery of expertise to countries affected by conflict-related crisis.To provide immediate access to appropriately skilled and equipped personnel and logistical support to ensure the rapid and integrated delivery of expertise to countries affected by conflict-related crisis.

title: Centre for UKs civil-military integrated approach to activity in/on fragile  and conflict affected states.
description: To provide expertise and logistical in support of a more effective UK joint civil-military integrated approach to activity in fragile and conflict affected states.To provide expertise and logistics in support of a more effective UK joint civil-military integrated approach to activity in fragile and conflict affected states, through providing expert assistance to military exercises, institutions and current operations.

title: Strengthening HMGs contribution to priority multi-lateral missions.
description: To enhance the UKs support of priority multilateral missions.To enhance the UKs support of priority multilateral missions.

title: Support to Girl Effect Rwanda
description: Strengthened enabling environment for adolescent girls in Rwanda results in improved government commitment to adolescent girls, more responsive services (eg health, education, violence prevention and response) and stronger voice for girls at community level

title: Rule of Law Expertise Programme
description: To improve Rule of Law environments in developing countries by matching UK judicial and legal expertise, both private and public sector, with demand in developing countries to improve the policies, organisations and practices of legal and judicial systems. It aims to provide targeted short-term assignments and to build strategic partnerships through  a combination of assignments, additional technical support, and through its evidence and lesson learning work. The Programme will respond to demand for UK legal expertise from all 28 DFID priority countries.

title: Support to Bond to improve the effectiveness, transparency and impact of development Non Governmental Organisations
description: To improve the effectiveness, transparency and impact of 395 UK development Non Governmental Organisations(NGOs), in order to contribute to better and longer term results for poor people on the receiving end of  NGO poverty reduction programmes.

title: St Helena Budgetary Aid 2014-15
description: The expected outcome is that public services provided by St Helena Government are delivered effectively and efficiently. This support extends to the provision of regular sea access to the island and the provision of technical cooperation to ensure adequate service provision.

title: Uganda Economic Transformation Project
description: To promote youth employment in Uganda by increasing young peoples capacity to acquire and create decent jobs.  This will directly benefit 100,000 youths (50% women) and improve their economic and social opportunities.  This contributes to eradicating poverty by meeting the specific needs and interests of women and girls and young people and will result in increased number of youth with income above the international poverty line by 2019.

title: Strengthening Services and Support Available to Survivors of Acid and Burns Violence
description: To promote the eradication of acid and burns and violence in Nepal and Pakistan and assist victims by -  improving access to and quality of medical responses, increasing access to justice, improving access to rehabilitation and reintegration services for survivors, increasing awareness of rights and skills needed to organise and create change, improving responses to and prevention of acid and burns violence and to create a stronger evidence-base to tackle and prevent acid and burns violence by September 2016.

title: Strategic Analysis, Research and Evaluation Fund
description: To improve the evidence base for the Government of Ethiopias Growth and Transformation Plan [and DFID Ethiopias Operational Plan] to 2015 and beyond by funding research and evaluation activities by academic and other organisations.

title: Strengthening Research and Knowledge Systems (SRKS) INASP
description: To build stronger, higher quality and durable research and knowledge systems in the global South by strengthening organisational capacity, networks and national/regional bodies that influence the research communication cycle. Key activities are provision of cost-effective national and regional Journal Online networks, supporting researchers in preparing research for publication, providing librarian skills training and encouraging collaborative licensing and purchasing of digital library resources using locally-sourced funds.

title: Business Innovation Facility in Burma
description: BIF Burma (Myanmar) will fund advice to at least 28 companies in 3-4 sectors about how they can adjust the way they do business in ways that create more jobs, opportunities, products and services for poor people  and it will do so in ways that ensure other companies in the same sector follow suit. As a result of DFID support at least 60,000 poor consumers will have access to new products and services, and at least 1,500 low income producers will gain access to new or more secure economic opportunities by December 2017.

title: Design of Phase 2 of Sanitation, Hygiene and Water in Nigeria Programme (SHAWN)
description: To accelerate and sustain progress in safe excreta disposal, the adoption of basic hygiene practices and access to safe water across selected communities, initially in 3 Local Government Areas in each of 4 selected States (i.e. 12 Local Government Areas) in rural areas of Nigeria.

title: Arab Partnership Economic Facility (APEF) - Natural Resource Management in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Region
description: To improve the management and transparency of natural resources in Libya and Tunisia. Supporting governments to manage resource wealth effectively for the benefit of its citizens; and building the capacity of civil society to hold government to account for the management of this sector.

title: PREDICTABLE HUMANITARIAN EMERGENCIES IN PAKISTAN DURING 2013
description: Humanitarian response to Monsoon floods and Internally displaced people in Pakistan and humanitarian reform and research. This will benefit 780,000 people who were severely affected by 2012 floods and up to 2.48 million people from emergencies in 2013

title: DFID Vietnam Evaluation Facility
description: To provide a brief historical account of the development co-operation between Vietnam and the UK since DFID Vietnam;To examine the evidence of DFIDs contribution to poverty reduction and effectiveness of the approaches used in Vietnam, and to draw out lessons-learned

title: Disability Rights Fund 2013/2016
description: The objective of supporting this fund is to be able to promote engagement with national civil society organisations Disabled Peoples Organisations working to ensure implemenration and monitoring of the UN Convention on the rights of persons with disabilities in the most cost effective way

title: Future Agricultures Consortium :Independent Research Debate on Future of Agriculture in Africa
description: The aim of the Future Agricultures Consortium is to improve discussions and support better improved policies and programmes to increase Agriculture productivity and reduce poverty in sub -Saharan Africa. Its purpose is to improve policy for promoting agriculture growth and poverty reduction for poor people in Africa

title: African Legal Support Facility (ALSF)
description: To enable African countries to negotiate oil, gas, mining and related infrastructure deals with greater financial and non-financial benefits to governments and citizens, by providing African governments with high quality legal support for negotiation of contracts. This will result in at least 4 renegotiated contracts that achieve greater financial benefits to host countries compared with original agreements and at least 8 contracts that governments and investor negotiators consider to reflect a fair distribution of benefits. This contributes towards our MDGs by increasing revenues to governments from extractive industries, and will help eight countries to achieve their national poverty reduction targets by 2017

title: Developing new partnership models that bring together science and business on food systems to tackle undernutrition.
description: to improve private sector support for new public private partnership models on nutrition to reduce undernutrition of the poor people in africa

title: DFID's share of the United Kingdom's Contribution to the European Commission's external action budget
description: To provide the Department for International Development's (DFID) contribution to the European Union's activities in support of economic development and poverty reduction in Asia and Latin American countries and South Africa. The European Union activities contribute towards Member States pledges to commit 0.7% of Gross National Income (GNI) on Official Development Assistance (ODA)

title: Security and risk management in hostile environments
description: To enhance the safety and security of aid workers engaged in humanitarian work by strengthening integrated security-risk management approaches, allowing increased and sustainable access to populations in need.

title: Linking Agribusiness and Nutrition in Mozambique
description: To improve the diet intake and nutritional practices in target beneficiaries (Infant and Young Child Feeding practices, hygiene, breastfeeding, water and sanitation) in the Beira corridor in Mozambique and promote the local production of Ready to Use Therapeutic Foods. This will target 623,000 beneficiaries and contribute to delivering MDG 1.C on reducing hunger. Key stakeholders (GoM, private sector and donors) influenced through credible, evidenced based models for effective nutrition interventions.

title: Support to the International Trade Centre Phase II
description: Reduced trade cost resulting from increased transparency of non-tariff measures and related obstacles to trade in goods and services, and initiatives aimed at mitigating identified barriers.Women entrepreneurs increased participation in trade.Better environment for women informal cross-border traders to engage in trade resulting in increase in cross border trade volumes.

title: Tax, Audit and Transparency (TAUT)
description: To support the Government of Ethiopia to increase domestic revenues (in real terms and as a proportion of GDP), and to improve accountability and transparency in how the revenues are deployed (public expenditure).

title: South Sudan Partnership Fund
description: To support the Government of the Republic of South Sudan in driving development outcomes in South Sudan, taking decisions supportive of peace-building and state-building and making more effective use of its financial resources. This will help strengthen core state institutions, support service delivery and build the foundations for economic diversification and wealth creation for the people of South Sudan.

title: Assessment of the evidence of links between Gender, Equality, Statebuilding and Peacebuilding
description: The purpose of this research is to deepen the evidence base on the relationship between gender equality and peacebuilding and statebuilding, and to explore the assumption that including women will make these processes more effective, sustainable and result in better outcomes for women and girls. Given that 21 of 28 of DFID's priority countries are fragile or conflict affected states, it is important to understand how men and women are affected by the dynamics of fragility, what strategies are effective in promoting gender equality and women's empowerment in these contexts. The research aims to move debate forward, pulling evidence to-date together into an implementable policy approach supported by an evidence-led theory of change, tools for implementation and analysis of where the evidence is limited to back assumptions made.  This will move not only DFIDs work forward but also that of the wider donor community.

title: Green Mini-Grids Africa
description: To increase access to clean energy through the creation of an expanding market of green mini-grid installations in Africa serving rural villages unconnected to the main grid.  This is expected to benefit around 1.3m people by 2018, while reducing carbon emissions by around 260,000 Tonnes of carbon dioxide, through supported private investment in the installation and operation of over 110 renewably-powered mini-grids (figures to be updated after Business Case completion).  Electricity access for lighting, communications and productive uses creates jobs, enables studying at night and enhances public services (such as clinics) and public safety (eg through streetlighting).  This project also addresses the post-2015 High Level Panels recommendation on a development goal entitled Secure Sustainable Energy, which includes energy access and renewable energy.

title: Vietnam Climate Innovation Centre
description: To enhance growth and mitigate climate change impacts in Vietnam by providing the private sector with support to engage in climate technology innovation. This will be done through setting Climate Innovation Centre which provide a set of services, including capital provision, capacity building; supporting new enterprises; and conducting market analysis. This will benefit 260,000 people and mitigate up to 340,000 tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents (tCO2e) by 2018

title: Local Governance Support Programme in Malawi
description: to enhance a better understanding of local governance issues, especially as they relate to the decentralisation process, management of service delivery and the possible impact of the 2014 election of local councillors

title: Improving the management of public funds for the benefit of people in Myanmar
description: To improve the use of public finances so that they benefit the people of Myanmar. The expected results include contributing to increasing tax collection from large tax payers by 40% by 2020. The UK will fund a World Bank led programme to work with the Ministry of Planning and Finance to improve their ability to manage public funds and the capacity of parliament to provide oversight of public spending. The programme will also separately support tax administration, fiscal decentralisation, social accountability, and Myanmars involvement in the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative.

title: Flexible Fund  supporting businesses to get renewable energy innovations to scale in developing countries
description: Facilitating sustainable development and reducing carbon emissions

title: Green Mini-Grids Kenya
description: Support for project preparation and leveraging of private investment in Green Mini-Grids (GMGs) in Kenya

title: Haiti Camp Resettlement
description: To support the relocation of 4,000 displaced people from unsafe camps into secure housing; and ensuring those remaining in camps can access basic services, and vulnerable girls and women are protected for from the threat of sexual violence.  The UK will also provide assistance to help with hurricane preparedness providing fuel and maintenance so that trucks can deliver life-saving items such as tents, mosquito nets, jerry cans and blankets to 600,000 people and  essential food assistance to 480,000 people; provide paid-for work for 300,000 people in the immediate aftermath of disaster; and allow the rapid treatment of 10,000 cholera victims by providing advance funding for medical staff, equipment and supervision of health facilities.

title: Support to Ifakara Health Institute
description: To support Ifakara Health institute strategic plan by strengthening the capacity to generate high quality evidence. This will enable the institute to deliver research and knowledge, which offers material contributions to advances in public health in Tanzania and globally. This contributes towards MDGs 4 and 5 by reducing under five mortality rate to 67 per 1000 live births, infant mortality rate to 40 per 1000 live births and maternal mortality ratio to 170 per 100000 live births by 2016.

title: International Development Association 17th Replenishment (IDA 17)
description: To contribute to the achievement of the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and post MDG framework  in IDA Client countries by boosting economic growth, reducing inequalities and improving living conditions.

title: Increasing access to essential medical equipment and commodities in Uganda
description: To improve the quality of health care by increasing availability of essential medicines, health supplies and equipment enhancing health outcomes particularly for women and children. This will contribute to the reduction of maternal and child mortality augmenting efforts to attain MDGs 4, 5 and 6 by 2015.

title: Support to the National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS2) in Rwanda
description: Strengthened, sustainable capacity of National Institute for Statistics of Rwanda and National Statistical System to meet immediate and future data needs

title: Contributing to the control of Malaria in Uganda
description: To improve malaria control in Uganda by distributing 1.5 million Insecticide treated bed nets to hospitals, expanding household spraying and training of health workers on better use of malaria kits and treatment of fever in children. This will prevent at least 13,845 child deaths between 2013 and 2016 and contribute to Ugandas progress towards Millenium Development Goals (MDGs) 4, 5 and 6.

title: Support to Development of the National Statistical System (NSS) in Malawi
description: Improve the coordination and production of statistics in Malawi and strengthen the National Statistical System by providing the National Statistics Office with 600,000 between July 2013 and June 2016 through the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.  This will benefit the Government of Malawi by increasing the availability and quality of statistics that inform development planning.  It will also enable development partners to coordinate their support to the National Statistics Office more efficiently.  This contributes indirectly to our MDGs by increasing the quality of evidence to determine progress against key development goals.
