title: Syria Humanitarian Assistance, 2013 - 2016
description: To deliver emergency humanitarian assistance to people affected by the conflict inside Syria and the wider region

title: Big Results Now delivery programme Phase II
description: Supporting the Government of Tanzania to implement a transformational new Big Results Now programme to accelerate achievement of middle income status by 2025 and transition out of aid dependency, by identifying and resolving constraints to results delivery in the Governments priority areas (initially: energy, water, transport, agriculture, education and resource mobilisation, with more to be added in future years). The results driven monitoring system will enable high-level oversight of progress, make the existing system work, and put transparency and accountability for performance front and centre.

title: Upgrading the Kigumba-Masindi-Hoima-Kabwoya (135km) road from gravel to bitumen standards
description: to improve road access to socio-economic facilities and quality of transport service levels in western Uganda

title: Northern Uganda: Transforming the Economy through Climate Smart Agribusiness (NU-TEC)
description: To increase the resilience to climate change of poor farmers in Northern Uganda, and to increase their incomes.   This will be achieved by working with agricultural businesses to supply farmers with cheaper, better and more varied agricultural inputs and services, and to create stronger markets for farmer produce.  This will benefit 250,000 households in Northern Uganda, who will adopt new practices, products and markets that will make them more resilient to climate change, while 150,000 households will see measurable increases to income. This will contribute to the MDGs (and their successor targets) by reducing poverty in Uganda.

title: Malawi Joint Donor Humanitarian Emergency Response Fund
description: To deliver humanitarian assistance to over 400,000 individuals over three years across a range of sectorial interventions including health, food, nutrition, water and sanitation and shelter which will save lives and reduce suffering of Malawians affected by disasters.  This contributes towards MDGs 1, 4, 6 and 7 by providing ready to use funds to enable humanitarian agencies deliver timely and coordinated assessments and humanitarian response by December 2015.

title: To contain the spread of artemisinin resistant malaria in South East Asia, in combination with governments in the region and development partners.
description: To address urgent gaps in the response to drug resistant malaria in the Greater Mekong Sub-region (GMS) of South East Asia, with the aim of helping to contain its spread to other countries and regions.

title: Support to the Enabling Environment for Humanitarian Response in Yemen (2015-16)
description: To provide rapid, specialist, expertise, transportation and equipment for the UN to enable a more effective and better coordinated response to the humanitarian crisis in Yemen in 2015

title: Expanding Access to Water and Sanitation- PLAN
description: This project is targeting access to an improved water source, taps and water wells, for an additional 31,500 people in 126 communities within the chiefdoms of Kowa and Fakunya in Moyamba and in Koya and T. M. Safroko in Port Loko, Sierra Leone.

title: The Commonwealth Foundation 2013 to 2016
description: To improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Commonwealth Foundation to ensure that it can deliver progress on the four short-term outcomes of the 2012 to 2016 Strategic Plan

title: Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience in South Sudan (HARISS) 2015 - 2024
description: HARISS aims to save lives, avert suffering, maintain dignity, and reinforce coping capacities for people affected by conflict, disasters, and shocks in South Sudan. It is a large-scale, multi-sector and multi-year humanitarian programme providing humanitarian assistance and resilience building activities (although these reduced from 2022). HARISS focuses on: 	Life-saving humanitarian assistance 	Humanitarian protection for the most vulnerable 	Resilience-building 	Support to the enabling environment

title: Climatescope - Clean Energy Investment Index
description: To increase private investment in renewable energy projects in developing countries by providing investors with comparable and robust policy and market information in an easilyaccesible data tool. Renewable energy is becoming a cheaper solution than fossil fuels in many developing countries and by providing better information to potential investors, Climatescope supports increasing investment in renewable energy in developing countries. This in turn will support economic growth through greater access to sustainable energy and allow businesses to prosper.

title: Evidence Base Programme
description: To improve the quality and availability of statistics in Sudan by providing technical assistance and capacity building to statisticians from the public sector, universities, civil society and the media. The generation of better quality data will benefit the people of Sudan by making it easier to identify vulnerable groups and providing evidence to support policies which make economic growth more inclusive. This will contribute towards the MDGs by making aid targeting more effective- helping all our other programmes become better at reaching their intended beneficiaries.

title: Scaling up orange fleshed sweetpotato through the International Potato Center
description: The UK will provide 12m as funding to the International Potato Centre (CIP) over a five year period (2013-2018).  This will enable the scale up of nutritionally improved (or biofortified) Orange Fleshed Sweet Potatoes (OFSP) to 1.2 million farming households in 4 countries in Africa.

title: Supporting Nutrition in Pakistan (SNIP)
description: To improve nutritional status for people in Pakistan, decreasing Undernutrition through nutrition-specific and nutrition sensitive interventions benefiting particularly poorest women, girls and under 5 children.

title: Stability and Growth Programme
description: To improve macro-economic stability and growth in Pakistan by providing the Government with financial aid and technical assistance in support of the International Monetary Fund Extended Financing Facility (2013 to 2016).  This will benefit the people of Pakistan by establishing the conditions for faster and more equitable growth.  This contributes towards our SDGs by enabling the Government of Pakistan to finance essential public expenditure and protect the poor from the adverse impact of structural economic reforms.

title: Dialogue between countries to improve effectiveness of development cooperation
description: To enhance the effectiveness of global development cooperation through fostering partnerships and facilitating dialogue between recipient countries, emerging powers and OECD donors

title: Effective Human Resources Management for Better Results in United Nations Agencies
description: To provide financial support to a research project on Human Resources practises within the United Nations which will help agencies to understand their specific Human Resources needs and advocate for change to support these needs

title: Core Contribution (CVC) to World Health Organisation (WHO)  2016-2020
description: This programme aims to support WHO reforms that take WHO towards organisational excellence, allowing it to: better deliver value for money; better deliver its global mandate of international health leadership; and ultimately to deliver better health results on the ground for all UK investments. The main areas of WHO organisational reform which the programme seeks progress on are: risk and financial management; transparency; value for money; budgets focussed on key priorities; partnership and effective leadership  The programme will also have a focus on an improved WHO response to health emergencies and outbreaks (such as Ebola, Yellow Fever and Zika), reducing the risk to the UK.

title: 2015 Election Planning(South Sudan)
description: Supporting South Sudan through targetted baseline research and the provision of technical assistance, to better demonstrate democracy through its delivery of impartial and independent elections, thereby building the trust and confidence of South Sudanese citizens.

title: Strategic Partnership with Save the Children UK
description: To improve access to humanitarian services in the health sector by providing rapid and cost effective support in a humanitarian crisis. This will benefit 2.4 million users of health services.

title: Disaster emergency preparedness in Haiti- 2013 hurricane season
description: To support disaster emergency preparedness in Haiti, prior to the upcoming hurricane season.

title: Support to Rural Water Supply, Sanitation & Hygiene in Tanzania
description: To improve the health and socio-economic status of poor people by providing access to clean water, sanitation and hygiene services in rural areas of Tanzania. This will benefit 2.8 million people. This contributes towards our MDGs by supporting development of water infrastructure and promotion of hygiene and sanitation services.  And will result in sustainability of water and sanitation services by 2022.

title: Support to the Africa Partnership Forum (APF) support unit
description: To improve policy dialogue between African countries and donor partners by bringing representatives from African countries, institutions, and donor countries together to discuss future action on critical policy areas. This will improve donor and African policy on poverty alleviation. This contributes towards our MDGs by supporting the creation of better policy and increased action on poverty alleviation.

title: Financial support for a crisis analysis adviser to review new technology and techniques for anticipating humanitarian crises, and co-ordinate and facilitate Rapid Response Facility partner discussions on emerging crises.
description: To improve the UK Government's humanitarian responses by providing funding for a crisis analysis adviser to facilitate the improved effectiveness of the Rapid Response Facility. This will benefit those affected by humanitarian disasters by ensuring that the UK can respond rapidly and according to needs in humanitarian crises and ensuring UK responses provide good value for money. This adviser will establish a mechanism for RRF Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO) partners to pool information on emerging crises, facilitate a discussion and based on this broker a decision whether to recommend activation of the RRF facility.

title: Core support to UNAIDS 2016-2021
description: Aim of the project is for UNAIDS to lead, coordinate and strengthen the global response to HIV/AIDS in order to end the AIDS epidemic by 2030. UNAIDS makes an important contribution towards reaching DFIDs Strategic Objective to eliminate extreme poverty through co-ordinating the global response to the HIV/AIDS epidemic. As the leading advocate for global action against HIV/AIDS at both the global and country level, UNAIDS plays a key role in delivering against objectives set out in HMGs Aid Strategy to tackle epidemic diseases and drug resistant infections. UNAIDS also remains an integral part of the international architecture for delivering against Global Goal 3 to end the AIDS epidemic by 2030.

title: Funding to the Communicating with Disaster Affected Communities Network
description: To better enable responders and affected communities to engage in communications in a humanitarian disaster, with predictable, consistent and resourced information provision ultimately contributing towards a more effective humanitarian response, ultimately saving more lives.

title: UN Capacity Building through the Junior Professional Officers Programme
description: To increase the level and influence of UK representation in the international system to act as a significant lever for shaping HMG's International agenda and to improve institutional effectiveness and efficiency.

title: The Commonwealth Local Government Forum: 2017/18 - 2019/20
description: To support the Commonwealth Local Government Forum (CLGF) to work with and build capacity of local government organisations to design, develop and implement Local Economic Development (LED) strategies that deliver local investment, job creation and business development that will inform and influence national Local Economic Development strategies.

title: Commonwealth Scholarship Commission in the UK (CSC)
description: To enhance the numbers of well qualified post graduates, academics and professionals working in development related fields in Commonwealth developing countries, with an appropriate Gender balance

title: Building Resilience in the Sahel through Adaptive Social Protection
description: Build the evidence and justification for adaptive social protection in the Sahel by establishing national level systems that will build the resilience of vulnerable populations and can be scaled in a time of crisis.

title: Urban Water for Sudan (UW4S)
description: To provide equitable and affordable access to sustainable water resources, clean drinking water supply, improved sanitation facilities, and hygiene promotion for up to 400,000 people

title: Global Panel on Agriculture and Food Systems for Nutrition
description: To improve policies and programmes in nutrition sensitive agriculture by providing support to a new Global Panel on Agriculture and Food Systems for Nutrition. This will benefit developing countries and programmes, by maximising the contribution of agriculture and food systems to improve nutritional outcomes. This contributes towards our MDGs by helping to accelerate global progress in tackling undernutrition, and will result in more nutrition-sensitive agricultural policies and programmes by 2016.

title: Tackling Corruption by Tackling Drug Trafficking in Ghana
description: To provide capacity building, equipment and mentoring to Ghana's Narcotics Control Board (NACOB) to improve its capability to investigate and tackle corruption, serious crime and drug trafficking.

title: Addressing conflict risks to development in Mali
description: To contribute to conflict mitigation and long-term stability in Mali by providing conflict prevention expertise to the European Union. This will support good donor practice and conflict sensitive programmes to ensure that foundations are laid for a peaceful transition and long-term stability. This will benefit conflict affected populations in Mali, and will result in improved EU practices by the end of 2014.

title: National Health Weeks 2013
description: To  increase basic health outcomes by providing vaccinations, malaria prevention, family planning to reach 3.5 million children and 340,000 women of reproductive age. This will help reduce maternal and child mortality in 2014 and contribute towards MDGs 4 and 5.

title: UK Humanitarian Response to India Floods - July 2013
description: To fund NGOs to provide thousands of the most vulnerable people with essential food, water, bedding and shelter  following the flash flooding in Uttarakhand (Northern India) in July 2013

title: Improved Community Safety and Security  Programme(South Sudan)
description: Improved safety and security for citizens through a more professional and accountable South Sudan National Police Service, working in partnership with local government and communities.

title: Global Environment Facility 6th Replenishment
description: To provide funding for projects and activities targeting global benefits in biodiversity, climate change, international waters, the ozone layer and land degredation

title: CSSF - Conflict Sensitivity Programme (CSP in South Sudan)
description: To provide a Resource Centre that will assist in ensuring that Donors and Implementing partners are able to deliver more effective and more conflict sensitive programmes which will contribute towards the peace building process in South Sudan.

title: Core Contribution 2014-2015 Food and Agriculture Organisation
description: The core funding will support the work of FAO, a standard-setting technical UN agency, to improve global food security, particularly in developing countries.  FAO will provide technical assistance for the development and implementation of international and national policies on food and agriculture; coupled with voluntary programme funding, this will benefit food-insecure and vulnerable people, especially in rural areas.  FAO sets and monitors global norms and standards relevant to the achievement of the Millennium Development Goals, particularly the eradication of extreme poverty and hunger, and the promotion of gender equity and environmental sustainability

title: Supporting Structural Reform in the Indian Power Sector
description: In line with the UK governments aid policy and new development partnership with India, the Supporting Structural Reform in the Indian Power Sector programme will improve the efficiency, reliability and sustainability of electricity supply in India through technical expertise, not through traditional grant support. It will provide world class expertise to support the market reforms and scale up of renewable energy supply that the Indian power sector needs to support growth and create jobs. It will work at the Central level and in upto three States which may include DFID focus states such as Odisha, Andhra Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh.

title: Protecting Adolescent Girls against Violence in Humanitarian Settings: Joint Programming on Safe Spaces
description: Improved prevention of and response to violence against adolescent girls in humanitarian settings, particularly in Ethiopia, Pakistan and DRC by providing adolescent girls and their communities with the skills and knowledge needed to lessen their risk to violence. This will directly benefit 8615 adolescent girls and will also provide a platform for learning and dissemination of knowledge on this under-developed area of work. This contributes to our MDGs by improving prevention of and response to violence against women and girls and will result in X% (yet to be established) of girls feeling safer in their environments by 2016.

title: Support to local governance structures in Syria
description: To support local governance structures in opposition-held and contested parts of Syria to meet the needs of the community by providing training and financial assistance. This project will help up to 40 communities to meet their urgent needs and provide them with an alternative experience of governance - one which is transparent and accountable, thereby strengthening the social contract between the state and its citizens. The project will contribute towards the MDGs by reducing poverty and supporting good governance.

title: Lower Limpopo River Valley Flood Reconstruction and Climate Resilience Project
description: To provide emergency infrastructure repairs to restore connectivity to 500,000 people in the Limpopo Valley in the short-term (build back) whilst building capacity within the Government through enhanced early warning systems to improve climate-resilient planning (build back better)

title: Mozambique Household Budget Survey
description: To support the National Institute of Mozambique to take forward a survey which will provide updated information on poverty and living conditions in Mozambique.

title: Medicines for Malaria Venture (2013-2018)
description: To research and develop new drugs for the treatment of malaria through public private partnership. This research will improve our understanding of the development of new drugs to treat malaria. This contributes to the health related MDGs and will help reduce morbidity and mortality amongst the 3.3 billion people at risk from the disease in 106 countries.

title: Support to Mozambique's Municipal(2013) and General(2014) Elections
description: To increase transparency and participation in municipal and general elections by strengthening civil society engagement in electoral processes through focused civic education activities and elections observation. This will benefit the people of Mozambique and contribute to more transparent and credible municipal and general elections through better knowledge of electoral laws and impartial observation of electoral processes. This will make it more likely that election results are accepted by all political parties involved and that the risk of political tension escalating to violence is mitigated.

title: To increase knowledge and evidence on role women and violent extremism and terrorism
description: To increase knowledge and evidence on women and violent extremism and terrorism and development

title: Violence Against Women and Girls High level meeting
description: The Call to Action aims to intensify the work of the humanitarian system to protect women and girls in emergency contexts, preventing and responding to all forms of gender-based violence, in both natural disasters and situations of conflict.  The event to be held in November 2013 builds on the landmark commitment G8 Foreign Ministers reached in their Declaration on Preventing Sexual Violence in Conflict in April 2013.

title: Foundation for Innovative New Diagnostics (FIND) 2013-2018
description: To research and develop new diagnostic tests for the neglected diseases of the poor, including Tuberculosis, Sleeping Sickness, Leishmaniasis, Malaria and Non-malarial febrile illness, through public private partnership. This research will advance the development of diagnostic tests for these diseases with a view to providing accurate diagnosis, appropriate treatment, improved patient outcomes and reducing drug wastage through misdiagnosis. This contributes to the health related MDGs by helping to tackle the 13.7million deaths and 377 million years of healthy and productive life globally caused by these diseases each year.

title: Drugs for Neglected Diseases Initiative 2013-2018
description: This investment will contribute towards the ultimate goal of achieving the World Health Organisation 2020 Neglected Tropical Disease (NTD) control and elimination targets through the development of, and increased access to, affordable and appropriate  new and improved disease treatments for neglected patients.

title: Innovative Vector Control Consortium (2013-2018)
description: To research and develop new insecticides for malaria control through public private partnership. This research will advance the development of new insecticides and help mitigate the threat posed by insecticide resistance on existing tools  long lasting insecticide treated nets and indoor residual spraying. This contributes towards the health related MDGs and will help reduce morbidity and mortality amongst the 3.3 billion people at risk from malaria in 106 countries

title: Strengthening Midwifery in Bangladesh
description: To contribute to the global goal of healthy lives and well-being for all and manifesto commitment on family planning. It will develop 5500 competent and licensed midwives in the public and private sectors and establish midwives as a professional cadre in Bangladesh. It will build capacity of BRAC University and the public institutions to provide standard diploma midwifery education and integrate midwifery in the health system through supporting UNFPA. It will develop midwifery society in the country with support of the RCM.

title: Annual assessed contribution over four calendar year-period 2016-2019 to the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation
description: Funding of the mandatory annual assessed contribution to UNESCO for calendar years 2016 - 2019 inclusive, covering the organisation's programme which includes Education, Science, Culture and Communication. Key programmes include the Education For All policy, Global Monitoring Report, Global Tsunami warning system, protection of Culture and World Heritage, Safety of Journalists and Freedom of Expression. Full details are in UNESCO's Programme and Budget.

title: Support Delivery of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Services in Rural Mozambique through UNICEF
description: To increase use of improved sanitation and safe water supplies, and improved hygiene practices in targeted rural districts (Zambezia, Manica, Sofala and Tete Provinces). This will benefits 39.000 people with water supplies, 225.000 people with access to safe sanitation and hygiene and 7.000 students with access to appropriate water, sanitation and hygiene and contributes towards our MDGs 7c on access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation by 2015.

title: International Development Association 18th Replenishment (IDA 18)
description: UK contribution to the 18th Replenishment of the World Bank International Development Association (IDA 18)

title: Global Alliance for TB Drug Development 2013-18
description: To research and develop new drugs for the treatment of tuberculosis (TB) through public private partnership. This research will advance the development of new, easier to use, and cheaper drugs for the treatment of TB, multi-drug resistant TB and extremely drug resistant TB. This contributes towards the health related MDGs by helping to advance treatments for the millions of people globally that are affected by TB each year - it is estimated that in 2010, 8.8 million people developed active TB and that 1.4 million died from the disease.

title: Support to the Ministry of Energy in Sierra Leone
description: To improve generation and transmission of energy in Sierra Leone by providing technical assistance to the Ministry of Energy to improve institutional and regulatory frameworks that attract private sector investment. This will benefit the people of Sierra Leone by contributing to increased, affordable and reliable access to sustainable electricity supply for human development and wealth creation.

title: Humanitarian Response to Food Insecurity in Malawi 2013/14
description: To save lives and reduce suffering of vulnerable people affected by food security in Malawi by providing food and cash. This will benefit 480,000 people by protecting them against hunger, malnutrition and use of negative copying strategies. This contributes to  Millennium Development Goal 1 by increasing food security which will result in reduced poverty by 2014

title: Reducing Tuberculosis and HIV in Mining Communities of Southern Africa
description: To decrease Tuberculosis and associated risk factors by providing miners, ex-miners and their communities improved Tuberculosis diagnosis, treatment and follow-up. This will benefit a significant number of miners, their mining communities and labour sending communities and reduce the incidence and spread of this highly infectious disease. This contributes to our MDGs by halting and reversing the incidence of Tuberculosis in the mining sector and associated communities in Southern Africa by December 2016.

title: Response to the humanitarian situation in the Central African Republic 2013
description: DFID will provide 5 million for humanitarian response in the Central African Republic. This will support over 250,000 people in Central African Republic with emergency health, nutrition and livelihoods support.

title: Enhancing Growth in New Enterprises (ENGINE)
description: To support Small and Medium scale Enterprises (SME's) to overcome barriers to growth and build competitive businesses through the provision of business development services. It will benefit over 1,000 SME owners in Ghana. This will lead an incremental contribution of the sector to GDP growth by 2018 while creating wealth and jobs in the process.

title: Liberia Reconstruction Trust Fund-2
description: The Liberia Reconstruction Trust Fund is a multi-donor funding mechanism to address the critical need for rehabilitation of key economic infrastructure (roads and energy) to improve access to services and opportunities throughout Liberia.  The first project that will be supported is part of the Ganta to Harper road which forms a section of the regional corridor between Guinea and Cote d'Ivoire.  This contributes towards the Millennium Development Goals by improving transportation and trade resulting in an increase economic growth for both rural and urban communities.

title: Tax administration diagnostic tool development (TADAT)
description: Through the development of a tax administration diagnostic tool, partner country tax authorities will achieve stronger and more effective systems to reduce tax evasion, tax avoidance and tax base erosion, and encourage compliance, and therefore enhancing domestic tax resources

title: Delivering direct nutrition interventions in the Democratic Republic of Congo
description: Deliver vitamin A supplementation and deworming to about 1.6 million children  in 56 health zones and ensure quality care to 63,000 children affected with Severe Acute Malnutrition

title: Start Fund: providing direct, lifesaving assistance to up to 15 million disaster affected people through NGOs
description: The Start Fund will provide approximately 9.8 million people across the globe with life-saving humanitarian assistance. To achieve this, responses will use local information and local partners to tailor the response and maximise its effectiveness, with NGOs able to flexibly deploy the type of assistance that is most appropriate. The Start Funds structure and operation allows it to fulfil a critical role in responding to small to medium scale underfunded disasters. It can activate within 3 days, and focuses on supporting for a short window of time  just 45 days  addressing a key gap in the system. This three year programme will support the Start Fund to scale up, attract substantial funding from other donors and cement its place in the global humanitarian architecture. This forms a part of the UKs push to create a system where funding supports resilience and local systems, is predictable, dependable and based on humanitarian need  in line with our Humanitarian Reform Policy.

title: United Nations Humanitarian Air Service
description: To support United Nations Humanitarian Air Service provision of air passenger transport and cargo services to the humanitarian community. This will allow agencies to continue to access hard to reach communities and deliver against their MDG goals for the remainder of 2013.

title: Study on How Corruption Impacts on the Growth of the Private Sector and Options for Response
description: To minimise the impact of corruption on the growth and development of the private sector by providing technical assistance until December 2013. This will identify options for response and propose an analytical framework to assist policy makers/advisers in assessing and responding to corruption challenges when supporting private sector growth in Sierra Leone

title: Enabling the Business of Agriculture
description: To improve the enabling environment for private sector investment in agriculture by providing policy-makers with relevant indicators on the ease of doing business in agriculture. This will benefit smallholder farmers and agribusinesses in more than 40 countries in Asia and Africa by supporting policy and regulatory improvements and removing obstacles to investment in agriculture. This contributes towards our MDGs by increasing investment and raising incomes and creating new jobs in the agricultural sector and improving poor peoples access to food.

title: Building Brazils Development Impact in Low Income Countries
description: It aims to increase the impact of Brazils development cooperation in low income countries through financing triangular cooperation projects in social and governance sectors and uptake of evidence-based policy into national development practices in Africa. This will benefit some of the poorest African countries (up to 5 by 2016) by promoting successful Brazilian development policies and contributing to the achievement of several Global Goals within the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

title: Sierra Leone Constitutional Review 2013/15
description: To improve more consolidated democratic governance in Sierra Leone through a revised Constitution with strengthened social, economic, political and civil rights approved by majority of the population from all regions by end 2015.

title: Ghana Education Quality Improvement Project (EQUIP)
description: Provision of high-quality core textbooks for English, Maths, Science and accompanying teacher guides for over 5.6 million school children in Ghana.  This is to ensure that quality education is improved and sustained at both primary and junior high school.  This contributes to our MDGs by providing essential  teaching and learning materials which will result in improved attendance and learning achievements by 2015.

title: UK Support for the 2014 Burma Census
description: The government, international organisations, Burma civil society and private enterprises have access to, and are able to use, recent and reliable data and analysis on the population of Burma. This will change how development is targeted and how policy is designed, benefiting the poorest and most vulnerable people in Burma by 2015. Transparent data will help civil society to hold government to account. This contributes towards all our MDGs by resulting in a better understanding of the situation in Burma and by providing baseline data for impact evaluation and evidence.

title: Ending the Cycle of Undernutrition in Bangladesh - Suchana [nutsen]
description: Significant reduction in incidence of stunting amongst children under two years of age in Sylhet and Moulvibazar districts of Sylhet division in Bangladesh and catalyse support across government and other stakeholders for a coordinated, multi-sectoral approach to undernutrition at the national level.

title: UK Collaborative on Development Sciences (UKCDS) Phase 2
description: To improve the relevance and maximise the impact of UK research funding on the lives of the world's poorest people.  The UK Collaborative on Development Sciences (UKCDS) will provide a framework for a more co-ordinated approach to development sciences research by UK based funders and stakeholders in international development research.

title: Bihar Agriculture Growth and Reform Initiative (BAGRI)
description: To significantly improve the performance of the agriculture sector in Bihar by improving access to markets for identified agriculture and horticulture products, access to finance, knowledge and technology, and institutional capacity for market regulation. This will reflect higher private sector investment, higher production and higher price realisation by 1,00,000 farmers.

title: New Vaccines For Tuberculosis  Aeras 2013-18
description: To develop new affordable vaccines for TB at scale which have the potential to reduce many millions of new cases of TB over a period of twenty years contributing to MDG 6 which includes halting and reducing the spread of Tuberculosis.

title: International AIDS Vaccine Initiative 2013-18
description: To improve health and save lives through the potential availability of safe, effective, accessible, preventive AIDS vaccines for use throughout the world, especially in developing countries most affected by AIDS, as part of a comprehensive & sustainable response to ending the AIDS pandemic.

title: International Partnership for Microbicides 2013-18
description: To research and develop new safe, effective female-initiated HIV prevention products through public private partnership. Reducing the incidence of HIV and AIDS by empowering women to protect their own health, will also help to improve their educational/economic outcomes, and so reduce poverty and enhance economic growth overall. This research contributes to the health related and womens empowerment MDGs, and has the potential to reduce the number of HIV positive women  - currently 60% of HIV positive adults in Sub Saharan Africa are women.

title: PATH Product Development Partnership Programme 2013 - 2018
description: To reduce poverty through investment in research to develop effective and affordable, diagnostics, treatment, drugs and vaccines for diarrhoea and malaria. In the longer term this has the potential to significantly reduce death and illness among the poor and will contribute towards MDG 6 (combating disease); MDG 4 (reducing child mortality) and MDG 5 (improving maternal health).

title: Strengthening Prevention of Gender Based Violence in Rwanda
description: To strengthen violence prevention mechanisms for women, girls and boys in Rwanda by scaling up promising practices in violence prevention. This will contribute to tackling the social norms which lie behind violence against women and children. This contributes towards our MDGs by promoting gender equality and the empowerment of women, contributing to a reduction  in violence against women, girls and boys.

title: Core Assessed Contribution to the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) for 2016-2017
description: To support the work of FAO to improve global food security and sustainable agricultural development, contributing particularly to SDGs 1 and 2 on ending poverty and eliminating hunger. FAO provides technical assistance to develop and implement policies on food, nutrition, and agriculture that benefit food-insecure and vulnerable people, especially in rural areas. FAO also promotes economic development, job creation, gender equity, and helps to build resilience to the effects of climate change.

title: Food and Agriculture Organisation Core Assessed Contribution 2018 - 2019
description: A renewed FAO delivering high quality services effectively and efficiently to developing countries in support of their plans to achieve food security and sustainable agricultural development

title: UK core contribution to International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) Tenth Replenishment (2016 - 2018)
description: To support IFADs work in enabling poor rural people in developing countries to improve their food security and nutrition, and increase their incomes. This will contribute particularly to SDGs 1 and 2 on ending poverty and eliminating hunger. IFAD also focuses on empowering women, and supporting the most vulnerable smallholder farmers to adapt to the effects of climate change. IFAD aims to reach 90 million of the worlds poorest people by 2018.

title: UK core contribution to the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD): Eleventh Replenishment (2019  21)
description: To support IFAD in delivering results and impact in rural areas of developing countries where over 75% of the worlds poorest people live. Through its Programme of Loans and Grants, IFAD aims to reach between 110  130 million of the poorest, most vulnerable people, supporting them to improve food and nutrition security;  increase income and production; access financial services, create jobs; and strengthen their resilience, including to the effects of climate change. IFAD aims to: support 44 million people in achieving economic mobility; improve the market access of 46 million people; and improve the production of 47 million people.  It will provide 16.5 million people in rural areas with financial services; support up to 120,000 rural enterprises to access business development services; and train over 2.4 million people in income-generating activities or business management. This will contribute to achieving the Global Goals, particularly the first two on ending poverty and hunger.

title: DFID-World Bank Strategic Partnership on Economic Growth Research
description: The purpose is to improve policy making on economic growth-related issues by the World Bank, through: stronger links between policy and research teams within the Bank; opening the Banks Research Department to external competition to improve quality and relevance of its research; and improving the availability to Bank policy staff of balanced, synthesised evidence on economic growth.   This should contribute to an improved performance of the Bank within the multilateral aid system.

title: Development Economics Research  Phase 3 of Funding for United Nations Universitys World Institute for Development Economics Research (UNU-WIDER)
description: To increase the use of high-quality research by policy-makers and practitioners on economic and social policy issues affecting developing countries. By 2018 there will be at least seven cases of changes in policy and practice in developing countries, informed by the projects research outputs, every year.

title: Capacity for Economic Research and Policy making in Africa (CERPA)
description: To increase the  number and quality of MSc and Phd Economics graduates in developing countries involved in research and policy activities,  and to improve ability of developing country researchers to undertake high quality economic research. This will enable developing countries to manage their economies better, which should help them to  achieve higher economic growth.

title: (INASP) Building Capacity to use Research Evidence in Ghana, Zimbabwe and South Africa
description: To improve the ability of government and parliaments in Ghana, Zimbabwe and South Africa to use research findings when designing policies and programmes, through providing specialist training and other support.  This will benefit government and parliamentary officials through building their skills to use research findings more effectively.  This contributes to our MDGs by helping developing countries to design more effective national policies that will better contribute to poverty reduction.

title: University Of Johannesburg Building Capacity to use Research Evidence in South Africa and Malawi
description: To improve the ability of governments in South Africa and Malawi to use research findings when designing policies and programmes, through providing specialist training and other support.  This will benefit government officials through building their skills to use research findings more effectively.  This contributes to our MDGs by helping developing countries to design more effective national policies that will better contribute to national development goals and poverty reduction

title: Promoting Inclusive Markets (PIMS) in Somalia aimed at improving productivity, competitiveness, and long term jobs in six value chains.
description: Project Purpose is to expand private sector investment by creating more income for firms in livestock, fisheries, poultry, food crop, construction and light manufacturing to create 9000 long term jobs (including 4400 long term jobs for women) and 500,000 employment days for the poor, women, and youth in the three regions of South Central, Somaliland and Puntland.

title: Montserrat Budget Aid 2015/16
description: Provide efficient and effective public services and maintain coverage of reasonable assistance needs with minimum budget contribution from HMG

title: Economic Growth and Building Evidence
description: To provide technical assistance to the Government of India to increase the uptake of evidence and evaluation in policy making. We hope that by putting in place the right incentives around use of evidence and evaluation, that policy makers will be better able to design policies that have a bigger impact on poverty.

title: Think Tank Initiative Phase II
description: The purpose of the project is to strengthen the capacity of independent policy research organisations in the developing world. The Think Tank Initiative provides funding that enables institutions to attract, retain and build local talent, develop independent research programmes, and invest in public outreach to ensure that research results inform and influence national and regional policy debates. To strengthen organisational capacity, research quality and policy engagement of 43 independent policy research organisations. This will inform and influence national, regional and selected global policy debates

title: National Family Health Survey 4 (NFHS 4)
description: To improve planning, delivery and monitoring of policies and programmes for Health , nutrition and sanitation, which will help Government, donors, UN and civil society have access to, and to use, recent and reliable data on these issues

title: Economic Policy and Prosperity Partnership (EPPP)
description: To assist India in creating an enabling environment for investments and business development through UK technical expertise and experience that will help to increase Indias GDP and enable the Indian economy keep up its levels of public expenditure on development outcomes. UKs technical assistance will support implementation of  key economic reforms with capacity building, institutional strengthening, knowledge transfer, evidence building and collaborative working.

title: Support to the Open Government Partnership
description: The UK is a founding member of the Open Government Partnership (OGP) and served as co-chair until September 2013. This is now a movement that includes 61 governments, each of whom have met eligibility criteria and made significant commitments to open government. The OGP has the potential to advance recent progress in transparency and open government through peer learning, research and evidence gathering. To support the work of this growing movement the secretariat is in particular need of core support to ensure impact, sustainability and value for money from this initiative.

title: Economic Development Policy Grant (EDPG) 2014-2018
description: To strengthen effective delivery by the Government of Mozambique of its role in facilitating broad based economic development and inclusive growth.

title: Support to the Transparency & Accountability Initiative
description: DFID was a founding member of the Transparency and Accountability Initiative (TAI).  The organisation has the potential to embed recent progress in transparency and open government around the world, through research and policy work, networking of organisations, and promoting a global movement in these areas.

title: Newborn, Women and Children - Saving Lives through access to essential health commodities
description: To contribute to the Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health Trust Fund to support high-burden countries to scale up availability and access for the essential health commodities to save the lives of women in pregnancy and childbirth as well as children under five.

title: Myanmar UK Partnership for Education
description: MUPE is to improve the reach and quality of education services in Burma and help prepare Burmas youth with the skills they need for life after school. MUPE has gone through 3 significant changes: 1) ODA reductions in 2019/20 2) Covid19 pandemic in 2020 and 3) military coup in Myanmar in 2021. Due to those significant changes, the programme was reshaped with only two components remaining (with one not having financial contribution) at the closure. The funded component which lasted till the closure of MUPE was MEC (Myanmar Education Consortium), which was maintained due to its relevance to the changed context and the ability to respond to challenging context.

title: Excluded People's Rights in Bangladesh
description: To promote rights and equality for 1.64 million people in Bangladesh who are at the highest risk of being excluded, including poor women and girls, people with disabilities, ethnic and religious minorities, Dalits (untouchables), children working in vulnerable situations (including modern slavery) and youth. The programme will increasingly focus on social cohesion. The partner supports a network of organisations to defend and enhance poor, minorities and other marginalised peoples rights and enabling them to access to assets, public services (e.g. health, education) and economic opportunities. The programme also works with local level service providers to help them meet their responsibilities and assist communities to monitor their performance. Where opportunities arise, the programme will contribute to the development of policies and laws that uphold the rights of the poor and excluded groups in society. FCDO's flagship rights programme.

title: Burma Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Programme
description: To save lives, reduce poverty and suffering of 400,000 crisis affected people in Burma and Burmese refugees in Thailand through providing humanitarian assistance, enhancing resilience and building local and international organisations capacity to respond to future humanitarian need in Burma

title: Kenya Bridge Devolution Programme 2013-2014
description: To build capabilities of county governments to enable them better understand and discharge their constitutional mandates and deliver results that match citizens needs through involving communities in planning and legislation. This will benefit 20 recipient counties  (43% of all counties in Kenya) and contribute towards our MDGs by improving good governanace and development which will result in improved county management by March 2014

title: Sustainable Energy for Women and Girls (SEWG)
description: Programme aims to shift clean energy markets and delivery systems towards improving the health, safety and economic opportunities of low income girls and women in developing countries, principally in DFID and International Climate Fund (ICF) priority countries in Africa.

title: Support to Public Financial Management (PFM) Reforms in South Africa (SPRSA)
description: To improve public financial management across all provincial, local and national level of government to improve service delivery and resource management

title: Health and Climate Change
description: Building resilience and preparedness of public health care systems in Southern Africa to climate change by investing in critical vulnerability assessment, research and evidence on the links between climate change and health, the preparedness and options for response by health care systems.

title: Strengthening International Waters Cooperation, Management and Development in sub-Saharan Africa
description: To strengthen regional water security in Africa for sustainable and climate resilient development

title: Strengthening Trade for Inclusive Development in Southern Africa
description: The objective of the design phase is to support the design of a new regional trade and integration programme in Southern Africa.  Taking a political economy approach, it will focus principally on the implementation of trade reforms in DFID priority countries in Southern Africa, with an explicit focus on the poor, thereby helping to create the conditions for increased trade, competitiveness, growth and poverty reduction.  The programmes value will be determined during the scoping for  design phase.

title: Preventing Child Labour in Bangladesh
description: This programme will target hazardous child labour in Bangladesh, with a focus on tea estates, domestic work and hazardous industrial work. It will build the evidence base and pilot innovative approaches that can be scaled up.

title: Strengthening Transnational Responses to Countering Illicit Financial Flows, Corruption and Organised Crime in Africa (CIFFS)
description: The UK will provide 15 million between 2016 and 2021 to strengthen transnational responses to illicit financial flows, corruption and crime through a Regional Network for Strengthening Transnational Responses to Countering Illicit Financial Flows, Corruption and Organised Crime in Africa (Countering Illicit Flows - Facility for Africa  CIFFs Facility) The programme will deliver the UKs Aid Strategy with its core objective of strengthening global peace, security and governance and pledge to invest more to tackle the causes of instability, insecurity and conflict, and to tackle crime and corruption. It will also contribute to the UKs commitments under SDG 16.4, which commits the UK by 2030 to significantly reduce illicit financial and arms flows, strengthen the recovery and return of stolen assets and combat all forms of organized crime.

title: Preventing Maternal Deaths in Eastern and Southern Africa programme (PreMDESA)
description: To increase the availability of robust evidence and proven innovations relating to sexual and reproductive health (SRH) and the improved awareness of, access to and uptake of family planning and SRH services across the East and Southern Africa (ESA) region, with a focus on women and adolescent girls. The programme will reduce unmet need for family planning by filling critical sexual & reproductive Health commodity gaps in 10 countries in the region within the next 3 years.

title: Support to Southern African Financial Markets
description: Strengthening Regional Financial Integration to Support Financial Sector Development and Facilitate Cheaper, Faster and Safer Cross Border Remittances in Southern Africa

title: Caribbean Anti-Corruption Programme
description: To strengthen the anti-corruption framework of Jamaica and the Organisation of Eastern Caribbean States (OECS), by building the capacity of select institutions to improve accountability and transparency. The project will deliver targeted interventions over a five year period 2015-2020. The interventions will: (1) strengthen the capacity of the Major and Organised Crime Anti-Corruption Agency (MOCA), to combat corruption and organised crime; (2) provide support to the Financial Investigations Division(FID) to recover assets acquired by corruption or organised crime; (3) provide support to the Independent Commission of Investigations (INDECOM) to hold public officials accountable for their abuse of power; (4) provide support to the Government of Jamaica (GoJ) for the establishment of an Integrity Commission, to fight corruption and strengthen accountability and (5) provide support to the Caribbeans Regional Security System (RSS)  to recover assets acquired illegally.

title: Growth, Resources, Opportunities and Wealth Creation in Bihar (GROW Bihar)
description: To assist Government of Bihar in attracting private sector Investments, effectively steering revenue collection and utilisation, and strengthening growth transmission: all benefiting women, Scheduled Castes and Minorities.

title: Montserrat Financial Aid 2016/17 - 2018/19
description: To support the provision of public services to meet the reasonable assistance needs of the people of Montserrat, including health, education and securing air and sea access, given that Montserrat is not yet self-sufficient. This is in line with the 2012 Overseas Territories White Paper and consistent with relevant elements of UKs Aid Strategy and DFIDs 2015-2020 Single Departmental Plan.

title: Support to the Global Partnership for Education 2015-18
description: To increase numbers of boys and girls gaining a good quality basic education, leading to improvements in learning for all in GPE partner countries.   From 2015 to 2018, with a budget of $2.2 billion, GPE expects to support 5.5 million children (2.4 million girls) in both primary and lower secondary school annually across 47 lower-income countries in Africa and Asia, of which 4.4 million will be in fragile and conflict-affected states (FCAS). GPE estimates that this will contribute to increasing primary and lower secondary completion rates, decreasing the number of out of school girls and boys, and increasing the percentage of trained teachers in GPE-partner countries. The results attributable to the UK from our 15% share of contributions (based on a $2.2bn GPE budget) are expected to include: support to 825,000 childen in basic education annually over 4 years; and increased completion and learning rates for GPE-partner countries.

title: UK investment in Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance (2016-2020)
description: Gavi supports vaccine delivery in 68 of the world's poorest countries reaching 60% of the world's birth cohort. Gavi immunises children against vaccine preventable diseases including measles, rubella, meningitis, cervical cancer, pneumonia and diarrhoea. Gavi has played a significant role in the recent halving of global child mortality. Over the 2016 to 2020, Gavi will fully deliver the UK target to immunise 76 million children and save 1.4 million lives. Gavi targets reaching those in hard to reach areas, the poorest, and the most marginalised. Gavi has a major global market shaping role for vaccines, negotiating lower prices for low-income countries, and incentivising new vaccines such as for Ebola and Malaria.

title: Skills for Employment
description: To increase incomes among marginalised youth,  women and adolescent girls, through relevant, quality,  non-state vocational training that leads to formal or self-employment. This contributes to MDG one (1) on achieving productive employment including for women and young people.

title: Support to Ethiopian Public Sector Reform
description: To improve the capacity of the Government of Ethiopias Public Sector Management and Civil Service performance through financial and technical assistance. This will contribute towards our MDGs by ensuring efficient and effective use of resources and improving service delivery.

title: Global Green Growth Institute (GGGI)
description: This programme will provide practical support to implement high quality green growth policies in developing countries. It will also improve knowledge and evidence on green growth policies and their implementation across developing countries.

title: Pilot support to the Grow Africa partnership to enhance responsible investment and inclusive agriculture growth in Africa
description: To increase responsible investment in African agriculture through a regional agri-business engagement platform, making agriculture an engine of African growth. To increase such through transferring an international partnership platform with high mobilisation & convening power to an African home, in support of African agriculture policies, setting-up specific inclusive value-chain partnerships at country level, & promoting internationally recognised standards to ensure investments are responsible, maximising development benefits for the smallholder farmers & overall inclusive agriculture growth.  Will provide an invaluable pilot for DFIDs engagement with agribusiness whilst placing a greater emphasis on increasing the potential of farmers to become more commercially profitable, support Africans heads of state vision to make of agriculture the engine for growth & ending hunger & halving poverty by 2025 & contribute to a G8 commitment of lifting 50 million people out of poverty by 2022.

title: Infrastructure and Cities for Economic Development (ICED)
description: To improve the enabling environment for sustainable, inclusive growth-enhancing infrastructure service delivery in DFID focus countries; and, Harness the benefits of cities for sustainable economic growth and poverty reduction in DFID focus countries.

title: Land Governance for Economic Development
description: DFID will pursue actions globally to improve land rights protection to: help ensure women and men enjoy legally recognised, secure property and tenure rights.  To Improve information and knowledgeto facilitate the provision of clear, transparent land related information and knowledge, enabling rights to be identified, understood and protected. To improve private sector investment through the development and rollout of a standardized investment risk assessment methodology and implementation of best practice in land governance.

title: Better Delivery on Jobs
description: To increase the impact on job creation and incomes in developing countries of the policies and programmes of DFID, the World Bank, other donors, development finance institutions and NGOs. Working primarily through a World Bank Trust Fund on Jobs this programme will strengthen the international communitys work by engaging with governments and the private sector, on issues including youth employment, fragile states and improving data on jobs.

title: Supporting Economic Transformation
description: To strengthen the economic development policies of partner governments and improve donor policies and programmes in support of these. The programme focuses on economic transformation, meaning how economies diversify and resources (such as labour) move from lower to higher productivity activities. The programme will work with country governments, with DFID departments and with other donors and development partners to increase the impact of policies and investments to promote economic transformation.

title: BEED - Business Environment for Economic Development
description: To improve how we and other donors do business environment reform. This will contribute towards the Millenium Development Goals by enabling economic growth and opening up economic opportunities, especially for women.

title: Enhancing Diagnostics
description: The programme is to help countries improve their capacity to diagnose growth constraints. A part of this is to better integrate into country diagnostic analysis key cross-cutting issues that underpin inclusive and resilient growth including political economy, fragility, sustainability, economic inclusion, gender and in particular female economic empowerment, jobs, and wider economic transformation. Better quality diagnostic analysis will provide a stronger evidence base on the constraints to inclusive growth, which is essential for economic development policy decisions, both for DFID portfolio choices and for wider policy dialogue.

title: Hunger Safety Net Programme
description: To reduce poverty, hunger and vulnerability by providing the poorest households in Kenya's arid and semi-arid lands with cash transfers. This contributes to our MDGs by preventing 720,000 people from becoming poorer and help them to increase their expenditure on food, health, education and wider livelihood opportunities by 2017.

title: Pitcairn Budget Aid 2015/16
description: Pitcairns public services are managed and delivered efficiently.

title: Additional contributions to UN consolidated and flash appeals
description: Provide emergency humanitarian assistance to the 250,000+ people displaced as part of the Zamboanga emergency and Bohol earthquake as well as the estimated 945,000 people who remain internally displaced by natural disaster and conflict in parts of Mindanao

title: Supporting the International Humanitarian Response in South Sudan (September 2013 to June 2014)
description: Reduction in severe food insecurity and effective response to deterioration in humanitarian situation particularly for vulnerable populations. Both chronic and sudden onset humanitarian needs are prepared for and responded to in a coordinated, effective and efficient manner, while improving the resilience of communities to deal with future crises.Reduction in severe food insecurity and effective response to deterioration in humanitarian situation particularly for vulnerable populations. Both chronic and sudden onset humanitarian needs are prepared for and responded to in a coordinated, effective and efficient manner, while improving the resilience of communities to deal with future crises.Reduction in severe food insecurity and effective response to deterioration in humanitarian situation particularly for vulnerable populations. Both chronic and sudden onset humanitarian needs are prepared for and responded to in a coordinated, effective and efficient manner, while improving the resilience of communities to deal with future crises.

title: Civil Society Support Mechanism Programme
description: To support to the new Civil Society Support mechanism Foundation to build the capacity of civil society organisations (CSOs) in order to hold the Mozambique government to account and promote responsiveness to the needs of citizens.  The Foundation will provide grants and capacity building to Mozambique CSOs, supporting them to take a more strategic, politically savvy approach in their advocacy.  It will include a specific focus in supporting the participation of marginalised groups, including women.

title: Family Planning Outreach Programe in Tanzania Phase II
description: To support poor rural women by providing them with reliable access to a range of effective family planning services through mobile clinical outreach and by delivering more than 4.4million Couple-Years of Protection (CYPs) to over 1.1million rural women and adolescence girls. The project will also provide 30,000 women and girls with access to safe post-abortion care (medical and surgical) resulting in fewer deaths and serious complications) and at least 800 health workers will be trained to offer a wider range of contraceptive services. This will result in more than 916,000 fewer pregnancies and 2,300 fewer maternal deaths by 2018. The project will also provide around 28,000 women who have suffered sexual violence with support to aid them in recovering as well as helping them to  advance their court cases, making the environment more supportive for women.

title: Conflict Security Stability Fund (CSSF) Security, Justice and Defence Programme in Libya
description: To improve security and justice services by providing the Government of Libya with technical assistance. This will benefit the Libyan authorities to provide security, justice and defence for citizens.

title: Jordan Emergency Services and Social Resilience Programme (JESSRP), Conflict, Security and Stability Fund (CSSF)
description: To support a World Bank Trust Fund that will release additional grants to six Jordanian Municipalities and communities that are hosting the largest concentration of Syrian refugees. These funds will help deliver additional public services for the benefit of 750,000 Jordanians and 280,000 Syrians.

title: Africa Division funding to the African Agriculture Development Company (AgDevCo)
description: AgDevCo is a specialised investor and project developer focused exclusively on early stage Small and Medium Enterprise agribusiness in Sub Saharan Africa. AgDevCo deploys patient capital and technical assistance to build profitable businesses that contribute to food security, drive economic growth and create jobs and income in rural areas and contribute to farmers resilience to climate change. AgDevCo currently operates in Sierra Leone, Ghana, Cote D'Ivoire, Rwanda, Kenya, Malawi, Mozambique, Tanzania, Uganda, Zambia.

title: The African Guarantee Fund
description: To increase loan financing for Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in up to 40 African countries, by providing partial guarantees to African banks to enable them to scale up their lending to SMEs.  The project will contribute towards the poverty reduction MDG by promoting the mobilisation of $5.7 billion in new SME financing by 2018, enabling the provision of credit support to 18,800 additional SMEs and the creation of 453,000 new jobs within those SMEs.

title: PROVIA - Programme of Research on Climate Change Vulnerability, Impacts and Adaptation
description: The Programme of Research on Climate Change Vulnerability, Impacts and Adaptation (PROVIA) is a formal United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) programme whose function is to help coordinate global research on climate change impacts and adaptation.  This funding will support the PROVIA work programme to deliver better global coordination of the area of research, with a better resourced and capable co-ordinating entity capable of engaging better with the wide range of stakeholders, including users which contributes to the MDG of developing a global partnership for development

title: CHASE Urban programme
description: A diverse range of actors have knowledge, skills and understanding to respond effectively to urban humanitarian crisis, in an enabling policy environment which recognises the specificity of urban crises.

title: Re-establishing basic policing in Somalia
description: To re-establish basic policing in three urban areas in south-central Somalia (Baidoa, Beledweyne and Kismayo) by assisting Somali authorities in recruiting  up to 1,860 additional police officers. This will provide improved security for Somali citizens, particularly women and girls with the additional 1,860 police personnel carrying out basic police functions in three urban areas in south-central Somalia and enable the re-establishment of essential services such as health and education. The programme will also help create the conditions for an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) exit and handover of basic security responsibilities to Somali security institutions. The programme will independently monitor the quality of policing on the ground and carry out regular local perception surveys to assess whether security in the three towns is improving.

title: Ilm Ideas Education Innovation Programme - Phase II (Ilm-2)
description: To improve learning outcomes for children in primary and secondary education by supporting innovative solutions in education. The programme will also build capacity of existing organisations in Pakistan to support evidence-based innovations in education. By 2019, 250,000 children between 5-16 years (50% girls) will benefit from the programme.

title: Supporting the Delivery of Sierra Leones Education Sector Plan: The MEST (Ministry of Education, Science and Technology) Change Unit
description: To support delivery and monitor the Sierra Leone Education Sector Plan (ESP) through a hybrid multi-donor trust fund managed by the World Bank with 4.4 million from 2013/14 to 2015/16.  learning outcomes for approximately 130,000 children in primary and junior secondary school.  This contributes towards our MDGs by increasing access to quality basic education and will result in increased and more equitable access to more effective schooling by 2016.

title: Supporting the National Action Plan for Ready-made Garment Sector in Bangladesh
description: To improve working conditions in the garment sector in Bangladesh by providing support to structural and fire assessments on around 1500 factories, strengthening the labour and factory inspection regime, providing occupational health and safety training to garment sector employees and increasing national health and safety awareness through media campaigns,  improving dialogue between workers and management at individual factory and national level and supporting the rehabilitation of the survivors of recent industrial accidents.

title: Education Programme For Results (EP4R)
description: To improve learning outcomes of students at the primary and lower secondary levels, to be demonstrated through improvements in end of Primary and secondary school  pass rates and improved learning of primary 2nd  grade (age 8/9) students in Reading, Writing and Arithmetic.

title: Productive Safety Net Programme Phase 4
description: To reduce hunger, improve livelihoods and reduce the risk of famine in rural Ethiopia by (i) providing cash and food transfers, livelihoods advice and access to microfinance to 1.2 million extremely poor Ethiopians and (ii) creating local infrastructure which reverses environmental degradation and improves access to markets and basic services.  85% of participant households receive transfers as wages for labour on public works projects (including 32,000 km of hillside terraces, 3,000 km of rural roads and 400 new or expanded schools); while the remainder (the elderly, those with disabilities, and pregnant women) receive cash and /  or food without a labour requirement.  This programme contributes towards national and international development goals and DFIDs own targets for reducing poverty and hunger and for building household resilience to climate change and other shocks.

title: J-PAL Education Initiative
description: The JPAL Education Initiative delivers the highest standards of quantitative research applied to critical policy questions on education. Researchers partner with education practitioners and governments to test, adapt and scale a wide range of promising interventions. The research focusses on 3 core themes: girls' education; foundational learning, and; climate change and education. Cost data is collected throughout, supporting evidence-based investment and dis-investment decisions by donors and country governments.

title: International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI)
description: To contribute to financing of the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) under the new IATI membership based financial model.  Funding will contribute to maintaining momentum of IATI and its work to expand the number of IATI publishers; further development of the IATI standard to strengthen its impact on the effectiveness of development assistance and accountability of providers; greater use of data by governments, citizens and other accountability bodies in partner countries; and, ensuring IATI continues to provide means by which DFID and its partners can create traceability of development assistance through delivery chains.

title: Risk Management Office
description: To enable DFID and its German implementing partner giz Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH programmes to work safely and effectively during Nepal's post-conflict transition by providing professional risk management support. Over a three year period until September 2016 Risk Management Office support will benefit 20 DFID funded programmes

title: Justice Assistance Network Review
description: To conduct an independent review of the UK Governments Justice Assistance Network to assess whether it remains fit for purpose in enabling effective coordination of the UK Governments approaches to justice assistance interventions overseas.  This will contribute to the UKs efforts to ensure that its support is strategic and effective in its provision of improved security and justice for poor people in developing countries.

title: Global Partnership for Effective Dev
description: To improve development effectiveness by providing the Global Partnership for Effective Development Co-operation (GPEDC) with support. This support will include carrying out objective research and peer-reviews, commissioning case studies, supporting events - including the first High Level Meeting of the GPEDC - and ensuring that there is transparent, active engagement with citizens on the ground. This will benefit all development partners through listening and acting on the voice of low-income countries and non-governmental stakeholders, including from fragile states, so as to stimulate the right changes on the ground to make development cooperation achieve more results per pound, dollar or yuan spent on poverty reduction. This contributes towards the existing Millennium Development Goals (MDG)  and especially MDG8  by making all forms of development cooperation including aid, trade, business and knowledge sharing, deliver more poverty reduction now and beyond 2015.

title: Understanding Activity Based Learning (ABL) in Tamil Nadu: Innovation in Pedagogy, Political Economy of Scale-up and the Impact on Learning Outcomes
description: What can we learn from the experience of the ABL revolution in Tamil Nadu on what has changed in the classroom, the political economy of enablers and barriers for scale-up and a broader dissemination, and ABLs impact on student learning outcomes?

title: Providing support to the reform of Libyan policing provision
description: To support the Libyan government in reforming the Libya policing provision by providing training and technical expertise. This project will directly benefit Libyan Government institutions, primarily the Ministry of Interior and the Libyan Police over three and a half years. The project will result in tangible improvements in security provision for Libyan citizens.

title: Providing support to the reform of Libyan detention provision.
description: To support the Libyan government in reforming the Libyan justice and detention provision by providing training and technical expertise. This project will directly benefit Libyan Government institutions, primarily the Ministry of Justice and the Judicial Police over three and a half years. The project will result in tangible improvements in security and justice provision for Libyan citizens.

title: Delivering training to support the development of internal capacity to provide Libyan border security.
description: To improve the delivery of border security and control in Libya by providing training and technical expertise. This project will directly benefit Libyan Government institutions, primarily the Ministry of Interior, Justice and Defence over three and a half years. The project will result in tangible improvements in security provision for Libyan citizens and will enhance the legitimacy of the Libyan Government, thus promoting the political stability.

title: Providing assistance to the Libyan government in developing a national-level dialogue on the development of an effective security strategy.
description: To assist the Libyan government in developing a national-level dialogue on an effective security strategy. This project will directly benefit Libyan Government institutions, primarily the Ministries of Interior, Justice and Defence over three and a half years. The project will result in tangible improvements in security provision for Libyan citizens and will enhance the legitimacy of the Libyan Government, thus promoting the political stability.

title: Providing a secure and flexible platform from which Phase 1 of the Libyan Security, Justice and Defence Programme can be delivered.
description: To support the delivery of the security, justice and defence programme in Libya by providing the relevant life support and platform for the staff delivering the projects. This support will contribute to the overall programme which in turn will directly benefit Libyan Government institutions and citizens.

title: Provision of expert assistance to deliver Phase 1 of the Libya Security, Justice and Defence Programme
description: To support the delivery of the security, justice and defence programme in Libya by providing expert assistance in delivering the projects. This provision will deliver the various elements of the programme, which in turn will directly benefit Libyan Government institutions and citizens. This will enhance the legitimacy of the Libyan Government, thus promoting the political stability.

title: Providing support to the development of Libyan government counter-proliferation activity
description: To support the Libyan government in the development of counter-proliferation capability by providing training and technical expertise. This project will directly benefit Libyan Government institutions, primarily the Ministry of Defence and the Libyan Armed Forces over three and a half years. The project will result in tangible improvements in security and defence provision for Libyan citizens.

title: FIRST (phase III) - Financial Sector Reform and Strengthening Initiative
description: To help strengthen financial sectors in low income countries by making them more stable, efficient and inclusive, so that they better support economic growth and poverty reduction.  Expected outcomes include improved regulation and supervision, an increase in bank accounts held by adults, greater access to financial services by Small and Medium Enterprises and increased provision of long term financing through bonds and equity.

title: Support to the Economic Recovery of Somalia (SERS)
