Many of the projects aim to help Turkey cope with over 4 million refugees from Syria. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Commonwealth Prosperity
description: The programme aims was set up to support the commitment of Commonwealth Heads of Government at their meeting in 2018 (CHOGM 2018) to realise a more prosperous future through (1) continuing to build support for the rules-based multilateral trading system; boost intra-Commonwealth trade; and support inclusive policy making; (2) improving the business environments in Commonwealth countries to enable them to be more globally competitive; and (3) facilitating the economic empowerment of women and young people by providing more business and educational opportunities.

title: Commonwealth Security
description: The Security Programme aims to support the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting, 2018 (CHOGM) commitment of delivering A More Secure Future by: A more secure cyber environment that enables digital growth through a free, open and peaceful cyber space. Progress towards a Commonwealth without modern slavery, forced labour human trafficking and the worst forms of child labour and enhanced capacity within the Commonwealth to tackle online child sexual exploitation.

title: Commonwealth Fairness
description: The Fairness Programme aims to support the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting, 2018 (CHOGM) commitment of delivering A Fairer Future by:  Universal access to justice, as well as effective, accountable and inclusive legal institutions; democratic, participatory and inclusive decision-making; transparent government and trade; fundamental freedoms; and non-discriminatory laws and greater civil engagement among youth/disadvantaged groups.

title: Commonwealth Sustainability
description: The Sustainability Programme aims to support the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting 2018 (CHOGM) commitment of delivering A More Sustainable Future by: increased resilience and responsiveness to climate change; conservation and sustainable use of Commonwealth oceans; supporting the integration and inclusion of vulnerable populations.

title: Counter Terrorism Programmes Fund
description: This programme focuses on building the capacity of international partners to conduct effective and human rights compliant criminal investigations, and the disruption, prosecution and detention of terrorists and violent extremists.  This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme.  The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Collaboration against trafficking and smuggling in Nigeria & Niger (CATS NN)(Formerly Upstream Programme)
description: The programme aims to support governments in Eritrea, Nigeria and Niger to be more effective at ensuring safe, managed and regular migration, including countering human trafficking and people smuggling in countries of origin and transit.

title: Multilateral UN Reform
description: The UN Reform programme aims support the UN Secretary-General Guterres three-pillar reform agenda, which came into effect on 1st January 2019, and his Sustaining Peace vision. The UN Reform programme provides technical support and funding to each of the three reform pillars of peace and security architecture, development and management. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Afghanistan Demining programme
description: This programme will fund mine clearance and community development activities in six Afghan provinces: Kabul, Balkh, Baghlan, Khost, Samangan and Logar. This will improve the security of vulnerable communities and reduce the risk of death or injury from mines and other Explosive Remnants of War (ERW).

title: Afghanistan Migration programme
description: This programme aims to help to inform government policies and enable government ownership of activities designed to reduce migrant flow.

title: Afghanistan Security Sector and Peace-building Support
description: This programme aims to strengthen the Afghan National Police (ANP) and Ministry of Interior Affairs (MoIA). The first component involves contributions to the Law and Order Trust Fund Afghanistan (LOTFA). The second component involves technical assistance to the MoIA.

title: Afghan National Army Trust Fund
description: This programme aims to provide training to the Afghan National Police (ANP) on Counter Improvised Explosive Devices (C-IED) as well as improving female ANP facilities. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Afghanistan Support to the Peace Process
description: This programme aims to support the Afghan governments peace objectives. Programme activities under the first component will support peace initiatives through a contribution over the next two years to the Afghan High Peace Council (HPC) through the UNDP administered Support to Peace and Social Cohesion in Afghanistan (SPSCA) programme. The second component will focus on peace-building activities at community level, including building the capacity of women, tribal elders, religious leaders and youth groups in 13 provinces.

title: Great Lakes Programme
description: This programme has multiple strands:  Strand 1: A project to deliver sustained and effective dialogue between security forces and local communities. Strand 2: A series of projects to support regional peacebuilding efforts by securing institutional change on human rights in Burundi. Strand 3: Monitoring and responding to conflict risks and supporting the conditions needed to allow for peaceful and fair elections in Burundi by 2020. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Nigeria Security & Justice Reform Programme
description: This programme will deliver defence, security and justice priorities in Nigeria through three interconnected components: (1) Strengthening security and justice accountability through the media. (2) Democratic Oversight and Accountability of the Nigerian Security Sector.  (3) Strategic assistance to the Nigerian Police Force (NPF).

title: North East Nigeria Security and Conflict and Stabilisation Programme
description: This programme aims to respond to interrelated issues in the northeast of Nigeria. By supporting the Nigerian Police Force and other security and justice actors in their efforts to protect civilians and uphold the rule of law in areas recently recovered from insurgent groups and to allow displaced people and former insurgent group fighters to return to their communities. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Strengthening Security and Resilience in Sierra Leone and Neighbouring Countries
description: This programme aims to work in partnership with the government of Sierra Leone to help make the security sector stronger and more resilient. This will be achieved by working to improve police accountability and governance. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Somaliland (Somalia) Programme
description: This programme aims to provide Security and Justice Sector Reform by increasing civilian oversight and professionalisation of the Somaliland Army and Coastguard. Increasing the effectiveness and accountability of the Judiciary and Prosecutors through development of the Somaliland High Judicial Council, and improving court security and administration Increasing the capacity of the Somaliland Police to provide security in an effective and human rights compliant manner and improving human resource and financial management. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Africa Peace and Security
description: This programme aims to provide support to the African Union Commission (AUC) in its oversight and delivery of Peace and Security Operations. This will be achieved through the provision of technical assistance in the form of advisors on protection of civilians, gender and international humanitarian law.  This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: East Africa Preventing Violent Extremism
description: This programme aims to strengthen the evidence base on preventing violent extremism and reduce the drivers and enablers of violent extremism in East Africa by supporting local government in Kenya to implement preventing violent extremism county action plans. Through civil society organisations supporting the most vulnerable groups to reintegrate into local communities by working with local government, young men, women and children and religious leaders. Facilitating the sharing of best practice between non-governmental organisations (NGOs) and civil society organisations (CSOs) working to prevent violent extremism, research to identify the main drivers of violent extremism in East Africa and evaluate the effectiveness of efforts to prevent it. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: East Africa Crime and Justice Programme
description: This programme aims to support Kenya and Tanzania to strengthen their law enforcement and criminal justice capability, enabling them to tackle more effectively serious organised crime, from investigation to prosecution by building regional capability and supporting the development of key institutions and systems.

title: East Africa Migration Programme
description: This programme will support countries in East Africa to tackle organised immigration crime by building the capacity of regional governments to identify, investigate and prosecute traffickers. Building the resilience of communities along migratory routes, disrupting organised immigration criminal activity in those communities and supporting East Africas response to organised immigration crime by providing policy and technical advice.

title: Nigeria Delta & Maritime Security and Stability Programme
description: This programme aims to encourage and support Nigerian decision makers to address the prominent issues of instability in the Niger Delta and the Gulf of Guinea by supporting research and pilot projects to deepen understanding in the Niger Delta on security and governance, economic diversification, oil theft and illegal refining, and environmental clean-up. Training and operational capacity building for the Nigerian Navy to develop operational capability and the institutions to deliver improved security in Nigerias territorial waters and the Gulf of Guinea. This will promote the importance of operating in accordance with maritime and domestic law, International Humanitarian Law and the Law of Armed Conflict.  This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Sahel Defence and Security
description: This programme aims to support the provision of civilian and military trainer secondees to the EU Training Mission (EUTM) Mali focusing on international humanitarian law.  This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Sahel Stabilisation Programme
description: This programme aims to deliver a scaled up package of support to stabilisation efforts in Central Mali through support to the Malian governments Stabilisation plan; deliver support to a broadened peace process in Mali; acting on the recommendations of the mediation scoping study and further developing the work achieved to date in piloting the Elite Bargains and Political Deals framework.

title: Somalia Human Rights and Vulnerable Persons Programme
description: This programme will strengthen the independent institutional framework required to develop human rights protections to hold perpetrators of abuses to account. Improving safety for women, girls and children by supporting protective attitudes and improving the capacity and policy framework available for responding to survivors of abuse. Providing professional support and strengthen independent oversight of human rights protection and supporting human rights defenders. This component will support effective capability to track and deal with human rights concerns in the security sector.

title: Somalia Counter Extremism Programme
description: This programme aims to support the Federal Government of Somalia to implement its National Programme for treatment and handling of disengaged combatants, designed to incentivise defections from Al Shabaab by providing alternative paths and viable rehabilitation options. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Somalia Security Sector Reform Programme
description: This programme aims to strengthen Somalias security institutions and governance at the national and regional level and reinforcing effective linkages between them; supporting AMISOM in delivering effective operations through capacity building. Improving the capacity of Somalias police force through training and capacity building. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Somalia Stabilisation Programme
description: This programme aims to reduce local drivers of conflict in areas of Somalia recently recovered from al-Shabaab control and provide foundations for the local political settlements and stability that will allow the Federal Government of Somalia and Federal Member States to establish a sustained presence. The programme also aims to deliver improved community cohesion through inclusive community engagement and a set of upstream interventions with both local and international actors to enhance civil-military coordination and influence Somalias overall approach to early recovery stabilisation. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: South Sudan Conflict Reduction
description: This programme will support peace building and reconciliation in South Sudan at the sub-national. This includes support to key peace agreement architecture, including monitoring the parties political and ceasefire commitments and emphasises the importance of improved transparency and accountability in securing a lasting peace for the people of South Sudan. This programme included Covid-19 activity  in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Sudan Conflict Reduction and Stabilisation Programme
description: This programme supports community based conflict resilience interventions in Darfur by strengthening the resilience of communities to manage conflict through mediation, dialogue and shared development goals.

title: East Africa Programme
description: This programme aims to strengthen the evidence base on preventing violent extremism and reduce the drivers and enablers of violent extremism in East Africa by supporting local government in Kenya to implement preventing violent extremism county action plans. Through civil society organisations supporting the most vulnerable groups to reintegrate into local communities by working with local government, young men, women and children and religious leaders. Facilitating the sharing of best practice between non-governmental organisations (NGOs) and civil society organisations (CSOs) working to prevent violent extremism, research to identify the main drivers of violent extremism in East Africa and evaluate the effectiveness of efforts to prevent it.

title: Somalia Programme
description: This programme aims to reduce local drivers of conflict in areas of Somalia recently recovered from al-Shabaab control and provide foundations for the local political settlements and stability that will allow the Federal Government of Somalia and Federal Member States to establish a sustained presence. The programme also aims to deliver improved community cohesion through inclusive community engagement and a set of upstream interventions with both local and international actors to enhance civil-military coordination and influence Somalias overall approach to early recovery stabilisation.

title: Lake Chad Basin Programme
description: This programme aims to promote political engagement by national and sub-national governments in Nigeria and other LCB countries, international actors, civil society and others to encourage a resolution of the conflict.

title: Sahel Programme
description: This programme aims to promote stabilisation efforts in the MINUSMA UK deployment Area of Operation through stabilisation expertise, civilian-military coordination and small projects. It includes other stabilisation activity in central Mali, including through the MINUSMA Trust Fund, and activity to promote womens meaningful involvement in local stabilisation.

title: Africa Peace Support Operations Programme
description: The programme aims to enhance the capability of African countries and institutions to make effective contributions to UN or African Union (AU) peace support operations (PSO), working with countries deploying or preparing to deploy to missions and top down to build the capability of the AU to manage PSO.

title: West Africa Programme
description: This programme aims to be  a flexible programme for relatively small-scale, short duration projects to address emerging threats to stability in the region. It is demand-led and projects eligibility is assessed through a set of pre-determined parameters relating to impact, risk level, purpose and theme (including strengthening regional cooperation and coordination and reducing the risks of spill-over effects of instability).

title: Caribbean  Serious and Organised Crime
description: This programme is working with countries in the region to make an improvement in the ability of the Caribbean governments to disrupt serious organised crime. The programme is focussed on identifying and supporting those at risk of engaging in criminality and building the levels of defence and resilience in vulnerable people, communities, businesses and systems. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity  in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Colombia Peace and Stability
description: This programme is supporting Colombias efforts to achieve long-term peace by implementing the peace agreement with the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC-EP) and tackling the underlying causes of conflict. We are doing this by working in three areas: (1) Enhancing civil society involvement (particularly women and victims) in peace implementation. (2) Strengthening local and national state capacity to deliver peace and stabilisation through catalytic funding and technical assistance. (3) Helping to put in place innovative, evidence-based, conflict and gender sensitive laws, policies and methodologies to tackle security challenges. This programme included Covid-19 activity  in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Peru/Colombia Serious Organised Crime (Formerly Combatting Illicit Economies - Colombia/Peru/Panama)
description: This programme engages with Peruvian and Colombian law enforcement agencies to improve their capability and to enable more effective criminal proceedings being taken against those involved in serious organised crime. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Central Asia Programme
description: This programme aims to provide technical and advisory support across the region on six key thematic themes: i) media development and countering disinformation; ii) defence, security and serious organised crime iii) good governance iv) conflict prevention through improved natural resource management and promoting youth inclusion v) gender equality and vi) penal reform.   This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 related activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Eastern Partnership
description: This programme aims to support space for dialogue around the protracted conflicts, address challenges faced by conflict affected societies and build resilience to external pressure including through support for media plurality. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 related activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Good Governance Fund
description: This programme will support governance and economic reform in Armenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, North Macedonia, Moldovaand Serbia. Specific areas the fund supports include anti-corruption measures, improving the business environment, judicial reform, key sector reforms (e.g. banking and energy), strengthening the rule of law and supporting an independent media. These interventions support states to become more resilient to external and internal (political or economic) shocks and support poverty reduction. This programme included Covid-19 related activity in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Ukraine Programme
description: CSSF continues to support the delivery of the Ukraine HMG Strategies to ensure a united, stable, sovereign and resilient Ukraine.

title: Algeria CSSF Programme
description: This programme will support two main areas: (1) Supporting economic reforms, youth and female employment and improvement of national education outcomes. (2) Improving the effectiveness and inclusivity of key institutions. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Egypt CSSF Programme
description: This programme aims to support (1) Inclusive economic growth in Egypt through an improved fiscal position, an improved business environment, job creation, and international recognition of the improved quality of governance. (2) Education reform to increase public access to quality education, increase human capital and strengthen economic participation. (3) Government reforms, strengthening civil society, and directly supporting NGOs in order to tackle inequality, marginalisation and extreme poverty. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Lebanon CSSF: Security Programme
description: This programme is addressing three key strands of overlapping security threats in Lebanon.  The programme supports (1) The establishment and deployment of Land Border Regiments of the Lebanese Armed Forces (LAF) to monitor and interdict illegal cross border activity along the northern and eastern border between Lebanon and Syria. (2) Aims to build the capability of the Internal Security Forces toward an improved service of internal security provision, including fostering more effective cooperation with other security institutions. (3) The work on countering violent extremism is addressing threats emerging from vulnerable communities by de-conflicting these communities and de-radicalising those at risk. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Libya CSSF Programme
description: The programme will support Libya in the delivery of greater security, stability and resilience; promote more inclusive political dialogue and participation; and boost economic development. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Morocco CSSF Programme
description: This programme will support Moroccos economic development and political, security and justice reform. The programme will support the regionalisation process with a focus on northern Morocco. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Yemen CSSF Programme
description: This programme focuses on supporting the peace process in Yemen and complements DFIDs contribution of humanitarian aid for Yemen. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone in FY 20/21 Q1.

title: Iraq Governance and Resilience
description: This programme seeks to support the Government of Iraq in newly liberated areas and in Basra to make governance and the delivery of services more effective, responsive and legitimate. It will build two-way communication and consultation mechanisms between citizens and local governments, empowering civil society and communities to engage, influence and hold local government to account. It seeks to achieve this through the following strands: (1) Rehabilitation of critical infrastructure in liberated areas, restoring essential services like water and electricity for citizens, and supporting the return of internally displaced people. (2) Build and use political will and capability among sub-national government institutions and leaders (men and women) in liberated areas and Basra to respond more effectively to citizens needs (men, women, girls and boys).

title: Iraq Security, Justice and Reconciliation
description: This programme aims to support the Government of Iraq to build stronger, more responsive and more accountable security sector institutions, and support the conditions for effective and sustainable community-level reconciliation. It seeks to achieve this through the following strands: (1) Supporting effective national, sub-national and local security institutions to be responsive to the needs of all Iraqis (men, women, boys and girls).  (2) The programme will support gender sensitive community-level reconciliation to rebuild trust within communities who have lived under Daesh. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Jordan Political Stability
description: This programme contributes to strengthening Jordans political stability with more accountable and transparent governance, stronger rule of law, an effective legal system and improved record of human rights. It seeks to achieve this through the following strands: (1) The Municipal Services and Social Resilience Programme Project  which strengthens state capacity by making municipal governments more capable and accountable in delivering services to Jordanian and Syrian residents and so reducing the risk of tensions both within communities and directed against the state.  (2) Reducing community tensions and strengthening citizen-government dialogue by delivering conflict-management techniques and essential infrastructure. (3) Strengthening decentralised governance by building the effectiveness of Parliament, citizens and civil society. (4) An intervention to strengthen the rule of law, including supporting implementation of the recommendations made by the Royal Commission on Judicial Reform.

title: Jordan Economic Sustainability
description: The programme aims to contribute to economic sustainability in Jordan by addressing the long-term and systemic economic drivers of instability in support of reforms under: the Kings Mandate to Government (2016); Vision 2025; the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Programme and the UK/Jordan Ten Year Partnership. It will be delivered through the following strands: (1) The successful expansion of the social safety net which is critical to public acceptance of ongoing subsidy reform. (2) Implementation of the World Banks reform matrix. (3) Supporting the UK/Jordan partnership by the provision of expertise to Government of Jordan, consultations around the Partnership, research and pilots to build momentum.

title: Jordan Internal Security
description: This programme aims to contribute to a reduction in internal security threats in Jordan by engaging in the following areas: (1) Support to the strategic direction and implementation of Jordanian policing reform. (2) Support the Government of Jordans Youth Strategy by building on previously approved resilience enhancing psychosocial activities. (3) Aims to integrate a gender-based approach towards womens participation in prevention and protection processes during conflicts, as well as in peace building and maintaining stability and sustainable security. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Lebanon CSSF: Community Stability Programme
description: This programme aims to address key drivers of grievances and conflict at the community level, including lack of economic opportunities, low and unequal access to services, and weak or stressed capacities for managing conflict and preventing violence. The programme consists of the following components: (1) The Lebanon Host Communities Services Programme which is improving local basic service and livelihood infrastructure in vulnerable refugee-hosting communities to reduce inter and intra-community tensions over strained basic services and competition over jobs following the influx of Syrian refugees. (2) Reducing inter- and intra-community grievances over solid waste management. This includes dispute mediation and responding to waste management tensions in target areas, along with capacity-building of local/sub-national government to design and deliver priority local waste management solutions. (3) Cultivating positive narratives, dialogue and interactions between conflicting communities to address tensions and highlight peace-building initiatives, particularly aimed at addressing negative attitudes towards refugees and to reduce tensions between host communities and refugees. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: The North Africa Fund for Regional Cooperation
description: This programme is supporting the North Africa region through interventions working in the political, economic, counter terrorism and security areas. The programme will support these components by addressing transnational elements through regional cooperation. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q2.

title: Technical Assistance FacilityProgramme
description: This programme aims to deliver technical assistance to governments, non-governmental organisations and multilateral partners, in five countries: Tunisia, Egypt, Libya, Morocco and Algeria, as well as support at a regional level. It works in a wide range of thematic areas including governance, economic growth and security and justice. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Middle East Peace Process (MEPP) CSSF Programme
description: The programme is designed to contribute towards delivery of the three overall objectives: (1) Building effective and accountable Palestinian institutions ready for statehood and resilient to political transition. (2) Supporting Palestinian Authority and civil society (Israeli and Palestinian) to work for peace, maintaining and increasing political support for a two state solution. (3) Protecting and assisting vulnerable communities to preserve the viability of a two state solution, to uphold international humanitarian law and respond to arising needs.  This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.  This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q2.

title: Syria: Community Support in North-Western Syria
description: This programme aims to provide targeted non-humanitarian support to four sectors: community policing and access to justice; education; governance and service delivery; and livelihoods and economic development. This support will be provided as part of a phased and responsible withdrawal of CSSF support to community policing; governance and service delivery; and livelihoods and economic development in Idlib, Aleppo, Eastern Ghouta and Rif Damascus.

title: Syria: Support for the Southern De-escalation Area
description: The programme aims to support civilian institutions and civil society in south-west Syria in the sectors of community policing and access to justice; education; governance and service delivery; livelihoods and economic development. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Whole of Syria Support to a Political Process
description: The programme aims to support a political settlement and the UN-led process in Geneva as well as providing support to Syrian voices and civil society. The programme will also work on human rights and accountability.

title: Tunisia CSSF Programme
description: The programme aims to support Tunisia by providing support to economic development, security sector reform and good governance. The programme will promote inclusive economic development and support to Tunisians to develop the right skills for the labour market. (2) Focusing on addressing economic and political exclusion and inequalities, particularly within marginalised regions. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Iraq CSSF Programme
description: This programme aims to change the conditions in Iraq to reduce the probability and reach of a future insurgency, contribute to an effective, legitimate and responsive Iraqi state and build a more resilient Iraqi society. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Syria CSSF: Future Syria Programme
description: This programme aims to contribute to international accountability efforts to prosecute perpetrators of human rights abuses and international humanitarian law violations and preserve civil society space at a local level whilst enhancing effective and meaningful participation of women in Syrian society.

title: UK-Jordan Partnership Facility Programme
description: This programme will provide a whole of government approach in the delivery of UK commitments to Jordan. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Lebanon CSSF: Political Reform Programme
description: This programme aims to build momentum for supply and demand side reform and to support broader areas of social and economic reform. It will do so through the following interventions female political participation, strengthen democratic mechanisms for reform, accountability and dialogue and strategic communications. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Syria CSSF: Civilian Protection and Community Resilience Programme
description: The Civilian Protection and Community Resilience (CPCR) programme mitigates the impact on communities of active conflict in north west Syria and strengthenscivilian protection. The programme saves lives through the provision of emergency civil protection, first response, service delivery and early warning of aerial bombardment.

title: Jordan CSSF: Political and Economic Resilience Programme
description: This programme aims to build inclusive and accountable governance, via a strands focused on: reducing community tensions; strengthening Citizen-Government dialogue; building social resilience and provision of municipal services and strengthening rule of law.

title: Jordan CSSF: Security and Stability Programme
description: This three-year programme, both ODA and non-ODA, delivers on HMGs commitment to Jordanian security under the UK-Jordan Partnership. It supports both security and stability, working with a cross-section of the JAF, responding directly to HM King Abdullah IIs request for UK assistance with policing, and supporting Jordan to deliver on the UN Security Council Resolution on Women, Peace and Security

title: Overseas Territories Justice, Security & Governance
description: This programme aims to ensure that the Overseas Territories (OTs) are protected from and resilient to a range of security threats including natural and man-made disasters, economic insecurity, crime and public health threats. It also aims to ensure that OTs are governed by effective and transparent government agencies and institutions that comply with key identified international conventions. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Maritime Governance and Environment Programme
description: This programme aims to provide support to achieve increases in the protection of marine biodiversity across the maritime zones of the Overseas Territories (OTs). Establish maritime strategies for compliance with international obligations and develop effective maritime legislative structures. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone

title: OTD Justice Programme
description: This programme aims to build capability within the law enforcement, agree standards informed by international good practice and provide technical expertise across the OTs.

title: OTD Governance Programme
description: This programme aims to build capability in relation to public health, maritime governance, public financial management, benificial ownership laws and child safeguarding.

title: OTD Environment, Sustainablity and Climate Change (ESCC) Programme
description: This programme aims to provide support to manage: Climate change and projects led by OT s in response to COP 26; marine pollution; seabed mapping and hydrographic governance; and biosecurity and protection against invasive species.

title: OTD Covid-19 Response Programme
description: The objective of this programme is to strengthen the resilience of the OTs in diagnosing and treating COVID-19 patients and limiting the spread of the virus.

title: OTD Border Security Programme
description: The Border Security Programme aims to ensure the OTs can detect and respond to threats to their borders through the implementation of modern, robust customs and immigration systems, maritime security and cyber security.

title: Consolidating Democracy in Pakistan
description: This programme will directly support key components of the UK Government's Pakistan strategy, which aims to help Pakistan to consolidate its democracy and provide effective government, prioritising economic growth and reducing poverty. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q2.

title: Rule of Law in Pakistan Programme
description: This programme will support Pakistan to improve citizens trust and public confidence in rule of law, especially among the poorest and most vulnerable, including minorities, women and girls.  This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme.  The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone.

title: Myanmar Country Programme
description: This programme aims to focus on three areas: (1) Support for Myanmars peace process increasing the inclusivity of negotiations, enhancing the quality of dialogue between stakeholders and helping the public to engage more in the process. (2) Helping to prevent violence against women and girls, improve safety in communities. (3) Monitoring land use changes in northern Rakhine to improve our ability to understand what is happening in villages where Rohingya lived. This programme included Covid-19 activity in Q1 and Q2.

title: Nepal Peacebuilding Programme
description: This programme will work with local and national political groups, civil society, human rights organisations and the media in order to build Nepalese capacity to resolve local conflicts and support marginalised communities.

title: Sri Lanka - Delivering increased stability and reducing the risk of a return to conflict
description: This programme aims to support reconciliation, strengthen democracy and the rule of law to ensure long-term stability, through the following project activity: Supporting police reform and training based on a community policing approach. Supporting the governments commitment to establishing credible and effective transitional justice mechanisms as part of Sri Lankas reconciliation process.  Clearing 600,000 sq. m of mine contaminated land in the North and East enabling the resettlement of Internally Displaced Peoples (IDP).  Sharing UK expertise to strengthen government capability to tackle bribery and corruption.  Support security sector reform and foster greater awareness of the importance of accountability and reconciliation. This is an ODA and non-ODA integrated programme. The spend reported against this programme is the ODA element alone. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Maldives CSSF Programme
description: CSSF continues to support HMGs strategies to increase democracy, accountability and stability in the Maldives.

title: Philippines Programme
description: This programme aims to address some of the key drivers of conflict and instability in the Bangsamoro region. The interventions primarily focus on support to the governance track of the Bangsamoro Peace Process, which established the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region of Muslim Mindanao (BARMM); and provision of Covid-19 support to the new region.

title: Pacific Programme
description: The Pacific CSSF programme aims to increase the ability of Pacific Island Countries to remain stable, secure and more resilient to malign external influences, through better governance, and to remain independent, and likeminded partners of the UK.

title: Western Balkans Programme
description: This programme aims to reduce the threat from organised criminality, extremism and terrorism, strengthening governance and the rule of law capability, supporting reconciliation and the fight against corruption.

title: Western Balkans Stability CSSF Programme
description: This programme provides assistance to address the priority drivers of instability in the region. The main pillars are around tackling the ongoing legacies of the wars of the 1990s, reducing the threat from extremism and terrorism, strengthening governance and the rule of law capability, and supporting reconciliation. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q1 and Q2.

title: Western Balkans: Media Cyber and Defence (MCD) CSSF Programme
description: This programme provides assistance to address the priority drivers of instability in the region. The main pillars are around tackling the ongoing legacies of the wars of the 1990s, reducing the threat from extremism and terrorism, strengthening governance and the rule of law capability, and supporting reconciliation. This programme included Covid-19 activity in FY 20/21 Q2.

title: Professionalising Criminal Investigations in the Ghanaian Police Service
description: This project will provide internationally recognised investigative and trainer skills training to the Ghanaian Police Service, embedding sustainability and improving the training for Criminal Investigation Department officers.

title: IMPROVING THE MALAWI REVENUE AUTHORITY'S CAPABILITY TO ENSURE TRANSBOUNDARY FREIGHT SECURITY
description: STRENGTHENING MALAWI'S FREIGHT SECURITY BY IMPROVING THE REVENUE AUTHORITY'S CAPACITY TO PROFILE CONTAINERS ENTERING THE COUNTRY

title: IMPROVING CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION TECHNIQUES IN MOZAMBIQUE
description: SUPPORTING RULE OF LAW IN MOZAMBIQUE BY PROVIDING EXPERT UK TRAINING IN ADVANCED INVESTIGATION TECHNIQUES TO LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS

title: Tri-parte Project
description: TRI-PARTE PROJECT TO CAPACITY & CAPABILITY BUILDING THE GUINEA BISSAU JUDICIAL POLICE - UK/CV/GB

title: Assisting the Senegalese's government in combating cyber crime.
description: This project will establish a Senegalese Cybercrime unit focusing its activity on Cyber enabled crime and groups exploiting Senegal's improved IT infrastructure. Equipment and training with enhance Senegal's ability to defend against current and emerging threats and pro-actively investigate and prosecute offenders. Senegal is an valued partner to the UK in the fight against organised crime, trafficking and illegal migration in West Africa and the Sahel.

title: Assisting the Cape Verdean government with a review of their National Security Strategy
description: This project will provide the Cape Verdean government with guidance around the revision of their National Security Strategy. This has enabled the revision of the existing model to more effectively combat evolving threats on a national and international level. Cape Verde is an important partner in the fight against drug trafficking from Latin America.

title: Project Cudgel - Build the West Africa organised crime network by strengthening the capacity of the Guinean Organised Crime Agency
description: Training, mentoring and capacity building for the Guinean Organised Crime Agency to allow them to interact effectively with other regional counterparts already supported by NCA. This will strengthen and extend the West Africa network against organised crime which is essential in stopping the flow of drugs - and possibly migrants - reaching the UK and Europe from West Africa.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in East Africa
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in East Africa.

title: Ethiopian elections & online debate
description: Research project to examine the extent to which hate speech was a part of the online political discourse around elections in Ethiopia in May 2015. Findings formed the basis of recommendations to support more constructive engagement between political actors online, thus contributing to a healthier political environment for future elections.

title: Building local capacity for social and economic development of rural communities
description: This project will boost social and economic development in rural areas of Angola through developing capacity for community project leaders in Angola's regions.

title: Promoting human rights and access to justice in Angola
description: This project will help raise awareness of Angola's human rights legislation, building capacity among para-legals across Angola thereby broadening effective legal access for all levels of society.

title: Promoting balanced and free media election coverage in Angola
description: This project will promote balanced media election coverage in Angola through training and guidance for journalists on free reporting ahead of the August 2017 elections.

title: Promoting Legal Awareness training across Angola
description: Raising awareness of human rights legislation across Angola and contributing to a database of possible violations.

title: Tackling Corruption Summit
description: Supporting the organisation of a local Summit, based on the London Tackling Corruption Summit, to raise awareness and discuss future actions to tackle corruption with key Angolan stakeholders, including Government, business and Civil Society.

title: Infrastructure development in East Africa
description: This project will promote economic development and trade opportunities in East Africa by providing UK expertise on the use of public private partnerships which will help to generate growth.

title: Promoting economic development in Ethiopia
description: This project will build the capacity of Ethiopian Government officials to understand the benefits and risks of private equity financing through training which introduces officials to private equity financing and improves Ethiopia's ability to develop private equity finance regulations.

title: Supporting social and physical infrastructure in post Ebola West Africa.
description: This project will build capacity to improve infrastructure delivery post Ebola through skill sharing, training and engagement in Guinea, Liberia, Sierra Leone, Cote D'Ivoire, and Mali.

title: Promoting agricultural development in Cameroon
description: This project will help develop agriculture and the local economy in the conflict affected northern region of Cameroon through improved sorghum yields, better management skills and use of a fair trade compliant supply chain to take advantage of trade opportunities with food beverage companies.

title: Electricity market reform in Southern Africa
description: This project will improve the functioning of the regional electricity market in Southern Africa by demonstrating the benefits of an open electricity market to African countries.

title: Promoting peace and economic development in Africa
description: This project provided support to Chatham House to enable the organisation to promote peace, prosperity and partnership in Africa through the provision of high quality policy advice and the sharing of diplomatic best practise.

title: Supporting the national human rights institution in Botswana.
description: This project supported the establishment of a new national human rights institution compliant with the Paris Principles, through the visit of the key Botswana decision makers to Tanzania to learn from their experience. Work is underway to draft legislation to establish the new institution.

title: Promoting Public Private Partnerships as a vehicle for Botswana's economic development.
description: Review the readiness of Botswana to undertake Public Private Partnerships and prepare detailed implementation plan for the Ministry of Finance and Development Planning to encourage the use of Public Private Partnerships where appropriate, providing opportunities for UK business.

title: Increasing women's participation in politics in Botswana.
description: A project to increase women's participation in politics, particularly the number of women parliamentarians elected for the upcoming 2019 general elections. Workshops to address issues that hinder women's aspirations for political office and the establishment of a support network for aspiring female political leaders.

title: Promoting women's rights in Cameroon
description: This project will empower women to defend their rights to decision making on health, economic issues and politics through educational interventions.

title: LEGAL AND SOCIAL AWARENESS AGAINST GENDER VIOLENCE ON YOUNG GIRLS
description: Advocacy campaign and legal workshops for authorities, parents, women and students to eradicate breast ironing, Female Genital Mutilation and other sexual violence in the South West and Littoral regions of Cameroon.

title: Building Women's Leadership through Education for Rights and Development
description: Support 16 women to complete their Masters degree course at local universities, in a field relevant to development and women's rights. Also the provision of leadership training to create a cadre of women who lead change in different sectors in Cameroon including science, technology, law, gender and development. This project supports UK objectives on women's participation in decision-making, human rights and development.

title: Promoting democratic values in Ethiopia
description: This project will work to embed democratic values in future Ethiopian leaders through supporting the work of youth parliaments and student civic clubs.

title: Promoting inter faith dialogue to reduce conflict
description: Building on a similar project led by the Archbishop of Canterbury during his visit to Ghana, this project gathered religious leaders and local chiefs in Ghana's most volatile region, the Northern Region; promoting open dialogue, confronting the threats of radicalisation and ensuring a network in place to report any potential security threats.

title: Countering Violent Extremism in Ghana: mentoring and strategy
description: Following a 2015 Bilateral Programme support, a 'PREVENT' committee was formed to assess Ghana's capacity to counter violent extremism through a PREVENT style strategy; to mentor key Ghanaians (primarily within the National Security architecture); and share lesssons from the UK, making recommendations on inter-agency working. This phase of the project is to assist Ghana in writing the 'Prevent' strategy and then subsequently implementing it across agencies as well as ensuring that Post's work complements efforts of other government departments and partners in Ghana.

title: Delivering Economic Growth for Ghana
description: Identify and analyse the current opportunities and constraints to doing business in the sectors of the Ghanaian economy where goods and services can be best directed for economic growth and opportunities for international businesses including UK businesses, and outline measures that could be taken to attract Foreign Direct Investment into these sectors.

title: ESTABLISHMENT OF A CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM IN SCHOOLS TO ENHANCE PROTECTION & REPORTING OF ABUSE, VIOLENCE & EXPLOITATION OF CHILDREN
description: This project will support identified schools in The Gambia to have in place a child protection policy and mechanisms to enhance protection and reporting of abuse, violence and exploitation of children. The project is also in line with UK objectives to engage in partnership opportunities with government, civil society organisation's and relevant stakeholders to ensure that children's rights are observed and respected. The investment by HMG into schools will strengthen bilateral ties. Adoption of this pilot project within the various regions and the identified schools will contribute towards showcasing the UK as an effective partner in child protection and child rights issues.

title: INTER-GENERATIONAL DIALOGUE ON GENDER BASED VIOLENCE AND CHILD PROTECTION
description: The project facilitates a platform where girls, young and older women will have the opportunity to engage in an inter-generational dialogue on Gender-Based Violence including girls and young women that have no formal education with the objective of developing an inter-generational action plan and strategic plan. The project will contribute to the reduction in prevalence of Gender Based Violence in The Gambia and create a platform for inter-generational dialogue. This concept is line with UK objectives in raising awareness on Gender Based Violence and advocating for its reduction countrywide. It is envisaged that an increased awareness level on Gender Based Violence and the recently banned Female Genital Mutilation practice, will deter dual nationals residing in UK from subjecting their children to harmful traditional practices.

title: Establishment of a child protection system in schools within The Gambia
description: This project will establish a child protection system in schools to increase the reporting of abuse, violence and exploitation of children, thus improving their welfare.

title: Strengthening transparency and accountability of public procurement in Cote d'Ivoire
description: This project will support both government and non-government stakeholders to improve the timeliness and quality of open data regarding public procurement and to use this information to monitor procurement methods for effectiveness, fairness, and integrity in Cte d'Ivoire.

title: Regional workshop in sustainable development
description: REGIONAL WORKSHOP ON BEST PRACTICES IN SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT OF ARTISANAL & SMALL-SCALE MINING.

title: Strengthening post-Ebola economic recovery in Guinea.
description: This project will strengthen post-Ebola economic recovery in Guinea by providing women with business skills necessary to maximise their role in entrepreneurship and social change.

title: Improving local health provision in Madagascar
description: This project will provide a translation of "Where there is no doctor: a village healthcare handbook" into Malagasy. Once translated, the project will work with local partners to distribute the handbook to primary health centres and small clinics in rural parts of the country which will help deliver higher quality medical care in resource poor settings where access to medical infrastructure and training is limited.

title: Promote sustainable development and investment in Madagascar.
description: This project will work to promote greater understanding of, and interest in, trade and investment opportunities and challenges in Madagascar in order to increase foreign direct investment. It will also help explore how UK expertise can help improve good governance and fight corruption which is key to attracting foreign direct investment.

title: Improving community health in Madagascar
description: This project aims to build and pilot a complete Population Health Environment (PHE) outreach package through a participatory process with communities in south west Madagascar. The package will provide leaders with the skills and knowledge necessary to mobilise their communities in critical thinking and decision making to achieve sustainable development.

title: Improving good governance and preventing corruption in Madagascar
description: This project will build on previous work with Transparency International to identify actionable ways to prevent corruption when businesses are created in Madagascar. The report will be shared with the local authorities and local anti corruption bodies with a view to supporting implementation of concrete and ready to implement reforms. These should provide tangible improvements in local governance and the ease of doing business (eg as judged by the World Bank's Doing Business indicators).

title: Promoting integrity in public procurement in Madagascar.
description: This project will help tackle corruption, and restore a level-playing field, in public procurement through a constructive dialogue amongst the public authorities, private sector representatives and civil society in order to enhance transparency and accountability.

title: Improving judicial integrity in Madagascar.
description: This project aims to help improve judicial integrity in Madagascar by empowering key Malagasy anti-corruption agents through three in-country visits led by two legal experts from the International Senior Lawyers Project - UK (ISLP-UK). Their task will be to build the capacity of the members of the Malagasy Reform Commission for Judicial Integrity in order to implement an inclusive and mutually supportive framework in which to develop a strategy for improving judicial integrity.

title: Promoting good governance and respect for human rights in Madagascar's mining sector.
description: This project aims to foster inclusive governance and human-rights based approaches in the management of natural resources in two key mining regions. The project should provide key stakeholders (civil society actors, security forces, local authorities and company representatives) with enhanced understanding of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights and the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights.

title: Supporting prosperity in Mauritius
description: A project to help build employability skills of young Chagossian adults, amongst the poorest in Mauritius and with one of the highest unemployment rates.

title: Improving gender awareness and equality at local government level in Mauritius
description: A project to identify gender issues in local administration workplaces, propose conflict resolution solutions and remove gender barriers in Mauritius where the gender gap between women and men is still significant in the workplace.

title: PROMOTING EDUCATION AS A DRIVER OF GROWTH IN RWANDA AND MAURITIUS
description: This project will assess the tertiary education needs and beneficial impact on the economy of Rwanda and Mauritius

title: PROMOTING INNOVATION AS A DRIVER OF GROWTH IN MAURITIUS
description: This project will promote innovative thinking in business delivery to achieve higher economic growth.

title: Support for greater prosperity and good governance through capacity building assistance in the oil and gas sector for the Malawi government
description: This project will support the Malawi government in developing a successful oil and gas sector in accordance with international regulatory best practice. Particular importance will be given to governance, social inclusion and environmental protection so that the state's natural resources can be used for the benefit of the nation and the Malawi people.

title: STRENGTHENING DEMOCRACY AND GOOD GOVERNANCE THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A MEDIA CENTRE OF EXCELLENCE TO IMPROVE JOURNALISTIC SKILLS AND INVESTIGATIVE REPORTING
description: This project will help ensure robust media to support democracy and the rule of law through the establishment of a media facility within the University of Malawi. The facility will be used by students and practising journalists for capacity building sessions in different aspects of journalism.

title: Strengthening the institutional capacity of Mozambique insurance regulator (ISSM)
description: This project will boost the effectiveness and capability of the Mozambique Insurance Regulator (ISSM) through specialized training, to become a more dynamic institution able to contribute to private sector development in a sustainable manner.

title: Supporting the treatment of prisoners' mental health needs
description: This project will promote stabilisation and security in correctional services through training and expert advice to prison officers which helps them meet the mental health needs of prisoners.

title: Promoting benefits of access to information
description: Promoting benefits of access to information enhancing democracy, transparency, accountability and strengthening governance to ensure prosperity/economic development.

title: Supporting Namibia's economic development
description: The project aims to improve Namibia's prosperity by enabling it to attract more foreign investment. It will develop Namibian capacity to use Public Private Partnerships to help fund infrastructure and other developments.

title: Supporting women's right against harmful cultural practices
description: The project supports the human rights of women in the Zambezi area. It will challenge harmful sexual practices which are not only detrimental to women's empowerment but which lead to increased rates of teenage pregnancy and HIV-AIDS.

title: Reducing conflict and protecting women's rights in Rwanda/DRC
description: This project aims to reduce the chances of conflict and protect women's rights through expanding small scale trade across the Rwanda DRC border. This includes grouping cross border women traders into co operatives, and training them in the regulations for trade and their rights under it.

title: Access to justice for refugee survivors of sexual and gender based violence
description: This project will provide support to organisations who help Congolese and Burundian refugees in Rwanda, who have suffered sexual and gender based violence, to obtain legal identity documentation. This allows them to pursue their abusers in the courts.

title: SUPPORTING INTERNATIONAL JUSTICE, LEGAL REFORM AND THE RULE OF LAW IN RWANDA
description: The project will promote equitable access to fair justice for the poor by bringing legal services and dispute resolution mechanisms near to the poor through equipping 80 paralegals with the technical skills required to provide better services in terms of information, education, juridical orientation and accompaniment. The project will promote equitable access to justice for indigents and reinforce the technical skills of paralegals in order to enable them provide better services at the grassroots. The project will enable paralegals to refresh and understand new and amended laws, trained and acquire skills in legal interpretation, procedural skills to be able to accompany cases to courts of law.

title: SUPPORTING MEASURES TO MONITOR AND EFFECTINVELY PREVENT HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSES IN RWANDAN PRISONS AND DETENTION CENTRES
description: The project aims to tackle human rights abuses that go on in Rwandan prisons and detention centres. The project will train 15 prison personnel (including 10 prison officers and 5 prison workers from the Rwanda Correctional Services), the project will also train 30 volunteers who will educate, monitor and report on human rights abuses. Training will focus on human rights and prevention of human rights abuses in prisons and detention facilities. The project will contribute to strengthening of the rule of law, respectful of human rights and fundamental freedoms, the values and principles of democratic in Rwanda through the promotion of the rights of prisoners and improving prisoners conditions as it provided by national and international legal instruments.

title: SUPPORTING THE CREATION OF SAFE SPACES FOTR WOMEN AND GIRLS VICTIMS OF SEXUAL AND GENDER BASED VIOLENCE IN RWANDA
description: This project will increase the capacity, opportunities and resilience of the poorest women and most vulnerable women and girls to escape stigma and poverty and be able to take control of their lives. The project will train 70 people (30 Rwanda Women Network staff and 40 women victims of sexual and gender based violence) at the Rwanda Women Network centers in Bugesera, Gasabo and Nyarugenge districts to equip them with counselling and trauma response skills.

title: Promoting healthy and sustainable livelihoods among disadvantaged youth in South Africa
description: The Grootbos Foundation in conjunction with the Premier League aims to develop sustainable livelihoods and active citizenship through football. The project focuses on sport for youth between the ages of 6 16 and coaching skills to youth between the ages of 16 25 with the aim of improving the health and employment prospects of participants.

title: Enhancing transparency and accountability within the South African Department of Home Affairs.
description: This project will put in place a joint cooperation agreement with the South African Department of Home Affairs which will help the department to identify areas where it can make more information available to the public, including by identifying challenges associated with opening up information on sensitive issues .

title: Promoting science in South Africa
description: The project will promote science education and research capability in South Africa through highlighting UK/South African partnerships and the achievements of South African scientist Kevin Govender, winner of the Edinburgh Medal for Science.

title: Promoting community mental health
description: This project will support the development of mental health services in the Seychelles by increasing the provision of mental health services at a rehabilitation centre to allow more people to benefit. It will also bring a currently unused part of the Centre's grounds into use which staff and patients will then maintain for the benefit of patients.

title: Promoting human rights in the Seychelles through capacity building to the LGBTI community.
description: The project will promote human rights in the Seychelles by producing and distribute promotional material which sets out the assistance available to LGBTI people. It will also provide training on how to deliver effective campaigns on human rights.

title: PROSPERITY & ENVIRONMENT: PROMOTING SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH IN THE BLUE ECONOMY SECTOR
description: This project develops the opportunities for youth in Seychelles to gain experience in the Blue Economy industries in Seychelles and Mauritius, two of the key nations engaged in the sector. The host country benefits through the continued engagement of its population in the Blue Economy, trade development and technological and scientific opportunities in the future. In developing future sources of income for Seychelles, such projects in this industry also increase British influence in education and technological and scientific innovation, while expanding British interests in the sustainable development field.

title: Supporting women's rights in Sudan through a campaign to end violence
description: The project supports public lectures, debate competitions, training workshops and a closing event on International Women's day (IWD) to raise awareness on Sexual Gender Based Violence and Violence Against Women.

title: Building Sustainable links and relationships with Civil Society Organisations in the inaccessible conflict areas of Blue Nile and Southern Kordofan
description: This project will map civil society organisations working in Blue Nile and South Kordofan and invite representatives from organisations in these inaccessible areas to Khartoum for a workshop on communications strategies, a donor reception and establishing a network to provide information on the conflict/humanitarian situation in those inaccessible areas. This will increase the knowledge of missions working in Khartoum on the situation on the ground in those areas and link organisations with funding sources.

title: ADVOCATING ON HUMAN RIGHTS ISSUES IN SUDAN AT UN HUMAN RIGHTS COUNCIL
description: Sending Sudanese human rights defenders to the Human Rights Council in Geneva in order to present their experiences and knowledge about the human rights situation in Sudan to the human rights council. They will advocate for a stronger mandate for the UN independent expert to address human rights issues in Sudan through lobbying strategic figures and holding panel discussions during the week of the human rights council periodic review.

title: PROMOTING YOUTH ACTIVISM AGAINST GENDER BASED VIOLENCE IN SUDAN
description: THIS PROJECT AIMS TO PROMOTE YOUTH ACTIVISM AGAINST GENDER BASED VIOLENCE IN SUDAN THROUGH INFORMATION SESSIONS IN UNIVERSITIES AND SMALL SUB-GRANTS TO UNIVERSITY STUDENTS TO CREATE THEIR OWN ADVOCACY CAMPAIGNS DURING 16 DAYS OF ACTIVISM AGAINST GENDER BASED VIOLENCE.

title: STRENGTHENING INSTITUTIONAL ENGAGEMENT AND CAPACITY ON ISSUES OF MIGRATION AND COUNTERING EXTREMISM
description: THIS PROJECT AIMS TO EDUCATE STRATEGIC CONTACTS WORKING IN MIGRATION AND COUNTERING EXTREMISM IN SUDAN THROUGH COURSES AND CONFERENCES IN ORDER TO COORDINATE WITH THEM ON THE UK MINISTERIAL APPROVED 'PHASED ENGAGEMENT' PLAN IN SUDAN ON AREAS OF MUTUAL INTEREST.

title: Youth entrepreneurship in Senegal to boost growth and tackle youth unemployment
description: This project is about working with Senegalese youth to develop specific entrepreneurship skills, as well as provide coaching training around innovation in order to help to address some of Senegal's key development challenges. The project provides direct support and opportunities to entrepreneurs, in order to develop specific skills.

title: WORKING WITH SENEGAL'S EXTRACTIVE INDUSTRIES TRANSPARENCY INITIATIVE (EITI) SECRETARIAT TO PROMOTE EXTRACTIVES TRANSPARENCY IN SENEGAL, PARTICULARLY IN THE HYDROCARBONS SECTOR
description: This project will help Senegal further develop their National Strategic Plan, particularly in the growing extractives sector by conducting a comprehensive study on Beneficial Ownership, and organising a training seminar on best practice for oil and gas governance.

title: STRENGTHEN THE VOICE OF WOMEN IN THE CAMPAIGN AGAINST FGM THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN EARLY WARNING SYSTEM
description: PURSUE THE PERPETRATORS OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND STRENGTHEN THE VOICE OF WOMEN IN THE CAMPAIGN AGAINST SEXUAL VIOLENCE THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN EARLY WARNING SYSTEM AND PLATFORM BETWEEN LOCAL AUTHORITES AND VICTIMS

title: Strengthen post-Ebola economic recovery in Guinea through the development of a cadre of female entrepreneurs to market non timber forest products.
description: Strengthen post-Ebola recovery and economic development in Guinea, while promoting forest conservation, through the development of a cadre of female entrepreneurs to market non-timber products.

title: Strengthen Post-Ebola recovery in Guinea by maximising the role of women in entrepreneurship.
description: This project will strengthen post-Ebola recovery in Guinea by promoting prosperity through maximising the role of women in entrepreneurship and thereby supporting social change.

title: Promoting prosperity in Sierra Leone through people with disability
description: The project will establish an employment bureau in Sierra Leone for people with disability with the aim of promoting economic prosperity and prosperity.

title: PROMOTING COMMUNITY DIALOGUE AND RECONCILIATION IN SOMALILAND
description: PROMOTING COMMUNITY DIALOGUE AND RECONCILIATION IN SOMALILAND

title: Improving Uganda's capacity to prevent sexual violence in conflict.
description: A project to train members of the Ugandan army, police force, medical professionals, civil society and journalists on the identification, investigation and documentation of sexual violence in conflict situations.

title: Preventing online child sexual exploitation and abuse in Uganda
description: A project to raise awareness amongst Ugandan law enforcement and improve techniques for identifying and investigating cases of online child sexual exploitation and abuse.

title: Support to the Uganda Human Rights Commission on protection of minority rights
description: A project to build the capacity of the Uganda Human Rights Commission to deal with cases involving minority groups, including sexual minorities.

title: Protection and Advocacy for human rights Defenders in Uganda
description: A project to build the capacity of members of the National Coalition of Human Rights Defenders to deal with cases involving minority groups, including sexual minorities

title: Support to the Uganda Police Force on protection of minority rights
description: A project to train members of the Uganda Police Force to improve management of cases involving LGBT people and other vulnerable and marginalised groups, in line with international human rights standards.

title: Promoting democratic governance in Ethiopia
description: This project funds pilot and research work which will help to shape future programmes to strengthen democratic governance in Ethiopia, including on oversight, accountability, transparency and human rights protection.

title: Public Dialogues on Development
description: A project to broaden the democratic space in Ethiopia through a series of public dialogues on development policy, enabling a wide range of stakeholders (including civil society organisations) to debate and contribute to public policy making.

title: Strengthening media reform in Ethiopia
description: This project will provide the Ethiopian Government with recommendations on activities the UK Government can provide support on to incrementally progress towards a more open media landscape.

title: Ethiopia political economy analysis
description: Analysis to better understand the context for political competition in Ethiopia to help sharpen the focus of HMG programming and partnerships

title: Understanding the dynamic political context in Ethiopia to inform HMG programming
description: Understanding the dynamic political context in Ethiopia to inform HMG programming

title: Promoting Ethiopias international Human Rights commitments.
description: This project supports civil society organisations monitoring progress and working on the implementation of Ethiopias Human Rights Universal Periodic Review recommendations.

title: Analysing scenarios for Ethiopias stability and development
description: This project will provide an analysis of the possible developments in Ethiopia following the announcement of the State of Emergency and the impacts for the work of Ethiopian Governments in promoting stable pro-poor growth.

title: Encouraging a strategic approach to Ethiopias foreign policy
description: This project will use analysis and a workshop with policymakers to discuss how updating Ethiopias National Security and Foreign Policy Strategy could help further Ethiopias role in reducing conflict in its region and beyond.

title: Supporting the global summit to end sexual violence in conflict
description: This project will increase the effectiveness of the global summit to end sexual violence in conflict by ensuring that the protocol from the summit is disseminated locally to help bring about change.

title: IMPROVING ACCOUNTABILITY AND SECURITY IN BENI AS A VITAL STEP TO THE STABILISATION OF EASTERN CONGO
description: This research project will clarify the identities of armed actors responsible for mass killings in the Beni area, and so kickstart accountability, protection of human rights and other processes of conflict resolution.

title: STRENGTHENING THE CAPACITY OF THE GENERAL DIRECTORATE OF MIGRATION
description: STRENGTHENING THE CAPACITY OF THE GENERAL DIRECTORATE OF MIGRATION BY PROVIDING TRAINING ON DOCUMENT EXAMINATION, PASSENGER PROFILING AND IMPOSTOR TRAINING

title: Combating wildlife crime in Zimbabwe
description: Design, production, and dissemination of a booklet for public prosecutors in Zimbabwe dealing with wildlife crime to increase awareness of the issue and drive more effective prosecutions.

title: Help Argentina to adopt more sustainable and efficient energy supply and distribution systems
description: This project is designed to support Argentina's Ministry of Energy adopt modern systems to model and manage the country's energy supply in a more efficient and sustainable way.

title: Create a more stable energy supply by supporting plans for greater openness and competition in the energy market through policy advice and capacity building
description: This project is designed to share UK best practice on energy market reform and regulation, with the aim of enhancing the design and implementation of policies that promote and control competition and efficiency in energy markets

title: Support Argentina's economic growth through enhancing its infrastructure financing Public-Private Partnerships capability
description: Train the team which is in charge to design new ways to finance infrastructure projects, in order to support infrastructure investment in Argentina

title: Promote and embed the sustainability of Argentina's economic reform programme
description: Compare experiences with South Africa and provide economic background to inform the design of economic transformation policies in Argentina to facilitate the achievement of accession to the OECD

title: Enhance flight-handling capacity at Buenos Aires' domestic airport to increase development potential and opportunities for greater connectivity
description: A better use of the airport will allow more flights to operate, increasing availability of quality and more affordable air transport in Argentina

title: Promote the adoption of sustainable economic development policy in line with the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development's (OECD) standards through educating policymakers and opinion-formers on best practice in governance and economic
description: To support reforms in public governance in line with OECD's Best Practices with the aim of facilitating a path to membership of the OECD

title: Work with Argentine organisations to improve Argentina's capacity to tackle domestic violence
description: Share UK expertise with Argentine government and civil society organisations in order to help them to increase Argentina's capacity at national and provincial levels to prevent domestic violence crime and punish perpetrators.
