title: Supporting Argentina's efforts to tackle money-laundering
description: share UK expertise to help increase Argentina's capacity to tackle the issue of money laundering

title: Promoting innovation, technology & transparency in Argentina
description: To improve Argentina's capacity to deliver quality and relevant public serices by sharing UK expertise on innovation, technology and transparency. Activity includes bringing a British expert on government innovation to share best practice and help improve Argentina's capacity to deliver quality and relevant public services. This project will contribute to our good governance, democracy, rule of law and human rights priorities by promoting UK experience at both the local and national levels.

title: Promoting a free and fair media in Argentina
description: To influence and help shape the new Argentine media law, whilst building on Post's links with government officials (both national and provincial), opinion leaders and businesses.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Brazil
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Brazil.

title: Tackling corruption in Chilean legislative bodies
description: This project supports the secondment by a member of Chilean Parliament to the UK to learn how to tackle and prevent corrupt practices within the Chilean legislative bodies through practical implementation of transparency and public accountability legislation.

title: Supporting business growth in Columbia
description: This project supports a secondment to British Business Bank by the Colombian business development bank, to support its need to improve governance and develop novel financial instruments that will allow significant growth plans.

title: Defining a chemical and solid waste regulatory framework in Colombia
description: This project advises the Colombian government on its management of chemical and solid waste according to global standards. Colombian accession to the OECD, which is conditional on this, would create more favourable conditions for businesses in Colombia.

title: Showcasing smart cities in Latin America
description: This project will promote urban development and renewal in Latin America by showcasing UK expertise in future "smart" cities. Smart cities integrate multiple technology solutions to securely and effectively manage city assets to improve quality of life and promote sustainable development.

title: Improving regulatory policies
description: The project will help Colombia meet OECD Regulatory Committee recommendations by providing UK expertise to the Columbian Department of National Planning so that it is able to undertake regulatory impact analysis, design a new Colombian Regulatory Office and develop tools such as the standard cost model.

title: Developing evaluation of foreign direct investment data
description: This project will help Chile evaluate the benefits of investment by providing expertise to assist the Statistics Department of Colombia on the disaggregation of financial flows by economic activity, countries, financial instruments and the nature of the foreign investment relationship.

title: Supporting tax reform in Colombia
description: This project advises the Ministry of Finance on how to widen the tax base and reduce tax evasion for Colombia to meet OECD requirements, increasing government revenue, and making the Colombian market more attractive for international business.

title: Creating an entrepreneurship strategy for the Pacific region
description: This project introduces policy planning to support the Science and Innovation programme to drive entrepreneurships as a growth driver in the new economy following the establishment of the peace process.

title: Supporting entrepreneurship in Columbia's Pacific region
description: This project supports a secondment to introduce a framework for support and key policy proposals to drive entrepreneurship in Cali.

title: Administrative costs of ODA Projects in Costa Rica
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Costa Rica.

title: Strengthening economic development in Peru through OECD engagement
description: The project supports the Peruvian government's engagement with the OECD and helps it implement its OECD country programme to bring its macroeconomic and business environment up to international standards.

title: Strengthening Peru's application for membership of the OECD
description: The project will support engagement with Peruvian political parties through dialogue in order to encourage them to continue the pursuit of OECD membership for Peru.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Uruguay
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as ODA projects in Uruguay.

title: Research and institutional collaboration for development
description: This project will build capability in science in Uruguay by creating links with UK researchers in shared priority areas like health and the environment.

title: Strengthen the Latin American Development Bank
description: The project provides UK experts who will strengthen the Development Bank of Latin America. The experts will provide guidance on the development of policies, the delivery of public private partnerships, implementation of low carbon commitments and social development programmes so that the bank is better able to promote economic growth.

title: Scoping visit to support post storm reconstruction in Dominica
description: This project supports a scoping study which aims to establish a plan to inform Dominica's recovery from tropical storm Erika.

title: Strengthening Parliamentary Scrutiny and democratic processes
description: This project aims to enhance the capacity of parliamentarians and officials in enabling an effective environment in which to scrutinise government activity and processes, thereby strengthening democracy in St Lucia

title: Proactive Prosecution Workshop to strengthen rule of law in St. Lucia
description: This training course will inform the Director of Public Prosecutions and police prosecutors how to pro-actively manage cases, the skills required for case building, how to prosecute drug conspiracies and sensitise the prosecutors about money laundering and how the DPP's can assist investigators with asset recovery.This project will be delivered to DPPs and police prosecutors (total of 15 people) to ensure a sustainable improvement in the St Lucia criminal justice system. The project increases the ability of the prosecutors to prosecute serious and organised crime effectively. This will ultimately serve to reduce the level of organised crime in these communities and reduce the impact on the UK.

title: Strengthening the Rule of Law and Human Rights in Dominica through Integrated Investigation Training
description: To train professionals in Integrated Investigation including the use of Rape-kits in the development of a victim centred Investigation and prosecution process

title: Promoting Womens' Rights in Grenada, St. Lucia & St. Vincent
description: This project is a development initiative targeting NGOs in Grenada, St. Lucia and St. Vincent working on the issue of domestic violence and violence within the family. The project will provide NGOs with training on how to counsel men with a history of violence within the family. The project falls under the Ambit of women's Rights which we believe to be a priority of the FCO. Providing NGOs with the training to impact on the behavior and conduct of men with a history of violence in the family is directly improving the conditions and quality of life for women in the home.

title: Strengthening Human rights in Dominica through a victim support programme
description: This project seeks to improve the practice of investigation and prosecution of sexual offences by providing individual victim support, a teen's support group with mentoring and advocating for the introduction of needed legislation, protocols and practices to promote justice and protect vulnerable witnesses through a coalition of civil society organizations.

title: Improving Service Delivery and Strengthening Institutional Response of Social Services Agencies in Saint Lucia
description: To improve service delivery and strengthen institutional response of social services agencies in Saint Lucia to better serve victims and survivors of rape, domestic violence, child physical and sexual abuse

title: Support UK engagement with the Caribbean through expert analysis and trade and investment promotion
description: Annual Subvention to the Caribbean Council to provide briefings, intelligence, and publications to the FCO, as well as to support events designed to promote trade and investment between the region and the UK.

title: Promoting climate change awareness among young people in Bolivia
description: This project informs young people in Bolivia about the full range of views, including the UK's, on the climate deal being negotiated at COP 21. It promotes a series of events involving young people including workshops, promotional events and a simulation of the United Nations climate negotiations.

title: Promoting access to justice
description: This project supports Bolivian Government efforts to reduce the high levels of pre trial detention in Cochabamba. It seeks to provide information to the prison population in order to strengthen processes in the administration of criminal justice and reduce pre trial detention. Prison reform is a priority for the Bolivian Government and the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights in Bolivia.

title: Improving the investment climate in Bolivia
description: To assist the Bolivian Government in identifying ways in which it can improve the business environment, to improve the awareness of UK products and services and to identify opportunities for UK Businesses.

title: Increasing transparency in Bolivia - Promoting the use of open data for press reporting.
description: To promote a culture of transparency within the public administration by enhancing and increasing the use of open data for investigative journalism in Bolivia

title: Promote female participation in business and political life in Bolivia
description: This project will promote female participation in business and political life by funding the attendance of a Bolivian representative at the "Week of Women Conference" at Wilton Park and Women Summit and Awards in London.

title: Ending Sexual Exploitation and Abuse of Children by UN peacekeepers
description: This project will bring together the Brazilian government and civil society activists engaged in UN peacekeeping activities to discuss the issue of Sexual Exploitation and Abuse of Children by UN peacekeepers.

title: 16 Days of activism against Gender-based violence
description: This project will support the existing effort of public and private sectors on working with a society and deepen discussions even further on strategies for women empowerment and solidarity

title: Best practices in Parliament: Brazil - UK III Edition
description: This project will help both Parliaments to make the best of their existing relationship and deepen discussions even further on broader cooperation and anti-corruption measures.

title: Supporting Brazilian policymakers to foster innovation on Energy Storage technologies
description: This project will provide support for Brazil's Electricity Regulator (ANEEL) and other government bodies to build internal expertise on energy storage, which will be essential to select, assess and monitor industry investments of Energy Storage Research & Development projects

title: Increasing Literacy, Language and Entrepreneurial skills for affected youth in the poorer areas of Belmopan
description: This project will provide at risks youths in the poorer areas of Belmopan with oppurtunities to increase their standard of living and encourage self sustainability through academic excellence and entrepreneurial training.

title: Improved protection of Forest and Water Resources for Communities in the Disputed Belize/Guatemala Border
description: A project to promote cross border cooperation and conflict prevention in the disputed Belize/Guatemala border, through impact awareness on deforestation and shared water resources.

title: Increasing trade in Belize through targeted deployment of Prosperity Honorary Consul
description: The Prosperity Honorary Consul will identify areas where British businesses and expertise can be brought on board to help Belize improve in underdeveloped areas, aiming to improve the economies of Belize and UK through increased trade and investment from the UK

title: Women Empowerment and Poverty Alleviation through Small Business and Financial Management Skills
description: This project will alleviate poverty and promote gender equality by giving women the opportunity to establish a functional Women's Textile Cooperative.

title: Promoting sustainable economic development through renewable energy sources in a small, poor, agricultural community- La Gracia.
description: Poverty alleviation through provision of electrical energy from renewable sources in small, poor, rural communities not connected to the national grid

title: Strengthening socio-economic development in Chile: Using UK expertise in building information modelling to modernise the Chilean construction sector
description: To use UK experience to support the Chilean public sector in its effort to lead the digital transformation of the construction sector through Building Information Modelling policies, processes, and technologies.

title: Strengthening socio-economic development in Chile: Using UK expertise to promote low-carbon districts and shared street use in Chile
description: To use UK experience to create a change in street use in Santiago by implementing a low carbon district with green transport infrastructure and data collection tools to raise civil society awareness of climate change and change people's attitudes towards sustainable transport infrastructure. Promoting the development of "Smarter" cities in Chile has the potential to generate further UK-Chile commercial and policy collaboration in the future.

title: Strengthening socio-economic development in Chile: Smart Cities - a UK/Chile exchange on urban innovation and improving business districts
description: To transfer UK best practice on urban innovation to the Chilean Government through policy briefs and a white paper on urban mobility, urban standards, urban governance and business improvement districts. Promoting the development of "Smarter" cities in Chile has the potential to generate further UK-Chile commercial and policy collaboration in the future.

title: Capacity building in cyber security for Chilean financial institutions
description: Raise awareness among Chilean banking and financial institutions, aimed at improving cyber security standards based on British model and best practices

title: Supporting a Pacific Alliance initiative to promote transparency in public life and effective local government within and between the four members of the Alliance (Mexico, Colombia, Peru and Chile).
description: To influence ongoing work within the Pacific Alliance - led by the pro tempore presidency Chile - promoting governance, transparency and effective local government

title: Strengthening the Pacific Alliance's Knowledge-Based Economies: the Role of Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) in Scientific Innovation
description: Pacific Alliance (PA) members knowledge-based economies will be strengthened by fostering greater scientific innovation and research through the application of quality assurance frameworks for their higher education institutions

title: Sharing UK expertise in smart city technology and mobility with Colombia
description: This project brings a UK expert to develop a "Future Cities" pilot project promoting the UK's expertise in innovation for smart cities. Smart cities integrate multiple technology solutions to securely and effectively manage city assets to improve quality of life and promote sustainable urban development.

title: Promoting better regulation to improve the business environment in Colombia
description: Capacity building workshop with the Colombian National Planning Department, relevant ministries, regulatory bodies and other stakeholders, focused on the identification, study and analysis of alternatives to regulation -based on the UK experience, to support better policy making and create a better business environment in Colombia, also contributing to Colombia's aspirations to OECD accession

title: Sharing UK expertise in methodologies to gather and evaluate national statistical information in Colombia
description: Provide assistance to the National Statistics Department of Colombia to improve its methodology and standars for managing Foreign Direct Investment and Overseas Direct Investment, by bringing UK experts for a workshop on gathering and evaluating national statistics and bring it in line with the OECD standars, supporting Colombia's aspirations to OECD accession

title: Applying UK knowledge on Big Data to improve data management in Colombia
description: UK experts will deliver conferences at the Big Data Gathering in Colombia, sharing the UK's expertise on managing Open and Big data with the public and private sector. This project responds to the Colombian government's need to receive training on the use and collection of public data to enhance decision-making on spend and prioritization of development activities in areas like future cities, agriculture, energy efficiency and anticorruption.

title: Strengthen Colombia's capacity to implement international standards and regulations on workplace health, safety and major hazards.
description: Support Colombia in strengthening occupational risk and environmental competences in the areas of chemical substances, risk evaluation, major hazards and infrastructure in the context of attaining OECD standards

title: Strengthening Governance in Costa Rica
description: This project will strengthen Costa Rica's Centre of Government to improve its coordination of strategic policy formulation. This will reduce fragmentation in public administration and demonstrate progress in the area of public governance in the context of the country's accession process to the OECD.

title: Improve transparency and management of major public Infrastructure projects in Costa Rica
description: Improve transparency and promote investment in Infrastructure in Costa Rica by implementing OECD recommendations for infrastructure development through Public Private Partnerships

title: Strengthening Judicial Independence, rule of law and transparency in Costa Rica.
description: This project aims to educate and create awareness on rule of law and transparency in Costa Rica by disseminating the findings of Arias & Munoz's (regional legal and business services firm) study on judicial independence.

title: Strengthening economic development in Costa Rica through support to women entrepreneurs
description: To connect women entrepreneurs in Costa Rica with multinational company supply chains, among them British companies, thereby generating economic growth and providing potential business opportunities for UK companies

title: Strengthening women's rights and protection against sexual violence in Nicaragua
description: To lower the incidence of domestic and sexual abuse in the Miskitu communities in Puerto Cabeza and Waspan by providing indigenous women from the selected tribe with the information and tools to recognise and defend themselves and fellow community members against sexual and domestic violence.

title: Strengthening Nicaragua's economic and social development through promoting the rule of law
description: This project will create awareness of and strengthen rule of law in Nicaragua in order to promote respect for human rights and drive economic growth. This will be achieved by identifying policy and practical initiatives to empower civil society and delivering educational workshops.

title: Supporting Costa Rica's economic development by supporting the design and implementation of an Open State Policy
description: This project will help prepare Costa Rica for its accession to the OECD by building capacity among state actors to support the design and implementation of the new national Open State policy

title: Strengthen human rights protection for imprisoned members of vulnerable groups in Costa Rica
description: Improvement of human rights standards in Costa Rica, particularly on modern slavery, rights of women & children and LGBT

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Cuba
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Cuba.

title: Build the capacity of the Cuban banking sector to decrease the potential for financial fraud in sectors of the economy vulnerable to money laundering.
description: To detect and prevent the entrance of criminal proceeds and terrorist funds into the financial systems of beneficiary countries

title: Support the Cuban government in developing the efficiency and transparency of its public procurement processes
description: Enhance understanding of international best practices and procedures for Public Procurement in order to enable Government institutions in Cuba to collaborate closer on bespoke national frameworks. Reinforcing the importance of transparency and accountability as Cuban institutions transition towards greater economic efficiency

title: Support the development of a Cuban national strategy for increasing the use of renewable energy sources
description: To provide tools, knowledge, capacity building and links to British expertise to support Cuba's Ministry of Energy in identifying energy policy interventions

title: Using British financial sector expertise to support economic reform in Cuba
description: To deliver a renewal of the UK/Cuba financial sector relationship, leading to a long term prosperity partnership that will deliver faster economic reform in Cuba

title: Strengthening educational links between UK and Cuba
description: To assist the Cuban Government in modernising its higher education system, helping it better serve the needs of its economy, support domestic reforms, and provide longer term opportunities for UK higher education and other business sectors.

title: Promoting economic reform in Cuba through capacity building for Cuban state financial and banking institutions
description: Increasing the capacity of the Cuban Central Bank and the principal state financial institutions, through professional training on finance and risk, financial management, anti money laundering, international banking and online payments. This will contribute to economic reform and infrastructure development in Cuba, facilitate Cuba's reintegration into the global financial system and develop long term opportunities for international investment.

title: Doing business successfully in Cuba
description: To share the UK's expertise in enterprise policy and better regulation so as to help increase growth and employment in the independent sector in Cuba and promote greater economic welfare.

title: Capacity building to enhance quality control of medicines and reduce counterfeit medicines in the Dominican Republic
description: The project aims to contribute to the strengthening of the technical capacities of the Dominican health authorities in monitoring pharmaceutical manufacturing practices. It will enhance the authorities' capacity to identify counterfeit medications and implement administrative sanctions to those involved. Ultimately, it will benefit British pharmaceuticals trading in the Dominican Republic as better inspection practices should reduce the production of counterfeits and/or remove them from the market.

title: Provide training and complimentary activities to the LGBT community an underrepresented minority group to increase their inclusion in Dominican society
description: This project aims to advance human rights, democracy, and governance in the Dominican Republic through the venue of strengthening the political participation of LGBTI people in the country by increasing the number of members from the LGBTI community participating in the democratic process.

title: Protection of children from Online Sexual Exploitation through sub-regional capacity building
description: to counter online sexual exploitation of children by strengthening the technical capacity of, and coordination among, responsible government institutions, in support of the global WeProtect Initiative goals

title: Training on reporting elections for Ecuadorean journalists
description: Provide training for Ecuadorean journalists about responsible reporting of elections in advance of the February 2017 presidential and parliamentary elections

title: Renewable energy solutions for earthquake-affected areas
description: Provide a solar-powered public lighting system in part of Manab province, one of the worst affected areas following the major earthquake of April 2016

title: Support to Colombian refugee communities in Ecuador
description: This project will support inclusion and reduced discrimination against Colombian refugees in Ecuador

title: El Salvador: Human Rights and Democracy promotion through penal and judicial reform, training and capacity building.
description: This project will provide world class British expertise (Professor Coyle and Baroness Stern) and influence in penal reform, sentencing and reintegration

title: Improving handling and care of adolescent girl victims of sexual violence
description: Improve education and awareness of health risks associated with teenage pregnancy, and develop a local inter-sectoral model and framework for co-ordinating key institutions responsible for the protection of adolescent girls, management of their treatment and the promotion of their rights (health facilities, schools, protection system, municipality, among others).

title: Increasing socio-economic opportunities in low income community
description: to stimulate environmental protection and the local economy through tourism in an area classified by "Ramsar" as a wetland with numerous plant and animal species,

title: Strengthening tax collection and customs transparency in Guatemala.
description: This project identifies the effects of smuggling and illegal trade on the Guatemalan tax collection systems and proposes efficient and effective tools to strengthen transparency and accountability in the responsible regulatory bodies.

title: Promoting ethics, anticorruption, transparency and social responsibility in Guatemala's business sector.
description: This project will create awareness of ethical, anti-corruption and transparency issues in the business community through a national forum and the development of an ethical leadership programme.

title: Assisting Guatemala combat money-laundering and improve financial transparency
description: This project will tackle the problem of Guatemala's non-financial businesses and professions receiving and laundering illicit funds by improving supervision and monitoring regimes in this sector.

title: Improving anti-corruption measures in Honduras
description: This project will help Honduran officials through building capacity and introducing International Best Practices to Honduras' Public Procurement Framework

title: Conflict reduction on the Belize/Guatemala border.
description: This project strengthens cross-border confidence building measures by tackling poverty in the border area. It will focus on improving agro-forestry systems, thus improving the lives of local families whilst at the same time contributing towards better environmental protection and a reduction in environmental conflict between Belize and Guatemala.

title: Improving the justice system in Guatemala
description: This project will support the implementation of the National Dialogue Towards Justice Reform in Guatemala. It will promote the discussion, and seek the approval of concrete reforms to the justice system, thus contributing to the fight against impunity and corruption; guaranteeing judicial independence; and strengthening Guatemalan justice institutions.

title: Strengthening Transparency and Citizen Engagement in Guatemala.
description: This project will support the definition of principles to guide and govern the digital society in Guatemala. Increased and better use of the Internet will help improve civic participation, combat corruption, and open avenues to cross cultural understanding. It will also reaffirm the public and private sector's commitment to freedom of expression and human development through IT.

title: Tackling corruption and impunity in Honduras
description: National and International experts will draw up regulations to establish an effective protection system for Honduran justice officials, under the framework of the Honduran Protection Law.

title: Good Governance: Building Civil Engagement and Transparency in Extractive Industries
description: Raise levels of governance and counter corrupt practices in the extractive industries through effective civic participation in the Multi- Stake-holder Committees in mining & forestry

title: Strengthening governance by enhancing Parliament's capacity to provide oversight
description: To enhance the ability of Parliament to better fulfil its oversight role by building the capacity of parliamentary committees and strengthening their administrative, financial and procedural independence from Government

title: Professional skills training for poorly educated and unemployed Guyanese Youth
description: To provide poorly educated, unemployed Guyanese youth with the skills needed to facilitate their return to gainful employment.

title: Improving Guyana's business environment to encourage economic growth.
description: to support and steer economic reforms in Guyana to improve the country's rating on the Ease of Doing Business index

title: Strengthening governance in Guyana through the development of a Code of Conduct for public office holders and anti-corruption training.
description: The creation of a Code of Conduct that will be included in an updated Integrity Commission Act for Guyana that will seek to prevent corruption among public office holders

title: Promoting Transparency and Accountability in Local Government in Guyana
description: To create and strengthen citizen monitoring at the local government level in Guyana.

title: Facilitating access to basic public services for returning Haitian migrants, through access to legal identity documentation
description: Strengthening the roll out of public servcies and access to democratic processes for undocumented returning migrants as part of HMG efforts to promote democracy and build more inclusive societies. The purpose of the project is to better integrate Haitian migrants into Haitian society and able to participate in the Haitian democratic process, while civil society will be better able to advocate for their rights.

title: Promoting climate change resilience and better sanitation practices, through the adoption of eco-sanitation solutions adapted to local communities in Port Au Prince and Cap Haitian
description: Training for Increased adaptability to resource changes brought about by climate change through, improved food security, freshwater conservation, improved risk management and diversification of livelihoods

title: Capacity building of Medical staff
description: Decrease of morbidity and mortality rates of cholera, zika fever and scabies within the prison population through a better functioning of the penitentiary health department and a training cycle for medical personnel.

title: Tackling discrimination and violence against women and girls in Jamaica, through partnership with US, Canada and EU.
description: to contribute to the elimination of all forms of discrimination against women and girls, helping to ensure their equality before the law, and securing their participation in political and public affairs according to international standards

title: Strengthening the educational system in Jamaica
description: This project will help to rehabilitate juvenile offenders through teaching them to use discipline and teamwork. The project will help them to transfer the lessons learnt to their everyday lives when they re enter society.

title: Promoting human rights in Jamaica
description: The project aims to highlight the problems which survivors of domestic violence/gender based violence experience when they seek police intervention, and helps to develop on appropriate and sensitive intervention and response.

title: Child Rights and Protection : Strengthening the capacity of Jamaica's Office of the Children's Advocate
description: To ensure that all Jamaicans are made aware of Jamaica's obligations as a party to the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child, and assist the Children's Advocate in ensuring that Jamaica fully implements its international commitments on child rights and protection

title: Middle East Expertise Exchange with Mexico
description: To share UK expertise with Mexico on Islamist extremism, geo-political instability and initiate a dialogue that aims to influence Mexico's international priorities

title: Improve Mexico's ability to tackle cyber-crime and Child Sexual Exploitation by providing UK best practice and training
description: To promote UK expertise and best practice on cyber security with the Presidency (which champions cyber policy in Mexico) and the Federal Police, by delivering tailored training

title: Sustainable development events at the British Houses during the Rio 2016 Olympic & Paralympic Games.
description: Contribute towards venue costs and specific events at the British Houses that help to foster sustainable development in Brazil and broaden cooperation in areas such as sport for development, biodiversity, climate, nutrition, diversity and inclusion.

title: Development events around the Rio 2016 Paralympic Games
description: The UK Government organised a range of events around the Rio 2016 Paralympic Games to advance the work of the Brazilian Government and civil society on climate change and the environment, education, paralympic legacy development, and human rights. The events also promoted the UK's interests in these areas, and contributed to promoting trade and investment between the UK and Brazil.

title: Raising awareness of human trafficking in Peru
description: The project aims to tackle human trafficking and reduce the risk to vulnerable groups by conducting a campaign in the public school system to raise secondary students' awareness about human trafficking.

title: Strengthening Prosperity and Stability in a Vulnerable Community in Lima through English Language Training and Teaching
description: This project will improve language learning for 1600 students in Manchay through delivering education best-practice training and language training for 8 teachers.

title: Strengthening Peruvian government delivery of prosperity and transparency priorities
description: To design and implement a Delivery Unit designed under UK's model and with British expertise to support Peru's new government monitor key prosperity and transparency indicators (Health, Formalization, Citizen security, anti corruption, water and sanitation and infrastructure)

title: Supporting Disaster Relief in Peru
description: To support disaster relief in Peru following El Nino disaster

title: Promoting education in Panama
description: To support development of skills among Panama's school children through involvement with public speaking competitions between schools, promoting participation and supporting delivery.

title: Capacity building for Public Private Partnerships in Panama
description: Sharing best practice from the UK in order to support Central American governments in developing a robust approach to Public Private Partnerships that will deliver improved social infrastructure, thereby facilitating economic growth and improving value in government investment.

title: Best practice in science curriculum and teacher training for basic level education in Panama
description: The Science Secretariat will use best UK practice to inform its reform of the science curriculum and teacher training for basic level education.

title: Establish a new model of Smart Urban Regeneration in Panama
description: Establish a new model of urban regeneration and infrastructure development to catalyse economic revitalisation and improved social cohesion.

title: Strengthening transparency systems and rule of law in Panama's public governance
description: UK experts to provide advice and support, including best practice and tools, to improve transparency in Panama's public sector, and to promote effective implementation of upcoming transparency legislation, thereby strengthening the rule of law in Panama.

title: Increasing transparency in public procurement by building capacity of citizen participation
description: Build capacity of emerging civil society leaders at key municipalities, developing their understanding of the recent decentralisation law.

title: Assistance to develop Panama's vocational skills sector
description: To develop a roadmap for national participation in Panama's new vocational education system, improving opportunities in the country's employment market.

title: Expertise for development of overarching transparency legislation
description: Provide UK expertise to consult on the development of over-arching legislation on a range of anti-corruption and transparency issues.

title: Using UK expertise to improve the planning and structuring of infrastructure projects
description: Introduce and transfer UK knowledge applied to technical and financial structuring of Public-Private Partnership projects to Panamanian public agencies in order to improve the delivery of new infrastructure.

title: Preliminary feasibility study to promote sustainable urban mobility solutions in Panama
description: Implement a pilot project to test urban mobility solutions in Panama, promoting a more sustainable transport network.

title: Agriculture Technical Institutes Teacher Develop Programme
description: Research the content and learning outcomes required to develop a bespoke training programme in Agriculture and English language for teachers of Panama's technical institutes of agriculture.

title: Capacity building in Panama's logistics sector
description: Share UK expertise to strengthen Panama's logistics capabilities, helping Panama maximise the benefit of the Canal Expansion and further diversify its economy by strengthening the country's skills base.

title: Strengthening financial reform in Paraguay
description: A project providing strategic advice to the Central Bank of Paraguay on the development of a Financial Stability Council aimed at improving accountability, transparency, and the business climate

title: Developing entrepreneurship in Paraguay
description: Help Paraguay develop an entrepreneurship culture and commercial opportunities for British businesses through a one week intensive course given by a UK implementer with a strong focus on mentorship with British companies.

title: Strengthen rule of law by combating terrorism and organised crime in Paraguay's Tri-Border Area
description: To ensure that terrorists and other criminals cannot finance their activities or launder the proceeds of their crimes through the physical cross-border transportation of currency and bearer negotiable instruments

title: Education World Forum
description: This project will allow the British Embassy in Asuncion to expand educational links between the UK and Paraguay. The project will lead to an improvement in education infrastructure in Paraguay, thus leading to poverty reduction.

title: Canning House Programme 16/17 - raising awareness and knowledge of Latin America
description: To drive membership and facilitate business in Latin America; to help raise awareness and knowledge of Latin America via the Canning House Lecture and Conference

title: Promoting development of financial services in Latin America
description: A seminar attended by business, Latin American diplomats and UK officials to discuss with the Lord Mayor of London his analysis of the challenges and opportunities for the development of financial services

title: Northern Ireland and Colombia  a strategic partnership
description: This project will share with Colombia key changes in its educational and policing policies and as a result, will set Colombia on the path to reform in these two areas.

title: Latin American Investment Forum 2016
description: Co-funding for an international conference to promote trade and investment in Latin America, supporting the region's economic development

title: Strengthening research collaboration between the UK and Latin America to drive innovation and economic development
description: Hold a Wilton Park conference to build better mutual understanding of synergies and common areas of interest and priority areas in order to provide opportunties for collaboration, identify key initiatives, to drive innovation, and enhance scientific collaboration across the region.

title: Caribbean 2030: New thinking for a new generation III
description: To improve governance in the Caribbean by further developing the network of Young Caribbean leaders established at the Wilton Park conference in 2015

title: Strengthening networks of future leaders from the Americas through policy-based engagement
description: This project will create opportunities for Chevening scholars from the Americas to meet and discuss key policy issues in their countries, and facilitate a network of future leaders who can learn from each other

title: Assessment of waste-to-energy solutions for the Caribbean using UK expertise.
description: To provide a detailed assessment on feasible waste-to-energy solutions for the Caribbean using UK expertise, offering an innovative and technologically advanced solution to three serious challenges facing the Caribbean: energy security, waste management and sargassum disposal

title: Caribbean Anti-Corruption and Financial Crime Prevention  Regional Initiative 2016/17
description: This project will provide targeted technical assistance to the Caribbean's anti-corruption and financial crime prevention efforts

title: INSTITUTIONAL STRENGTHENING OF THE JAMAICAN REVENUE PROTECTION DIVISION
description: To increase transparency and good governance in Jamaica, by modernising the Revenue Protection Division ('RPD') and enhancing their capacity to tackle corruption by investigating cases of fraud against the revenue

title: Provision of technical assistance to the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) in the fight against vector borne diseases.
description: to provide technical assistance to CARPHA to assist the Caribbean region's response to the ZIKA virus.

title: Regional workshop for industry and policy makers: The Caribbean Sugar Industry Post-2017
description: This project will bring senior sugar industry decision makers and Government policy makers across the Caribbean together to focus on the practical options to support the industry through changes expected in 2017, and different approaches to the industry to make it commercially viable.

title: Energy efficiency benchmarking system
description: Achieve Uruguayan National Energy Policy goals for reducing energy consumption in tertiary sector buildings.

title: Developing Uruguayan Agritech Sector
description: To impact decision making in improving agricultural policies and tackling market barriers in order to increase exports and economic growth

title: Strengthening state owned Engineering Faculty capabilities in technology transfer in Uruguay
description: To provide capabilities in technology transfer platforms based on University of Liverpool best practice examples in order to boost the productive sector in Uruguay.

title: Preventing Corruption in Public Works
description: A better prepared Commission for the creation of institutional policies and procedures to reduce opportunities for fraud, corruption and collusion in the contracting of public works

title: Contract control mechanisms for Public-Private Partnerships
description: To support the Uruguay Government in setting up a proactive, practical and constructive Contract Management Policy for the management of Public-Private Partnerships contracts that deliver infrastructure projects' objectives and Value for Money outcomes

title: Increase National Assembly expertise on parliamentary best practice
description: Strengthen Venezuelan parliament's institutional capacity by running UK expertise sharing workshops for members of the Venezuelan National Assembly. It will focus on parliamentary structure, decision making and transparency.

title: Enabling Venezuelan decision makers to reduce subsidies of Liquefied Petroleum Gas.
description: Enable key decision makers (in both Government and the National Assembly) to scale back LPG subsidies by estimating the distributional impact and transaction costs associated with this subsidy for low-income communities

title: Promoting the design and implementation of a Climate Change plan in Venezuela
description: Climate change scientists, government authorities, and Indigenous leaders to design a national Climate Change action plan to integrate local solutions and scientific research into the government's policy

title: Enhancing access to public information and transparency in Venezuela
description: This project will promote transparency and accountability in Venezuela, through improved capacity of civil society to base investigations on open data. The project's main outcome is an online tool summarising open data from key institutions.

title: Build Venezuela's capacity to responsibly develop their enormous offshore gas sector, using UK expertise
description: This project will strengthen Venezuela's capacity in developing offshore gas , establishing a robust and environmentally sound offshore gas industry through technical assistance from the UK.

title: STRENGTHENING THE CAPACITY OF VENEZUELAN JOURNALISTS TO REPORT ON HUMAN RIGHTS
description: Use UK expertise to strengthen the capacity of Venezuelan journalists to report accurately on human rights through the use of digital tools

title: Tackling violence against women and girls in Venezuela.
description: Build the capacity of civil society and local government institutions to map and tackle gender-based violence in Venezuela, through the creation of a national observation and action network

title: Grant-in-aid to Great Britain and China Centre
description: This grant-in-aid will be used to promote mutual trust and understanding between the UK and China through dialogue and the promotion of rule of law, good governance and sustainable development.

title: Capacity building for young leaders to promote regional stability in SE Asia
description: Working with the UK's International Institute for Strategic Studies, to help members of a new generation of strategic thinkers from the ASEAN region engage more closely in policy-relevant debate over some of the most important strategic challenges facing the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Inception of the National Assembly of Laos' Institute for Legislative Studies
description: This project aims to increase the Lao National Assembly and Provincial Peoples' Assemblies' confidence and capacity in lawmaking (reviewing/drafting effective laws) and representation (better representing the interests and aspirations of constituents) by strengthening the research capacity of the newly established Institute of Legislative Studies.

title: Strengthening Rights Protections for Refugees, migrants and survivors of trafficking in ASEAN
description: This project will increase access to legal protection and prevent the abusive detention of refugees and survivors of trafficking in SE Asia while improving public understanding of these groups, to deliver UK migration objectives in the region.

title: Support for regional programme to develop the capability of senior leaders from the commercial, public and not-for-profit sectors in ASEAN, to tackle the challenge of developing "smart cities".
description: To connect and develop a network of ASEAN's senior leaders to develop their capacity and collaboration to solve the region's challenges and opportunities at the national and regional level, with a focus on the sustainable development of "smart cities" focusing on good governance, urban planning, the environment, physical and social infrastructure and use of technology.

title: International Regional Anti-Corruption Week
description: To raise awareness and standards of Anti Money Laundering and Anti Corruption legislation among Government and Financial Sectors across Asia.

title: Southeast Asian Ministers of Education Organization - Annual Associate Membership Contribution
description: Annual contribution for the UK's associate membership of the Southeast Asian Ministers of Education Organization

title: ASEAN cultural mapping to increase individual members? capacity to use soft power in pursuing their objectives and building their prosperity
description: Seeks to explore how ASEAN's contemporary cultural landscape contributes to a distinctive ASEAN narrative to identify and understand the ASEAN model of networked soft power. This awareness and understanding will build and strengthen the cultural capacity to use soft power of individual member States, as well of ASEAN itself. The networks created through this project will also enable each country to develop their research capability and continue to share best practice to sustain the impact of the reports and lessons learnt as their findings are implemented.

title: Youth employment, leadership and entrepreneurship training in Cambodia
description: This project delivers an employment and social entrepreneurship expert meeting on youth employment? and capacity training on leadership and entrepreneurship.

title: Environmental protection in Burma
description: This project aims to reduce the illegal and unsustainable hunting and trade of wildlife for meat in Burma by establishing a network with core institutions.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in China
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in China.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in China
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in China.

title: Promoting economic growth and opportunities in China by identifying best practice and policy issues in new energy innovation
description: This project will support Chinese economic growth looking at best practice for innovation within the new energy sector one of its "Strategic Emerging Industries" sectors identified to drive economic growth.

title: Improving sustainable healthcare in Zhejiang and Shanghai
description: This project will introduce and evaluate a sustainable training programme for community staff working in primary care in Zhejiang and Shanghai that aims to improve screening, case identification and interventions for elderly individuals with mental health problems living in the community. This provides future options for the delivery of healthcare services in China, and future research and commercial engagement for UK organisations.

title: Building capacity in the big data sector
description: The project aims to establish a network for collaboration on "big data" based research and innovation, sharing expertise from the UK and providing a channel for policy advice and exchange.

title: Improving protection of intellectual property in research and innovation in China
description: This project will publish bilingual resources containing practical advice and model contracts on intellectual property for participants in UK China collaborative research and innovation projects, increasing China's capacity to conduct international collaborative projects, and improving protection of intellectual property of UK entities working with China.

title: Improving regulatory awareness of climate risks in the Chinese insurance system
description: This project aims to open up new areas of collaboration with insurance institutes in China and build their knowledge on the relationship between climate change and insurance. This project will also help to open the market to UK insurance companies in areas such as training, modelling and providing new products.

title: Supporting long term planning for China's low carbon transition
description: The project aims to assist China in developing a roadmap for energy transition ambitious enough to achieve current global carbon reduction targets.

title: Helping develop sustainable and resilient infrastructure in Burma
description: A joint project with Japan to develop government capacity on infrastructure development. Through workshops and site visits, the project will use UK expertise to deepen Burmese and donor understanding on urban infrastructure development and regional connectivity.

title: Strengthening cooperation between the UK and Malaysia to address key issues around food security
description: This project aims to strengthen the Malaysian government's support for agricultural diversification to address the issue of food security and climate change and to influence policy decisions in this area. The project will support UK participation at a symposium to develop a Global Action Plan for Agriculture Diversification that meets specific Sustainable Development Goals.

title: Enhancing accountability and good governance in the Philippines through the promotion of fiscal transparency in business
description: This project aims to produce a 10 point list of recommendations to improve fiscal transparency in business operations and governance to be given to the next administration. It facilitates a series of targeted activities in partnership with the Makati Business Club (MBC) including the participation of UK firms to mitigate risks in high value projects in the Philippines.

title: Improving Vietnam patients' access to quality healthcare
description: The project will engage, through workshops, with health policy makers and opinion formers to ensure that policies are developed which will allow Vietnamese people to have sustainable and fast access to innovative, high quality and safe medicines. The project is run in collaboration with the Vietnamese Ministry of Health and with the local pharmaceutical sector trade association which includes UK companies operating in Vietnam among its membership.

title: Combating the wild meat trade in Burma
description: This project aims to strengthen cooperation linkages among selected trade related institutions of Myanmar in order to establish an inter institutional framework for trade related information sharing which will reduce illegal and unsustainable hunting and the trade of wildlife for meat.

title: Voter education in Burma
description: This project aims to promote democracy through voter education implemented by local organisations in Burmese regions.

title: Promoting greater awareness of human rights, through a series of films and related events, to reach a broader cross section of Burmese society
description: This project will promote human rights awareness by using the power of film and the persuasive strength of audio-visual communication is to build a society where all people are able to live in dignity and to create a space for encouraging human rights discussions amongst the general public in Burma

title: Working to ensure the human rights of those affected by leprosy and disabilities are respected in Burma.
description: To provide support to people with disability and people affected by leprosy to exercise their rights under national legislation as well as their human rights under international law to enable them to have improved opportunities in Burma and access to services

title: Strengthening Burma's democratic process by encouraging stronger civic engagement in society working through the British Council's Active Citizens Programme
description: Develop and support active citizen engagement in Burma's nascent democratic process to enable a better informed populace who can strengthen their engagement with the government and other state institutions during the transition to improve governance and enable a peaceful and democratic society

title: Promoting Civic Participation in Parliaments by raising parliamentary awareness among ordinary people and increasing their contact with MPs while promoting the UK's democratic values agenda
description: Supporting awareness training in rural communities to help them understand basic human rights and constitutional issues as well as the process and procedure of Parliament to better equip them to advocate for their concerns with their local MPs, thereby improving MP representation of their concerns in Parliament

title: Promoting the Rule of Law and respect for human rights in Burma through the training of Burmese lawyers
description: This project will improve the skills and capabilities of lawyers defending human rights of vulnerable population, and thus enhance justice, peace and stability in the country.

title: Delivering good governance in Burma's financial sector through the launch of a good governance toolkit
description: The purpose of the project is to develop, pilot and disseminate an easy to use anti-corruption toolkit that supports organisations that work in Burma and their staff to combat corruption more effectively.

title: Support awareness raising of the Khmer Rouge Tribunal in Cambodia
description: Support to the Khmer Rouge Tribunal in Cambodia in building awareness of sexual and gender-based violence perpetrated during the Khmer Rouge period in the 1970s, in order to prevent such violence in modern-day Cambodia.

title: Promoting awareness and access to Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths (STEM) education opportunities in Cambodia
description: To continue our advocacy and support for Science,Technology, Engineering and Maths education across Cambodia to raise awareness of the extraordinary opportunities for those with qualifications in this field and to fill the continued and chronic skills gap which is vital for accelerating Cambodia's development.

title: A portfolio of projects on priority areas including civil society, rule of law, and sustainable development
description: These projects promoted the rule of law in China by influencing reform initiatives through sharing UK best practice. Two further projects enhanced democracy and transparency by delivering an improved legislative environment for NGOs and deepening engagement with local government. Two further projects support sustainable economic development, environmental protection, and low carbon growth by feeding UK recommendations and expertise into provincial level 'five year plans', promotion of market mechanisms, and leverage of private capital to support sustainable development.

title: Strengthening the rule of law in China
description: This project aims to influence the reform of the rule of law in China through dialogue and network building to broaden engagement .

title: Building influence with political and economic decision makers
description: This project aims to deliver a portfolio of projects to build better relationships with key Chinese State influencers with the objective of supporting China's development drawing on UK best practice.

title: Development of independent civil society in China
description: This project aims to support the development of independent civil society in China through influencing new NGO legislation, training for NGOs working on key social issues including domestic violence and HIV, and promoting United Nations international human rights days.

title: Engaging China on security and conflict reduction issues
description: This project aims to deliver a portfolio of projects to help China responsibly engage on foreign policy, including in the Middle East through dialogue, influence and experience sharing

title: Promoting human rights in Chinese Provinces
description: These projects aim to support sustainable and inclusive local economic and core public service development, environmental and human rights objectives in Chinese provinces through education initiatives.

title: UK outreach in East China
description: These projects aim to work with NGOs to promote the rights of children and women in East China.

title: Empowering civil society to challenge discrimination against people living with HIV and to reduce HIV infection rates
description: Through medical rights based advocacy develop HIV-friendly hospitals and doctors, and motivate government officials to establish new policies for people living with HIV to get access to better healthcare services in northeast China.

title: LGBTI Policy Advocacy and Capacity Building
description: This project aims to build the advocacy capacity of LGBTI activists through skills sessions and forums to encourage more advocacy cases seeking equal rights and help secure positive outcomes. It also develops capacity for cooperation in this area through an impact litigation case.

title: Using UK expertise to influence judicial reform in China
description: To better influence China's rule of law process through deepening understanding of judicial reform and enhancing UK experience/expertise sharing with China.

title: Improving access to justice for victims of gender based violence among most vulnerable women and girls in China.
description: This project will empower women access justice and legal officials more responsive to women's rights and needs through a workshop on awareness raising and capacity on gender based violence as well as through partnerships with a grassroots organizations.

title: Building the capacity of women to play a better leadership role in Chinese civil society.
description: Develop Chinese civil society, with a focus on NGOs working on women's rights, The project will invite 4 women's rights activists from second and third tier Chinese cities to Beijing for a month long program that will deliver skills training, networking and education to participants.

title: To use UK expertise to improve healthcare and family planning in Xi'an
description: To bring healthcare innovation experience and know-how from Sheffield to Xi'an in collaboration with the Xi'an Municipal Commission of Healthcare & Family Planning. It may also raise the profile of the digital healthcare innovation sector in the UK with the potential benefit is that Xi'an will use at least one of the innovations in their new hospitals within the next five years Furthermore, it will strengthen and build the relationship between Xi'an district and Sheffield City Region.

title: Using UK expertise to improve healthcare in Guangdong province.
description: This project will organise knowledge-sharing seminars in Guangdong, delivered by UK experts from the NHS and/or RCGP to encourage future China-UK collaboration in health policy, social care and employment.

title: Promoting effective safeguards for prisoners' rights during pre-trial detention
description: This project aims to tackle the use of forced confession and other forms of ill-treatment during criminal pre-trial detention in China's criminal justice system through a pilot project working with the police bureau in Yunnan Province in China. It is expected that the project will provide a frame of reference for further amendments to the Criminal Procedure Law in China.

title: Capacity building for Chinese LGBT rights leaders to improve the protection of human rights in China, supporting the UK's objective for safer, more inclusive and more prosperous societies
description: This project aims to build capacity for Chinese LGBT rights leaders through organising the 2016 China LGBTI Community Leader Conference to encourage discussions between 70 NGO leaders in this area. This is supplemented by training on best-practice in advocacy. This work delivers against FCO China Network goals on human rights.

title: Supporting Peaceful Settlement of Disputes
description: This project aims to contribute to strengthening of the rules-based international system (RBIS) through a roundtable with senior Chinese, UK, and global experts. This contributes to the skills development of Chinese legal capabilities and strengthens the foundation for Chinese attitudes to the RBIS.

title: Women and young entrepreneurs in Yunnan
description: Using UK experience to provide capacity building for women and young entrepreneurs in Yunnan, increasing business participation, and thereby promoting a more transparent and open economy

title: Sustainable development of historical districts in Wuhan
description: Using UK expertise to promote sustainable development of historical districts in Wuhan, creating opportunities for UK business.

title: UK-China Forum on bilateral co-operation on Reform and Innovation.
description: The forum will develop UK-China co-operation in economic growth and innovation, leading to improved and more sustainable economic growth in China.

title: Promoting gender equality and diversity through cooperation with Chinese civil society.
description: A combination of educational conferences, workshops and personnel exchanges to promote women's rights and diversity in China. The project enables the greater participation of marginalised groups in Chinese society in line with the UK's commitment to supporting the better protection of human rights. We will educate on the positive role that diversity and inclusion can play in supporting sustainable economic development. This takes place in the context of tightening space for civil society and the introduction of restrictive foreign NGO law. Gender equality and diversity are UK priority objectives.

title: Building capacity for Chinese UN peacekeepers by teaching them technical English through the UK College of Policing.
description: Provide training to enhance inter-operability of Chinese peacekeepers with other international troops by teaching them technical English through the UK College of Policing.

title: Promoting and developing social enterprises in China, improving the effectiveness of the non-profit sector and supporting the growth of Chinese civil society
description: This project will create an online, Mandarin language, platform, providing skills and knowledge development to social enterprises across China, promoting the growth and development of the non-profit sector and placing it on a more sustainable footing. This will help strengthen a key civil society strand.

title: Using UK expertise to promote and influence the implementation of China's new Domestic Violence law
description: This project aims to influence and promote China's new domestic violence law, through targeted seminars and discussions with key Chinese academics and NGOs. These activities strive to positively influence the capacity of attendees to tackle domestic violence.

title: Targeted training to residents of migration 'hot-spots' in Fujian province, to help them set up on-line businesses and thereby reduce illegal migration to the UK
description: This project provides e-commerce coaching to 20 migrants who have been returned from the UK and 50 college students from Fuqing County. This is aimed at improving business skills, which will help start up businesses to succeed and so help address illegal migration including to the UK.

title: Strengthening the engagement of civil society in sustainable and environmental development work across Guangxi Province
description: This project will increase awareness and support for environmental education in China by casting a light upon the achievements of groups (such as BRC) and fostering public and government support for their interventions. In the longer-term a growing awareness of environmental groups and growing public interest (and participation in) conservation work not only will lead to positive impacts on environmental and economic well-being, but may also will enhance the UK's relationship with the Guangxi government and promote UK universities to students.

title: Promotion of Global Building Information Modelling (BIM) standards and management training to increase sustainability of rapid urbanisation in South West China
description: Our project aims to support China's rapid urbanisation and infrastructure development - leveraging the UK's BIM policy and management skills in low carbon, energy-saving and sustainable development for the Architecture, Engineering and Construction industries. Our project will mainly include UK-China collaboration under the One Belt One Road OBOR initiative on infrastructure; and provision of high quality BIM management training to help improve local and national BIM practise and its development in Southwest China.

title: Ending demand for Ivory, leading to a reduction in the Illegal Wildlife Trade in Africa, and a more sustainable economy in China
description: To educate young Chinese, especially university students, on the harmful effects of the illegal wildlife trade, so they can influence others, thereby reducing demand in China for ivory

title: Exposing Chinese Communist Party institutions to UK best practice on governance, policy making and capacity building, to improve their transparency and effectiveness
description: Using UK expertise to encourage a more transparent and accountable culture within the Chinese Communist Party, which should lead to more transparency and improved governance in Chinese society.

title: Training Teachers in China to better support vulnerable children, particularly those with absent parents
description: Organising workshops to extend a training programme to teachers in rural areas who deal with vulnerable children, particularly left behind children'

title: Developing the capacity of non-government organisations to help Chinese civil society in the international sphere, which is consistent with the UK's positions on civil society and the rules based international system.
description: Developing the capacity of non-government organisations to help Chinese civil society in the international sphere, which is consistent with the UK's positions on civil society and the rules based international system. This will support the UK's interests in a more transparent and open civil society, as well as furthering work on a rules-based international system

title: Hubei Party School Capacity Building to support Hubei climate change development
description: Using UK expertise to help Hubei Province develop low carbon policies that should reduce global Greenhouse Gas emissions, and increase opportunities for British companies

title: Countering the root causes of violent extremism undermining growth and stability in China's Xinjiang Region by sharing UK best practice
description: RUSI will organise a one day Track 2 Dialogue in Beijing bringing together UK experts on CVE with Chinese officials and academics working on these issues in Xinjiang to demonstrate the effectiveness of UK best practice in CVE and identify ways this can be adopted in China.

title: Training young people in Guangdong to actively participate and resolve social issues such as LGBT rights, labour rights and social justice
description: This project aims to help increase the participation of young people (aged 15-30) in problem-solving and social change by firstly raising their awareness of social issues

title: Supporting journalists to work more closely with civil society in China, in order to raise awareness of pressing social issues.
description: Developing a network of media professionals that can support public debate and raise awareness of civil society issues in China, such as human rights, labour rights, LGBT rights and social justice

title: Developing the use of mediation to tackle workplace disputes in China, thereby supporting labour rights and helping to reduce the incidence of strike action
description: The project will develop mediation approaches to help local businesses implement labour rights (e.g. pay, overtime, safe working conditions and employee welfare)

title: Media Workshop to improve the reporting of gender issues in the Chinese media
description: Raise standards on the reporting of gender issues within Chinese media, including enhancing understanding of gender equality and violence against women in China and improving capacity.

title: Promoting and developing female leadership in business to support inclusive economic growth in China.
description: This project will work to identify, encourage, and develop women in leadership positions in China, through engaging businesses to provide mentorship opportunities, with subsequent benefits for a more transparent economy

title: Promoting LGBT Rights by training and establishing new volunteers for existing support networks in Southwest China.
description: This project will train volunteers in South West China so they can set up and operate LGBT support networks to better combat discrimination, leading to a more inclusive and transparent society.

title: Capacity building in China's judiciary, to strengthen links with the UK judicial system, and support a reformed and more effective legal system.
description: To support the development of the rule of law in China, through interchange with the UK judicial system and Ministry of Justice, with the aim of introducing reforms

title: Supporting healthcare reform and material improvement of health outcomes in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region.
description: This project will provide a unique opportunity for the UK to influence and support healthcare reform in Ningxia by introducing UK/National Health Service (NHS) expertise as a total healthcare solution in order to enhance the delivery of primary healthcare, encourage greater efficiency in the local healthcare system and improve the lives of citizens in this less developed region of North West China.

title: Developing green finance in Guangdong, China in support of global climate change objectives.
description: This project aims to tackle climate change, in line with FCO objectives, by improving Guangdong Province's ability to develop a green finance system. Senior UK expertise in green finance bonds will be introduced in order to tackle climate change in China. Secondarily, this will likely assist further cooperation between the UK and China in this area.

title: Reviewing and projecting Guangdong's Carbon Dioxide Capture, Utilisation and Storage (CCUS) development through a conference run by the UK-China CCUS Centre to further support and encourage the use of CCUS as a primary low carbon option for China
description: Through a high level conference, this project aims to review Carbon Dioxide Capture, Utilisation and Storage (CCUS) development in China; to mark breakthroughs in collaboration on CO2 capturing technologies and offshore storage preparation; and to maintain momentum so that CCUS is ensured as a cost-effective mitigation option for China so as to meet the 2 C target for global warming.

title: Promoting public awareness of LGBTQ rights across Chinese society
description: This project will support the LGBTQ network in China by promoting the use of mediation to heal familial rifts, thereby allowing those families to become positive role models. Delivering against FCO goals to support equal rights for LGBTQ people.

title: Promoting the rights of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) people in China through the high-school education system.
description: This project aims to support LGBTQ people and human rights in China via educational training events for China high-school teachers. It delivers against our objectives to provide better protection for human rights and improve the environment for UK companies and citizens in China. We aim to raise awareness of the UK's inclusive norms and values, providing education that is not readily available in the host country.

title: Advancing democratic reform in Burma
description: This project supports democratic reform in Burma through visits by UK experts to build capacity and provide English language training to government officials. Visits include a joint programme of the Supreme Court, Judicial Appointments Commission and Association of Women Judges to look at rule of law and judicial sector reform, and a visit by UK women MPs to deliver tailored capacity building to women MPs in Burma's parliament as part of their wider parliamentary induction.

title: Grant-in-aid to Great Britain and China Centre
description: This grant-in-aid will be used to promote mutual trust and understanding between the UK and China through dialogue and the promotion of rule of law, good governance and sustainable development.

title: To provide funding to the Solomon Islands Paralympic team at the Pacific Games in Port Moresby, thereby raising the profile of the team to improve public perceptions of disability
description: The Paralympic team is significantly underfunded. There is a keen desire to build on the success of the SI team who went to the London 2012 games and the High Commission continues to support the progress of the Para athletes who face significant difficulties in accessing support for their sports.

title: Supporting economic development in Laos through improving capacity of Central Bank
description: Capacity building to Bank of Laos on forecasting and risk assessment in the banking sector. Staff will be trained in 'Systemic Risk Assessment' at Centre for Central Banking Studies, the Bank of England.

title: Improving educational standards in Cambodia
description: These projects aim to promote science, technology, engineering and maths careers in Cambodia by providing hands on science experiences which will inspire children, particularly girls, to consider future careers in engineering.

title: Supporting regulatory reform in the Indonesian energy sector
description: Delivering energy security improvements in Indonesia through supporting them to identify and implement regulatory reforms to create a level playing field for competition and private sector investment.

title: Promoting debate on climate change choices in Indonesia
description: Create platforms and opportunities to revitalise engagement with, and discussion of, the recommendations of the new Climate Economy report, tailored to Indonesia's domestic context, with the aim of informing the thinking of policy makers and those in positions of influence.

title: Capacity Building for Indonesian Human Rights Organisation to support community-based initiatives and human rights campaigns in Indonesia
description: Transforming the impact and sustainability of 20-25 selected human organisations through tailored capacity building and mentoring

title: Promoting Moderate Islam in Indonesia through UK/Indonesia exchanges to Counter Extremist Ideologies and Reduce Terrorist Threats
description: Support and enhance Islamic educational standards in Indonesian Islamic schools and universities by building academic links and initiating dialogue on moderate Islam via exchanges between British and Indonesian Muslim educational practitioners, teachers, academics and young activists, to counter extremist ideology
