title: Supporting reforms in Indonesia's prisons to minimise conditions enabling the spread of violent extremism and reducing the number of radicalised individuals both in prison and on release
description: To provide support to the process of reform and management of extremist offenders underway in Indonesian prisons to prevent the spread of violent extremism to other prisoners thereby reducing the threat from radicalised individuals.

title: Promoting good governance and transparency in Indonesia
description: An experts forum to promote best practice in corruption eradication in key areas of local government in Indonesia such as devolved budget

title: Indonesian E-Public Consultation to increase public participation in policy decision making
description: The project aims to strengthen good governance in Indonesia by increasing public participation in policy decision making processes. It will provide capacity building for National Law Development Agency (BPHN) officials and civil society, facilitating implementation of the e-Public Consultation initiative to international standards, and empowering civil society as active champions for public consultation.

title: Support to strengthen the capability of Islamic schools in Indonesia to promote human rights
description: Strengthening the capacity of Islamic Schools in Indonesia to promote human rights and to counter extremism and religious radicalism in the school curriculum and, through community engagement by the schools, to spread these messages into surrounding communities to prevent extremism and radicalisation

title: Limiting use of death sentence in Indonesia in the revised Penal Code
description: This project aims to Influence the Indonesian Government and Parliament to limit the death sentence provisions in the current work on revising the Indonesian Penal Code.

title: Training Senegalese peacekeepers to prevent and tackle sexual conflict, jointly with Japan
description: In conjonction with the Japanese Embassy in Dakar, and through a key NGO based in Senegal (FAS-Femme Africa Solidarity), the project aims to work with the Senegalese military in order to improve the pre-deployment training given to Senegalese peacekeepers, ensuring that they are better prepared to respond to cases of sexual violence in conflict.

title: Improving cooperation on gender participation and equality in African peace building through event organised by UK and Japan.
description: A UK-Japan organised event at the sixth Tokyo International Conference on African Development (TICAD) in Nairobi addressing how governments, experts and civil society can work together to promote gender equality and women's empowerment in African peacebuilding.

title: Improving Angola's economic development by clearing mine fields and increasing available agricultural land, co-funded with Japan and Norway
description: This project supports demining activities and the release of land in the Province of Malanje by the Norwegian People's Aid (NPA). The funding allows NPA mine clearance teams to access mission-critical protective gear and enhanced communications equipment as well as contributes to the return of family farming practices in Malanje.

title: Build capacity in Asian countries to support sexual violence survivors and children born of rape, working with the UN and Japan.
description: This project will produce a report based on research conducted and expert group meetings on whether and how NAP have addressed the needs of sexual violence survivors (in accessing healthcare and livelihood programmes).

title: Countering Violent Extremism Through Community Policing
description: Strengthening Indonesian CVE response by equipping police operating at community level to recognise and mitigate violent extremism thereby contributing to a decrease in the number of new recruits engaging in terror activities in Indonesia mitigating the serious risk posed by the return of terrorist offenders/Syria alumni to communities (through CVE training).

title: Human Rights Dialogue between the UK and China, 2016
description: This project funded the UK/China Human Rights Dialogue in London in October 2016. This is the primary bilateral event on Human Rights between UK & China and enables the UK to discuss, in depth and in detail, the full range of its Human Rights concerns with the Chinese authorities. The dialogue includes an expert workshop that allows academic and intellectual engagement between UK and Chinese experts - this year the expert workshop was on the benefit of an active civil society (a key UK priority).

title: Visit by the President of China's Supreme People's Court, Zhou Qiang
description: Visit of Supreme People's Court of China President Zhou Qiang. The purpose of the visit is to strengthen UK-China rule of law cooperation and elevate the level of UK-China judicial cooperation

title: Increasing understanding of gender based violence in Laos and encouraging the Lao Government's engagement on the Preventing Sexual Violence in Conflict Initiative (PSVI), promoting UK values.
description: Support to the Lao government in developing and implementing its policies on gender-based and domestic violence both to improve national efforts to address these issues and also to encourage Laos to sign up to the Preventing Sexual Violence Initiative.

title: Support development
description: Following a needs assessment conducted by the British Council with the Lao Ministry of Education, this project will support the development of a strategic planning framework for the Lao education curriculum and a Centre of Excellence

title: Strengthening Lao PDR's policy on small and medium-sized enterprises in tourism and hospitality.
description: The three research studies of this project strengthen Lao Government policy making, by supporting and informing current efforts by the Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism's to improve the business environment for Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs).

title: Capacity building in Lao PDR's tourism and hospitality industry through better health and safety policies, regulations and monitoring.
description: The project covered a comprehensive health and safety assessment of the Lao tourism industry, informing a review of Lao PDR's standards and policies by the Lao Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism. Improved health and safety standards, policies and monitoring would make Laos a more attractive tourism destination and thereby contribute to economic development.

title: Providing capacity to support Laos' attempts to combat money laundering, helping to improve economic development and support wider UK interests
description: Training 40 Customs Officers from across Laos in methods to identify and disrupt bulk cash transfers. This will reduce Laos' vulnerability to money laundering, thereby contributing to wider efforts to tackle corruption.

title: Strengthening education in Laos through improving teaching of English language
description: The project will fund the provision of an Educational Governance Assessment Advisor to the Lao government. The Advisor will work with the Ministry of Education and develop a series of recommendations to facilitate the roll out of the government's plans to enhance English language teaching.

title: Enhancing economic development by tackling money laundering in Laos
description: The project will train 90 prosecutors and judges from across Laos in Laos' new anti money laundering penal code provisions. This will enable greater numbers of prosecutions to take place, thereby stimulating the improved business environment necessary to assist Laos' ambitions to grow its economy and reduce poverty.

title: Enhancing economic development in Laos by developing the tourism sector, using UK expertise
description: The project will fund three UK academics to run training workshops on tourism marketing and development in Laos. This will enhance the Lao tourism strategy 2016/17. Tourism is the major sector in the Lao economy for job creation and therefore provides the most significant potential to contribute to poverty reduction.

title: Developing Lao economy by creating a credit reporting and monitoring system, working with Japan
description: This project will focus on making financial services in Lao PDR more affordable, convenient and efficient. This is possible by strengthening the country's critical financial infrastructure to improve the quality and ease of access to credit information, which will reduce information asymmetry and the cost of financial transactions for both lenders and borrowers. It will open up more opportunities for investment including from British companies and create synergies between Lao PDR and UK.

title: Building the capacity of the Malaysian semi-skilled corporate and vocational labour force on Management and Technical Skills using UK expertise and experiences
description: This project willto bring a group of UK education and training organisations to Sarawak and Kuala Lumpur to help address Malaysia's need for skilled workers, entrepreneurs and leaders in order to achieve developed nation status by the year 2020. This project will establish the UK as Malaysia's partner of choice for training to develop skilled workers, entrepreneurs and leaders.

title: Promoting women's engagement to support HMG's moderation and equalities objectives in Malaysia
description: Through promoting women's access to employment, this project will build senior Malaysian support for equality of representation and opportunity in Malaysia, and in so doing provide platforms for discussion of tolerance, faith, race and meritocracy, supporting the emergence of diverse talent (given ongoing preferential treatment for Malays).

title: Building capacity of Malaysian planners and policymakers on low carbon, climate resilient urban development using UK expertise and experiences
description: This project uses UK expertise to sensitise Malaysian stakeholders on what low-carbon, climate resilient urban development looks like (sharing the various UK city experiences); and identify and assess the possible risks and economic opportunities posed by a changing climate in at least two Malaysian cities.

title: Capacity building and vocational training for young future leaders and journalists in political participation, news literacy and the media
description: This project will increase political and civil participation of Malaysian youth by building knowledge, developing skills and leveraging UK expertise for training through a two-way Youth Parliament Exchange and through their ownership and delivery of a new youth-operated digital radio programme.

title: Increasing Malaysian expertise in Crisis Management
description: The project will establish a partnership between the UK's Cabinet Office Emergency Planning College (EPC) and the Malaysian National Defence University (NDU) to advise and educate Malaysian authorities on the development of their national and regional resilience capability. This project will support UK national security and prosperity objectives and further promote the UK as Malaysia's partner of choice in the security sector.

title: Capacity building in GST tax administration for Royal Malaysian Customs, using UK expertise to increase cooperation relating to the transnational crime agenda and ensuring UK businesses are transparently and professionally audited.
description: Using UK expertise, train Royal Malaysian Custom officers (RMC) from the Goods and services tax division (GST) in Tax Auditing to develop an effective and robust tax system and build capacity, thus protecting UK businesses subject to GST in Malaysia, reaffirming HMRC as Malaysia's partner of choice, and encouraging increased intelligence sharing and reciprocity in other areas of organised crime.

title: Fostering innovation and critical thinking through improved English proficiency among school children in Malaysia using literature and innovative poetry techniques
description: In line with the Malaysian government's National Education Blueprint objectives, the project aims to develop the English proficiency and critical thinking skills of school children in Malaysia

title: Strengthening the capacity of Malaysian enforcement agencies in combating illegal wildlife trade flows by enhancing current regional and international cooperation
description: To enhance and strengthen the capacity of Malaysian enforcement agencies thereby enabling them to play a more pro-active role in combating global illegal wildlife trade flow entering and transiting the country.

title: Promote rights-based and open governance values in policy making in Malaysia, using UK expertise and experience in democratisation
description: Using British expertise to assist local civil society to identify and to develop rights-based and open governance values within Malaysia's institutional and cultural framework, in order to more effectively deliver on the UK's governance and values agenda.

title: Encouraging Electoral Reform in Mongolia
description: UK technical assistance to Parliament and Mongolian Electoral Commission to increase oversight and transparency of electoral campaigns in the build up to the 2016 and 2017 elections, with a focus on campaign financing.

title: Targeted work with local and national government and the private sector, to reduce corruption risks in the Mongolian mining sector
description: This project will reduce corruption risks in the mining sector. Technical assistance will be provided on international best practice as Mongolia looks to pass a new Mining Law, a review of transparency around the issuing of mining licenses will be undertaken with the Ministry of Mines, and training will be given on responsible mining to local stakeholders and journalists.

title: Strengthening Government Communications in Mongolia, enabling it more effectively to attract overseas investment and increase exports
description: To strengthen the Government's ability to communicate effectively internationally in order to increase foreign investment and exports in support Mongolia's development objectives

title: Tackling corruption in Mongolia through business integrity and civil engagement
description: To create a more transparent and fair business environment, and to reduce public sector corruption, by enabling whistle-blowing and training businesses on anti-corruption measures

title: Supporting Mongolia's economic development by increasing access to foreign direct investment
description: This project aims to support Government of Mongolia to participate in the "Minex Asia 2016" forum and to promote Mongolia as a favoured frontier market for global investors. Its primary goal is to assist the Government of Mongolia to access foreign direct investment which is crucial for Mongolia's mining-based economy to prosper.

title: Developing Mongolian industrial mathematics capability to help Mongolia form evidence-based policies that will drive economic, industrial and environmental development
description: Form UK-Mongolia research teams focussing on the use of statistics and data science to model problems facing Mongolia such as air pollution and infectious disease controls

title: Training for DPRK government officials and exposure to British norms and values
description: This project aims to increase awareness of democratic institutions by providing a strong and sustainable programme of education, cultural links and activity based around English language teaching and training. It will highlight British objectives and promote the merits of engaging more constructively with the rest of the world.. This expenditure covers the training course costs.

title: Improved access to functional rehabilitation services for DPRK citizens outside Pyongyang.
description: This project will provide refresher physiotherapy training/mentorship to six health facilities of South Hamgyong and North Pyongan province of the DPRK.

title: Improved and secure access to potable water for DPRK citizens in Anbyon, Kangwon Province.
description: This project will provide a secure supply of drinking water to a remote DPRK community, to tackle poverty in a closed society.

title: Provision of post-disaster emergency support, supplying hygiene and household kits and assisting devices to the most vulnerable people, including those with disabilities, in flood-affected areas of the DPRK.
description: This project will provide immediate humanitarian assistance (Health promotion, physical rehabilitation and injuries management) to the most vulnerable communities, including people with disabilities, affected by the floods in North Hamgyong province.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in the Philippines
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in the Philippines.

title: Promoting conflict reduction in the Philippines through support to the Comprehensive Agreement in the Bangsamoro (CAB)
description: The project aims to support the successful implementation of the Comprehensive Agreement in the Bangsamoro (CAB) in the Philippines through UK and Philippines bilateral knowledge exchange and sharing best practice.

title: Promoting better healthcare in the Philippines through online services
description: The project aims to support patients through the promotion of an online platform which will improve the quality of health facility services by generating at least 5000 healthcare reviews from Filipino patients.

title: Chevening Scholarships
description: This project provides access to education through Chevening scholarships to students from eligible countries, enabling them to pursue postgraduate study in the UK. This allows the UK to engage with and invest in future leaders at an early stage of their career, helping us to work better together in the future.

title: PHM:Sharing of UK experience to counter violent extremism and support conflict resolution in Mindanao
description: Sharing UK expertise, including from the Northern Ireland Peace Process, to reduce violence and support conflict resolution in the country by bringing together UK experts and conflict parties to support the Mindanao Peace Process.

title: Engaging with Philippine policy makers, business and educators to demonstrate the mutual value of transnational education (TNE) to the Philippines and UK.
description: This project will bring together UK experts and members of the Philippine Congress among others to improve the status of transnational education in Malaysia.

title: Supporting economic development through improvement of Philippines aviation efficiency and security.
description: This project will support the Philippines Department of Transportation, through the advice of UK experts, on improving efficiency and security on current and future airports and their systems. The experts will advise on sector challenges, opportunities for expansion and improvement, and make recommendations that will help achieve long term economic goals in aviation efficiency and security.

title: Strengthening leadership among disenfranchised young people to enable them to participate fully in political processes to advocate for social inclusion and development in Mindanao
description: This project will support disenfranchised and excluded young members of society to contribute towards peace and development in the country, and promote political participation, including through a programme with the Office of the Presidential Adviser on the Peace Process and Congress of the Philippines.

title: To assist the Philippines Government to cut red tape in the business environment through the Standard Cost Model for Project Repeal
description: This project will aim to promote economic development in the Philippines by promoting regulatory reform across the public and private sectors.

title: A series of Chevening scholar hosted policy debates on topics of key national development concern including the Mindanao peace process, health, disaster risk reduction management and renewable energy.
description: This project aims to support good governance in the Philippines by stimulating public policy debate across a broad range of areas, including universal health coverage and renewable energy.

title: Supporting the rule of law in the Philippines through enhancing efficiencies and transparency in the judicial process in the family court system.
description: This project aims to support the rule of law through enabling the creation of a process map co-authored with the Supreme court that will help reduce delays and congestion in the Philippine Judiciary, and increase confidence in the justice system. This pilot will focus on the step by step process of two courts: the regular family court and the e-court. It will identify areas for improvement and where the extreme backlogs can be significantly reduced. The process map will be presented at the 2017 Family Court Summit and will help the Supreme Court to assess whether e-courts provide anticipated efficiencies.

title: Supporting preparations for a referendum on independence of the Autonomous Region of Bougainville in Papua New Guinea
description: This project aims to support democracy in the country by sharing expertise between the UK and officials from Papua New Guinea and the Autonomous Bougainville governments into devolution, peace building and referenda.

title: Capacity building in the Samoan journalism sector with a focus on the promotion of Commonwealth values such as government accountability, transparency and gender equality.
description: Visit to the UK of Samoan journalist  building better skills, promoting shared commonwealth values, including transparency

title: Strengthening Senior Pacific Police Leadership Programme 2016: Samoa
description: This project aims to support the rule of law by providing leadership and best practice training for senior members of the Pacific Police.

title: Building awareness and acceptance of LGBTI rights in Samoa
description: To improve acceptance of LGBTI issues specifically, to improve social acceptance of the Fa'afafine community in Samoa and ensure government support, by developing a strategy and implementing outreach activities.

title: Strengthening rule of law in Vanuatu through support to the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions
description: To provide direct funding to the Government of Vanuatu for the sole purpose of employing an expatriate Director of Public Prosecutions to increase transparency in the Justice sector, address issues of corruption and build local capacity.

title: Supporting democracy and freedom of expression in Fiji and Solomon Islands through support to the media
description: The project will build capacity for Fiji and Solomon Islands to produce effective, robust and expert journalistic reporting in order to hold Parliament, Parliamentarians and Government to account and therefore create development by encouraging democracy, freedom of expression and popular 'voice'.

title: Human Rights Education in Solomon Island Schools
description: To develop an understanding of human rights and the international rules based system in the next generation of Solomon Islanders, thereby promoting peace and stability in the country and Solomon Island support

title: Community engagement on the prevention of sexual and gender based violence in the Solomon Islands
description: This project aims to: a) reduce sexual and gender based violence through increased community awareness of its impact on society; b) increase access for victims to support centres and c) expand the geographic reach of counselling services.

title: Strengthening governance and rule of law in the South Pacific through enhanced Police leadership
description: Project will train, influence and provide skills for senior Pacific Police to utilise in their drive to professionalise the police, with a focus on preventing corruption and eliminating domestic violence.

title: Strengthening transparency and accountability in Papua New Guinea though training for magistrates
description: The project will assist Papua New Guinea (PNG) magistrates to effectively apply PNG's proceeds of crime legislation in case assessment and referrals, particularly for corruption and financial crime cases.

title: Increasing Papua New Guinea government officials understanding of human rights
description: Increasing Papua New Guinea government officials understanding of human rights through training support to the Human Rights Defence Network (HRDN) in the Highlands region of Papua New Guinea.

title: Raising awareness on how to tackle corruption
description: Series of 3 provincial youth forums by Transparency International PNG to stimulate youth engagement and leadership in the fight against corruption. 360 youths have participated and are now spreading the anti-corruption message in the run-up to PNG's 2017 general elections.

title: Building capacity of Vanuatu Public Prosecutor's Office
description: Sponsoring a public prosecutor to build legal capacity in the Vanuatu Public Prosecutor's Office which will ensure that the rule of law is upheld.

title: Programme to strengthen the Senior Pacific Police Leadership Programme 2016
description: This project aims to strengthen the rule of law by training members of the Senior Pacific Police in strategic leadership, enabling them to carry out their roles and lead the force more effectively.

title: Improved employment opportunities for young people in Vanuatu
description: This project aims to improve economic prosperity in Vanuatu by improving employment opportunities for people through training. The project will focus on vulnerable women, former prisoners and young people.

title: Strengthening human rights in Fiji
description: Supporting Fiji to become compliant with the United Nations Convention Against Torture through the development of a first hour procedure to include recording Police interviews with suspects.

title: Promoting conflict reduction in Southern Thailand by encouraging a negotiated settlement between the parties
description: To support those facilitating study groups for stakeholders involved in the conflict in Southern Thailand in order to encourage a negotiated settlement.

title: Building capacity within Thai law enforcement to protect Thai children from online sexual exploitation
description: This project will increase arrests of those in Thailand using the internet to view indecent images of children by engaging with Thai and international partners.

title: Expanding and enhancing access to justice for victims of human rights violations in Thailand through increased legal support, strategic litigation, and building capacity for evidence based advocacy
description: To expand democratic space in Thailand by promoting and protecting values of human rights and democracy in order to enhance human rights enforcement and acess to justice for victims of human rights violations and for civilians subjected to military justice and prosecution

title: Building capacity of Thailand's prison system to improve conditions and to meet international human rights standards to the benefit of both Thai and foreign, including British nationals in prison in Thailand
description: To work with the Thai authorities to improve prison conditions in a way that better provides respect and humane conditions for prisoners while also meeting international human rights standards

title: Capacity building for Thailand's education sector through evaluation of current training in English, Science, Technology, Engineering Mathematics (STEM) and vocational training and identifying opportunities for UK providers
description: Through an evaluation of the currently system of training in English, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM) and vocational education in Thailand, this project will identify how the UK and Thailand can collaborate to reform Thailand's teacher training curriculumn and assessment and will position UK as a model for Thailand's education system while creating opportunities for UK education providers

title: Protecting human rights defenders and decriminalizing defamation in Thailand
description: To increase protections for affected communities and human rights defenders from the consequences of criminal defamation actions brought by companies seeking to silence those working for environmental protection, human rights, and corporate responsibility

title: Building a journalism network to enhance freedom of expression people's representation in the Northern Region of Thailand
description: To organise and facilitate a series of journalism-training workshops to establish a journalism network in the region with a clear and sustainable output of news and feature stores. The workshops are linked to public forums on the issues of freedom of expression and human rights, which are designed to define key problems facing the Northeast and provide a space for representatives of marginalised communities to voice their concerns and to seek solutions

title: Strengthening Thailand's Media Ethics
description: To strengthen and embed the National Press Council's new code of practice by assessing and authenticating its underlying principles and to support consular officials' work with the code when they encounter privacy issues with the media

title: Promoting conflict resolution in southern Thailand by supporting the development channels of communication to enable peace negotiations
description: Support to the Thai government to develop channels of communication between groups in southern Thailand to progress negotiations towards a peaceful settlement.

title: Support development of a greenhouse gas emissions reduction plan to enable Thailand to grow a low carbon, sustainable economy
description: This project will support the development of Thailand's greenhouse gas reduction plan using a framework developed in the UK, leading to delivery of Thailand's commitment to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and to promote future sustainable development

title: Improving transparency by supporting a better self-regulatory system for Thai media
description: To fund Thomson Foundation's expert to work to implement the results of the previous scoping mission. To work with Thai media groups to promote and designing a strong media ethics and self-regulatory system in order to promote freedom of expression in Thailand

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Vietnam
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Vietnam.

title: Promoting positive change in media freedom through Vietnam's revised Press Law.
description: This project aims to produce a set of targeted and specific recommendations on how to bring Vietnam's revised Press Law in line with recognised international standards thereby supporting the growth of the media as a mechanism for transparency and accountability

title: Developing policy options to address the risks of corruption in the Vietnamese court system leading to a fairer and more predictable judicial system benefitting both Vietnamese and UK
description: The project will change high-level policy-makers' understanding of corruption risks the business community faces in resolving disputes in Vietnam's courts

title: Enhancing the skills of newly elected Young Deputies to strengthen the oversight function of the National Assembly.
description: To influence Young Deputies in Vietnam's National Assembly, encouraging them to be more active in supporting the voice of young people in the legislative process and by sharing UK visiting MP's expertise in soft skills development and good practice in policy appraisal.

title: Developing rule of law capabilities and encouraging international cooperation in this area among key Vietnamese Government Officials through a workshop entitled "Navigation Towards the Free and Open Seas of Asia
description: The workshop, with the participation of leading experts from the UK, Japan and Vietnam, aims to highlight the advantages of promoting the rule of law in the South China Sea and how it can impact positively on threats to regional peace and security. Legal experts will make recommendations to Vietnamese policy makers using good examples of peaceful resolution of conflict through the application of the rule of law and international cooperation.

title: Tackling the Illegal Wildlife Trade in Vietnam
description: Helping Vietnam acquire and best utilise increased capacity and expertise to tackle the illegal wildlife trade by implementing its commitments from the Hanoi Conference on IWT of November 2016

title: Building a vocational training model for Vietnam using British expertise, enabling Vietnam to develop a better trained workforce and helping to increase prosperity in Vietnam
description: This project aims to enhance economic prosperity in Vietnam by creating a transferable skills training model for the garment and textile industries that will be applicable across multiple sectors.

title: Support for the Adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) in Vietnam to enable the development of a transparent business environment in Vietnam, to increase domestic and foreign investor confidence, including UK companies.
description: The project will aim to strengthen the financial reporting capabilities of a group of public sector accounting professionals in order that they can drive the adoption of IFRS in Vietnam

title: To improve access to high quality and safe medicine for Vietnamese people by providing specialist and updated medical information for pharmacists and developing understanding of the protection of intellectual property of medicines
description: Ensure that Vietnamese people have fast and sustainable access to high quality, safe and innovative medicines in collaboration with the Government of Vietnam, through a medical information campaign for pharmacists and by improving awarness on interllectual property of medicines.

title: Provide UK technical and expert input to a Vietnamese government review designed to strengthen Vietnam's anti-corruption laws and procedures relating to business activities designed to build sustainability, transparency and integrity in the business
description: Provide UK technical and expert input to a Vietnamese government review designed to strengthen Vietnam's anti-corruption laws and procedures relating to business activities designed to build sustainability, transparency and integrity in the business environment, for Vietnam's long-term growth and better opportunities for UK and international business

title: Training for ODA countries on the Wassenaar Arrangement on Export Controls for Conventional Arms
description: UK Contribution for ODA countries to attend training for Government Officials run by the Secretariat of the Wassenaar Arrangement on Export Controls for Conventional Arms and Dual-Use Goods & Technologies. The workshop introduced participants to the latest international practices in the field of export control, licensing and enforcement.

title: Assistance to African ODA Countries on Ratification & Implementation of International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Nuclear Safeguards
description: This project will strengthen the international safeguards regime by facilitating the adherence to and implementation of the current standard of IAEA safeguards, through the delivery of a package of legal and regulatory assistance.

title: Training in South Africa for officials and relevant bodies on counter proliferation finance
description: Training to financial institutions, governments, and regulators on the prevention of illegal financing of weapon proliferation.

title: To provide training and assistance to ODA countries on how to implement United Nations Security Council Resolution 1540 (2004).
description: To provide training and assistance to ODA countries such as Mozambique, Equatorial Guinea and Guinea on implementation and reporting requirements of United Nations Security Council Resolution 1540, which relates to the security of nuclear, chemical or biological weapons and particularly their security from terrorists.

title: Bolstering the healthcare system in India
description: This project aims to increase awareness of potential radiological threats and suitable responses in the Indian healthcare sector and to disseminate the knowledge and good practice developed.

title: Diversion of Arms China
description: This project will prevent Diversion of Arms, Dual-use Goods and Technologies by working with Chinese counterparts to share experience and discuss priorities.

title: Combating trafficking of small arms and light weapons and improvised explosive devices in Lebanon
description: This project aims to improve security by equipping the Lebanese Security Forces with the skills and knowledge to address the trafficking of small arms and light weapons and improvised explosive devices.

title: Establishing Regional Networks in South East Asia to assist Arms Trade Treaty (ATT) Ratifications
description: Establishing Regional Networks, Convening Technical Training Workshops and Producing Technical Research Papers Aimed at Increasing Arms Trade Treaty ratification in South East Asia.

title: Arms Trade Treaty Capacity building for ODA Countries
description: Capacity building to ODA countries to improve the quality of reporting on compliance with the Arms Trade Treaty (ATT).

title: UK-India expert exchanges on radiological security.
description: UK-India expert exchanges on Radiological Security and Incident Response Procedures in the Indian Healthcare Sector.

title: Supporting and strengthening the Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention and the Chemical Weapons Convention Through Comprehensive National Legislative Development and Regulatory Frameworks Assistance to ODA Countries
description: The purpose of this project is to assist ODA States to develop and adopt the necessary laws and regulations to implement their obligations under the Biological Weapons and the Chemical Weapons Conventions, as well as the related provisions of UN Security Council Resolution 1540, in order to introduce appropriate controls related to dual-use material, reduction of risk related to biological and chemical terrorism and prevent and/or punish the proliferation of biological and chemical weapons.

title: Assisting ODA countries understand and implement Democratic People's Republic of Korea sanctions
description: Assisting ODA Countries to understand and implement Democratic People's Republic of Korea Sanctions and expand links between the Countries and the UN Panel of Experts through training and discussions.

title: Burma-UK-US Non-proliferation Dialogue and Training
description: Build upon the first three Burma-UK-US Non-proliferation Dialogues to institutionalise and sustain non-proliferation discussions and cooperation among Burma, the United Kingdom, and the United States after the 2015 Burma general election and beyond; promote non-proliferation capacity building in Burma over the long-term with a focus on strategic trade controls; and help build a lasting non-proliferation cadre in Burma.

title: IAEA Safeguards for ODA
description: This project will identify and communicate Best Practices in the Implementation of IAEA Safeguards to ODA Countries

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Indonesia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Indonesia

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Nigeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Nigeria

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Somalia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Somalia

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Somalia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Somalia

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Pakistan
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Pakistan

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Somalia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Somalia

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Nigeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Nigeria

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Somalia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Somalia

title: Supporting judicial reform in Pakistan
description: This project will improve Pakistan's ability to successfully investigate, prosecute, convict and lawfully detain criminals based on human rights and international law by identifying areas where legal reform is needed.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Pakistan
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Pakistan

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Nigeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Nigeria

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Kenya
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Kenya

title: Supporting security and justice sector reform in Africa
description: This project will improve the ability of African countries to successfully investigate, prosecute, convict and lawfully detain criminals based on the correct application of human rights and international law by identifying where legal reform is needed.

title: Improving strategic communications and security in Pakistan
description: This project aims to build capacity in Pakistan's strategic communications. Using British expertise, this project will focus on improving Pakistan's ability to disrupt crime, thereby increasing stability and security in the region.

title: Strengthening Cyber Security in Indonesia
description: This project will provide a comprehensive National Cyber Security Policy Review and Recommendations for the purpose of protecting Indonesia's Critical National Infrastructure.

title: Strengthening cyber security in Mexico
description: The project aims to help the Government of Mexico strengthen its national cyber security regime. This will mitigate cyber threats to the UK and support economic development.

title: Strengthening cyber security in the Americas
description: This project supports the development of cyber security strategies in Costa Rica and Peru and reviews Colombia's cyber security strategy to reduce cyber threats both internally and internationally, including to the UK.

title: Tackling cyber crime in the Commonwealth
description: This project will support the strengthening of legal frameworks in Commonwealth countries to enable effective prosecution of cyber crime. This will increase Commonwealth countries' prosperity and protect UK interests overseas.

title: Tackling cyber crime in Moldova
description: This project aims to build the resource and capability of the Moldovan police to effectively combat cyber crime through training and mentoring, thereby reducing cyber crime threats to the UK.

title: Strengthen Rwandan law enforcement's ability to tackle cyber crime
description: Working with INTERPOL, the project provides training to the Rwandan Police on law enforcement and human rights, with a cyber security dimension (cyber ethics and governance)

title: Strengthen cyber security in Commonwealth countries in Africa
description: This project provides support to the governments of Tanzania, Malawi, Mozambique, Botswana, Cameroon, Uganda and Rwanda to enable them to implement robust cyber security strategies to tackle cyber-enabled threats to economic development

title: Tackle cyber crime in Bangladesh and Pakistan and providing additional support to Nigeria
description: Working with the Telecommunications sector in Bangladesh, Pakistan and Nigeria to combat and investigate cyber crime. The project will improve the response in each country to instances of cyber crime, ensuring that the telecommunications sector assists with deterrence and investigations

title: Cyber Security practical awareness campaign & training in Africa
description: To create, implement and manage a national training and awareness campaign in South Africa to educate information security staff & general users on cyber threats.

title: Community threat intelligence model / establishing sector incident response teams in public-private institutions in South Africa
description: To improve threat intelligence gathering and sharing for the benefit of South Africa and UK stakeholders i.e. Computer Security Incident Response Teams, industry bodies and public / private organisations.

title: Strengthening the cyber security of the Nigerian banking sector
description: This project aims to improve cyber security in the Nigerian banking sector by assessing the threats faced, the current state of the sector's security, and proposing improvements.

title: Strengthening Cybersecurity in the Americas: Enabling Computer Emergency Response Teams across Latin America to share best practice and work better to combat cyber attacks
description: To protect and promote economic growth in Latin America through creating a network of National Computer Emergency Response Teams to use a pooled set of cyber attack experiences and share best practice in responding to cyber attacks. This will create greater user confidence in the internet across these countries and enable them to derive the proven economic benefits of using digital services to transact business (i.e. lower costs, faster communication).

title: Strengthening Cybersecurity in the Americas: Provision of technical training to information security technicians, critical infrastructure operators, and law enforcement officers
description: This project aims to enhance cyber-crime prevention by enhancing the technical skills of information security technicians, critical infrastructure operators and law enforcement officers in detecting, preventing, responding, and recovering from cyber incidents, and in investigating and combating cybercrime in OAS member states.

title: Tackling cyber crime in India caused through Malware attacks
description: This project will analyse malware attacks for the purpose of creating proactive defences for cyber security at national / state / enterprise level in India, assisting the country's successful transition to a digital economy.

title: Build capacity of Indian law enforcement agencies to tackle cyber crime
description: This project aims to identify gaps in cyber security capacities among law enforcement agencies in India  at the federal and state levels -- and train officials tackling cyber crime in four major areas: information sharing, incident reporting, legal awareness, and early response.

title: Improve understanding of cyber security amongst Parliamentarians and senior officials in the Commonwealth
description: This project consists of three workshops in Africa, Asia-Pacific and the Americas regions to improve Parliamentarians, Ministers and Senior Civil Servants in up to thirty Commonwealth countries understand and respond to issues of cyber security and cybercrime

title: Tackling cyber-enabled crime in Brazil
description: Tackling cyber-enabled crime in Brazil - Brazilian National Counter Corruption and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) programme

title: Improve strategic and operational capacity of Brazil's cyber defences
description: To improve strategic and operational capacity within Brazil's new Cyber Defence Centre (CDCiber) through sharing UK cyber expertise

title: Strengthening cyber skills and awareness in the Brazilian judiciary system
description: Strengthening cyber knowledge in the Brazilian judiciary system, to enable them to identify threats and opportunities. This is for the purpose of strengthening regulation in Brazil and promoting a more secure, open and democratic cyberspace in line with the Brazilian Internet Bill of Rights

title: Enabling the Federal Police in Mexico to better preserve digital evidence in cybercrime cases for the purpose of securing prosecutions
description: Strengthening cyber knowledge in the Brazilian judiciary system, to enable them to identify threats and opportunities. This is for the purpose of strengthening regulation in Brazil and promoting a more secure, open and democratic cyberspace in line with the Brazilian Internet Bill of Rights

title: Strengthening Sri Lanka's Computer Emergency Response Team to better respond to cyber crime
description: This project will enhance the operational capabilities of Sri Lanka's Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) Coordination Centre by updating its computer equipment and providing additional training to its staff .

title: Enabling Montenegro to strengthen its defence against cyber attacks
description: Research and produce report on the current state of Montenegro's cyber security for the Montenegrin government to better understand how its institutions work together to respond to cyber attacks. The Montenegrin government can then target resources where needed.

title: Tackling Cyber Crime and corruption in Kenya and East African States
description: A five day workshop to foster partnerships, and fast track the implementation of the United Nations Convention against Corruption (UNCAC). The key deliverable is an actionable outcome document which East African Association of Anti-Corruption Authorities member states could adopt in fast-tracking the implementation of the United Nations Convention against Corruption.

title: Strengthening the effectiveness of the peace process in Colombia and Mozambique
description: Strengthening the effectiveness of the peace process in Colombia and Mozambique through mediation, tactical advice and opening channels of communication for key stakeholders.

title: Strengthening civil society capacity to deliver reform and improve standards in Azerbaijan.
description: This project will kick-start civil society efforts to address the poor levels of road safety in Azerbaijan by targeting taxi drivers and children. This engagement will allow for improved access to authorities to tackle more difficult issues and equip civil society to campaign for further reform.

title: Training junior journalists in Azerbaijan
description: This project will improve the professional skills and knowledge of 15 junior journalists with an aim of bolstering Azerbaijan's diminishing independent media sector.

title: Strengthening civil society in Belarus
description: To build support and sustainability of civic activists and civil society organisations (CSOs) in local communities of Belarus, through promotion and recognition of community leadership and CSO activities in the media.

title: Supporting NGO activity in Belarus
description: Through the provision of legal skills seminars, support the regularisation of NGO activity in Belarus, to aid development of a pluralistic society with a view to more open debate and development of freedom of association and assembly

title: Support for an independent Media Hub in Belarus
description: This project will build a platform for independent journalism in Belarus, supporting growth and greater independence. This project will also provide training opportunities for media professionals by facilitating discussions about best practice and professional standards.

title: Education and Engagement on the Death Penalty in Belarus
description: To educate the public in Belarus about the death penalty and engage with the authorities to encourage them to impose a moratorium

title: Support the development of youth policy in Belarus
description: To educate young people about basic democratic rights and advocacy principles by creating a sustainable platform for youth policy discussions, knowledge exchange, learning and networking

title: Strengthening the capacity and coordination of the Belarus government to combat human trafficking
description: Through training workshops, assist Belarus in building multi-agency capacity to support child victims, tackle Child Sexual Exploitation (CSE) and combat cybercrime and internet-based child pornography.

title: Advisory support to Implementation of the Reform Agenda (UK/GER Initiative) in BiH - Economic, EU & Strategic Communication Advisers in CoM, RS & F-BiH
description: The project is providing advisory/expert support to the Offices of Chairman/Prime Ministers of BH Council of Ministers/FBiH & Republika Srpska governments in planning and implementing measures from the BH Reform Agenda, in specific areas (Economy, SOEs, Strategic Communications, Eu Integration...). At the same time, Advisers are serving as a contact points for all the GGF projects, and as source for political/economy analyses of the BE Sarajevo.

title: Building government capacity in Georgia
description: This project provides a phased programme of support to the Georgian government, delivered by the UK Government Communications Service, to develop the professional capabilities of staff and Ministers to coordinate its messaging and set out its programme and priorities to the public.

title: Promoting political reform in Georgia
description: This project seeks to provide regional media outlets with the means to report objectively on issues related to Georgia's social and economic reform agenda, including in minority ethnic languages.

title: Capacity building of the human rights Secretariat of the Georgian Government administration
description: To scope human rights awareness and training in the civil service and make recommendations on how to embed human rights across government, and improve implementation of international obligations.

title: Building good governance in Georgia
description: This project funds a scoping document setting out the training needs of Georgian MPs and parliamentary staff, shares best practice from the Welsh National Assembly and offers recommendations on induction training for new MPs.

title: Supporting Georgian government strategic communications
description: This project delivers bespoke media training and coaching for selected Georgian government Ministers, to support consistent and transparent communication of government policy to the public.

title: Supporting good governance in Serbia
description: This project enabled ten Serbian rule of law professionals to learn from UK host institutions, to support Serbia in ensuring public administration in the area of rule of law delivers on UK good governance objectives.

title: Strengthening transparency in Serbia
description: This project promotes UK best practice through tutorials and workshops for the Serbian civil service, fostering institutional transparency and better communication of policy issues through digital reform and establishing the UK as a partner of choice to advance digital reform.

title: Promoting government accountability in Serbia
description: This project promotes and enhances democracy in Serbia through publication of articles, holding public debates and creating online platforms to strengthen understanding of the democratic process.

title: Promoting human rights in Serbia
description: By the end of March 2016, this project trained 25 governmental institutions, 100 municipalities and 70 civil society representatives in anti discrimination measures and services, boosting good governance and raising awareness of UK values on fundamental human rights.

title: Promoting democratic values in Serbia
description: This project creates a new web portal ('Danas 3') with material on UK and international norms on democracy and freedom of expression.

title: Promoting democratic values in Serbia
description: This project creates a new web portal ('Vreme') with material on UK and international norms on democracy and freedom of expression.

title: Supporting democracy in Kazakhstan
description: The project aimed to increase the participation of young people in the elections process through enhancing their knowledge of voters' rights and increasing their awareness of elections procedures. This educational initiative would strengthen government transparency and rule of law through educating voters about their rights.

title: Promoting political stability in central Asia
description: This project aimed to initiate cooperation between Kazakhstan and leading British analytical centres and think tanks specializing in the fields of strategic studies and foreign policy in relation to the Central Asian region. This would promote the establishment of a strong network, strengthen expert capacity and efficiency, and enable the development of new forms of cooperation through joint research projects, internships and conferences.

title: Election monitoring in Kazakhstan
description: This project provided seconded election monitors for the observers' mission to the OSCE during the parliamentary elections in 2016.

title: Strengthening rule of law, democracy and good governance in Kyrgyzstan
description: This project funded a targeted study visit to Wales by the Deputy Minister of Education and the head of Ethnic and Religious Policy and Civil Society Co operation Department of the presidential administration of Kyrgyzstan. The aim was to expose Kyrgyz ministers and senior officials to Welsh Government policies in the fields of legislature, education and media which had an impact on plurality of opinion and diversity.

title: Strengthening good governance and the rule of law in Kyrgyzstan
description: This project aims to strengthen good governance and rule of law by supporting Kyrgyzstan's democratic development. The project provides for long and short term observers to monitor the October 2015 Parliamentary elections.

title: Strengthening good governance and the rule of law in Kyrgyzstan
description: The project aims to increase the specialised expertise and skills of Kyrgyz criminal justice officials in the investigation and prosecution of serious financial crimes. It will also bring together officials from various state bodies involved in investigation and prosecution of financial crimes to improve operational cooperation and intelligence exchange on national level.

title: Strengthening human rights in Kyrgyzstan
description: The project aims to accelerate judicial reform in Kyrgyzstan through an ongoing bilateral criminal justice dialogue, including expert visits, in order to significantly increase Kyrgyz understanding of the UK judicial system and to help establish it as a model for judicial reform.

title: Capacity building and professional training for mass media in Kyrgyzstan
description: This project aims to strengthen transparency in Kyrgyzstan by achieving sustainable improvements in journalistic standards and ethics, including training for journalism students.

title: Continued support for Kyrgyzstan's democratic development. Further strengthening of Parliament to Parliament links through a parliamentary delegation to the UK
description: The project will send 6 Kyrgyz parliamentarians to the UK for engagement with the UK parliament, strengthening ties and promoting the reform of the Kyrgyz Parliamentary system. The visit will further improve inter-parliamentary links and establish a sustained dialogue between the key Kyrgyz and British MPs within the UK-Kyrgyzstan Friendship Group; help Kyrgyz MPs better understand the UK Parliamentary democracy as a possible model for future democratic development and will help to professionalise Kyrgyz MPs.

title: Support for the Annual Festival of Human Rights Documentaries to improve democracy in Kyrgyzstan
description: This project aims to support human rights and democracy in the country by providing support for the screening of films about human rights, engaging wider society, the media and government in debate about the rights of citizens.

title: Supporting economic development through the delivery of the first UK Trade Mission to Kyrgyzstan
description: This project aims to promote economic development through enabling the country's private sector to engage internationally, combating corruption, and sharing UK expertise.

title: Capacity building in policy development for mining sector
description: This project is designed to promote economic development and environmental awareness through improved policy formation, and the development of cadres of informed leaders to raise the quality of public debate in the mining industry.

title: Support for policy development regarding security threats in the information sphere (notably online radicalisation) in order to strengthen Kyrgyzstan's resilience, promote good governance and greater emphasis on the protection of human rights.
description: Help create a national institutional capacity in the field of information security in Kyrgyzstan, and contribute to an improved legal, technical and analytical response to global and regional information threats such as online radicalisation. The project will support the welfare and the development of Kyrgyzstan as it seeks to improve governance around the handling of security threats in the information sphere and encourage greater democratisation. Improved legislation and implementation will better support the protection of human rights of citizens affected by the law.

title: Promote peace building in Batken, Kyrgyzstan
description: This project will help foster a deeper communal understanding of natural resource management and improve institutional capacities of local coordination committees in the conflict-prone areas of Batken, Kyrgyzstan

title: Grant to European Endowment for Democracy
description: This project aims to enhance democracy and respect for human rights across the Former Soviet Union region through funding to the European Endowment for Democracy to disburse grants to democracy and human rights organisations.

title: Programme of fellowships at the John Smith Trust
description: This project aims to support good governance, social justice and the rule of law through delivery of a fellowship programme targeting future leaders from a range of fields and countries across the Former Soviet Union.

title: Analysis of Civil Society and Civil Service Capacity across the Former Soviet Union region
description: A scoping study to identify priority opportunities for supporting a resilient civil society and building capacity and capabilities in civil services, and other governmental bodies charged with delivering democratic reforms across Eastern Europe and Central Asia.

title: Improving Public Financial Management in Kyrgyzstan
description: This project funded a World Bank project to deliver improvements to Public Financial Management in Kyrgyzstan

title: Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability (PEFA) assessment in support of Public Finance Management Reform in Tajikistan
description: Support for a World Bank project to deliver a Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability (PEFA) Assessment in Tajikistan.

title: Supporting democracy and rule of law in Kyrgyzstan through building the capacity of future leaders.
description: Contribution to a Council of Europe project to deliver capacity building and professional legal training for new generation of public leaders in Kyrgyzstan.

title: Building the Capacity of Civil Protection and Emergency Situations Service in Moldova
description: Improving ability of the Moldovan department of Civil Protection and Emergency Situations Service (CPESS) to respond to a range of Emergency situations, including natural or man made incidents.

title: Raising awareness and understanding of human rights issues in Moldova
description: This project aims to engage society, media and the Government in debates intend to raise awareness and understanding of human rights violations in Moldova through film.

title: Promoting open and strong governance through increased transparency in the extractives sector.
description: This project aims to promote good governance through a one-week workshop to support the Armenian Multi-Stakeholder Group, the coalition, which lies at the heart of EITI and is responsible for overseeing its implementation in Armenia

title: Supporting the Armenian economy's development, employment growth through raising the profile of Armenia's high-technology sector in the UK.
description: The project will support Armenia's prosperity and economic development by increasing employment opportunities in the high-tech sector, reducing poverty, and boosting both inward investments and exports with the view to contributing to a long term goal of a resilient, more prosperous Armenia. This will enable astable democratic governance and greater respect for human rights.

title: Increasing opportunities for UK-Armenian engagement to promote human rights and good governance in Armenia.
description: Supporting Armenian delegates' attendance to HMG hosted international conferences to increase opportunities for UK-Armenian engagement to promote human rights and good governance in Armenia.

title: Supporting economic growth in Armenia
description: Training and certifying Armenian professionals for the leadership and management courses of the Chartered Management Institute to deliver accredited leadership and management qualifications of the Chartered Management Institute in Armenia.

title: Sharing UK expertise to create robust anti-discrimination legislation in Armenia
description: Sharing UK expertise to create robust anti-discrimination legislation in Armenia through arranging a short study tour for the Armenian delegation in the UK

title: Supporting a more inclusive and effective conflict resolution mechanism by engaging women in the decision making processes
description: Through a series of workshops and a conference, the project will develop the capacity of women to engage effectively in peace processes and conflict resolution mechanisms in order to address the needs of women during and after conflict. The project will strengthen the women's peace network and contribute towards UN targets for adoption of gender perspective in prevention and resolution of conflicts and promotion of peace-building and security.

title: Sharing British experience and expertise in support of Armenian parliamentary reform in defence and security sector
description: Supporting a study visit of Armenian Parliamentarians to the British Parliament to acquire practical knowledge on parliamentary scrutiny in the fields of defence and security in order to inform Armenia's defence and security sector reforms.

title: Promoting gender equality and preventing gender based violence in Armenia through a series of televised debates.
description: The project aims to fund a series of six 30-minute TV debates titled "Generations Debate on Equality" to promote the concept of equal treatment and unacceptability of gender based violence. The Embassy will join the 16 Days of Activism Against the Gender-Based Violence Campaign together with the EU Delegation, OSCE, CoE, UN and local civil society groups to contribute to the promotion of gender equality with a special emphasis on combating gender based violence in Armenia.

title: Promoting diversity and HR
description: This project will promote inclusive societies, equality, diverse perspectives and human rights values by showcasing best of UK filmmaking through screenings, post screening facilitated discussions and workshops

title: Election observation mission to Armenia
description: UK contribution to the OSCE (Organisation of Security and Cooperation in Europe) election monitoring mission for the April 2017 Parliamentary elections in Armenia.

title: Strengthening the capacity of the judiciary in Turkmenistan
description: This project will support the implementation of the Turkmenistan National Human Rights Action Plan for 2016-2020.

title: Promoting gender equality and supporting economic empowerment of women in Uzbekistan
description: This project aims to address gender inequality, help women to support their families and reduce poverty by providing women with key employment and entrepreneurship skills, enabling them to better participate in business and the labour market.

title: Promoting best practice in environmental management and awareness of climate change in Uzbekistan.
description: This project aims to raise awareness of, and integrate into domestic planning, climate change issues and water management. The project provides UK expertise to universities in Uzbekistan to enable the incorporation of environmental management training into university curricula in line with UK best practice and to reflect this practice in draft legislation.

title: Encouraging criminal justice reform and torture prevention in Uzbekistan
description: This project supports the implementation of the Convention Against Torture and encourages ratification of the Optional Protocol to that convention in Uzbekistan through participation in a Uzbek National Human Rights Centre conference by UK prison reform expert Baroness Stern, and translation and distribution of a revised Uzbek language version of a Torture Reporting Handbook, written by the University of Essex Human Rights Centre.

title: Organisation for Security Co-operation in Europe Monitoring Uzbekistan Presidential Elections - Dec 2016
description: This project supports democracy through the funding of UK Observers participating in the Organisation for Security Co-operation in Europe Monitoring Mission to the Uzbekistan Presidential Elections, 4 December 2016 contribute to the capacity of the Organisation for Security Co-operation in Europe to support governance, and democratic reform in Uzbekistan, strengthening Uzbekistan's security and stability.

title: Youth Enterprise Programme
description: This project aims to equip 20,000 young people with skills and competences to live and work in a global economy, presenting vocational training as an attractive career option giving people the confidence and awareness to fulfil their potential.

title: Tashkent good governance
description: This project will support government efforts in introducing effective digital services that result in increased transparency and reduced corruption practices by learning best international experience.

title: Secretariat of the Pacific Regional Environment Programme (SPREP) Membership Subscription
description: SPREP has an important role in helping Pacific Island Countries adapt to the challenges of climate change and UK membership forms part of our continued commitment to the Pacific Region.

title: Strengthening economic governance in Serbia
description: This project provides advice from UK employers and educational providers on how to boost local job creation and strengthen economic development.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in the Western Balkans
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in the Western Balkans.

title: Supporting criminal justice in Turkey
description: This project supports capacity building activities between the Protective Operations & Risk Management Team and the Turkish National Witness Protection authorities under the coordination of the National Crime Agency.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Montenegro
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Montenegro.

title: Supporting human rights and institutional reform in Turkey
description: Various grouped bilateral projects in Turkey aiming at promotion of fundamental rights and freedoms, supporting the institutional and legislative capacity building efforts of Turkish public institutions and civil society organisations, and supporting the conflict resolution and peace building processes in Turkey.

title: Strengthening the rules based international system in Turkey
description: Various bilateral projects aiming at capacity building by supporting and working with Turkish civil society and government departments to strengthen their compliance with the rules based international system in line with UK values.

title: Supporting economic development and the rule of law in Serbia
description: 10 grouped projects providing a range of bilateral assistance focused on supporting the rule of law, enhancing sectoral economic development, encouraging regional reconciliation and dialogue, and providing technical capacity building with the Serbian Interior Ministry.

title: Supporting economic development and the rule of law in Serbia
description: 10 grouped projects providing a range of bilateral assistance focused on supporting the rule of law, enhancing sectoral economic development, encouraging regional reconciliation and dialogue, and providing technical capacity building with the Serbian Interior Ministry.

title: Promoting economic reform in Montenegro
description: This project enables expert consultations between Montenegro and UK government to produce policy recommendations focused on job creation.

title: Supporting judicial cooperation with Albania
description: This project helps train prison officials and judiciary to support implementation of the UK/Albania Prisoner Transfer Agreement and advance wider judicial reform objectives.

title: Election monitoring in Turkey
description: This project supports the Organization for Security and Co operation in Europe's mission to Turkey for monitoring the 2015 Parliamentary Elections in order to strengthen democracy and transparency.

title: Supporting the Turkish police
description: This project provides capacity building assistance to the Serious Organised Crime division of the Turkish National Police in order to improve capability and facilitate further cooperation.

title: Supporting Cypriot re unification
description: This project provides the basis for a research report on unification in Cyprus with prioritised recommendations for Turkey in political, social and economic areas.

title: Monitoring Parliamentary Elections in Georgia
description: Strengthening democracy and transparency through monitoring of pre-election and election day environment of parliamentary elections on 8th of October, 2016.

title: Strengthening democracy, governance and stability through activities in support of the Wardrop dialogue
description: This project will strengthen Georgia democracy, governance and stability through delivery of projects identified at the UK-Georgia bilateral Wardrop' dialogue, including through high level institutional exchanges on counter terrorism, cyber crime and human rights.

title: Tackling fiscal crime in Georgia
description: This project aims to strengthen the rule of law through the sharing of UK expertise, and building the capacity of the Georgian government to tackle tax fraud and other forms of fiscal crime.

title: Supporting freedom of the press in Kazakhstan
description: This project aims to enhance transparency by working with non-governmental organisations to promote freedom of speech, including improving legislation covering the media.

title: Enhancing public awareness, influencing legislation and improving the training of lawyers in support of promoting the use of jury trials in Kazakhstan
description: This project aims to increase take up of the right to jury trial in Kazakhstan through producing a series of videos aimed at raising awareness of this right among the general population and policy-makers, producing a manual for lawyers on the conduct of jury trials, and training 15-20 practising lawyers at each of three training sessions in different major cities. This is an opportunity to use UK experience and expertise in jury trials to strengthen governance and rule of law in Kazakhstan.

title: Strengthening the contribution of Human Rights Organisations in implementation of Human Rights Standards
description: To render the structure related to the protection and improvement of human rights, more participatory, transparent and harmonised with the European Convention of Human Rights by providing alternative information to the relevant actors on the implementation of the judgments of European Court of Human Rights.

title: Strengthening capacity of NGOs who are working with refugees to improve knowledge and awareness among refugees of access to rights and services.
description: The project will allow better access to rights by the refugees, improved services provided to refugees and better perceptions on refugees in Turkey which are expected to weaken motivations for irregularly crossing into the EU and UK and to strengthen integration in Turkey.

title: Mitigating human trafficking risk of Syrian refugees in Turkey through capacity building of NGOs
description: Decreasing the human trafficking risk of Syrian refugees especially women and children in four provinces by increasing anti-trafficking knowledge and skills of 80 NGO workers and other service providers through trainings, workshops, meetings, visits and distribution of informative materials within one year period.

title: Promoting the Human Rights of the Roma Minority.
description: Promoting UK values by raising public awareness of the human rights of disadvantaged Roma communities in Turkey to encourage both equality of treatment and economic opportunity

title: Turkey: Increasing respect for the human rights of vulnerable groups in Turkey
description: To promote UK values by raising public awareness and supporting human rights of vulnerable groups focussing specifically on strengthening networking and communication at local, national and regional levels

title: Human Rights Training for young people in Bursa
description: Action to promote UK values among young people in Turkey, by raising the awareness of and providing training to 150 students in Bursa on human rights, and encouraging them to become advocates for tolerance and peace.

title: Turkey: Bringing Transparency and Participation to Parliament
description: To promote UK values by creating a virtual meeting ground for citizens, civil society, journalists, academicians and decision makers to exchange views and discuss ways to make laws more responsive to citizen needs in Turkey.

title: Improving access to justice in Turkey through Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) mechanisms
description: To promote UK values relating to effective legal procedures, and to support reform of the Turkish judicial system, by improving the implementation of the Law on Mediation in Turkey, promoting mediation mechanisms and increasing public awareness of alternatives to formal legal proceedings

title: Strengthening freedom of expression and media freedom in Turkey
description: To promote UK values on media freedom by providing training on the basic principles of journalism for 100 participants including NGOs, activists, academicians, members of social movements and employee associations; thus enhancing freedom of expression through citizen journalism across Turkey

title: Turkey: European School of Politics: Promoting awareness of European standards in political and public life amongst future politicians in Turkey
