description: To promote UK democratic values in Turkey by introducing and strengthening awareness of European norms in political and public life, and the roles of the EU institutions, among 33 future political and civil society leaders

title: Gender Equality, Participation in Policy Making and Reporting in Turkey
description: To build a wider capacity among women's rights and gender equality activists/NGOs on data development, data collection, monitoring and reporting, in order to enhance their ability to impact upon and monitor local and national policy making in Turkey.

title: Freedom of Media in Turkey
description: To promote UK values by supporting the basic principles of journalism for citizens from NGOs, activists, academics, members of social movements and employee associations thus enhancing freedom of expression across Turkey.

title: Supporting democratic governance in Turkey
description: This project aims to enhance democracy in Turkey by encouraging the Government to undertake constitutional and system reforms to better support democratic governance.

title: Improving transparency through enhancing data literacy
description: To empower civil society organizations, journalists and citizens with the skills they need to use data effectively in their efforts and also improving data literacy efforts to create more equitable and effective societies and data driven project; thus to develop open data and data journalism practices and to raise awareness on essentialness of open data for the transparency, accountability and freedom of information in Turkey.

title: Strengthening the capacity of Turkish government in implementing the Turkish reform agenda
description: Harnessing UK expertise and credibility to provide capacity-building sessions with Turkish Ministers and senior officials to support the Turkish government effectively implement their ambitious reform agenda

title: Strengthening the Ministry of Health's capacity to design and operate first class healthcare Public Private Partnership projects
description: This project aims to support healthcare in Turkey by strengthening the capacity of10 Ministry of Health experts to run Public Private Partnership projects in healthcare in collaboration with international business partners

title: Promoting efficient use of natural resources in the Black Sea Region through the empowerment of the female workforce
description: To promote UK values and development objectives by raising awareness of sustainable consumption and production methods whilst building the capacity and skills of women workers in the Black Sea Region

title: Supporting the training capacity of the Turkish National Police
description: This project will support the Turkish National Police in improving their training capabilities, as part of their ongoing strategy to improve organisational performance and policing effectiveness, bringing them closer to EU standards.

title: Strengthening dialogue in civil society on peace building and conflict resolution in Turkey and the region
description: To promote UK security and UK values by working with civil society to broaden the base of support in Turkey for enhanced domestic political dialogue and regional conflict resolution, while promoting democratic norms and respect for human rights.

title: Conducting a baseline study and threat assessment relating to the extent of Child Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (CSEA) in Turkey
description: This project will undertake a baseline study to understand the threat from CSEA in order to establish a cross sector action plan that would help develop a national response to child protection and better support for victims.

title: University & private sector mentorship for women's empowerment in Turkish business and academia.
description: This project will bring together Leading Turkish women at all stages in their professional lives; fostering mentorship exchanges; establishing an alumni network and on-line educational materials

title: Support international efforts to reduce the proliferation of Turkish Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) in the Western Balkans.
description: To increase knowledge and awareness of the extent to which weapons manufactured in Turkey are readily convertible to live fire, the proliferation of such weapons in crime scenes(the use by criminals) and the lessons that can be learnt for changes in the manufacture process. The aim is to work with the Turkish authorities to deliver the findings and examine ways to alter manufacturing processes so that these weapons are harder to convert. This will reduce the threat of criminal use in Turkey and across Europe. Will prevent the illicit purchase of these weapons by crime groups in Turkey. Will bring Turkey in line with more robust checks, balances and assurance processes found in similar weapons manufacture in EU.

title: Political Consolidation for Social Peace: Road map towards resolving the issues of Alawites, Kurds and seculars in Turkey
description: The project aims to identify how to remove obstacles to greater inclusion of Alawites, Kurds and secular groups in politics.

title: Academic research into promoting Conflict Resolution and Democracy in Turkey post coup attempt
description: To support UK values by a programme to identify and analyse the key conflicts that challenge the consolidation of Turkish democracy in the post-coup period and, through research and dialogue offer possible solutions to contain polarization and foster inclusive democracy

title: Enhancing factual reporting in a crisis
description: This project aims to support crisis response work in Turkey by providing a mechanism for verified information in crisis situations, guarding against the spread of hoaxes.

title: Development of Social Innovation Centre to Strengthen Capacity of Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs) in Ankara
description: This project will promote UK values in collaboration with TED University. This will help strengthen and develop its Center for Social Innovation (Istasyon TEDU) to work with NGOs in building their capacity and knowledge of civil society organisations in Ankara that are engaged on social entrepreneurship.

title: Empowering Teachers to Support the Integration of Syrian Refugee Children and Youngsters in Turkey into the Education System
description: The project aims to (i) train & equip primary/secondary school teachers in Turkey, to support Syrian pupils in terms of their accommodation into the formal education system, and thus support the peaceful integration of Syrian refugees and host communities across Turkey.

title: UK contribution to the ODIHR observation mission for the Turkey Referendum in support of democracy, transparency and accountability
description: This project will assist Turkey in fulfilling all OSCE international standards for the organisation and delivery of a democratic referendum, and to address all outstanding OSCE/ODIHR recommendations by providing an effective UK contribution to the ODIHR election observation mission for the referendum via the deployment of 3 Long Term Observers (LTOs).

title: Increasing prosperity in Serbia by supporting youth entrepreneurship
description: To develop and promote youth entrepreneurship in Serbia by providing capacity-building to the next generation of entrepreneurs using UK best practice

title: Promoting Serbia's economic development by providing UK capacity-building to develop its creative economy
description: To promote economic development in Serbia by using UK expertise to support and develop Serbia's film industry and to create joint ventures between the UK and Serbia

title: Supporting Serbia in delivering regional dialogue on foreign policy and security issues in order to promote greater regional stability
description: To support the delivery of a Western Balkans strategic dialogue, through the Belgrade Security Forum, to ensure a stronger regional and EU response to global challenges

title: Developing UK-Serbia partnerships to promote freedom of expression
description: This project aims to support freedom of expression and civil society participation in political debates in Serbia by enhancing youth empowerment.

title: Capacity-building for Montenegro's civil service to meet EU-required standards
description: To help build a professional, efficient and effective civil service able to operate in an international environment and to improve communications to enhance public discourse on public policy making.

title: Simplifying business regulations to improve economic governance and UK business prospects in Montenegro.
description: Use the Chevening Alumni network to create an authoritative business platform of officials and business influencers to improve economic governance in Montenegro.

title: Capacity building to address the rule of law in Montenegro
description: To establish a Judicial Reform Forum to bring together the leadership of Montenegro's judiciary, Montenegro's Minister of Justice, and British legal experts to address the remaining challenges regarding the country's implementation of the rule of law.

title: Strengthening financial oversight in Montenegro's Parliament
description: This project will establish a successful Parliamentary Budget Office within the Parliament of Montenegro will enhance the culture of effective financial oversight and scrutiny.

title: Providing technical assistance to meet international election standards
description: To ensure a higher level of implementation of international elections standards, prevention of election fraud and prevention of abuse of state resources during Parliamentary elections in 2016.

title: Providing technical assistance to Montenegrin State Election Commission
description: To strengthen the professional capacities of the State Election Commission (SEC) members and staff and election commissioners in line with the legal and procedural framework.

title: Capacity building for the improvement of business environment, structural and regulatory reforms in Montenegro
description: Capacity building for the Council for Improvement of Business Environment, Structural and Regulatory Reforms in their efforts to tailor the public administration in Montenegro to the needs of businesses and citizens.

title: Civic engagement to enhance oversight of reforms that contribute to Montenegro's advancement in the EU integration process by meeting EU standards on rule of law.
description: Capacity building to enable Civil Society Organisations to independently monitor implementation of various reforms linked to the implementation of Chapters 23 and 24, leading to improved oversight and transparency surrounding national legislation, policies and institutional framework for reforms.

title: Promoting financial accountability in Montenegro
description: To increase transparency and accountability of budgetary spending in Montenegro by empowering Civil Society Organisations to both participate in and perform oversight over decision-making processes.

title: Depoliticisation of Montenegrin Civil Service through a UK-led Human Resources Management strengthening programme in support of UK security/governance objectives.
description: To promote UK security, influence and prosperity by engaging UK experts to develop an accredited independent professional training, allowing the Human Resources Management Authority to promote the depoliticisation of the Montenegrin civil service as a key rule of law element in line with the UK's governance priorities in the Western Balkans.

title: Programme to deliver a more open, free and transparent business environment in Montenegro
description: This project aims to improve support economic reform and a more open market in Montenegro through developing a better regulatory impact assessment.

title: Effective implementation of political finance legislation in Montenegro
description: To assist the Anti-Corruption Agency of Montenegro in establishing an effective party finance monitoring mechanism that meets standards and embodies good regulatory practice.

title: Capacity building for Montenegro to implement human rights legislation in line with EU required reforms
description: Targeted support to assist Montenegro to implement human rights legislation (LGBT rights, training on disability rights and training for journalists and editors on topics of freedom of expression and right to privacy).

title: Support programme to institutional development and capacity building of Montenegrin civil service
description: Enhance transparency, accountability and effectiveness of Montenegrin civil service, with special emphasis on Government communications using UK expertise (Government Communications Services) as the benchmark.

title: UK contribution to the Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights election observation mission for Montenegrin elections in October 2016 in support of democracy, transparency and accountability
description: To assist Montenegro to fulfil all Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe international standards for the organisation and delivery of democratic elections, and to address all outstanding Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe /Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights recommendations by providing an effective UK contribution to the Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights election observation mission for Montenegrin elections in October 2016 via the deployment of 2 Long Term Observers and 10 Short Term Observers.

title: Promoting good governance in Montenegro by strengthening government strategic communications
description: Drawing on UK expertise, this project will develop the strategy, structures and training in government communications. The result will be more alignment of activity across different ministries, transparency in decision-making, and improvement in the quality of information citizens receive. The project will also help improve Montenegro's international messaging as it becomes a member of NATO.

title: Strengthening rule of law in Montenegro through codification of civil law
description: This project aims to strengthen the rule of law by funding a scoping project to develop a plan for codification of Montenegrin civil law, and regional harmonisation of commercial law.

title: Support for integration and access to services for minority populations in Kosovo
description: To secure access to inclusive education and health services for members of minority communities in Kosovo

title: Technical support to help support the implementation of elections in line with EU/US Mid Term Assessment
description: To support civil society organisations in Macedonia in offering monitoring reports on the behaviour and the abuse of power by political parties during the pre-electoral and electoral period.

title: Building accountability for public institutions in Macedonia through civil society engagement
description: Supporting community based Civil Society Organisations (CSOs) to monitor municipal decisions related to use of local budgets for CSOs, health services, education, sports and media; raise awareness of violence during sport events, judicial decisions and inter-ethnic relations, empowering citizens to engage with local authorities to ensure accountable local governments.

title: UK contribution to the Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights election observation mission for Macedonian elections in October 2016 in support of democracy, transparency and accountability
description: To assist Macedonia to fulfil all Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe international standards for the organisation and delivery of democratic elections, and to address all outstanding Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe /Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights recommendations by providing an effective UK contribution to the Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights election observation mission for Montenegrin elections in October 2016 via the deployment of 2 Long Term Observers and 10 Short Term Observers.

title: Capacity-building of Albanian prison and judicial sectors to progress implementation of UK/Albania Prisoner Transfer Agreement.
description: Familiarisation visits, provision of documentary material and training for Albanian prison officials and judiciary to support implementation of UK/Albania Prisoner Transfer Agreement and advance wider judicial reform objectives.

title: Building capacity in Albanian higher education
description: To contribute to raising standards in higher education and capacity of those institutions to meet the demand for skilled work force and promote wider economic development and employment in Albania.

title: Capacity building in Albanian prisons
description: This project will assist the Albanian General Directorate of Prisons in developing an information management system in Albanian prisons to improve prisons security, including for those prisoners transferred under the UK Albania Prisoner Transfer Agreement.

title: Building capacity of the Albanian judiciary
description: To provide UK technical assistance to ensure that Albania implements its Justice Sector Reform Strategy in order to meet EU-required standards and strengthen bilateral cooperation against organised crime.

title: Improving the legal environment and business climate in Albania
description: This project will assist Albania to implement EU-required judicial reforms by building the capacity of Albanian judges to improve the legal environment and business climate in Albania, facilitating economic growth and UK and other investment.

title: Assistance to the Albanian law enforcement agencies to improve the detection of smuggled cash, help improve the control of maritime borders and help tackle cyber crime.
description: This project will help prevent crime by strengthening the capacity of Albanian law enforcement agencies to tackle money laundering, physically detect smuggled cash, help improve the control of maritime borders and help tackle cyber crime.

title: Improve Albania's ability to fight Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking
description: This project will enable Albania, which is one of the origin countries for potential victims of trafficking to the UK, to attend a conference on Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking', strengthening their ability to tackle human trafficking and illegal migration

title: International conference to address improving citizens' participation and direct democracy
description: A project enabling an English election expert to attend an International Conference "We the People; Citizens' Participation and Direct Democracy" to share best practice, engage in debate and formulate conclusions on the best way to establish legal mechanisms to increase citizens' participation and direct democracy in Albania.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin Turkey
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Turkey

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin Turkey
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Turkey

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin Albania
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Albania

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin Montenegro
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Montenegro

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin Albania
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Albania

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Kosovo
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Kosovo.

title: UK contribution to the Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe election monitoring mission for the Georgian Parliamentary Elections in October 2016
description: Strengthening democracy and transparency through the provision of UK election monitors to take part in the Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe election monitoring mission for the Georgian Parliamentary Elections in October 2016.

title: Supporting minority rights in Turkey
description: This project helps civil society organisations to monitor the discrimination of minorities within Turkey's education system and advocate for much needed changes in this domain with the view of bringing Turkey's standards up to the level of the EU and the requirements of the international law.

title: Promoting democracy in Serbia
description: This project promotes democracy in Serbia through the deployment of mobile election monitoring teams during the 2016 elections.

title: Strengthening victims' rights in the Turkish criminal justice system
description: This project seeks to strengthen the legislative and institutional structure in the field of victims' rights by promoting closer coordination among academics, bar associations, related state departments and non governmental organizations.

title: Promoting good governance in Serbia
description: This project provides technical advice to the office of the independent Ombudsman in order to strengthen cooperation with human rights civil society organisations and to promote democracy and transparency values and norms.

title: Strengthening freedom of expression in Serbia
description: This project assists the monitoring of new media laws in order to support UK objectives in governance, and to strengthen accountability and improve transparency.

title: Promoting good governance in Serbia
description: This project aims to improve transparency and accountability of local government administration in Serbia by assisting and reinforcing local anti corruption efforts.

title: Promoting human rights in Serbia
description: This project aims to enhance understanding of hate crimes in the security sector and to promote UK and international values on human rights by building instructional capacity to deal transparently with hate crimes and discrimination.

title: Promoting good governance in Serbia
description: This project aims to support and enhance democratic values through civil society monitoring of EU accession talks on the rule of law and fundamental freedoms.

title: Promoting good governance in Serbia
description: This project provides for the training of key public policy officials in how to improve civic engagement and conduct more robust policy formation.

title: Assisting judicial reform in Serbia
description: This project aims to strengthen Serbia's Judicial Academy by providing technical assistance on rule of law issues.

title: Supporting good governance in Serbia
description: This project aims to raise awareness of the importance of citizen engagement with government institutions and increase parliamentary transparency and accountability in pursuit of shared democratic values, through sharing the lessons of 'UK Parliament Week'.

title: Building capacity in the Bosnian civil service
description: This project supports the development of a new strategic framework for the training of civil servants to allow them to improve state structures.

title: Building capacity in the Bosnian civil service
description: This project provides training for civil servants at the local and regional level on the technical requirements of the EU Accession process.

title: Supporting economic reform in Bosnia and Herzegovina
description: This project aims to ensure that Bosnia and Herzegovina makes specific progress on implementing the reform agenda (initiated by UK/German initiative) with a particular focus on socio economic related reforms.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Kosovo
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Kosovo.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Kosovo
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Kosovo.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Montenegro
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Montenegro.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Albania
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Albania

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Bosnia and Herzegovina
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of UK strategic aims in Bosnia.

title: Supporting The Police In Tackling Domestic Violence In North Africa
description: This project will design and deliver a training course that develops knowledge of good practice in tackling domestic violence in North Africa. This project has the potential to be transformational by helping to build on the momentum of legal reforms.

title: Strengthening human rights and security in extractive industries in Angola
description: Working with Angolan stakeholders, including Government, Businesses, and Local Communities, to implement the Voluntary Principles (VPs) initiatives in the Lunda diamond mining areas, thereby ensuring that importers and consumers (including in the UK) are not complicit in human rights abuses.

title: Promoting human rights in Lunda Norte
description: This project will enhance the understanding and effective implementation of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights (VPs) among key sectors including national government, the security forces, business leaders, and local communities in Lunda Norte.

title: Promoting the right to freedom of expression in Bangladesh
description: This project will create greater compliance to international standards that uphold the safety of journalists and social media communicators. It will promote the right to freedom of expression, protect those who exercise it and help to break a culture of impunity on violent acts against them.

title: Protecting the Rights of Workers in Bangladesh
description: To ensure the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights are applied in the Bangladeshi Garment, Leather and Tannery Industries, thereby protecting UK consumers /importers from complicity in abuse of human rights and modern slavery.

title: Supporting survivors of conflict related sexual violence in Bosnia and Herzegovina
description: This project aims to strengthen the support available to survivors of rape and sexual violence in Bosnia and Herzegovina in accordance with the principles of the International Protocol on the Documentation and Investigation of Sexual Violence in Conflict.

title: Supporting survivors of conflict related sexual violence in Bosnia and Herzegovina
description: This project develops a strategy on how to advocate for compensation claims to be decided in criminal proceedings for victims of wartime sexual violence in Bosnia and Herzegovina; and on how to enforce judgments which award compensation.

title: Parliamentary Election Monitoring in Belarus
description: To carry out a long-term election observation campaign during the 2016 parliamentary elections in Belarus, in support of free and fair elections and the cause of democracy

title: Counteract and Prevent Gender-based Violence in Belarus
description: To enhance the comprehensive response to violence against women by implementing a legal and practical framework in line with international standards and the country`s commitment to counter violence against women.

title: Acting Against Human Trafficking in Belarus
description: To advocate for implementation of national anti-trafficking and gender policies in Belarus based on international rules

title: Empowering Black Women To Tackle Racism And Sexism In Brazil
description: To strengthen and empower young black women's groups to advocate against and tackle their human violations rights through capacity building, mobilization hubs and the digital platform Alyne: Em defesa das mulheres negras.

title: Strengthening Business and Human Rights Policies and Practices through Collective Actions in Brazil
description: The project aims to improve business practices and public policies on the business and human rights agenda through collective actions initiatives, specifically looking at the coordination of activities/strategies through a Coalition of institutions.

title: Defending The Rights Of LGB&T People In Botswana
description: This project aims to support the rights of LGBT people in Botswana by building evidence of discriminatory practices, policies and laws, and working to change these, putting in place a non-discriminatory environment.

title: Promoting an independent judiciary in Botswana
description: This project supported a series of debates chaired by a British barrister with young people, key stakeholders and the public about the importance of a strong, independent judiciary in a modern democratic system, helping to address concerns about the role of executive power in decisions about Botswana's courts. The project led to the establishment of peer to peer relationships for future development.

title: Decriminalising freedom of expression in Burma
description: To increase the Burmese government's capacity to reform laws that criminalise freedom of expression, bringing them into conformity with international standards.

title: Improving Respect For Human Rights In Burma
description: To advance civil and political rights in Burma through support for ratification of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.

title: Protecting civil society through better regulation
description: To support development of policies for fair, transparent and effective regulation of civil society, through public debate on charity legislation and providing technical assistance to the Government.

title: Supporting fair trials for vulnerable defendants facing the death penalty in Asia
description: The project aims to protect the right to fair trial of defendants in death penalty review cases, by improving relevant policies of the criminal legal aid service and helping the criminal legal aid lawyers obtain special trial techniques of death penalty cases via setting guidelines and training.

title: Reducing the use of detention in the justice system of an ODA eligible country
description: To lower long term detention rates of those not convicted of crime through the introduction of procedural guidance, to help coordinate the work of the public prosecution service and the police when deciding on formal arrests. The project will also promote non-custodial alternative measures to detention.

title: Improving the functioning of the judiciary in Asia
description: To promote greater public participation in judicial processes by drawing on good experience and practice of UK's jury system to promote reform. To do this, the project will use comparative studies, capacity building for people's assessors and judges, and legislative recommendations. This will make the judiciary more open and democratic.

title: Countering domestic violence in ODA eligible country
description: This project will protect women and children's rights against domestic violence in a developing Asian country. This will be achieved through improving the model of prevention and intervention into domestic violence, and drawing on international experiences of legislation and practice.

title: Upholding the rights of people with mental health problems in an ODA eligible country.
description: To uphold the rights of people with mental health problems through empowering Civil Society Organisations in an ODA eligible country

title: Supporting engagement with Chinese civil society in UN human rights advocacy mechanisms
description: This project aims to enable civil society organisations to engage with UN human rights mechanisms for more effective advocacy, including seeking to advance government accountability on issues of sexual orientation and gender identity and expression, and women's human rights.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Asia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Asia.

title: Tackling domestic violence against women in China
description: This project aims to improve the Chinese police response to domestic violence by contributing to the development of an early warning system and court civil protection system for victims.

title: Death penalty prevention in China
description: This project aims to provide training and guidance to Chinese judges on dealing with the media and victims in death penalty cases, and to draw up legislative recommendations on victims' rights.

title: Supporting workers rights
description: This project will promote workers rights in accordance with new national regulations and the UN Guiding Principles (UNGPs) by developing effective social dialogue structures and industry guidance.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Eastern Asia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of the Magna Carta Fund for Human Rights and Democracy strategy in Eastern Asia

title: Administrative costs of ODA Projects in China
description: Monitoring and evaluation costs for human rights and democracy programme projects in China, to ensure value for money and probity.

title: Protecting Human Rights Defenders In Colombia: Territorial process of guarantees for human rights defenders and peace building in Colombia
description: The project will set up local coordination mechanisms called "Regional Guarantees Roundtables" in seven regions of Colombia, for consultation and dialogue between human rights defenders, local and national government and the international community. At the roundtables protection measures for human rights defenders will be jointly agreed; they will identify specific needs for protection, including those of women human rights defenders, and also contribute to monitor the human rights situation in areas highly impacted by the armed conflict, and where the peace agreements will be implemented

title: Implementing The National Action Plan (Nap) On Business And Human Rights In Colombia
description: The project will support the implementation of the Colombian National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights, by providing technical support for the government to set up the criteria of how an institutional grievances mechanism should look like. Recommendations for a remedy mechanism for communities affected by businesses operations will be delivered, and three pilots to test how feasible these recommendations are will be implemented. Local public officers will be trained, so they are better equipped to fulfil their duty to protect and remedy

title: Supporting human rights in Colombia
description: This project delivers a protocol with specific and appropriate measures to protect human rights defenders in rural Colombia, jointly designed by human rights defenders and the Colombian state.

title: Preventing sexual violence in Colombia
description: This project creates a network of women victims of sexual violence and professionals to support and empower victims in five regions of the country (Putumayo, Nario, Bolvar, Cesar y Meta) for the prevention of sexual violence, both in conflict and post conflict scenarios.

title: Implementing the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights in the Colombian mining sector
description: This project promotes knowledge of the human rights impacts of mining gold and construction materials and develops tools for their prevention, mitigation and access to non judicial remedies with the government, mining companies, community based organisations and civil society organisations. The project supports an evidence based strategy and policy document on access and use of non judicial remedy to human rights grievances delivered to the Colombian government.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Columbia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Columbia

title: Strengthening Democratic Participation In Cuba
description: The project will strengthen local democratic participation by disadvantaged communities in Havana, and especially vulnerable groups within them. It will do this by giving them a voice in local urban development planning and decision-making, and by co-creating solutions with officials and technical professionals.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in America
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of the Human Rights and Democracy Programme strategy in America.

title: Reducing violence against women in Cuba
description: This project promotes a series of information campaigns and community workshops that raise awareness of violence against women in Cuba, develops the capacity of local and national governments to tackle the issue, and develops strategies for longer term protection of human rights for women in Cuba.

title: Administrative costs of ODA Projects in Cuba
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of the Human Rights and Democracy Programme strategy in Cuba.

title: Strengthening the capacity of human rights reporting tools in an ODA eligible country
description: To improve the capacity of human rights reporters and independent journalists in an ODA eligible country to document, verify and archive digital media pertaining to alleged rights abuses.

title: Criminal Justice Reform in North Africa
description: This project will advance the long-term cause of criminal justice reform in North Africa through capacity building activities aimed at developing young magistrates and judges' understanding of international best practices, and in-depth research and scholarship necessary for the formulation of new public policy directives.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Africa
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Africa

title: Supporting judicial and legislative democratic reform in El Salvador
description: The project aims to use British expertise to influence the development, content and adoption of a reinsertion and rehabilitation bill in El Salvador in line with international democratic and professional norms. This substantial reform will promote justice, rule of law, social inclusion and violence reduction.

title: Strengthening the Eritrean judicial system
description: This project will focus on dialogue with the Eritrean judiciary to promote engagement on judicial ethics, mediation and the rule of law. It will also deliver a better understanding of the current legal situation in Eritrea in order to make reforms which strengthen the rule of law that have buy in from the judiciary.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin ODA eligible countries
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in ODA eligible countries

title: Supporting the performance of Parliament in Fiji
description: To enhance the capabilities of Parliament by making the Standing Committee system more effective in scrutinising government activity and processes, thereby strengthening democracy in this Commonwealth country.

title: Engaging Young Women in Fiji's Democratisation
description: To engage girls and young women in Fiji's ongoing democratization process and help them mobilize to demand government accountability and transparency, justice and women's rights.

title: Strengthening the role of ombudspersons in enhancing respect for human rights in conflict affected regions in Georgia
description: This project will contribute to the conflict settlement process in Georgia by enhancing respect for human rights in the conflict affected regions through contacts and exchanges between the ombudspersons from Tbilisi and Sukhumi as well as a selected number of civil society representatives active in the relevant fields.

title: Supporting transitional justice measures in Moldova
description: Confidence building measures on both banks of the river Nistru/Dniester: follow up to the Council of Europe expert's report in the field of criminal justice

title: Supporting advocacy for the abolition of the death penalty in an ODA eligible country
description: This project aims to support human rights through support for the abolition of the death penalty by hosting a roundtable with senior officials and civil society organisations.

title: Tackling human trafficking in Honduras
description: This project aims to achieve effective implementation and Congressional oversight of Human Trafficking Legislation

title: Empowering girls to understand their rights in Guatemala
description: To set up and support "I am a Girl and I have Rights" - a leadership and empowerment girls club for urban at-risk girls living on the margins of society in Guatemala City, which will help them understand their rights and provide support.

title: Administrative costs of ODA Projects in Honduras
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Honduras.

title: Defending Human Rights through the Indonesian Parliament
description: This project seeks to embed human rights principles in the development and oversight of parliamentary human rights legislation.

title: Tackling radicalisation and extremism in Indonesia
description: To strengthen civil society's role in countering radicalisation and violent extremism in Indonesia through intensive communications and media campaigns.

title: Promote religious freedom in Indonesia by strengthening the capacity of strategic legal aid advocates.
description: Improve the standard of advocacy for the right to religious freedom of religious minorities both at policy and litigation levels to support and promote human rights and freedom of religion or belief in Indonesia.

title: Improving Police Treatment Of Women in ODA eligible countries
description: This project works to ensure women's complaints of sexual offences are appropriately received and dealt with. This will be achieved through creating a dialogue between police forces in Asia and women's advocate groups to create local solutions. At a national level the project will create a training module to teach police forces how to properly receive women's complaints of sexual abuse.

title: Improving Women's Access to Justice in an ODA Eligible Country
description: This project will increase access to justice, rights and protection for women and girl victims of violence through knowledge transfer and training of police officers and lawyers.

title: To combat violence and discrimination against women in India
description: This project will empower human rights defenders to use domestic law as a tool to challenge social and institutional discrimination that perpetuates and normalises violence against Dalit women.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in India
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in India

title: Protecting human rights defenders in the Middle East
description: This project will support freedom of expression in the Middle East by creating a protected on line platform for human rights defenders

title: Reducing the use of the death penalty in Iran
description: This project will support international advocacy for the abolition of the death penalty in law and in practice in Iran

title: Strengthening the freedom of expression in the occupied Palestinian territories
description: This project will strengthen access to information and create public awareness about judicial, governmental and private sector processes with regard to freedom of expression, the plurality of opinion, rights of local media, and open internet freedoms

title: Promoting freedom of expression and the right to information through technology
description: The project aims to promote democracy by establishing a digital platform that promotes free expression, where decision makers, journalists, and citizens can interact freely to achieve accountability, transparency, and the right to information.

title: Defending the rights of detainees in Jordan
description: To improve the treatment of detainees in Jordan through enhancing their access to legal assistance following arrest and during interrogation

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Jordan
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Jordan.

title: Supporting reintegration into society of ex-prisoners in Kyrgyzstan
description: To develop policies which promote the employment of ex-prisoners and social reintegration of prisoners after release.

title: Documenting human rights violations in Syria
description: This project will provide Syrian CSOs with greater capacity to inform policy-makers/the public about the results of documentation projects detailing HR violations, thereby reducing the risk of impunity for violations committed.

title: Tackling Violence Against Women And Girls In The Middle East And North Africa
description: This project will encourage political leadership, legislative reforms and regional cooperation in order to produce a safer environment for women and girls.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Lebanon
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Lebanon.

title: Preventing the Use of Torture In Africa
description: This project will strengthen African regional approaches to prevent torture and strengthen their linkages with and support to domestic efforts to criminalise torture in Nigeria, Tunisia and Namibia. This will be achieved by working with the Committee to Prevent Torture in Africa to collect information and to engage civil scoiety and senior government officials.

title: Preventing torture in developing countries
description: This project will advocate for the prevention of torture through the national application of the Optional Protocol to the UN Convention against Torture, in particular by supporting the capacity of National Preventive Mechanisms.

title: Reducing The Use Of The Death Penalty In Bangladesh, India, Kenya And Zimbabwe
description: To promote and protect the human rights of those facing the death penalty through a combination of strengthening the rule of law, capacity building of members of the judiciary, lawyers and medical experts, and empirical research on perceived attitudes towards the death penalty.

title: Moving Towards Abolition of the Death Penalty
description: This project will engage with countries retaining the death penalty, specifically sending members of the All Party Parliamentary Group for the Abolition of the Death Penalty on eight missions to countries around the world over a two year period, with the aim of influencing governments, support abolitionist activity and to equip abolitionist parliamentarians and those from civil society to become more confident and more active in ending the death penalty.

title: Building consensus on abolition of the death penalty in Botswana, Malawi and Uganda
description: The project will empower and strengthen the capacity of local lawyers and grassroots organisations to use litigation to challenge the death penalty in key South and East African countries and to build an anti-death penalty consensus, assisting them in converting formal and de facto moratoria into death penalty abolition.

title: Defending Freedom Of Religion Or Belief In The Middle East And North Africa
description: This project will prevent intolerance and social hostility toward religious communities by strengthening the capacity of educators to teach about the freedom of religion or belief and create a culture of respect for this right among youth. The project will do this through offering training opportunities to Ministries of Education across the Middle East and North Africa.

title: Creating advocates for Freedom of Religion or Belief in developing countries
description: This project will equip post-graduate students in the UK with an in-depth understanding of the importance of Freedom of Religion or Belief (FORB), and to empower them to become advocates of FORB in their universities and home countries.

title: Building the capacity and accountability of the Lao Parliament
description: To improve the capacity of the National Assembly of Laos to develop legislation, represent the population and hold government to account. Westminster Foundation for Democracy will support the National Assembly by sharing experiences from the House of Commons, devolved assemblies, and the Ombudsman office, and from partner parliaments in other countries, which provide a variety of examples of approaches and practices required to perform effectively.

title: Helping an ODA Eligible Country Improve Human Rights
description: To strengthen the capacity of civil society in an ODA eligible country to engage in the United Nations Universal Periodic Review Process, thereby making it more likely that reforms and improvements can be implemented to the benefit of citizens.

title: To strengthen democracy in Laos by identifying support required by the National Assembly in Laos.
description: The project will identify priority areas for UK support to the Lao Parliament. The National Assembly (NA) will play an important role in Laos through continued integration into the rules based international system, and given the UK's world leading expertise in this field, the project will make a real difference to its emerging capacity

title: Defending freedom of expression and freedom of religion or belief in ODA eligible country
description: The project will conduct a series of workshops on international standards on Freedom of Expression and Freedom of Religion or Belief, particularly on countering hate speech with civil society and key government stakeholders.

title: Strengthening justice and torture prevention in Mexico
description: To provide enforced disappearance and torture prevention training for Mexican judges, prosecutors and public defenders

title: Building A National Torture Preventive Mechanism In Morocco
description: This project will work with the Moroccan authorities in building an effective, independent and transparent Optional Protocol to the Convention Against Torture (OPCAT) National Preventive Mechanism in Morocco through multi-stakeholder training sessions, dialogues and an effective communications campaign.

title: Protecting Migrant Labourers Against Abuse In Asia And The Middle East
description: This project will strengthen international human rights institutions and improve the implementation of international human rights standards on labour migration in Asia and the Gulf. It will do this by supporting grassroots activists with training and technology to document rights violations and strengthen their advocacy campaigns for migrant rights at national, regional, and international levels.

title: Defending universal rights and democratic governance by resisting internet shutdowns as a tactic of repression
description: This project will defend universal rights and democratic governance by resisting the growing use of internet shutdowns worldwide. It will do this by building international consensus around the issue, forming a strong multi-stakeholder coalition against the issue, and gaining commitment from the tech sector to push back against shutdowns and keep internet access online.

title: Defending civic space and freedom of expression in Central Asia
description: To support democratic freedoms in Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan in order to help them become more stable and prosperous partners for UK. It will do this by protecting civic space, through improving protection for human rights defenders and independent media; and challenging restrictive legislation, policies and practices domestically and internationally.

title: Promoting social stability and security through advancing freedom of religion or belief in Central Asia
description: This project will contribute to social stability and security in CA through building the capacity of key state and non-state stakeholders in two Central Asian OSCE participating States to advance FoRB for all.

title: Strengthening freedom of expression in East Africa
description: This project will identify the online security threats facing civil society organisations in a number of East African countries, recommend a plan of action for countering these threats to society activity and democratic participation, and work with civil society organisations to increase their capacity and resilience. This included a mapping exercise of cyber threats and a cyber capacity assessment. The project held two launch events, one in the region and one at a leading international conference in Brussels, to disseminate the results.

title: Tackling Gender-Based Violence And Discrimination In Egypt, Jordan And Tunisia
description: This project aims to take action against discrimination and gender-based violence in cities and public spaces by increasing understanding of the value of gender responsive services amongst authority groups, and their value in address the discrimination and violation of women's rights. It will also work to hold duty bearers accountable for making public services gender responsive in Jordan, Egypt and Tunisia.

title: Enhancing global democratic participation and human rights by applying lessons learned from UNDEF civil society projects.
description: To strengthen global efforts to advance democratic participation and human rights by drawing on evaluations of the United Nations Democracy Fund's (UNDEF) global civil society projects, so as to continuously build knowledge and establish best practices on civil society work that can be applied by UNDEF, the wider UN family, civil society and other international partners and donors. The project aims to make future engagement with civil society on democratic participation and human rights more impactful and effective by understanding and evaluating previous projects.

title: Empowering women through mentoring networks in the OSCE region
description: To work with NGOs in a number of OSCE states to help them establish and expand mentoring networks that contribute to the empowerment of marginalised women, including migrant women and survivors of gender-based violence.

title: Delivering the Women, Peace and Security agenda in developing countries in the OSCE region
description: This project will support workshops between government and civil society practitioners from 10 developing countries in the OSCE region, which are currently implementing the UNSCR1325 designed to address human rights abuses related to the Women, Peace and Security agenda. The workshops share best practise and provide support to countries developing, implementing and updating these National Action Plans.

title: Enhancing gender equality in political parties in the OSCE region
description: This project will advance women's participation in political parties in a number of OSCE ODA countries, by assessing the current baseline and gaps, and producing tailored recommendations, supported by training and workshops in-country.

title: Promoting the Women, Peace and Security agenda with developing country governments
description: This project will promote greater implementation of commitments on UNSCR 1325 in the OSCE, by considering best practice and experiences from countries in the OSCE region, including Bosnia and Herzegovina and Tajikistan.

title: Strengthening LGBTI rights in Eastern Europe and Central Asia
description: To coordinate and strengthen regional efforts to counter hate speech and negative social attitudes targeting LGBTI people; thereby counteracting intolerance across Europe and Central Asia. It will do this by facilitating knowledge exchange and dialogue between activists and civil society organisations, monitoring hate speech, informing journalists on freedom of expression principles, and cross-regional advocacy.

title: Defending The Rights Of Workers In Brazil, India, Mexico And Malaysia
description: To promote the uptake of the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights through multi-sector dialogue and capacity building with key stakeholders, thereby working for a level playing field and secure, respectable supply chains in four of UK's key overseas economic partners.

title: Preventing mass atrocities in Asia, Africa and the Middle East
description: To promote the Responsibility to Protect (R2P) by strengthening national and regional capacity to prevent mass atrocities, raising awareness of atrocity risk situations and using publications to advocate for timely preventive or responsive action by the international community.

title: Strengthening respect for human rights in the context of mega sporting events
description: To establish mechanisms, guidance and best practice to ensure that human rights considerations are taken into account when evaluating mega sporting events bids from candidate States, and throughout the planning and execution phase of these events.

title: Preventing Genocide And Countering Extremism In Africa, Asia And The Middle East
description: This project will reduce the risk of extremism and a genocide by encouraging selected vulnerable countries to examine the history of the Holocaust as an example of what can happen when hatred goes unchecked, and to search out contemporary connections. The project will build the capacity of key institutions and individuals in these countries to create tolerance and nurture democratic values in their own communities, and it will provide recommendations for policy in these states.

title: Promoting women's rights with Muslim governments in developing countries
description: To support the work of international human rights mechanisms, as well as groups and individuals engaged with these processes, by providing concepts, language and research that bridge the perceived gap between Islam and women's human rights, and promote the universality of human rights.

title: Promoting human rights online
description: This project facilitates civil society engagement in international internet related policy debates relevant for freedom of expression online.

title: Supporting Indonesia and Colombia to implement the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights
description: The project will support the governments of Colombia and Indonesia to implement the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights, in particular the 'state duty to protect'. It will provide technical expertise to improve the governments' capacity to discharge their obligations in the area of investment policy.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Indonesia, China and Philippines
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Indonesia, China and Philippines

title: Combating torture in Nigeria
description: This project will contribute to the effective operation of Nigeria's National Preventative Mechanism (NPM), established in accordance with the Optional Protocol to the Convention against Torture. It will develop a legal framework for the NPM and provide expert assistance and training to its personnel.

title: Tackling Radicalisation In Nigeria
description: To work for the de-radicalisation and the re-integration of young people who have been exposed to violent extremist groups, therefore reducing the risk that they become violent and a danger to peace and stability in Nigeria and beyond. It will do this by setting up community forums, training prominent villagers on how to de-radicalise and mentor young people returning to their communities, and teaching these young people professional skills.

title: Preventing sexual violence in Nepal
description: This project aims to increase public awareness of sexual violence against women and possible means of support through producing radio dramas.

title: Making provincial government more accountable for human rights in an ODA eligible country
description: This project will enable the provincial ministries to identify human rights risks and become better equipped to deal with human rights issues that arise by improving accountability measures.

title: Challenging the blasphemy law in ODA eligible country
description: This project will challenge blasphemy laws by deconstructing and disseminating a sophisticated counter-narrative; producing a compendium of litigation that can be used to press for legislative changes; and producing a legal defence manual.

title: Supporting The Transition To Peace In Mindanao, Philippines
description: To support the transition to a Bangsamoro Parliament in conflict-affected Mindanao, supporting the establishment of peace and stability after years of conflict.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projectsin the Philippines
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in the Philippines.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projectsin the Philippines
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in the Philippines.

title: Defending The Rights Of LGBT People In Eastern Europe and Central Asia
description: This project will carry out a capacity development programme for LGBT Human Rights Defenders in Eastern Europe and Central Asia

title: Promoting human rights in Rwanda
description: The project facilitates the completion of the ratification process for the Optional Protocol on the Convention Against Torture and the designation of an National Preventive Mechanism (NPM) in Rwanda.

title: Strengthening asset recovery and anti-bribery awareness training in South Africa
description: This project will promote awareness of international anti-bribery standards and increase understanding of these in South Africa. The project will then enhance the capacity of law enforcement to trace and recover the proceeds of financial misconduct.

title: Administrative costs of ODA Projects in South Africa
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in South Africa.

title: Widening democratic space in South Sudan
description: To improve citizen engagement on the Agreement on Resolution of Conflict in South Sudan (ARCISS) and its implementation, through radio discussions, dialogues and talk shows.

title: Reducing sexual violence in South Sudan
description: This project will establish women's peacekeeping teams in two counties in South Sudan. It aims to achieve a sustainable reduction in sexual violence in Aerial and Rumbek counties.

title: Preventing sexual violence in South Sudan
description: This project will work with survivors' groups to contribute to the prevention of sexual violence in South Sudan. It will build their capacity to hold the national authorities to account through training and expertise sharing.

title: Reducing Use Of The Death Penalty In Sudan
description: To convene legal advocates to identify strategies for reducing the application of the death penalty in Sudan

title: Supporting democracy in Sudan
description: To support democracy in Sudan by improving legislative scrutiny, oversight and responsiveness to citizens by the Sudanese Parliament

title: Promoting freedom of speech in Sudan
description: This project increases public awareness of social issues and pressure for social change by amplifying the voice and impact of citizen journalists.

title: Strengthening accountability for sexual and gender-based violence in an ODA eligible country
description: To promote accountability for torture, sexual and gender-based violence and other serious human rights violations and abuses in an ODA eligible country.

title: Protecting human rights in the Maldives
description: To widen democratic space and protect human rights through collective lobbying, advocacy, partnership building and dialogue between civil society, the media, youth groups and the public.

title: Promoting good governance and accountability in Sierra Leone
description: A workshop aimed at enhancing the capacity of selected committees from the Parliament of Sierra Leone to strengthen their performance of oversight functions in relation to democratic governance, human security and accountability. This will contribute to effective parliamentary engagement with the ongoing constitutional review process.

title: Protecting And Empowering Human Rights Defenders In the MENA Region
description: To protect and empower human rights defenders in the MENA region, and improve their capacity to promote respect for human rights, through training on international human rights law and human rights monitoring.

title: Supporting participation at the Human Rights Council by Least Developed Countries and Small Island Developing States
description: Support for a voluntary fund to enable participation by least (ODA) developed countries and small island developing states, at the Human Rights Council

title: Empowering human rights defenders in developing countries
description: This project will support human rights defenders by strengthening and promoting effective implementation of international, regional and national standards for their protection, and by building their capacity to use international human rights mechanisms as levers for concrete, national-level human rights change.

title: Enhancing Victims' Access To Justice Through UN Human Rights Mechanisms
description: The project aims to improve the impact of UN human rights mechanisms in securing justice for victims of violations, in FCO priority countries in Asia, by building the capacity of human rights lawyers to engage with the Geneva-based human rights system. In conjunction with FCO Missions, selected human rights lawyers will received detailed training in the region, with a small number also completing a more detailed mentorship programme.

title: UN voluntary trust contribution to support Human Rights
description: Contribution to UN voluntary trust fund on ending contemporary forms of slavery

title: Tackling corruption with a focus in Colombia, Honduras and Guatemala
description: Leveraging The Un Human Rights System To Contribute To The Global Fight Against Corruption And The Realisation Of Sustainable Development Goals 2016.

title: Building the capacity of human rights defenders in India, South Sudan, Venezuela and Zimbabwe
description: To enhance the capacity of civil society organisations (CSOs) to engage with and utilise the Universal Periodic Review (UPR) in order to ensure the implementation of the recommendations received by their governments

title: Supporting efforts to tackle contemporary slavery in Niger and Mauritania
description: Follow-up activities relating to the country missions of the Special Rapporteur on modern slavery; including engagement with government, civil society and UN stakeholders to gather information on the implementation of the modern slavery recommendations following country visits, as well as further workshops, bilateral meetings, ongoing monitoring and evaluation.

title: Supporting human rights in Syria by addressing sexual based violence
description: The projects aims to help women, girls and men in Syria to understand and question negative sexual violence social norms, attitudes and behaviours and take action in their local communities to help prevent sexual violence. It also aims to increase the capacity of Syrian media practitioners to report sexual violence responsibly.

title: Promoting human rights in Syria by empowering civil society organisations
description: This project empowers emerging Syrian civil society groups and human rights defenders operating inside Syria with the skills, action oriented tools, and peer support networks to effectively engage with key decision makers at the local level to raise awareness of sexual violence and advocate for sustainable, long term policy change.

title: Strengthening human rights in Thailand
description: To ensure a meaningful engagement of all stakeholders in Thailand's Universal Periodic Review (UPR) and an effective implementation of UPR recommendations in order to improve the human rights situation on the ground, thereby supporting greater stability and propserity in Thailand.

title: Facilitating diverse public voices in Thailand
description: This project aims to promote democracy and support freedom of expression in Thailand by influencing constitutional and political reform through the provision of an inclusive online platform for broad and constructive public scrutiny of and engagement in the reform process.

title: Supporting the rights of disabled people in Turkmenistan
description: This project will raise awareness of disabled people's rights through advocacy work that informs people with disabilities and their families about legal information on human rights.

title: Implementing the constitution of an ODA country through new legislation to strengthen rule of law
description: To supporting the implementation of the country's constitution's democratic and human rights guarantees, by translating them into laws that strengthen rule of law, including access to justice, and thereby establishing the foundations for the creation of democratic and judicial institutions

title: Defending rights of LGBT people in African ODA eligible country
description: To defend LGBT rights by creating safe spaces, improving support services to LGBT people and changing public perceptions of LGBT issues

title: Upholding Freedom Of Expression And Promoting Stable Pluralistic Societies In the MENA region
description: To promote stability and protect freedom of expression by providing tools and methodologies to states while strengthening civil society to call for institutional, legislative and policy change, engage with international human rights mechanisms and combat intolerance and hate speech.

title: Supporting the rule of law and human rights in Tunisia
description: This project seeks to use UK assistance to help Tunisian security services implement national policies that could achieve quick results, by nurturing the political will and organisational capacity of the Ministries of Interior, Justice and Defence to prevent, prohibit and punish torture and mistreatment.

title: Defending the rights of workers in Turkey
description: To strengthen the Turkish clothing and textile sector's ability to implement the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGPs) through the establishment of a local platform, bringing together business, trade unions and civil society that will raise business and human rights awareness, promote workplace social dialogue and address the root causes of human rights issues in the sector

title: Promoting democracy and dialogue through the media in ODA eligible country
description: To promote freedom of expression and non-discriminatory reporting, as well as encouraging use of social media to promote messages of tolerance and of countering radicalization

title: Countering violent extremism in ODA eligible country
description: To improve knowledge, and where possible practice, on countering violent extremism through training and knowledge exchange, thereby making the country more stable and promoting its sustainable development

title: Supporting the implementation of the UN campaign for LGB&T equality
description: This project will support continued implementation of the UN Free & Equal Campaign by producing multimedia campaign materials, tailored national-level activities and UNHQ events.

title: Strengthening the UN systems' approach to comprehensive womens access to justice
description: Addressing the shortfalls in the UN system's response to discriminatory personal laws by establishing inter-agency working groups, creating a comprehensive report on this shortfall, conducting country-level situation analyses, and expanding UN training syllabus' to include a module on this topic.

title: Fighting slavery and human trafficking by non-state armed groups
description: Identify clear and actionable ways in which the international community can fight slavery and human trafficking by non-state armed groups and counter violent extremism.

title: Strengthening Parliamentary democracy and transparency in Venezuela
description: To strengthening the Venezuelan National Assembly's institutional capacity to promote a more democratic, transparent and effective parliamentary culture

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Venezuela
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Venezuela.

title: Defending the human rights of victims and potential victims of human trafficking in Vietnam
description: To support victims and potential victims of human trafficking, thereby seeking to reduce informal and illegal migration, including to the UK

title: Countering anti-LGBT hate crime and hate speech in South East Europe
description: To work with Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) Human Rights Defenders (HRDs), police forces and judicial entities in the UK and South East Europe thereby transforming institutions and empowering movements to address LGBT hate crimes/speech and incidents.

title: Strengthening Justice In Zimbabwe
description: To contribute to the proper establishment and functioning of the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) for impartial and effective justice delivery.

title: Promoting Participation in Elections in an ODA eligible country
description: To uphold fundamental rights, contribute to the conduct of free and fair elections, and assist in effective decision-making around electoral participation through strategic litigation and related advocacy and media initiatives.

title: Supporting under-represented black and female advocates in South Africa
description: This project will build the technical skills and ethical standards of black and female advocates (a significantly under-represented group at the bar) to the highest levels, particularly in courtroom advocacy.

title: Strengthening law enforcement oversight in an ODA eligible country
description: To Improve the impact of specialised law enforcement oversight agencies in an ODA eligible country.

title: Chevening Scholarships
description: This project provides access to education through Chevening scholarships to students from ODA eligible countries, enabling them to pursue postgraduate study in the UK. This allows the UK to engage with and invest in future leaders at an early stage of their career, helping us to work better together in the future.

title: South East Asia Maritime Disaster response initiative
description: Support to South East Asian states to co-operate on Maritime Disaster response issues leading to a more effective regional and co-ordinated approach to Maritime incidents

title: South East Asia Maritime Disaster Response Initiative
description: Project will support South East Asian states to co operate on Maritime Disaster response issues leading to a more effective regional and co ordinated approach to Maritime incidents.

title: Improving maritime security in West Africa
description: This project will provide a liaison officer to the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) in order to help improve regional maritime security awareness.

title: Westminster Foundation Grant
description: This grant was used to help establish and strengthen pluralist democratic institutions, particularly political parties, in countries where they are absent, of recent foundation, or in need of further encouragement and development.

title: Westminster Foundation Grant
description: This grant was used to help establish and strengthen pluralist democratic institutions, particularly political parties, in countries where they are absent, of recent foundation, or in need of further encouragement and development.

title: Supporting Seychelles maritime law enforcement
description: This project will provide specialist advice to help the Seychelles Government establish a Maritime Police unit which will help promote prosperity by opening up opportunities within the marine economy as well as contributing to the safety of seafarers.

title: Seychelles Maritime Police
description: Provide specialist advice to help Government of Seychelles establish a Maritime Police unit to help improve opportunities for the blue economy and the safety of seafarers.

title: Promoting human rights and good governance
description: These projects have provided training to institutions globally to enable them to better tackle corruption and to promote transparency and accountability.

title: Tertiary education for Syrian refugees and asylum seekers in Egypt
description: This project aims to alleviate pressures for Syrian refugees and migrants to seek irregular migration by providing 25 Syrian refugees with reason to remain in Egypt through funding their tertiary education. This will enhance opportunities for them to find gainful employment in Egypt after completion of their degrees.

title: Promote sustainable livelihoods for youth in Eritrea
description: This project will provide increased access to vocational training for Eritrean youth in order to ensure they have the necessary skills to participate in the economy which will in turn contribute to the wider development of the Eritrean economy.

title: Promoting human rights in Jamaica
description: The project increases the capacity of a homeless shelter to assist in the reintegration of deported migrants, by providing additional housing, training and income generation.

title: Promoting prison reform in Jamaica
description: The project assists the Jamaican government to strengthen their ability to house prisoners in Jamaica as well as foreign national offenders. The project will allow UK experts to visit Jamaica to work with the government on prison reform and a prisoner transfer agreement.

title: Strengthen law enforcement in prevention of human trafficking in Vietnam.
description: To provide capacity building training to key stakeholders in raising awareness of human trafficking for vulnerable individuals. This will increase the ability to identify human trafficking victims and support their recovery in order to ensure a reduction in trafficking.

title: Promoting democracy in Algeria
description: The project aim is to promote messages of democratic development to young people and academics across Algeria through an exhibition tour and university speeches, also helping the Embassy to forge new links with audiences and organisations in Algeria.

title: Strengthening democracy supporting young Algerians to engage in debating
description: This project aims to support democracy by strengthening youth engagement through providing young people, from across Algeria, with debating skills culminating in a national debating completion.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Algeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Algeria.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Tunisia
