description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of programme strategy in Tunisia

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Algeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Algeria.

title: Promoting democracy through connecting MPs with their constituents
description: The project aims to increase the capacity of Moroccan MPs to interact with citizens through the establishment and management of 14 constituency offices. These offices will deliver improved constituent outreach which will strengthen the ability of MPs to understand and respond to citizens' needs, promoting increased public transparency and accountability.

title: Promoting women's political participation and representation in Morocco
description: The project will address the disparity and inequality between women and men in political rights by undertaking a series of activities such as training which will strengthen the participation and political representation of women in the 2015 municipal, provincial and regional elections.

title: Strengthening governance and democracy by supporting local NGOs to monitor elections
description: This project aims to build the capacity of local NGOs to monitor and provide non partisan assessments of local elections. It also aims to increase the awareness of civil society and citizens on transparent, peaceful and credible elections.

title: Promoting good governance and transparency in Morocco
description: The project aims to strengthen governance and transparency in Morocco through promoting citizen engagement. It will do so through developing schemes which help citizens participate in budgeting at a local level and developing a certification scheme that publicly recognises good management by local authorities.

title: Fighting corruption and promoting transparency through citizens.
description: The project will help civil society organisations and citizens' improve their advocacy skills so that they are better able to participate in efforts to improve legislation on corruption and transparency. It will also disseminate information which help citizens better understand their rights so that they can interact more effectively with the Moroccan authorities.

title: Promoting a culture of integrity, transparency and accountability in Moroccan schools
description: The project supports reform in the Moroccan school system through funding educational activities (such as building awareness of proper standards of behaviour) which promote transparency and integrity in selected state schools. The project is intended as a pilot that could be funded nationally by the Moroccan Ministry of National Education if successful.

title: Promoting an increased civil society role in participatory democracy
description: To project will improve the regulation of charities in Morocco through providing expertise from the UK's Charity Commission on how the Moroccan government could improve international charity regulation, governance and communication with the charity sector.

title: Strengthening the rule of law in Morocco
description: This project will provide training to relevant Moroccan government institutions which increases their ability to deal effectively with internal and regional threats and instability within international human rights standards.

title: Improving accountability in Tunisia
description: The project supports Tunisian efforts to improve accountability in public life by providing training and expertise to Tunisia's court of Accounts which will strengthen the ability of the Court to act as a effective judicial body, able to provide oversight of both the legislative and executive authorities.

title: Strengthening governance through support to the Tunisian Prime Minister's Office
description: This project strengthens the capacity of central government to undertake strategic planning, design and management. This includes reorganising Tunisia's equivalent of the Cabinet Office so it is better able to develop and monitor key reforms.

title: Supporting the development of freedom of expression legislation in Tunisia
description: To strengthen public voice, freedom of expression and democratic functioning in Tunisia through a progressive legal and regulatory framework for freedom of expression and access to information consistent with the new Tunisian constitution and international standards.

title: Enhancing security in Tunisia through strategic assistance to the Ministry of Interior
description: The project supports the new government to implement strategic plans to make the security sector more effective, accountable and trusted, by consolidating strategic planning capabilities within the Ministry of Interior. It will also develop national level strategic plans, coordination structures and planning capabilities in other security ministries so that the Tunisian government takes a more efficient, coordinated and evidence based approach to security.

title: Political participation: projects encouraging wider public engagement in political processes and robust institutions in Algeria.
description: Reinforce the Algerian political system's capacity to develop responsive policy solutions that address Algerians' concerns, by strengthening parties' capacity to engage citizensyouth in particularin identifying and implementing policy solutions to the country's most pressing challenges. A growing recognition that economic diversification and systemic reform are essential to securing a peaceful future for Algeriaand avoiding a return to the "Black Decade" of the 1990scan serve parties working to integrate citizens' inputs into a reform agenda.

title: Enhancing Parties' Abilities to Participate Effectively in Electoral Processes
description: This project will help political parties with their ability to participate effectively in electoral processes by delivering workshops and other training and guidance on topics including citizen outreach, communications, campaign planning, election framework knowledge, and poll watching skills.

title: Effective and sustainable participation of women in elected assemblies
description: This project will support the effective and sustainable participation of women in elected assemblies through an ongoing project being implemented by the United Nations Development Programme.

title: Supporting the development of Public Service Media in Algeria.
description: This project will focus effort on the online departments of Radio Algerie, EPTV and APS to help them provide attractive, public service-oriented, inclusive and relevant online platforms, and to have staff who are equipped to improve programmatic output which takes account of local audience needs and actively encourages audience participation.

title: Enhancing the protection of the rights of accused persons within the Algerian Justice System.
description: Initiate and establish a platform for discussion on gaps in legislation and practice and required changes in law and policy. The implementer's proposed project model aims to address the gaps in the justice system by establishing a national platform for discussion and debate between key criminal justice stakeholders on justice reform priorities, action and recommendations for changes that respects fair trial procedures and the rights of accused persons in Algeria.

title: Supporting of the development of public service media in Algeria.
description: The project will focus on supporting staff in implementing PSB values including through the production of programming that gives a voice to all Algerian citizens at Radio Algeria. It also aims to support Radio Algeria in drafting Editorial Guidelines they have ownership of, and which are relevant to the Algerian context, in consultation with their staff. The project will ensure sustainability post-project by working with Radio Algeria's in-house trainers, trained under previous projects and HR department to develop durable training material and resources which can be used across the organisation. The success of BBC Media Action's partnership with Radio Algeria has triggered the interest of ENTV and APS which the project will also include.

title: Strengthening Elected Bodies And Political Parties Jordan
description: Enhance the effectiveness of elected institutions; develop parliamentary blocs and political parties; and strengthen the links between the Government, Parliament, governorate councils and citizens

title: Social Venture Fund
description: This project will establish in partnership with the Banque du Liban and donors a "Social Investment Fund", which will offer financing for social enterprises and technical assistance as an innovative means of promoting economic and social development in Lebanon. In doing so, it will address emigration flows and a resulting brain drain.

title: National Strategy for Citizenship & Coexistence Education Phase 2, Lebanon
description: This project will support reform of citizenship education in Lebanon to improve coexistence in order to strengthen Lebanese institutions and society.

title: Women Political Participation in Lebanon
description: We aim to increase the number of women participating in Lebanese politics by shaping public perceptions of "women in politics", through TV debates, and other communications.

title: Elections Skills Training Campaign in Lebanon
description: The objective of this programme is to support the timely conduct of credible, free, fair and transparent parliamentary elections in Lebanon. We are offering all political parties training and mentoring on how to run an effective campaign, media training, manifesto writing, and other core skills. Sessions will increase candidates' skills, and enhance the quality of the policy debate during the elections.

title: Get out the Vote Campaign in Lebanon
description: Communications Campaign to Get-out-the-vote to support Lebanon in the timely conduct of credible, free, fair and transparent parliamentary elections which increase the link between the people and their representatives.

title: UK Lebanon TechHub  Strengthening Lebanese Stability through Job Creation in the Knowledge Economy
description: High levels of unemployment amongst young and tertiary-educated Lebanese are major drivers of instability in Lebanon. Risks to economic security are also high, and increasing. This project supports UK objectives through job creation in the Knowledge Economy sector. It does this by supporting the UK-Lebanon TechHubs plan to establish an R&D Centre to bolster Lebanons knowledge creation, and to boost foreign investment and international trade with Lebanon.

title: Assessing and Strengthening Lebanese Strategic Communications
description: UK mentoring to Government of Lebanon to strengthen their communication in Lebanon to meet globally recognised UK standards. This includes an assessment by the UK Government Communication Service, and then tailored mentoring depending on recommendations made.

title: Supporting Reform within the Moroccan Parliament through Increasing Political Participation and Promoting Transparency and Accountability
description: Project aims to promote transparency and increase accountability through: 1. Building MPs' capacity in public policy evaluation; 2. Supporting the new Equity Committee to better defend women's rights; 3. Improving the MPs' understanding of legislative scrutiny and impact assessment; 4. Supporting the House of Counsellors' research centre and agreeing a workplan.

title: Promoting good governance, transparency and accountability at the local level.
description: Promote good governance principles & effective implementation of citizen participation at the local level, through awarding a "Good Governance Certification" to local authorities that meet a set of good governance criteria.

title: Fighting corruption and promoting transparency by supporting local authorities and elected officials.
description: The project aims to facilitate elected officials' advocacy to improve legislation related to corruption and transparency. It also aims to promote citizens' access to information and participation at the local level.

title: Supporting the Moroccan Parliament to evaluate public policies, scrutinise the government's finances and build the capacity of women and young MPs.
description: To support Parliament to improve governance, to become more efficient and transparent in its financial oversight, in evaluating and implementing public policies with greater input from citizens and civil society organisations, and to facilitate a greater voice for women in parliament. The project will also support the research capabilities of parliamentary staff and MPs and develop the parliament's ability to conduct effective parliamentary diplomacy.

title: Supporting Morocco's prison administration, institution's and civil society's ability to respond to emerging and new challenges in line with international human rights standards.
description: The project aims to support Morocco's prisons and civil society to respond to emerging challenges in line with international human rights standards through: 1. Organising training of trainers for prison administration staff on prison management. 2. Organising a round table on the prisons law to bring an international perspective. 3. Providing technical support to the committee in charge of drafting the prison law. 4. Organising a National conference to introduce the new minimum standards for rules for the Treatment of Prisoners.

title: Advocacy for citizen participation in local governance.
description: Promote transparency and human rights values through increased citizens' participation in local governance. The project includes three main areas: 1. identification of disfunctions and corruption cases 2. training elected officials on good practices and laws that regulate local governance and 3. advocacy for the implementation of laws and enhancing legislation such as access to information and petitions.

title: Study into radicalisation in the North of Morocco
description: As part of the preparatory work for developing a four-year programme in northern Morocco, a study was conducted that will help the British Embassy better understand the drivers of radicalisation in the Northern Region of Morocco.

title: Identifying Development Support To Morocco
description: Design of organisational development support to Moroccan think tanks and funding for key research on UK priority policy areas that can be achieved during 2017-18.

title: Inclusive Voices in North Africa: Bringing the voices of the Sahara into the public sphere
description: Provide space for voices of marginalised populations in Algeria, Libya, Mali, Morocco, Mauritania & Tunisia; to enhance understanding of their concerns & awareness of need for equality & political inclusion.

title: Syria TracK II Dialogue Initiative AP
description: This project will build consensus among key Syrian actors to achieve a legitimate, just, and peaceful political transition through organising structured dialogues where influential Syrians representing diverse constituencies can meet, voice their views, and agree on common positions.

title: Support to the Presidency of Tunisia (Prime Ministry).
description: This project will continue to work on the reform of the PM's office, Chief of Staff Office and the new Ministry of Public Administration, Governance & Anti-Corruption to increase the Tunisian Government's capacity to deliver reforms and to improve public service delivery.

title: To increase young Tunisians' political and civic engagement
description: Enhancing the civic engagement and political participation by Tunisian youth through supporting media programme content that tackles key yough issues (e.g unemployment, corruption, education); and increased capacity of Tunisian media and Civil Society Organisations to reach youth audiences through TV and digial content.

title: Increased youth participation in local elections by building the capacity of the electoral authorities to communicate with young voters.
description: Building greater youth participation in the March 2017 local elections by increasing the electoral authroities' capacity to communicate with young voters through digital media. To be delivered through funding a United Nations Development Programme project.

title: Strategic assistance to Tunisian security sector.
description: Support democratic reform of the Tunisian security and justice sector, increasing its efficiency and effectiveness through supporting: i. the development of ministerial and national strategic plans for key security threats (CT, CVE, borders); ii. the development of a formal NSC structure/system, as requested by Presidential Security Adviser; iii. enhancing strategic capabilities to create these plans and lead reform.

title: Support Algerian Government Communications
description: This project will provide support to political and economic reform and assist crisis management through providing an assessment of strategic communications of the Government of Algeria.

title: UK/Algeria Chamber Commerce
description: This project will increase UK trade with Algeria and to facilitate investment in the UK for Algerian businessmen by the establishment of a British- Algeria Chamber of Commerce to offer one stop shop facilities

title: Countering Extremism Through Education Reform in Egypt
description: This project will promote stability and reduce conflict by improving the academic level of students and providing training to schools on new learning techniques. Students will be more inclined to pursue their education and less likely to be radicalised.

title: Promoting Good Governance and Accountable Public Services in the Egyptian Health Sector
description: Advance UK action on promoting good governance by mobilising local NGOs to monitor health service quality through a community monitoring tool. It enables service providers, regulators and policy-makers to identify areas of defects and track the progress of their quality improvement processes. It also allows holding authorities, local councils and hospitals accountable for the services they provide.

title: Improving Economic Growth in Egypt
description: Tackle barriers of sustainable growth and improve Egyptian business environment. Create network of communicators, trade partners of the future, ethical leaders and successful entrepreneurs by developing skills/mindsets of young men/women

title: Promoting Human Rights in Egypt
description: Advance the UK action on human rights, promoting stability and reducing conflict by building the capacity of disabled people organisations to advocate for the rights of people with disabilities

title: Improving Economic Governance and Business Environment in Egypt
description: Tackle economic governance and improve the business environment by assisting the Egyptian government's work on reforms of the tax system by attendance of tax officials on the HM Revenue training course

title: Reduce Conflict in Syrian Refugee Communities in Egypt
description: This project will promote stability and reduce conflict by raising awareness on Sexual Gender Based Violence and child protection in communities for Syrian refugees.

title: Countering Daesh Narrative Through Promoting Iraqi Heritage and Fostering National Identity
description: This project aims to extend focus on training and equipping local Iraqi archaeologists' capacity in archaeological techniques so that they have the skills to lead future projects. Fostering Iraqi National Identity is a core part of the NSC Iraq Strategy and a country human rights priority. Shared cultural heritage helps to promote this national identity and supporting reconciliation.

title: Supporting victims of sexual violence in Iraq
description: This project will provide support to survivors of sexual violence and counter negative attitudes and stigmatisation by establishing a network of service providers, government decision makers and civil society to audit current practice in terms of access to justice and health and welfare support, increase awareness of the different dimension of stigma and its impact on the community.

title: UK support to Jordanian Government to reduce political instability
description: Reduce political instability by reducing unemployment rates in Ma'an by building youth capacities in renewable energy sector thereby ensuring UK support for Jordanian Government in economic reform and reduced reliance on energy imports

title: Supporting Stability in Jordan by Increasing Public Access to Information
description: Enabling the OECD (through funding OECD technical experts) to help the Jordanian Government to draft an action plan to give effect to Jordan's commitments, under the Open Government Partnership, to increase the Jordanian public's access to information. The OECD technical experts were also able to work extensively with civil society in Jordan to ensure their views were included in the draft plan. By being more open and accountable to its people, will increase Jordan's political resilience and thereby its economic security.

title: Providing journalists with technical and data skills to produce improved reporting on human rights issues
description: This project will provide journalists with technical and data skills to improve human rights reporting in Jordan.

title: Training young people in entrepreneurship skills to boost the private sector
description: This project will provide young people with practical tips on how to start a business in an online, accessible and sustainable way thereby reducing political instability by addressing high levels of youth unemployment.

title: Reducing Barriers to Growth in Jordanian Rural Communities
description: Improve Human Rights in Jordan by giving disadvantaged Jordanian women skills to generate an income stream.

title: Promoting Economic Growth Through Business Education in Jordanian Schools
description: This project will teach young people entrepreneurship skills to improve their employability and help them find private sector jobs, driving economic growth.

title: Promoting British values and gender equality in Lebanon
description: This project will promote democratic practices in Lebanon and improve women's equal citizenship rights. This will be achieved through targeted training programs, promoting women engaged in politics and encouraging youth to vote.

title: Preventing Modern Slavery in Lebanon
description: This project will prevent modern slavery through protecting migrant domestic workers in Lebanon from physical and sexual abuse, isolation and extreme working conditions. This is to be achieved by creating a learning package. As a result it will improve management skills and help set ethical working and living conditions that both the employer and employee will benefit from.

title: Countering Violent Extremism in the Palestinian Camps by Transforming no-go Facilities into safe public spaces
description: This project will promote stability among young Palestinian refugees by promoting refurbishing 'no-go' areas such as ex-torture facilities and rubbish dumps into safe public spaces for Palestinian youth, for sports, arts, music and culture.

title: UK Contribution to the Special Tribunal for Lebanon in 2017
description: This project will strengthen accountability and amplify the credibility of governance, the rule of law and the rules-based international system in Lebanon through supporting the Special Tribunal. This will in turn foster greater political inclusion by inspiring greater confidence amongst the Lebanese people in state institutions and the ability of their Government to deliver on its promises.

title: Assessing and Strengthening Lebanese Strategic Communications
description: This project will strengthen the Lebanese Government communication in Lebanon to meet globally recognised UK standard to help deliver the NSC strategy. To be achieved through an in-house scoping review, followed by a work plan based on its findings. By strengthening the communications this can lead to increased trade and investment opportunities between Lebanon and the UK.

title: Continuing to Introduce New Technologies in the Libyan University Language Classroom
description: This project introduces new technology into Libyan University language classrooms to help improve the quality of English language training. It will support teachers in developing strategies to encourage students to use technology to support their individual language learning. Outcomes from the project will be: change perceptions of the role, and increase the use of, technology in the universities' English language classroom; this will lead to Libyan universities producing graduates with higher English levels which will enhance their employability.

title: Promote and Support Human Rights in Libya
description: This project will promote and support human rights by enabling people with disabilities to use technology to increase their capacity and integration in the workforce and remove barriers to social integration in Libya

title: Promoting Gender Equality in Morocco Through Female Political Participation
description: This project will support women's rights by strengthening female political participation in rural areas of Northern Morocco through capacity building of 14 female elected officials in local governance, female issues and local management.

title: Promoting Women's Rights in Morocco Through the Adoption of the Law on Violence Against Women
description: Promote & safeguard women's rights through advocating the adoption of the international law on violence against women.

title: Promoting Women's Rights in Morocco Through the Adoption of the Law on Violence Against Women: Implementation
description: This project will support UK policy priority on violence against women by safeguarding women's rights through advocating the adoption of the international law on violence against women. Training local NGOs and lawyers to monitor key public services, including the health care, law enforcement, and justice systems in their treatment of violence against women cases.

title: Reducing risk of conflict in Gaza strip waters
description: Reducing the risk of conflict and contributing to greater stability with Israeli naval forces by providing equipment and training to vulnerable fishermen in Gaza Strip contributing to the safety and economic prosperity of Gazan fishermen.

title: Supporting Palestinian Identity in East Jerusalem
description: Promoting stability in the OPTs, and preserving the cultural and physical viability of the two state solution throughsupporting East Jerusalem's historic and at-risk Palestinian National Theatre by producing a theatre festival highlighting young Palestinian actors from across the Occupied Palestinian Territories.

title: Reducing the Risk of Conflict in Area C
description: Reducing risk of conflict by providing equipment and assisting vulnerable Palestinian communities in Area C to harvest their olives quickly and safely, helping to mitigate the threat from violent settlers, promoting Palestinian access to land, human rights, and international rule of law while confirming UK support for economically sustainable Palestinian presence on the land.

title: Improve employment prospects and build the skills of vulnerable youth in volatile areas of East Jerusalem
description: This project will improve employment prospects and build skills of vulnerable youth through academic and leadership training, creating of extra-curricular programmes to reduce likelihood of violence & countering extremism in Occupied East Jerusalem.

title: Promoting Democracy and Good Governance with Youth in the West Bank
description: Promoting democratic engagement and good governance in West Bank by building capacity of politically-engaged youth leaders from different political and geographical backgrounds to advocate and engage politically with Palestinian Authority

title: Countering Violent Extremism By Developing Youth Literacy in Gaza
description: Tackling the risk of extremism and countering those seeking to radicalize youth in Gaza by providing alternative extra-curricular opportunities. Supporting the human rights of vulnerable and at-risk children in an underserved area of Gaza

title: Mine Clearance in West Bank
description: Mine clearance in West Bank to improve security for civilians. Promote UK role in resolving conflict by returning land to Palestinians, strengthening Palestinian presence in Area C and preserving viability of the two-state solution

title: Promoting Human Rights and Economic Viability for women in Rafah
description: Promoting stability in OPTs, and physical viability of the two state solution. Building on UK leadership by providing vocational/professional training to disabled women in Rafah, supporting their human rights and economic viability

title: UK-China Cooperation on MENA
description: This project will strengthen UK-China Cooperation in MENA by increasing understanding of each other's policies and identify areas where our two countries can work together. To be achieved through various meetings and discussions.

title: Supporting the UK's understanding of the situation of the Syria crisis through amplifying Syrian voices
description: Strengthen UK/international community understanding of experience of Syrian civilians. Empower Syrians and inform humanitarian/non-humanitarian responses by supporting dialogue amongst Syrians on rebuilding their country

title: Promoting Human-Rights and Pro-Democracy Values through multimedia
description: Promote dialogue, resilience, reconciliation, unity, peacebuilding, counter-radicalisation and counter-violent extremism through production and broadcast of various audio-visual packages

title: Assistance to the Tunisian Healthcare reform improving healthcare provision & increasing UK commercial opportunities
description: Promote UK prosperity by providing UK commercial expertise to the Tunisian Ministry of Public Health to improve budget and resource management of pathology in Tunisia in order to improve healthcare and reduce deficit for improved economic stability, and create commercial opportunities for the UK by portraying the UK as a country that contribute to bringing the solutions that Tunisia needs for its development in a sector where the UK is not traditionally known for.

title: Promote effective monitoring of human rights in Yemen
description: Support post-conflict reconciliation and stability, reducing risk of conflict. Enhance cooperation between Yemen's Human Rights Committee and local civil society contributing to effective monitoring of human rights by creating a channel of communication between the parties to ensure diversity of information and build confidence amongst victims of human rights violations.

title: Ensuring Libyan Women's inclusion in the reconstruction and political process
description: This project will provide support to civil society organisations that promote the inclusion of women in the national dialogue and reconciliation process throughout Libya. It will focus on the promotion of women's rights and their participation in the constitutional drafting process.

title: Leadership training for civil society in the Alexandria region
description: This project provides leadership training to civil society organisations contributing to social and economic development and stability in Alexandria. The project aims to create a network of organisations to facilitate mutual learning, understanding, exchange and cooperation.

title: Supporting the Iraqi National Museum
description: This project supports the Iraqi National Museum to provide a space for the public to experience and view exhibits linked to Iraqi heritage and history and helps promote a sense of national identity, a core part of the National Security Council strategy for Iraq.

title: Supporting the Iraqi Museum of Modern Art
description: This project supports the Iraqi Museum of Modern Art in the restoration and repair of neglected pieces of art to display to the Iraqi public. Preserving art for future generations supports the UK's efforts to promote a sense of national identity through shared cultural heritage, which fosters a non sectarian, inclusive community.

title: Reconciliation across the new generation in Iraq
description: This project brings together Sunni, Shia and Kurdish children in order to promote reconciliation and engagement through the next generation in Iraq. It will also help to strengthen the educational infrastructure allowing more children, particularly girls, to benefit.

title: Supporting grass roots national reconciliation
description: This project promotes reconciliation and reduces inter community conflict through supporting the Iraqi National Symphony Orchestra to hold events in the community. Bringing together people, regardless of ethnicity or religion, to share an appreciation of music encouraged bottom up reconciliation among different communities and promoted a sense of Iraqi national identity.

title: Digitising Iraq's cultural heritage
description: This project provides technical equipment to the Ministry of Culture to digitise Iraqi cultural heritage, and the long term capability to continue this process. This project strengthens the resilience of Iraqi heritage contributing to the creation of a more stable environment that promotes a sense of unity and counters Daesh messaging and destruction of cultural heritage.

title: Inward visit of Iranian Foreign Minister and Party to attend Syria Conference
description: The UK is hosting a global conference to discuss and secure support for a progressive policy to resolve the Syria crisis. By having Iran participating at the conference, will result in a greater chance of securing a region wide agreement. The visit will also build on recent positive developments in our bilateral relations.

title: Supporting economic development in Palestine
description: This project will provide leadership and communications training to 50 Palestinian youth in order to improve their employment prospects and to increase local economic development.

title: Supporting access to health care in Hebron
description: This project provides access to health care in Hebron's Old City, by establishing an emergency health clinic for local residents. It contributes to the human rights of Palestinians affected severely by settler violence and movement and access restrictions.

title: Promoting stability through supporting economic development
description: This project will support the prosperity of marginalized women of Ein Al Beida Women's Cooperative by providing training which a) ensures locally developed food products meet the market standard and b) increases access to the job market for the women, helping to allow them to maintain a presence in the Jordan Valley which is at risk from settlement expansion.

title: Reducing violent behaviour in Jordanian schools
description: This project aims to introduce a creative education programme in order to build understanding between pupils and to reduce violent and confrontational behaviour.

title: Supporting economic development by training underprivileged women
description: The project aims to improve the situation of underprivileged women by training them to conduct income generating activities.

title: Supporting stabilisation, peace and security and counter radicalisation
description: This project aims to strengthen community cohesion and support counter radicalisation efforts in Amman, Jordan through psycho social support for underprivileged children. It will support underprivileged communities in Amman, hosting large numbers of Syrian refugee families, to encourage positive cross community integration and build positive support networks, helping to mitigate the impact of poverty, a known driver of radicalisation.

title: Promoting justice and reparations for survivors of wartime sexual violence in Bosnia Herzegovina
description: Improving mechanisms aimed at delivering justice and reparations for survivors of wartime sexual violence in Bosnia Herzegovina.

title: Fighting impunity and accessing justice in Burundi.
description: This project aims to reinforce the capacity of local actors in Burundi to fight against the impunity of perpetrators of international crimes and to strengthen the Rule of Law in the country

title: Combating sexual violence in Burundi
description: Empowering Burundian Women to uphold universal rights by: raising awareness of their role in promoting peace and tackling sexual violence; building capacity as first responders to document sexual violence, and promoting engagement with decision makers in government.

title: Preventing the spread and impact of sexual violence in conflict in Burundi
description: Build early warning systems to enhance the capacity of communities in Burundi to develop processes which prevent the spread and impact of sexual violence in conflict.

title: Protecting women from sexual violence in conflict in Burma
description: Improving mechanisms for protecting women from sexual violence in conflict in Burma by developing the capacity of influential stakeholders to investigate, document and report cases of sexual violence and protect women's rights

title: Strengthening measures to prevent and respond to sexual and gender-based violence in the Central African Republic
description: This project will provide awareness campaigns, child protection and childs rights training to counter traditional assumptions around women's rights, reduce stigma and support the creation of a protective environment. It will establish and train community-based Child Protection Committees, and build capacity of local actors to prevent and respond to sexual violence. It will also support survivors of sexual violence including psychosocial care and referral to health services.

title: Investigating sexual and gender-based violence and prosecutions in Cambodia
description: Supporting Accountability and Restorative Justice Mechanisms for Sexual Violence Perpetrated during the Khmer Rouge Regime in Cambodia

title: Promoting justice and accountability in Cambodia
description: Annual Contribution to support the Extraordinary Chambers in the Courts of Cambodia (ECCC) try the most senior surviving members of the Khmer Rouge regime on charges of war crimes, crimes against humanity and genocide committed during the period from 1975 to 1979.

title: Preventing sexual violence in Colombia and providing support to women survivors
description: The project will expand and strengthen the "Network of Women Victims" to implement prevention plans for sexual violence in 11 regions of Colombia, providing support to victims, increasing the number of cases reported before authorities, advocating for access to justice and fighting stigma through a comms campaign

title: Protecting the rights of survivors of sexual violence in the context of transitional justice in Colombia.
description: Women survivors of sexual violence in the Colombian conflict will be supported with legal and psychosocial accompaniment to enhance their access to justice and truth in the transitional justice framework arising from the peace negotiations in Havana. 20 cases will be documented and policy papers with recommendations for the Congress will be delivered

title: Preventing sexual violence in Colombia providing support to women survivors
description: This project will expand and strengthen the "Network of Women Victims and Professionals" to implement prevention plans for sexual violence in 11 regions of Colombia. It will support and empower victims of sexual violence get access to justice and referral pathways. It will also implement a communications campaign to raise awareness regarding sexual violence in Colombia.

title: Reducing conflicts in mining scenarios in Colombia
description: Multi-stakeholder human rights dialogue to reduce conflicts in mining scenarios in Colombia

title: Improving the role of business in transitional justice in Colombia
description: This project will provide cusinesses and the Government of Colombia with recommendations on private sector involvement in non-judicial mechanisms within the Truth, Reparations and Reconciliation System of the peace agreement between the Government of Colombia and the FARC-EP.

title: Supporting the legal prosecution of atrocities committed by Daesh in Iraq
description: This project aims to document and preserve evidence by protecting mass graves from disturbance and unregulated excavation to facilitate investigation and prosecution of atrocity crimes

title: Increasing the political participation of women in Iraq
description: To strengthen governance and increase political participation of Iraqi women, addressing the impact of the current crisis on women.

title: Tackling extremism in Commonwealth countries
description: To promote a new alliance between faith based universities to develop practical means of promoting tolerance, respect and objectivity amongst their staff and students

title: Promoting inclusive and stable societies in the Commonwealth
description: To strengthen capacity, coordination and strategic approach of Commonwealth NGO networks to promote more inclusive and stable societies

title: Improving the access of Commonwealth states to multilateral trade
description: Increased Commonwealth Small Island Developing States' participation in international trade negotiations by increasing access to technical/legal research and use by eligible CWSS beneficiaries. Strengthening of relationships within Commonwealth and non-Commonwealth WTO members and groupings.

title: Tackling corruption in Commonwealth countries
description: This project will produce a scoping study and recommendations for Commonwealth countries to tackle corruption.

title: Improving the access of Commonwealth Small States to UN institutions
description: Contribution to maintain the Commonwealth States Offices in Geneva and New York, that provide facilities for small and vulnerable states to enable them participate more fully in international decision-making in multilateral forums, including the United Nations and the World Trade Organisation.

title: Promoting democracy through targeted projects overseas
description: This project will centre on strengthening the rules-based international system, and complement FCO activities under its human rights theme, Democratic Values and the Rule of Law.

title: Strengthening justice and accountability measures in Africa
description: This project will support efforts to strengthen justice and accountability measures in Africa through domestic and regional capacity building, advice and outreach, and enhancing cooperation between Africa and the International Criminal Court.

title: Supporting access to justice for victims of atrocities in DRC and Uganda
description: Supporting access to justice in ICC situation countries for victims of atrocities through a range of projects aimed at providing reparative/restorative justice

title: Strengthening casework for missing persons in the Western Balkans and conflict affected areas
description: To support central capabilities of the International Commission for Missing Persons including the DNA lab and securing data & expertise for project work aligned with 5 thematic strands.

title: Reducing threats to stability through the responsible sourcing of minerals
description: Support the European Programme for Responsible Minerals to deliver training on implementation of responsible sourcing to reduce threats to stability

title: Supporting Better Security and Human Rights Observance in Africa, Asia and Latin America
description: Support implementation of the Voluntary Principles on the Geneva Centre for the Democratic Control of Armed Forces in Tanzania and Angola.

title: Strengthening prosecution of sexual violence in conflict in Central African Republic, Colombia, Democratic Republic of Congo and Mexico.
description: To support the investigation and documentation of sexual violence in conflict and work to bring perpetrators to account through raising awareness and implementing the International Protocol on the Documentation and Investigation of Sexual Violence in Conflict.

title: Improving access to justice and accountability for sexual and gender-based crimes in conflict
description: To increase accountability for sexual and gender-based crimes internationally by the ICC and nationally by authorities in conflict affected countries, as well as increase access to justice and participation for victims/survivors.

title: Promoting the International Protocol on the Documentation and Investigation of Sexual Violence in Conflict
description: To better enable the delivery of justice for survivors of sexual violence in conflict through revision, promotion and implementation of the International Protocol on Documentation & Investigation of Sexual Violence in conflict

title: Combating stigma against rape survivors and children born of rape in armed conflict in DRC, South Sudan, and Uganda
description: This project will tackle the stigma associated with sexual violence in conflict and support survivors and children born of rape in reconciling with families and communities through in-country workshops.

title: Promoting the needs of women in conflict in the Middle East and North Africa
description: This project will contribute to making decision-makers at the national, regional and international levels more responsive to the practical needs and strategic interests of women and girls in conflict and fragile settings. This will be achieved through engagement of women's rights organisations with national governments, regional bodies, and the UN system.

title: Understanding the political, social and economic consequences of the stigmatisation of survivors of sexual violence
description: This project will fund academic research to inform the development of tackling survivor stigma and the impact on long-term community reconciliation and peace-building

title: Consultations to develop the UK National Action Plan on Women, Peace and Security
description: An FCO-led global campaign, focussed on developing countries, to hold a series of in-country consultations with Civil Society Organisations to inform the UK's next National Action Plan on Women, Peace and Security

title: Pursuing justice for victims of conflict-related violence in Asia, the Middle East and Africa
description: Pursuing justice for victims of conflict-related sexual and gender based violence in Sri Lanka, Burma, Iraq and Uganda, by enhancing the capacity of civil-society actors to document and investigate conflict-related sexual and gender based violence, advocating for justice in courts.

title: Strengthen UN Strengthen UN peacekeeping in conflict affected states
description: Online training courses for UN peacekeepers to deliver peace and security in fragile and conflict-affect states and in line with UK aid strategy

title: Protecting children in fragile and conflict affected countries
description: To support the NGO Watchlist to help end violations against children in armed conflicts and to guarantee their rights. Watchlist collects and disseminates information on violations against children in conflicts in order to influence key decision-makers in the UN and elsewhere to create and implement programmes and policies that effectively protect children.

title: Supporting participation of women in peace processes in fragile and conflict-affected states
description: Advocating for the full implementation of the women, peace and security (WPS) agenda in the UN Security Council and UN leadership's country specific decision making

title: Encouraging economic development opportunities in developing countries
description: Produce peer-reviewed reports for the Information Economy Report 2017 to encourage economic development policies and e-commerce opportunities in developing countries.

title: Creating online platforms to promote economic development in developing countries through e-commerce
description: Supporting policies and creation of an online platform in developing countries to help connect with e-commerce opportunities in other countries, including the UK.

title: Developing skills in agriculture and construction sectors for economic growth in Jordan
description: Support to Syrians and vulnerable Jordanians in agriculture and construction sectors through job matching and skills development services to reduce poverty

title: Supporting transitional justice in Nepal
description: Scoping study to define longer-term track two efforts to build consensus for a transitional justice process that ensures the dignity of victims is respected

title: Developing responsible business supply chains in Rwanda
description: Developing responsible and transparent mineral supply chains in Rwanda by supporting compliance with international supply chain due diligence expectations, and reconciling commercial interests with both transparency and positive development outcomes in collaboration with the Rwandan Government

title: Promoting economic growth in Rwanda
description: Produce e-commerce strategy to strengthen government's capacity for supporting private sector-led growth to deliver economic benefits to Rwanda and the UK

title: Advancing the inclusion of women in Sudan's peace and transition processes
description: Support to the Taskforce on the Engagement of Women: Advancing Women's Inclusion in Sudan's Peace and Transition Processes.

title: Increasing the participation of women in the transitional justice process in Sri Lanka
description: Promoting a gender sensitive approach to transitional justice in Sri Lanka by working with grassroots women's organisations, conducting consultations with conflict affected women, and increasing their participation to influence government justice mechanisms.

title: Enhancing local capacities to address sexual violence in Syria
description: Empower Syrian activists with the skills and resources to raise awareness of sexual violence and women's rights issues; provide/facilitate psychosocial and medical services for survivors; facilitate measures to document, report and store data related to sexual violence; draft policy measures that support women's rights and reduce sexual violence.

title: Investigating and documenting sexual violence in conflict in Uganda
description: Promoting uptake of the International Protocol on the Documentation and Investigation of Sexual Violence in Conflict in Uganda

title: Promoting accountability for sexual violence crimes and providing support to survivors in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
description: Promoting accountability for sexual violence crimes and building local capacity to effectively document and provide assistance to sexual violence survivors in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Preventing sexual violence in conflict-affected communities in the Democratic Republic of Congo
description: To enhance community-level prevention, protection and response to sexual violence in conflict-affected communities in Democratic Republic of Congo. Engaging with faith and community groups/leaders through training, peer-to-peer support, and establishing community action groups.

title: Protective Security Capacity Building
description: Strengthening protective security in key overseas locations,

title: CT Preparedness Capacity Building
description: Strengthening CT preparedness and response in key overseas locations,

title: Protective Security Capacity Building
description: Strengthening protective security in key overseas locations,

title: CT Preparedness Capacity Building
description: Strengthening CT preparedness and response in key overseas locations,

title: Programme support for Protect and Prepare Capacity Building
description: Programme support for Protect and Prepare Capacity Building

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Somalia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Somalia

title: Improving Tunisian Border Security
description: Enhance capacity of the Tunisian Ministry of the Interior to analyse data on cross-border criminality and terrorist threats.

title: Security and justice sector capacity building in Somalia
description: Support to improve South-Central Somalia's ability to successfully investigate, prosecute, convict and lawfully detain criminals on the basis of human rights and international law

title: Enhancing Somaliland's Rule of Law
description: Supporting the Rule of Law in Somaliland  This project will strengthen Somaliland's ability to successfully investigate, prosecute and convict criminals based on the application of human rights and international law by identifying where legal reform is needed.

title: Indonesia Capacity Building
description: Supporting the Rule of Law in Indonesia - This project will strengthen Indonesia's ability to successfully investigate crimes based on the application of human rights and international law by identifying where legal reform is needed.

title: Enhancing Kenya's Rule of Law
description: Supporting the Rule of Law in Kenya  This project will strengthen Kenya's ability to successful investigate, prosecute and convict criminals based on the application of human rights and international law by identifying where legal reform is needed.

title: Justice and Human Rights Partnership
description: Building capacity and human rights compliance of the criminal justice system.

title: Identifying Opportunities to build the Rule of Law within Iraq
description: Understanding current capability gaps in the Iraqi justice and rule of law system, specifically aimed at developing evidence base investigation techniques.

title: Enhancing Pakistan's Rule of Law
description: Supporting the Rule of Law in Pakistan  This project will strengthen Pakistan's ability to successfully investigate, prosecute and convict criminals based on the application of human rights and international law by identifying where legal reform is needed.

title: Counter Terrorism Capacity Building Programme - Tunisia
description: To build the capacity of Tunisian law enforcement agencies, (LEAs) including the Border Guard to detect, disrupt, prosecute and detain terrorists in a human rights compliant manner.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Tunisia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Tunisia.

title: Enhancing Lebanon's rule of law
description: This project will strengthen Lebanons ability to successfully investigate suspected criminals in accordance with human rights and international law to mitigate societal and economic impact.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Lebanon
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Lebanon.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects in Pakistan
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Pakistan.

title: Supporting economic development on Montserrat through capacity building in local government and civil society.
description: This project aims to strengthen local government and civil society in Montserrat by building capacity so that they can improve governance and develop their economy. It will support more effective planning and fiscal management to strengthen their economic prospects

title: Supporting the local Police Force to investigate child sexual abuse allegations on Montserrat.
description: This project aims to provide support to the local police service in partnership with the National Crime Agency in the investigation into alleged child sexual abuses on Montserrat.

title: Child Safeguarding investigation in St Helena
description: This project will fund a child safeguarding investigation into allegations of abuse on St Helena, which will drive reform across all of the UK Overseas Territories improving the welfare of all children.

title: Implementing the Wass report
description: This project will implement the findings in the Wass report in order to improve the standards of child protection in St Helena.

title: Building capacity in civil society
description: This project will build capacity in civil society to work effectively with government by engaging with all stakeholders and providing them with education, training and relevant expertise.

title: Strengthening the justice system in St Helena
description: This project will install video conferencing between the court and witness suite, to support the protection of minor and vulnerable witnesses

title: Promoting Green Finance and carbon emission reduction in Bangladesh
description: This project aims to promote green finance facilities to manufacturers in Bangladesh with the aim of increasing productivity, reducing carbon emissions, minimising environmental impacts and driving economic growth.

title: Combating hate speech in Bangladesh
description: This project aims to help civil society and policy makers to develop a greater understanding of the legitimate restrictions that may be placed on freedom of expression to combat hate speech and extremist views through education and awareness raising.

title: A research study into radicalisation in the Bangladeshi prison system.
description: This project will develop an understanding of radicalisation in the Bangladeshi Prison system to help inform future UK policy focus on Countering Violent Extremism work and protecting UK security interests.

title: English Language training for Expatriate Welfare Cell police in Sylhet
description: The Expatriate Welfare Cell operating in Sylhet, the ancestral home to majority of Bangladeshi origin British Nationals in the UK, specialises in offering police help and advice to all Bangladeshi ex-pats and provide assistance to over 500 British nationals per year. The Expatriate Welfare Cell will receive training on English Language to develop their language skills and identify new ways of working to provide better services to the British Nationals.

title: A study on relationships between British nationals/residents of Sylheti heritage and local Sylhetis
description: To understand if and how radicalisation is taking place through flow of funds, ideas and people between British nationals/residents of Sylheti heritageand local Sylhetis. If so, to identify overlaps between the UK Government's counter radicalisation programs in the UK and opportunities for intervention in Bangladesh.

title: Strengthening human rights in the Bangladeshi readymade garment sector
description: To support UK companies with supply chains in Bangladesh meet their obligations under the UK Modern Slavery Act (2015), reduce modern day forms of slavery in RMG factories and increase the protection of RMG workers' human rights.

title: Improving the rule of law in Pakistan
description: The project aims to strengthen rule of law processes and enhance Pakistan's capacity to prevent and detect forged identity and passport documents by supplying specialist equipment and training.

title: Cybercrime Legislation Report
description: Pakistan Cybercrime Legislation Assistance Report - commissioning a report on Pakistan's draft cybercrime legislation to identify potential weaknesses that could be exploited by cybercriminals

title: Workshops for training of Pakistan police on kidnap and extortion response
description: Programme of workshops and courses to improve the ability of Pakistani Law Enforcement to respond to kidnap and extortion situations

title: Reprieve project on Pakistan narcotics legislation and use of death penalty
description: Phase 1 of a long term project to encourage an amendment to Pakistan's Anti-Narcotics Legislation to remove the death penalty. Focus on capacity building of human rights NGOs, supportive Parliamentarians and judges

title: Study visit for 3 senior National Accountability Bureau officials to the UK
description: To invite three senior members of Pakistan's National Accountability Bureau to visit the UK on a study trip. This will promote good practice and UK methodology and facilitate increased levels of cooperation and goodwill.

title: Professional analysis of the training needs of the National Accountability Bureau
description: To provide a professional, objective assessment of the capabilities of the National Accountability Bureau in order to better understand their training needs and the level of UK investment required over the coming years

title: Improving capabilities of Pakistan's Ministry of Interior to process cases
description: Mutual Legal Assistance project - will help tackle backlog of cases and will also support UK prosecutions

title: Administrative cost of ODA projects in India
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in India

title: Building regional stability in South Asia
description: This project aims to bolster regional security by encouraging the Indian diplomatic and strategic community to take a more proactive foreign policy approach towards West Asia and thereby increase peace and stability in the region.

title: Promoting women's rights in India
description: This project aims to raise awareness of sexual harassment and safety among college students and adolescent girls in Hyderabad and to enable them to perform a safety audit of the city.

title: Promoting ethical practices in the Indian healthcare sector
description: This project aims to strengthen awareness and understanding of ethical issues in medical practice and research and to develop ethical leadership amongst medical educators, research supervisors and administrators through education and engagement.

title: Supporting women's rights in India
description: This project aims to improve the knowledge and handling of cases relating to violence against women in Tamil Nadu and Kerala by influencing the trainers of legal, judicial and police officers using UK best practice.

title: Supporting prison reform in India
description: This project aims to improve prison conditions by working with key officials to emphasise the importance of prisoner rehabilitation, healthcare provision and decent accommodation standards.

title: Supporting democratic debate in India
description: This project sponsors a series of inter university debates, with the aim of providing a public platform for India's next generation of leaders to freely debate global issues affecting both the UK and India

title: Combating gender violence in India
description: This project supports a local NGO in providing an information line to local communities on both gender violence and sexual and reproductive rights.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in India
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in India

title: FCO contribution to the UK India Education Research Initiative
description: The UK India Education and Research Initiative (UKIERI) is a partnership between the UK and Indian Governments with the aim of enhancing and strengthening educational links between India and the UK and covering all segments of the education sector.

title: Empowering the future foreign policy makers and opinion formers of India.
description: Empowering the future foreign policy makers and opinion formers of India by bringing together this next generation of leaders to discuss the biggest challenges and opportunities facing India as an emerging power in the 21st century and the implications for partnership with the UK and its global role. This includes a series of events in India and in the UK that bring together some of the brightest and potentially most influential Indian young thinkers with UK experts and institutions to create lasting partnerships that will benefit both countries and our modern 21st century partnership.

title: Tackle child labour by ensuring child rights in brick kilns
description: Link children of brick kiln workers with schooling and associated services so that they are removed from work in brick kilns

title: Promoting climate resilient urban development in Chandigarh through efficient waste management. India
description: Improve energy efficiency, reduce waste & build resilience of Chandigarh city by supporting & developing capacity of City Administration to enable them to plan, implement, govern and sustain smart urban development solutions.

title: Develop a new system of support services for survivors of 'burn' violence against women and girls
description: This project will develop a new system of support services for survivors of 'burn' violence against women and girls in 4 target states most affected by this form of violence that can be a model of protection and empowerment across India.

title: Building leadership skills of marginalised Dalit and Muslim communities with a focus on adolescent girls towards enhancing socio-economic conditions from resettlement colonies in Delhi
description: The project aims to facilitate learning centres and provide infrastructure space for youth, especially adolescent girls in the three resettlement colonies Bawana, Bhalaswa and Khanpur (Delhi). India

title: Support India's reform and growth priorities through targeted engagement with 24 Next Generation Indian politicians
description: The project will engage 24 future policy makers in a bid to support India's reform and growth priorities, build awareness of parliamentary and good governance best practices deepen political linkages and provide opportunities to build cross-cutting networks and future collaborations

title: Legal empowerment of the transgender community in India by increased access to justice.
description: Increased access to justice through legal empowerment of the transgender community in selected states in India to address discrimination and secure rights increasing the visibility and inclusion of transgender issues in public discourse in India.

title: Promoting interfaith issues through capacity building training of graduate-level students by influential faith leaders
description: The project aims to promote inter-faith understanding and co-operation of principles amongst graduate-level students, through 6 capacity building training programmes across several cities in India.

title: Targeted capacity building of young, promising journalists working in India's growing local language media-reporting on issues of global importance like climate change, prosperity, human rights, security, good governance and rule of law.
description: targeted capacity building of young, promising journalists working in India's growing local language media-reporting on issues of global importance like climate change, prosperity, human rights, security, good governance and rule of law.

title: Capacity building of Law Enforcement Agencies to follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) when dealing with victims of human trafficking.
description: The project aim is to build capacity of law enforcement agencies & Government and Non-Government Service Providers in West Bengal and building knowledge and skills of adolescent girls in Goa (major tourist destination) on child sexual abuse and commercial sexual exploitation, helping to strengthen the usage of rule of law encapsulated in international laws and protecting rights of victims of Human Trafficking for Child Sexual Exploitation and Child Sexual Abuse.

title: Empower young women leaders in slum communities, enabling them to challenge gender inequality
description: The project aim is to promote the cause of women empowerment in Mumbai slums by creating awareness among young women about gender equality, their rights & duties in a social context, and help them mobilise their communities to espouse just gender norms

title: Strengthening Telangana state institutions to provide a more integrated approach to climate change resilience and adaptation. India
description: This project will recommend cross-departmental strategies to boost social and infrastructural development whilst addressing the challenges of climate change in the state of Telangana

title: Strengthening of commercial dispute resolution system in Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka
description: To identify the issues and challenges in commercial dispute resolution system, provide policy recommendations and up-skill a cadre of officers in Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka who will support the effective functioning of Commercial Dispute Resolution centres with improved techniques of mediation-arbitration.

title: Build capacity of Technology Business Incubators(TBI) in Punjab, Maharashtra, West Bengal and Kerala to improve India's Ease of Doing business and Growth.
description: To support technology business incubators(TBI) through capacity building their managers and stakeholders by helping them develop financially sustainable TBI operations through bespoke training workshops, and that will produce innovative start-ups with high survival rates leading to jobs creation.

title: Improved urban governance through capacity-building workshop(s) for city officials and elected Representatives of Local Govt. in the State of Karnataka. India
description: Sensitising civic authorities to adopt a systems-based approach to Urban issues to address quality of life issues and highlight the UK's offer on SMART cities and urban governance expertise. India

title: Accelerate the rate of India's emission reduction commitments by supporting South Indian Clean energy sector through UK expertise on technology, innovation and financial mechanisms.
description: This project through UK speaker-led workshops in Bangalore, Hyderabad and Delhi, will showcase UK expertise in developing energy storage solutions and raising green finance to a select audience comprising of renewable energy policy, think tank and commercial representatives, leading to an exchange of best practices and opportunities for future collaboration to strengthen energy access and energy security.

title: Tackling gender inequality in India's top jobs by creating a network of next generation future women leaders who are inspired and empowered to lead transformational change.
description: A cadre of ten aspirational young women are created and are empowered to lead change within their specific professions, contributing to Indian Government's vision of women leading growth in India

title: Address slavery and gender based violence amongst factory workers in the garment sector
description: The project through an effective sensitisation, accountability and grievance handling framework aims to ensure workers within garment factories, irrespective of their gender or caste are treated with respect and dignity and not subjected to implicit or explicit forms of slavery, forced labour, gender violence, harassment or discrimination.

title: Tackle child marriage in Uttar Pradesh through increasing awareness of the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act 2006
description: The aim of the project is to tackle child marriage in Uttar Pradesh through increase awareness of the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act 2006 amongst police, prosecutors, non government organisations and protection officers through training and advocacy contributing to entitlement of human rights for children below 18 years.

title: Countering Extremism: Empowering Muslim youth to recognize and reject extremist ideology.
description: To empower and strengthen the voice of Muslim youth in mainstream debate on issues related to identity and citizenship whilst rejecting extremist ideology.

title: Protection of human rights in the workplace by training businesses and civil society groups on the National Voluntary Guidelines (NVG)
description: The project aim is to increase understanding and contribute to the capacity building of companies and Civil society organisations in India on the practicalities of responsible business, through facilitated dialogue and evidence based learning.

title: Address human trafficking in North-East India by building capacity of stakeholders using Information Technology solutions
description: The project aims at building capacities of young stakeholders from different professions and background including law enforcement, prosecutors, information technology, Community Based Organizations (CBOs) media and business professionals from North East India to visit the UK with the objective to develop capacities to strengthen their knowledge on the use of information technology in addressing human trafficking in the North-East.

title: Strengthen the access of migrant women in the informal sector from violence and discrimination.
description: The project aim is increased access to justice through empowerment and capacity building of the migrant women workers in Assam to address discrimination and exploitation and secure rights and get their social security benefits.

title: GREAT Debate : Support India's development goals through debate on priority topics among Indian's Next Generation university students.
description: The project will engage with India's brightest up and coming students- by sharing the UK's expertise in key priorities areas like climate change, technology, urban issues, smart cities.

title: Supporting biodiversity and sustainability in Nepal
description: This project aims to create links between the Royal Botanic Gardens of Edinburgh and Nepal in order to develop local capacity in protecting and improving biodiversity.

title: Protecting wildlife in Nepal
description: This project aims to combat the illegal wildlife trade by providing an inventory of animal parts stockpiles in Nepal and raising awareness against illegal practices.

title: Bringing speakers from the UK to share knowledge and experiences on economic issues
description: The project aims to invite speakers from the UK to engage with various stakeholders, including political leaders, government officials and media, to discuss economic issues and share their experiences from the UK and overseas.

title: Improving disaster response in Nepal
description: This project aims to improve the capacity of local authorities to deliver air accident investigations and thereby air safety through training and experience sharing.

title: Contributing to Nepal's post-earthquake economic recovery through support to reconstruction of tourism infrastructure.
description: This project will continue the restoration of the Visvesvara Temple in Patan Durbar Square, which was started in a previous bilateral project.

title: Build capacity among young leaders in Nepal to create a better business environment and make economic development a central part of policy
description: The project aims to train a cohort of young individuals to become assistants, who will support young leaders across different political parties on policy research. This is to encourage political leaders/parties to invest in institutionalizing a research division within their operational structures to ensure evidence-based economic policy making in Nepal.

title: Improving Air Safety in Nepal to provide benefit to British Tourist and Nepalese People
description: To provide the current head of accident investigation for Nepal, Joint Secretary Suresh Acharya, with the training he requires to be able to competently lead accident investigation within Nepal. The project will provide air accident investigator manager to the head of the department to be able to effectively manage the investigation of air accident.

title: Shifting perspectives in Pakistan on education, women's rights and young people - and promoting UK activities within themes
description: This project will use strategic communications to shift perspectives in Pakistan on education, women's rights and youth.

title: Enable Government of Pakistan to effectively use media and communications
description: To help the Government of Pakistan improve its perception and the value off its public services through better use of its media and communications. This project was delivered using comms experts from the cabinet office who delivered a two-day session to Pakistan comms officials on ways to improve their public profile through proactive use of communications methodologies and channels of communications.

title: Building media reporting standards in Pakistan by training entry level journalists
description: This project will help increase the local media's capacity to promote the culture of fair reporting which does not risk the lives of journalists, and uplifts their standards, speed and accuracy of reporting. A strong media base can help strengthen the democracy and democratic institutions in Pakistan, which is part of the British High Commission's Integrated Delivery Plan.

title: Supporting sustainable economic development and inclusion for the disabled in rural Sri Lanka
description: This project provided concrete assistance to a village community badly affected by the 2004 tsunami to enable sustainable economic development, improve livelihoods and provide therapeutic interventions for disabled children

title: Combating corruption in Sri Lanka
description: This project aims to bolster Sri Lankan anti corruption work through developing a UK programme with the Serious Fraud Office for four Sri Lankan officials.

title: Promoting gender equality in the Maldives
description: This project aims to support gender equality through sponsoring awareness raising campaigns geared to improve the self confidence and aspiration of girls.

title: Strengthening the rule of law in the Maldives
description: This project aims to build capacity within the legal system by monitoring court proceedings to ensure legal compliance during trials.

title: Supporting human rights in the Maldives
description: This project aims to raise support against the reintroduction of the death penalty and for an introduction of a moratorium on flogging.

title: Combating violence against women in Sri Lanka
description: This project aims to improve access to police services for female victims of violence through awareness raising campaigns.

title: Combating corruption in Sri Lanka
description: This project seconded a Serious Fraud Office barrister to Sri Lanka to improve the skills and competence of local anti corruption officials.

title: Combating corruption in Sri Lanka
description: This project delivered theoretical and practical training in advanced interviewing techniques through eight days classroom based training for 20 delegates drawn from the four key criminal investigation institutions.

title: Combating illegal migration in Sri Lanka
description: This project conducted research into the motivations of illegal migrant returnees to Sri Lanka in order to assist the development of effective immigration policies in future.

title: Countering violent extremism in Sri Lanka
description: This project aims to provide Sri Lanka with lessons learnt from countering violent extremism in the UK by supporting a visit to the UK of a small group of high ranking security personnel.

title: Support to NGOs active in areas of LGBTIQ rights, Women's rights and gender issues
description: Improving human rights and increasing stability in Sri Lanka through support for increased debate and activism to challenge discriminatory legislation in Sri Lanka and Maldives
