title: Strengthening the role of women in Maldivian society- This project will support capacity development for women by enhancing HfW's ability to deliver effective programmes.
description: This project will support capacity development for women by enhancing implementer - Hope for Women's ability to deliver effective programmes through the development of a long term strategy, use of extrnal experts, implementation of the strategy and material to complement this work.

title: Promoting gender equality by building girls' confidence so they are better able to participate more fully in society and politics and enabling them to uphold UK values of good governance, rule of law, stability and human rights.
description: Run under the 'banner' GRACE Campaign, this project aims to build girls' confidence, promoting gender equality

title: Promoting the empowerment of women in leadership roles in Maldives enabling the UK to help uphold principles of good governance, gender equality and universal human rights
description: To give credibility and visibility to the subject of gender diversity and promote the empowerment of women in leadership within the atolls and remote islands

title: Empowering human rights defenders to speak freely, protect democratic space and universal human rights in Maldives
description: To facilitate the empowerment of human rights defenders who come under violent and political pressure, by offering a program of physical, digital and legal security.

title: Empowering Maldivian citizens to hold their politicians to account, exercising their democratic and civic rights, and protect universal freedoms of expression, association and good governance
description: Increasing citizen participation in standing up against corruption and injustice, and in demanding political accountability from their government

title: Improving Support for Gender Based Violence Victims with Special Focus on Tourist Areas Visited by British Nationals
description: This project will create more gender sensitive and gender aware stakeholders, in order to ensure a much safer and tourist-friendly environment for British nationals visiting Sri Lanka.

title: Increasing the level of confidence and proficiency in the English language of tourist police officers including to enable them to provide more effective assistance to UK nationals
description: This project will provide 50 hours English language training course to enable the tourist police officers to better protect tourists abroad.

title: Building capacity of local NGOs, empowering them to promote increased respect for human rights in Sri Lanka and Maldives and support UK objectives and priorities through attendance at international conferences, including Wilton Park
description: Capacity building of local NGOs for respect of human rights in Sri Lanka and Maldives, by funding attendance of Sri Lankans and Maldivians at Wilton Park conferences and the 6th World Congress against Anti Death Penalty in Oslo

title: Sri Lanka Unites - Youth organisations engagement to work in diverse partnerships
description: This project aims to engage youth to work in diversed partnerships using the youth network of Sri Lanka Unites, to create a culture that stimulate positive change through social action and build value based youth leadership for reconciliation.

title: Sri Lankan Diaspora contribution facilitation and strengthening
description: This project aims to facilitate and strengthen contributions that can be made by overseas Sri Lankans to the country's ongoing reconciliation process through investment and technical assistance by providing a platform for joint deliberations between policy makers, overseas Sri Lankans, business community, and civil society on incentive mechanism and policy recommendations.

title: Promotion of UK Higher Education in Sri Lanka
description: This project aims to improve student mobility to the UK and to strengthen economic growth and prosperity in Sri Lanka through the return of students with world class UK degrees.

title: Raising awareness around reparations and truth in Sri Lanka through translation into Sinhala and dissemination of a land rights documentary
description: Raising awareness around reparations and truth in Sri Lanka through translation into Sinhala and dissemination of a land rights documentary

title: UK technical support to the Sri Lankan constitutional reform process
description: To provide expertise on plain English drafting and share comparative international experience relevant to Sri Lankan's constitutional reform process.

title: Administrative costs of the Anti-Corruption ODA Programme
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of the Anti-Coruption ODA programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Non Staff Administrative Costs of Anti Corruption Prosperity Fund ODA programme
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of the Global Anti-Corruption ODA Programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Improving transparency in partnership with the OECD - to increase accountability and designing out opportunities for corruption
description: This project comprises three work streams: creating an online portal for the storage and exploitation of relevant material, supporting the OECD's Integrity Forum and "partnering" or "twinning" countries to share best practice with one another on tackling corruption. Corruption disproportionally impacts British business ability to invest overseas. Tackling corruption is necessary to level the playing field for the UK. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Implementing the UN Convention Against Corruption
description: Supporting the implementing of the UN convention against corruption in key countries. Working with the UNODC, the UK will match learning and development needs with expertise to deliver programming, concentrating on the priority deliverables of the anti-corruption strategy. Corruption disproportionally impacts British business ability to invest overseas. Tackling corruption is necessary to level the playing field for the UK. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Delivering ethical leadership training to South African Government officials
description: This project will assist South African efforts to boost socio-economic development, empowerment and job-creation to reduce inequality. It will support South Africa's local service delivery and inclusive economic growth, improving the general business environment. Training will seek to increase cooperation in promoting good governance, democracy and the rule of law and drive inclusive economic development  helping SA use its influence in the region. Corruption disproportionally impacts businesses ability to invest overseas, including UK companies. Tackling corruption is necessary to level the playing field, improve the business environment and enable mutually beneficial trade and investment.

title: In partnership with the OECD, improving transparency to increase accountability and designing out opportunities for corruption
description: This project builds on previous Prosperity Fund support to the OECD's work on anti-corruption.  Corruption is a major barrier to economic growth, particularly in developing countries, and prolongs extreme poverty.  This project helps reduce corruption by hosting the OECD global anti-corruption and integrity forum, developing an online knowledge-sharing hub, and strengthening business integrity systems.  Tackling corruption is necessary to level the playing field, improve the business environment and enable mutually beneficial trade and investment opportunities, including for British businesses. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Tackling corruption by supporting global asset recovery efforts
description: This project will support follow-up activities to the 2017 Global Forum on Asset Recovery.  Corruption is a major barrier to economic growth, particularly in developing countries, and prolongs extreme poverty.  This project will help reduce corruption by influencing the international policy around asset recovery and supporting individual countries to recover their stolen assets that are sitting overseas.  Tackling corruption is necessary to level the playing field, improve the business environment and enable mutually beneficial trade and investment opportunities, including for British businesses. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Brazil
description: Programme facilitation costs for the design, management, implementation and communication of the Brazil PF Programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Brazil
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Brazil [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Development and design of ODA programme in Brazil
description: Development and facilitation costs related to activities design, research, consultations and preparations of the Brazil Prosperity Fund ODA programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative costs for the development and design of the Brazil Prosperity Fund programme
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of the Brazilian PF programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA programme in China
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA programme in China [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA programme in China
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA programme in China [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Development of the China Phase One Business Case
description: Development and facilitation costs to cover the design, research, consultations and preparations of the China programme across rule of law, Low Carbon/Energy and infrastructure sectors [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Evaluating and prioritising UK/China Infrastructure Alliance projects in developing countries.
description: This project will evaluate up to 200 projects against the UK/China Infrastructure Alliance Project Evaluation Framework and produce plans to target key priority projects The Alliance is designed to contribute to sustainable development in developing countries and ensure the UK and China can make a substantial contribution to meeting infrastructure needs globally through increasing capacity, investment and financing. Prioritisation will ensure the Infrastructure Alliance is able to focus on the most valuable and credible projects that will improve infrastructure and contribute to poverty alleviation. The overall programme is also designed to generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Scoping study to research barriers to unconventional gas development in China
description: This project is designed to scope the shape of activity under the Energy/Low Carbon pillar of the forthcoming China programme. It will ascertain whether UK expertise on environmental regulations and monitoring (e.g. water management plans, risk assessments of soil pollution, methane leakage) can support the sustainable development of China's unconventional gas industry. The forthcoming China programme will match China's specific reform needs with UK energy and low carbon strengths, reducing global emissions by accelerating China's energy transition. It will also aim to generate opportunities for international, including UK, business.

title: Developing China's green bond definitions and standards to improve financing of climate resilient projects.
description: This project is designed to draw upon the UK's leadership in global financial markets, connecting China's domestic green bond market with the international market. It aims to establish green bonds as a tool for China to finance low-carbon and climate resilient projects. This project will lay the groundwork for the Energy and Low Carbon pillar of the China Prosperity programme.

title: Supporting the modernisation of China's anti-money laundering framework to meet with global standards in combating money laundering
description: This project is designed to support China in aligning its legislation and practice with global standards - set by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) - laying the groundwork for the Rule of Law pillar of the China programme. China is due to undergo its next FATF evaluation in 2018-19. The project will add value through a baseline study for FATF evaluation, raise awareness of FATF requirements among business and government, and develop recommendations for meeting these requirements. A stronger anti-money laundering infrastructure will enhance sustainable and inclusive economic growth, ensure a more level playing field for international, including UK, business and reduce risk for international investment.

title: Supporting China's ability to monitor climate risks and develop climate infrastructure, helping work towards a lower carbon society.
description: This project is designed to define a set of climate risk indicators that provide Chinese decision-makers with a clearer picture of climate risk. This will help to develop China's markets in climate resilient infrastructure and insurance, supporting China's move to a lower carbon society. China is the world's largest emitter of greenhouse gasses and largest energy consumer and producer. This project will lay groundwork for the Energy and Low Carbon pillar of a China prosperity programme which will look to match China's specific reform needs with energy and low carbon sector strengths, reducing global emissions by accelerating China's energy transition.

title: Supporting power sector reform in South China to increase integration of renewable energy into the region.
description: This project is designed to support China's adoption of new market arrangements in its power sector to enable the effective integration of renewable energy. Building on a previous project, it will draw upon UK policy and market expertise to inform and accelerate Yunnan's power market reforms and create new bilateral partnerships in key reform pilots, including in Chongqing and Guangdong. It is expected that the market structure decisions taken by China will generate commercial opportunities for international business, including from UK. This project will further set groundwork for the Energy/Low Carbon pillar of a China prosperity programme, which will match China's specific reform needs with energy and low carbon sector strengths, reducing global emissions by accelerating China's energy transition.

title: Supporting China's development of more effective legislation, regulation and enforcement, to enhance its business environment
description: This project is designed to improve China's institutional capacity in rule of law to tackle major economic and business issues that currently inhibits the business environment for international business. The project intends to promote key UK-China judicial and legal relationships, support China's enhancement of legislation and regulations, and address enforcement issues identified by international business in China. The project will also create a platform for the Rule of Law pillar of a China prosperity programme which will support progress towards a stronger rule of law including clearer judicial processes, dispute resolution and protection of intellectual property

title: Supporting China's development of more effective legislation, regulation and enforcement, to enhance its business environment
description: This project works in conjunction with another to improve China's institutional capacity in rule of law to tackle major economic and business issues that currently inhibit China's sustainable economic growth. The project will promote key UK-China judicial and legal relationships, support China's enhancement of legislation and regulations, and address enforcement issues identified by international business in China.

title: Supporting reform of the power sector in China
description: This project is designed to support China's market structure decisions and adoption of new market arrangements in its power sector. This will support China's de-carbonisation and integration of renewable energy. The expected reforms to China's market would open access to business. This project will set further groundwork for the Energy/Low Carbon pillar of a China prosperity programme, which will match China's specific reform needs with energy and low carbon sector strengths, reducing global emissions by accelerating China's energy transition.

title: Supporting China's development of its regulatory approach to financial innovation
description: This project is designed to draw on UK best practice - to support the strengthening and refinement of China's regulatory approach to financial innovation. This is intended to build Chinese capacity, support innovation, improve efficiency and manage risks. It will support the building of a more robust financial system in China. It will also provide a platform for the Financial Services pillar of a China prosperity programme. This pillar will work to promote financial sector reform though sharing policy and private sector expertise, and capacity building in the Chinese regulatory sector, to enable a transition to a more innovative and inclusive economy. This will also work to generate opportunities for international business, bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete, including; Rule of Law, Energy and Low Carbon, Financial Services and Infrastructure.

title: Supporting international participation in China's bond and equities market
description: This project is designed to support the development of China's bond market by enhancing its audit regulatory framework. It will promote and enhance cooperation between China and global financial markets, which will support the international issuance of Chinese Yuan Renminbi (RMB)-denominated bonds in China. This collaboration will support the opening up of China's bond market to international participants, and support sustainable economic growth in China. The project is a foundation for the Financial Services pillar of a China prosperity programme. This pillar will work to promote financial sector reform though sharing policy and private sector expertise, and capacity building in the Chinese regulatory sector, to enable a transition to a more efficient, productive, inclusive economy.

title: Enhancing regulatory effectiveness for business in China
description: This project is designed to enhance the effectiveness of regulations for business in China. It will introduce UK best practice and support China's creation of a robust regulatory regime that will enhance the sustainability of its financial system. This will reduce financial risks and market misconduct thereby benefiting international including UK business' in China. The project will lay the foundations for the Rule of Law pillar of a China prosperity programme. This pillar will support China's progress towards a stronger rule of law including clearer judicial processes, dispute resolution and protection of intellectual property, ultimately leading to an improved business environment and stronger economic growth.

title: Designing a measurement tool to evaluate the impact of the Rule of Law for Business programme in China
description: This project aims to establish a monitoring and evaluation tool with core indicators of success to assess the progress and impact of the Rule of Law for Business programme. The programme will support China's progress on the rule of law for business including clearer judicial processes, commercial dispute resolution and protection of intellectual property, leading to an improved business environment and stronger economic growth. It is also expected to generate opportunities for international business, bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete, including; Rule of Law, Energy and Low Carbon, Financial Services and Infrastructure.

title: Conducting a scoping study for a UK-China research programme to facilitate increased private and international investment into Belt and Road infrastructure projects
description: The project is designed to identify issues with and barriers to increased private investment in Belt and Road infrastructure projects within key thematic areas, and propose specific interventions. Increased private and international capital will be essential to delivering sustainable and commercially-viable infrastructure projects as part of the Belt and Road Initiative. The overall programme will lead to more productive, higher quality and greener overseas infrastructure investment that delivers social and economic benefits and contributes to poverty alleviation. It will also generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Administrative costs of Prosperity ODA projects in China
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in China [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Enhancing China's credit risk control through studying UK best practice.
description: This project is designed to help China's law-makers and financial regulators better understand the UK's approach to reducing pre-settlement credit risk, with the view to China adopting the UK's approach to these issues. This will reduce credit risk in China and bring the local market more in line with global best practice, enhancing financial stability and leading to poverty reduction through a more inclusive and sustainable Chinese economy. This will generate opportunities for international businesses in the Financial Services sector, bringing potential benefits to British companies in a sector where they are well placed to compete.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA eligible Prosperity Fund programme in China
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA eligible Prosperity Fund programme in China. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Enhancing financial stability and supporting regulatory reform in China through a UK-China Financial Services Advisory Group
description: This project is designed to bring together a group of senior regulators, academics and experts to discuss and provide recommendations for how the Prosperity Fund Financial Services programme can best support the development of a more robust and transparent regulatory environment for the financial services sector in China. This work willensure that the programme helps support China's ongoing transition to a more inclusive, sustainable and productive economy. This will also generate opportunities for international businesses in the Financial Services sector, bringing potential benefits to British companies in a sector where they are well placed to compete.

title: Supporting the research and development of a UK-style pension annuities system in China
description: This project will support China to improve its annuity policy and explore the feasibility of introducing an auto-enrolment mechanism in China to incentivise participation in occupational pensions.  It will help reduce poverty and support China's ongoing transition to a more inclusive and sustainable economy. This will also generate opportunities for international businesses in the Financial Services sector, bringing potential benefits to British companies in a sector where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Strengthening China's Anti-Money Laundering Framework to meet international standards.
description: This project will involve technical assistance to help establish an anti-money laundering regime more closely aligned with international standards. Improving anti-money laundering measures will create stronger conditions for sustainable economic growth, also leading to an improved business environment for companies, including for British business

title: Supporting the strengthening of China's commercial dispute resolution system for international commercial legal challenges
description: This project draws on UK judicial expertise to support China's establishment of their International Commercial Court, which will deal with international commercial disputes. This will support the development of a better, fairer, more predictable commercial dispute resolution system, leading to an improved business environment for companies, including for British business. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA programme in China
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA programme in China [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting the promotion and development of an effective anti-money laundering system in China
description: This project is designed to draw on UK and international expertise to support the development of an effective anti-money laundering system in China, aligned with global standards set by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), ahead of China's FATF evaluation in 2018-19. This project will develop recommendations for meeting FATF requirements by government and business through a National Action Plan. The project will also lay the groundwork for the multi-year Prosperity Fund Rule of Law for Business programme. A stronger anti-money laundering infrastructure will enhance sustainable and inclusive economic growth and lead to an improved business environment for international business, including for British companies. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Developing more effective Intellectual Property (IP) protection in China
description: This project draws on UK expertise to promote more effective IP protection and law enforcement by Chinese government and private-sector entities. It will influence e-commerce law; address counterfeit supply chains; and establish industry platforms to support China's development in these areas. This project will lay the groundwork for the multi-year Prosperity Fund Rule of Law for Business programme. An enhanced IP system will help create a more inclusive, sustainable and productive economy and improve the business environment for international business, including for British companies. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Improving the commercial dispute resolution legal framework, its implementation and enforceability in China
description: The project aims to improve the quality, accessibility, consistency and enforceability of commercial dispute resolution outcomes in China. This will be achieved through a targeted policy and institutional stakeholder mapping exercise and pilot capacity-building initiatives across the government policy-makers, courts and alternative dispute resolution sectors. It will support the multi-year Rule of Law for Business programme, which will lead to an improved, fairer and more transparent business environment and stronger and more sustainable growth. This will in turn benefit improved business environment for domestic and international companies, including UK ones. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Promoting trilateral UK-South Africa-China infrastructure cooperation and partnerships to support sustainable, inclusive economic development in South Africa
description: This pilot project, part of the China Infrastructure programme, is designed to match UK, South African and Chinese expertise and best practice to jointly identify and deliver infrastructure projects that meet South African demand. It will promote the involvement of international best practice in design, engineering, financial, professional and legal services, and environmental and social standards in Chinese-led projects. South Africa requires more productive, higher quality and greener overseas inward investment, which is fundamental to its sustainable and inclusive economic development. The trilateral infrastructure partnerships formed will provide additional opportunities for trade and investment for South African and international, including UK, businesses.

title: Reporting on the results of UK-China expert collaboration on  climate risk assessment
description: We will report the key findings and recommendations from a multi-year collaboration between the UK Climate Change Committee and China's National Expert Committee for Climate Change, focusing on supporting China to identify and mitigate the impacts of climate change. This work supports the multi-year Energy and Low Carbon Economy Prosperity Fund programme, which aims to match China's specific reform needs with UK energy and low carbon strengths. It will also reduce global emissions by accelerating China's energy transition to a sustainable low carbon economy. This will generate opportunities for international business in the Energy and Low Carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British companies, in a sector where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA programme in China
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA programme in China [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting China in the design of guidelines to deliver a cleaner, lower cost and more resilient power system.
description: This project is designed to support the Chinese National Energy Agency to design a set of national and sub-national power sector reform guidelines. The project will look to match China's specific reform needs with the UK's energy and low carbon sector strengths to build expert-to-expert relationships to influence the modernisation of the Chinese energy system. Supporting a cleaner, lower cost and more resilient power system will accelerate China's energy transition to a sustainable low carbon economy, thereby helping to reduce global emissions. This will also generate opportunities for international business in the Energy and Low Carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British companies in a sector where they are well placed to compete.

title: Developing the UK-China Clean Energy Partnership 2019 Work Plan
description: This project is designed to support the development of the UK-China Clean Energy Partnership 2019 Work Plan. It will set out the multi-year Prosperity Fund Energy and Low Carbon Economy Programmes focus areas for 2019/2020. This will ensure that the programme remains in line with the overall objective of reducing global emissions by accelerating Chinas energy transition to a sustainable, low carbon economy. This will also generate opportunities for international business in the Energy and Low Carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British companies, in a sector where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting the development of Chinas offshore wind sector to help facilitate Chinas low-carbon transition
description: Drawing on UK expertise, this project is designed to support China in developing subsidy policies for offshore wind, so that the cost of renewable energy can be driven down. It will demonstrate the value of UK-China offshore wind collaboration through an Industry Advisory Group, to support the Clean Energy Partnership between the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy and the National Energy Administration of China. It will support Chinas transition to a sustainable, low carbon economy. The project will also generate opportunities for international business in the Energy and Low Carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British companies in a sector where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Mapping China's Climate Policies (4th Edition) to increase awareness and capacity of Chinese officials to develop more ambitious climate policies
description: This project is designed to update climate governance mapping to reflect the reorganisation of government agency responsibilities for national climate policy in China. It is part of the multi-year Energy and Low Carbon programme and focuses on enhancing Chinas engagement with international energy and climate governance structures. The project will increase capacity of Chinese officials to develop more ambitious climate policies and support accelerating China's energy transition to a sustainable, low carbon economy. This will also generate opportunities for international business in the Energy and Low Carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to UK business where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Providing UK expertise to support the design and construction of Fujians power sector reform through the first UK-Fujian Power Sector Reform Forum
description: This project is designed to establish expertise between the UK and Fujian Province to support power sector reform. It is part of the multi-year China Energy and Low Carbon programme and focuses on clean technology policy and regulation. The project intends to support China in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, and accelerate China's energy transition to a sustainable, low carbon economy. As a secondary benefit, policy, operation and technical needs arising from the reforms in Fujian will offer new opportunities for UK-China collaboration. This will generate opportunities for international business in the Energy and Low Carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to UK companies in relevant sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Providing UK expertise on Power Sector Reform in Jiangsu to facilitate low carbon transition.
description: This project will accelerate power sector reform process in Jiangsu with UK policy and market expertise. It is part of the multi-year China Energy and Low Carbon programme and focuses on clean technology policy and regulation. The success of this project will facilitate Jiangsus low carbon transition and accelerate China's overall energy transition to a sustainable, low carbon economy. As a secondary benefit, policy, operation and technical needs arising from these reforms offer new opportunities for UK-China collaboration. This will generate opportunities for international business in the Energy and low Carbon sectors, bringing potential and bring potential benefits to British companies in a sector where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Providing Economic Appraisal Support for the China Prosperity Fund Future Cities Programme.
description: This projects aim is to provide expert economic analysis to improve the design of future programming, and develop programme interventions for the multi-year Prosperity Fund Future Cities programme. The programme is designed to use UK expertise to work with Chinese cities and partners to assist with the development challenges of rapid urbanisation, such as environmental damage, over use of resources, poor health outcomes and inefficient infrastructure development, all of which impact disproportionately on the poor. This will support China to make cities smarter and more efficient, inclusive, green and sustainable places for a growing population, Helping overcome these urban challenges will also lead to an improved business environment for companies, including for British business.

title: Administrative Costs of the China Phase 2 ODA Programme
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of the China Phase 2 ODA Programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting China to improve the skills of Early Years education professionals.
description: This project aims to support China in developing a wider policy framework and training models to improve the skills of Early Years education professionals, drawing on UK experience and best practice. This supports the multi-year Skills programme of the China Prosperity Portfolio, which plans to improve education and skills levels, which in turn will lead to inclusive economic growth. It will also generate opportunities for international business and bring benefits to UK companies in sectors where they are best placed to compete, including Education and Training.

title: Conducting a scoping study to inform future work for the China Prosperity Fund Skills programme.
description: This project is designed to identify barriers to and opportunities for addressing China's skills gap, and to propose recommendations and interventions in specific sectors. The project will inform the design of the Skills programme of the China Prosperity Portfolio. The overall programme will support reforms across China's skills sector that deliver social and economic benefits and contribute to poverty alleviation. The Skills programme will generate opportunities for international business and bring benefits to UK companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete, including Education and Training. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Strengthening Technical and Vocational Education and Training in Ningbo, China
description: This pilot project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support China in improving Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) in Ningbo. Working jointly with the Ningbo municipal government and engaging practitioners across multiple sectors in Ningbos TVET industry, this project will lay the groundwork for, and inform the design of, the multi-year Prosperity Fund Skills programme of the China Prosperity Portfolio. This will lead to a more skilled and productive workforce, helping Chinas ongoing transition to an inclusive, sustainable and productive economy. It will also generate opportunities for international business in the Skills and Education sectors, bringing potential benefits to British companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting Technical and Vocational Education and Training in China's advanced manufacturing and logistics industries
description: This pilot project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support China in improving Technical and Vocational Education and Training in the advanced manufacturing and logistics industries. Working jointly with key Chinese stakeholders such as the National Reform and Development Commission and the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, and engaging practitioners in the Chinese Technical and Vocational Education and Training industry, this project will lay the groundwork for, and inform the design of, the multi-year Prosperity Fund Skills programme, part of the China Prosperity Portfolio. This programme will lead to a more skilled and productive workforce helping China's ongoing transition to an inclusive, sustainable and productive economy. It will also generate opportunities for international business in the Skills and Education sectors, bringing potential benefits to British companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete.

title: Strengthening Technical and Vocational Education and Training in priority vocational industries in China.
description: This project is designed to build the understanding of policy makers from key Chinese ministries of the strengths of UK vocational expertise. This will help identify opportunities where the UK can support China to develop and improve its wider policy and training models in priority vocational sectors, and facilitate international partnerships. This project will lay the groundwork for, and inform the design of, the multi-year Prosperity Fund Skills programme of the China Prosperity Portfolio. This programme will lead to a more skilled and productive workforce, helping China's ongoing transition to an inclusive, sustainable and productive economy. It will also generate opportunities for international business in the Skills and Education sectors, bringing potential benefits for British companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete.

title: Scoping and research to support development of Prosperity Fund China Global Partners Programme.
description: The project will undertake research, stakeholder consultation and analysis to support the development of the multi-year Global Partners programme. The project will make recommendations on designing a Programme that, through engagement with the UK, provides Chinese future leaders with the knowledge and networks needed to tackle key global challenges, and develop and implement policies for the reduction of poverty and inclusive, sustainable and productive economic growth. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: UK technical expertise to support development of Prosperity Fund China Skills Programme
description: The project is designed to support the development of the multi-year Skills programme. It will bring UK skills experts together to discuss and provide recommendations on how the programme can be best designed to promote better skills outcomes. It focuses particularly on tackling the development of better standards, progression pathways, as part of a more responsive and industry-led Skills sector, to support China's ongoing transition to a more inclusive, sustainable and productive economy. The programme will also increase equality of skills outcomes through interventions aimed at benefiting migrant workers, unemployed youth and women in particular. It will also generate opportunities for international business including in the technical and vocational education and training sector, and bring potential benefits to UK companies in sectors where they are best placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting China to strengthen its health care system in handling Non-communicable diseases.
description: This project is designed to draw on UK best practice to support the strengthening of the primary care system in China. Scoping activities will identify areas of collaboration.   The project will help China build its capacity and expertise to deal with the challenges posed by non-communicable diseases and set the groundwork for part of the China Prosperity Fund Health programme. This work will also generate opportunities for international business in the healthcare sector, with potential benefits to British companies in a sector where they are well placed to compete.

title: Conducting a scoping and design study to assess opportunities for the China Prosperity Fund Health programme
description: The project is designed to facilitate UK expertise in supporting reform of Chinas healthcare system and propose specific interventions for the multi-year Prosperity Fund Health programme. The overall programme will focus particularly on tackling non-communicable diseases in the Primary Care system and improving access to medicines to promote better health outcomes. Strengthening the health sector will support social and economic development and contributes to poverty alleviation. This will generate opportunities for international business in the healthcare sector, bringing potential benefits to UK companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: UK technical expertise to support development of Prosperity Fund China Health Programme
description: The project is designed to support the development of the multi-year China Health programme. It will bring UK health experts and academics together to discuss and provide recommendations on how the programme can be best designed to promote better health outcomes. It focuses particularly on tackling the rising burden of Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) through strengthening the Primary Care System and improving patient access to medicines. The programme will increase equality of health outcomes, notably through increased access to care  a change that will especially benefit women. It will generate opportunities for international business in the Healthcare sector, and bring potential benefits to UK companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Costs of ODA projects for the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects for the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects for the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects for the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme.

title: Collecting and analysing data across environmental resilience, and safe and efficient trade
description: The data collection will inform management of the marine environment and resilience of ODA eligible Small Island Developing States.

title: Monitoring & risk assessment to support Climate Change Resilience within the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme
description: Project activities will support increased understanding of the sensitivities of the marine environment and ecosystems, to inform decisions regarding the sustainable management of marine resources in ODA eligible Small Island Developing states.

title: Decreasing pollution and increasing human health in Commonwealth Marine economies
description: This project will assess how water quality can impact on ecosystems (habitats and species) in the Pacific. This will enable decision makers to prioritise actions to help reduce the impacts on the marine environment (e.g. pollution control and habitat protection). This in turn will have positive implications for human health.

title: Sustainable Fisheries Development in Commonwealth Marine Economies.
description: This project aims to support the development of sustainable fisheries in the Caribbean region.The project is doing this through: exploring diversification into sustainable aquaculture; assisting with Marine Stewardship Council (MSC) accreditation and conducting fisheries assessments to contribute to the development of insurance products to respond to climatic events such as hurricanes. This aims to provide an improved marine environment, generating economic growth and wider opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Natural Capital Assessment in Commonwealth Marine Economies.
description: This project will initiate surveys to define the social and economic value of marine ecosystems. The results will provide socio-economic data in accessible reports (and through training) to enable policy makers to have a better understanding of different policy options concerning the marine environment and the livelihoods of those that depend on it.

title: Informing infrastructure development, training and knowledge exchange in Commonwealth Marine Economies.
description: This project will aid knowledge transfer and the development of in-state technical capability relating to activities being conducted through the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme. It will enable beneficiary governments and stakeholders to make sound decisions regarding the safe and sustainable development of their marine economies. It will also support the development of stronger networks and partnerships with both the UK and other Small Island Developing States generating economic growth and wider opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Developing country plans for sustainable programme activities in Commonwealth Marine Economies.
description: This project will develop national plans for the future implementation of sustainable marine activities. It will do this through communication and engagement with ODA eligible Small Island Developing States. The national plans will help ensure best practice will be enshrined in national policy beyond the length of the Commonwealth Marine Economy programme.

title: Administrative programme management costs for the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme
description: Administrative and programme support costs to support and ensure the sustainability of the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme.

title: Support the Colombia programme on gender and financial expertise. The programme will facilitate better development, design, finance support and gender strategy.
description: Provide gender inputs to the Colombia programme (quarterly and annual reports, project Monitoring & Evaluation, capacity building for Prosperity Fund Team and Implementing Partners). Provide financial review of the programme (quarterly and annual reports) [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: This Project will work to support the development of more efficient multi-model transport and regulatory framework for the rail sector
description: Helping to develop Colombia's national rail strategy and regulatory framework through four rail feasibility studies, design and implement economic development plans for up to four municipalities that benefit from the new rail investments [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Increase productivity of eight cities by providing training and skills to the relevant local officials
description: To increase city productivity and tackle poverty by supporting technical assistance in Colombia's second tier cities, working to: plan, appraise and structure projects; promote transparency in the construction sector, improve institutional coordination and better assess financing options. Building government capacity to implement urban master plans in up to 10 cities, deliver up to 40 urban development projects, and train up to 200 officials on urban development. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Increase investment and yield in the Agricultural sector in Colombia
description: This project will support rural inclusive growth by encouraging increased innovation in Colombias under-performing agriculture sector, the development of inclusive technologies and education programmes to stimulate demand for agricultural insurance by smallholders and small agri-enterprises, where the UK has a comparative advantage. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including, Infrastructure and capacity building, Agri-tech and insurance. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Promote inclusive growth in Colombias agriculture sector by using new technology to increase  productivity and sustainability
description: Increase productivity for Colombian smallholder farmers and micro and small agri-businesses through improved technology and innovation. Once pilot project shows the productivity benefits of agro-tech solutions in Colombia this will create an opportunity for their wider roll-out, in turn establishing the conditions for inclusive growth in Colombias agriculture sector.  This will help reduce poverty both in the agricultural sector and beyond (given the importance of agriculture to the wider economy). It will also generate opportunities for international business to pitch agro-tech solutions, bringing potential benefit for UK companies who are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Strength regional economic development competitiveness in Colombia
description: Support economic development in Colombia's regions by improving their competitiveness. Build government capacity in up to 8 regions; deliver up to 24 specific competitiveness projects and train up to 200 officials in project development and management. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including, Infrastructure and capacity building, Agri-tech and insurance. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Building institutional capacity for improved transparency
description: Build government capacity to implement the International Open Procurement Standards in up to 8 regions and train up to 200 officials in open procurement and its effective implementation. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Support corporate governance reform of Colombia's National Infrastructure Agency in order to improve Colombian capacity to deliver infrastructure projects that enable inclusive economic growth
description: Support the creation of corporate governance standards and capabilities at Colombia's National Infrastructure Agency in line with UK best practice. Improved infrastructure is key to sustainable economic growth and will reduce poverty in Colombia. Our work will make large Colombian infrastructure projects more attractive to international finance and business (including from UK), and make their successful delivery more likely, which would increase the potential for sustainable economic growth.

title: Development and design of Digital Access ODA programme
description: The Digital Access Programme will work across three UK departments; DFID, FCO and DCMS in targeted ODA eligible countries. The programme will look to address issues of connectivity, cyber security, digital skills and inclusion, the regulatory and policy environment, and digital ecosystems. The FCO component will work to help counter act cybercrime and cyber security threats which act as a brake on development and prosperity gains. It will aim to promote greater inclusion of the world's poorest people in the digital economy, reducing poverty and increasing economic prosperity opportunites for UK businesses . [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects for Prosperity Fund in Future Cities Programmes
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects under the Future Cities programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Scoping study assessing opportunities for the global Future Cities programme across ODA eligible 10 middle income countries
description: The Global Future Cities Prosperity Fund programme will carry out targeted interventions in selected cities to encourage sustainable development, and increase prosperity whilst alleviating high levels of city poverty. Scoping for the programme looked at opportunities where sector capabilities of the UK government, civil society, academia and business are able to respond and successfully implement investment opportunities arising in ODA eligible, middle income countries.

title: Prosperity Fund Future Cities programme; supporting South Africa in using data to understand complex urban challenges
description: Providing technical assistance to support the City of Cape Town in understanding the potential of data collection and its usage to understand complex urban challenges with a focus on equity, equality and sustainability, as part of the multi-year Global Future Cities Prosperity Fund programme. The programme will carry out targeted interventions in selected cities to encourage sustainable development, and increase prosperity whilst alleviating high levels of city poverty. This sectoral programme will learn lessons from the focus countries and apply these to other parts of the portfolio to advance the SDGs and wider HMG objectives.The programme will bring benefits and opportunities to businesses across multiple sectors in growing markets, including for UK businesses who are world-recognised leaders in the field of Future Cities. You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Prosperity Fund Smart Cities Showcase, Bangkok

The programme will carry out targeted interventions in selected cities to encourage sustainable development, and increase prosperity whilst alleviating high levels of city poverty.  It will also generate opportunities for international business in this sector, and bring potential benefits to British businesses in this sector where they are well placed to compete.

title: Future Cities Programme transition delivery work undertaken by UN Habitat
description: The Global Future Cities Prosperity Fund Programme will provide overseas development assistance funding over the next 3-4 years to support a target group of cities in the Americas, Africa, South East Asia and Europe. The programme scoping will assess the viability of the proposed interventions, across transport, urban planning and resilience, and assess levels of stakeholder engagement in order to validate the likely effectiveness of the proposed interventions in the selected cities. The programme will create significant short and long-term business opportunities in growing markets for international and UK exporters, who are world leaders in the field of future cities. title: Global Business Environment Programme; improving the business environment in emerging economies.
description: Through the World Bank the programme is designed to support reforms that improve the business environment in a range of ODA eligible middle-income countries. Working with the World Bank it will look to unlock inclusive growth, create jobs and help lift significant numbers of people out of poverty. It will also tackle gender specific business environment reforms in sectors with the most potential to affect women's employment. This sectoral programme will learn lessons from the focus countries and apply these to other parts of the portfolio to advance the SDGs and wider HMG objectives.This project will generate opportunities for International and British businesses in sectors where they are well placed to compete. title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in India
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in India [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Scaling up the industrial energy efficiency market in India
description: This project will facilitate the sharing of international and UK best practice and technologies with Indian industries. It will support industry and government in achieving Nationally Determined Contributions targets. This will improve energy efficiency in the worlds fastest growing major economy in order to strengthen Indias energy security and sustainability and avoid dangerous climate change, reducing the risks to lives and livelihoods of poor people, including in India. This programme will bring benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including, energy and low carbon; urban and smart cities; ease of doing business; financial services; and skills.

title: Advisory services to support Government of India to develop an IT based contract management system to accelerate investments in India's natural gas sector
description: To support the Government of India to implement global Exploration and Production best practice through efficient contract management. The programme aims to improve global investment attractiveness and ultimately increase the effectiveness of domestic oil and gas production.

title: Supporting improved Ease Of Doing Business in India through sharing of UK expertise to promote mutual growth.
description: To improve the business environment in India by sharing best practice. The project will deliver a series of interactions to share expertise and experience, and support Indian policy makers in developing and delivering reform required to further open up the business environment in India. Focal areas include: reducing regulation, improving tax administration, and trade facilitation. The objective is to improve the business environment for Indian and international (including UK) businesses, as well as to promote international trade and increase GOI revenues that can be reinvested for the benefit of the Indian public.

title: Supporting the development of new insolvency practices in India to improve the business environment.
description: To support Indian decision-makers and professionals in developing a robust insolvency practice in India, through engagement with UK insolvency professionals and decision-makers on their experience of the insolvency process. The programme will also help bring greater certainty to the business environment for international companies, including UK companies when investing in India. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including, energy and low carbon; urban and smart cities; ease of doing business; financial services; and skills.

title: Using Green Bonds to raise international capital for India's transition to a low-carbon and climate resilient economy - phase II
description: The project will build on existing work to support Indian companies to raise capital through Green Bonds from international markets including the UK (City of London). Drawing on expertise from the UK, the project will also develop a set of recommendations to scale up the Green Finance market in India. This activity will lead to accelerated flows of international finance for resourcing the development of clean energy in India at pace and scale, enabling India to power its economy and meet the energy needs of its citizens in greener ways.

title: Scoping study to identify opportunities for accelerating electricity sector growth in selected Indian states
description: The project will identify specific opportunities for international engagement including from the UK with selected states in India. These opportunities will focus on how to deploy new clean energy at a faster pace and strengthen electricity markets, in order to improve energy security, power India's economy and meet the energy needs of India's citizens.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in India
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in India. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: A study proposing improvements to the import and export processes in India, identifying barriers for the food industry operating in India in order to facilitate economic growth
description: Develop proposals for the improvement of the IT infrastructure of India's food regulator, to streamline the process of food imports and exports and reduce the burden on compliant businesses, based on global best practices. This will generate opportunities for international businesses in the food sector, bringing potential benefits to British businesses in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Knowledge and expertise sharing to develop regulatory capacity and best practice in India
description: Improve the regulatory environment in India through a series of government-to-government exchanges that leverage UK expertise to deliver sustainable reforms. This will promote economic growth and job creation in country. It will also generate opportunities for international business, bringing potential benefits to British businesses in sectors where they are best placed to compete.     [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Advance regulatory reform in India, drawing on global expertise to help develop stronger independent institutions working to improve the business environment
description: Advance the Government of Indias vision of an easier, faster and cheaper regulatory environment for business by using global experience to train, develop and strengthen the business reform secretariat. This will generate opportunities for economic growth and job creation in India.  It will also bring potential benefits to business including UK companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Deliver commercial and economic outcomes in India for the Fintech Awards
description: Identify financial technology firms which promote financial inclusion and innovation in India, through the exchange of global expertise and best practice.  This will contribute to the development of an open and inclusive financial services sector in India, improving the business environment, increasing competitiveness and growth potential, which will impact positively on poverty and inequality. The programme will generate opportunities for international business in the financial services sector, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Support the development of the pensions ecosystem in India
description: This project is designed to support the development of a strong and sustainable pension eco-system in India by sharing global expertise, in particular from the UK. This will enhance financial inclusion and promote greater financial security by promoting greater access to pensions for Indias workforce.  It will also create opportunities for international and UK business in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Support the development of the insolvency policy framework in India
description: This project is designed to work with Indian regulators to strengthen the insolvency regime in India by sharing international best practice on cross-border and personal insolvency regulations through a national conference and a two-day training workshop for insolvency practitioners and government officials. This will support the evolution of Indias bankruptcy reforms and build regulatory capacity in the Indian system. As a secondary benefit, it will build stronger links between UK and Indian insolvency experts and create opportunities for international companies including UK businesses in areas where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Technical Assistance Programme on Financial Services in India
description: This programme will work in partnership with the Indian central and state governments and financial regulators to support greater financial inclusion and the reach of financial services to Indias population through FinTech, including greater access to insurance and pensions products, and create sustainable and inclusive economic growth through better access to finance to invest in infrastructure. The programme will also generate opportunities for international businesses including bringing potential benefits to British business in the financial services sector, where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Chevening Financial Services Fellowship Programme India
description: The Chevening Financial Services Fellowship Programme is designed to develop expertise and specialist skills in financial services for Indias next generation of leaders from the public and private sectors. Fellows will return to their professional positions of influence in India with greater capabilities, which will improve decision-making and policy thinking in India, thereby promoting more robust regulation and policy outcomes in financial markets that lead to greater opportunities for sustainable economic growth. This will also forge stronger links between the UK and Indian finance sectors. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Mapping of global best practices on policies and regulations to inform India's oil and gas sector priorities
description: To map global best practice policies and regulations relevant to India's priorities for reducing import dependency in the oil and gas sector and increasing the use of gas as a cleaner fuel. This will include UK best practice. This programme will generate opportunities for international business in the energy and low carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Assessment of best practices on safe & effective oil and gas decommissioning and site restoration in India and development of options for a common industry framework.
description: This project will map global best practices on safe and effective decommissioning of oil and gas assets and site restoration.  To help minimise the negative social and environmental impacts of ageing infrastructure. Through the project, recommendations on a common industry framework will also be made.  This programme will generate opportunities for international business in the energy sector, bringing potential benefits to British businesses in areas where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line. description: To support selected Indian states to introduce well informed Electric Vehicles strategies through development of policy and market frameworks, stakeholder training and showcasing global best practice including from the UK. This programme will generate opportunities for international business in the clean energy and low carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete. description: To bring together industry-led coalitions and key stakeholders to strengthen corporate action on renewable energy and energy efficiency in India. It will focus on exchange of international best practice, knowledge and technologies including from the UK. This programme will generate opportunities for international business in the clean energy and low carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.
