title: Knowledge exchange on approaches for enhancing energy efficiency in India through consumer behaviour and smart grids
description: The project will facilitate targeted knowledge exchange between the government and private sector in India with their counterparts in the UK on energy demand side management and smart grids deployment. Through the exchanges, the project will support energy efficiency improvements and accelerated deployment of cleaner energy in India. The project will generate opportunities for international business in the clean energy and low carbon sector, bringing potential benefits to British businesses in areas where they are best placed to compete. title: Collaborating with Indian states on better waste management, in particular drawing lessons from the circular economy model
description: Work with the Greater Chennai Corporation; Coimbatore Municipal Corporation; and Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation to improve existing waste management plans, in particular by better aligning policies with those of international best practice associated with the Circular Economy Model.The programme will contribute to economic growth through more efficient model of resource management and will improve the living conditions of urban citizens bringing associated health impacts. title: Build the capacity of men and women, businesses and government officials in the energy sector in Mexico.
description: The Energy Strand of the Mexico programme will focus on 3 main interventions: developing the skills of the local workforce; building the capacity of Mexican SMEs to support increased supply chain integration; and capacity building for energy regulators. These interventions will contribute to the promotion of inclusive economic growth and social development, through more productive and resilient men and women, businesses and government officials that are best placed to lead Mexicos transition to a low carbon economy. Greater development in the energy sector in Mexico will also generate opportunities for international businesses, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Prosperity Fund Mexico funding to support continued business case development of the future cities strand
description: Beneficiary engagement to develop key stakeholder relationships in advance of the change in government in Mexico, to ensure alignment with future poverty-reduction policies in country, small-scale and targeted activities in urban mobility, infrastructure and digitalisation. In order to maintain momentum with government departments prior to multi-year programme implementation. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: The Future Cities programme supports urban development and urban mobility services in Mexico to promote safer, resilient and more sustainable cities.
description: The Future Cities Strand of the Mexico programme will support urban development in Mexicos cities, resulting in safer, resilient and more sustainable urban mobility services for citizens, particularly for women and girls. The programme aims to tackle urban poverty through: governance and planning to improve decision-making processes and planning mechanisms for more integrated urban mobility services; and implementation of strategies tested in successful pilots to deliver sustainable urban mobility services in Mexicos cities. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Prosperity Fund Mexico funding to support continued business case development of the financial services strand
description: Beneficiary engagement to develop key stakeholder relationships in advance of the change in government in Mexico, to ensure alignment with future poverty-reduction policies in country. Through targeted small-scale activities that support the development of financial inclusion and the implementation of financial mechanisms in Mexico. In order to maintain momentum with government departments prior to multi-year programme implementation. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Financial Services: Developing phase 1 of Mexican secondary regulation on Open Banking.
description: A project supporting the Mexican financial regulators in the development of the first batch of Open Banking related standards, which will foster Mexico's financial technology agenda and support its principles of inclusion, innovation, competition, and consumer protection. This programme will generate opportunities for international business in the financial services sector, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete.

title: Development of the National Anti-Corruption Digital Platform in Mexico
description: Developing a proposal on reporting data standards that the National Digital Platform should include. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Development and design of the Mexico Prosperity Fund ODA programme.
description: Development and facilitation costs related to activities (design, research, consultations and preparations) of the Mexico Prosperity Fund ODA programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting increased access to and usage of Financial Services in Mexico as drivers for inclusive and sustainable economic growth.
description: The Financial Services strand of the Mexico programme will deliver a more inclusive and competitive financial services sector, accessible to all segments of Mexican society and new market entrants. Given that the sector is highly concentrated, and over 60% of Mexicans do not have a bank account; the programme will aim to improve financial literacy in Mexico, and support the development of its Financial Technology (FinTech) ecosystem. Through this, we intend to allow for targeted, affordable and accessible financial services provision for men and women, resulting in increased levels of financial inclusion and a diversification of the market. This will also result in increased commercial opportunities for international, including UK businesses in sectors where they are well placed to compete.

title: Supporting the consolidation of the anti-corruption and justice systems in Mexico by strengthening capabilities for detection and investigation of crime and corruption.
description: The Anti-Corruption & Rule of Law strand of the Mexico programme will contribute to the consolidation of the anti-corruption and justice systems in Mexico by strengthening capabilities for detection and investigation of crime and corruption cases. It will work to improve policy, procedures and standards; build capacity of public officials detecting and investigating crime and corruption cases; and improve inter-institutional coordination between security, justice and anti-corruption institutions. Creating anenvironment that promotes prosperity for all.This will increase economic growth by attracting investment and contributing to poverty reduction and gender equality. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Programme development and implementation costs for the South East Asia Low Carbon Energy Programme
description: This project is designed to support the development of the Low Carbon Energy Programme in South East Asia.  Through this project we funded a conference at Wilton Park entitled Financing SE Asias Energy Transition. The Low Carbon Energy programme will provide policy support, capacity building and technical assistance to facilitate green finance flows and improve the regulatory, policy and practical conditions for energy efficiency measures. This will bringing benefits to British business in the Low Carbon Energy sector, where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line. title: Administrative costs of Prosperity Fund Economic Reform Programme in South East Asia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in South East Asia [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Advancing business and government transparency and integrity in Vietnam as part of the Economic Reform programme in SE Asia
description: The aim of this project is to establish a joint government and private sector business integrity forum to support the development of a clean, fair and transparent business environment in Vietnam. It builds on the project delivered under previous Prosperity Fund work which developed an online toolkit to train and support over 1,100 Small and Medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to resist corruption. An improved business environment will help to generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Technical collaboration on regulatory reform as part of the SE Asia Economic Reform ODA programme
description: This project will enhance technical cooperation with Philippines' agencies on regulatory reform, including informing its upcoming Ease of Doing Business bill.

title: Technical exchange on market competition as part of the SE Asia Economic Reform ODA programme
description: This project is designed to support the development of an effective competition regime in Philippines by enhancing the technical capability of the Philippine Competition Commission and the Philippine Judiciary, to support them in the promotion and fair administration of competition law. This will be done through capacity building and demonstration of the effective application of economic policies. In doing so, the project aims to create favourable conditions for investment and open opportunities on shared priorities for future collaboration.

title: Administrative Costs of Prosperity Fund Economic Reform programme in SE Asia
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in South East Asia [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line. description:
Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in South East Asia
[Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line. You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Improving Intellectual Property (IP) systems and policy frameworks in South East Asia through technical advice and knowledge sharingas part of the ASEAN Economic Reform programme.
description: The project is designed to improve Intellectual Property (IP) policy frameworks through the provision of technical advice and knowledge sharing assistance. It will also protect the commercial interests of both local and international firms by improving the IP environment and enhancing IP enforcement measures in South East Asia. Improved IP policy frameworks will support a more business friendly environment in the region, and assist in enhancing sustainable economic growth, which will help reduce poverty. This will also generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Building Intellectual Property (IP) capacity and networks in South East Asia through technical assistance, capacity building and knowledge sharing.
description: The project is designed to support the improvement of the Intellectual Property (IP) environment in South East Asia through capacity building, knowledge sharing and technical assistance. It aims to enhance in-country regulations and frameworks on IP legislation, practice and enforcement. An improved IP environment will assist in enhancing sustainable economic growth which will help reduce poverty. It will also generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Improving the efficiency of business regulations in South East Asia through technical assistance, policy expertise and training.
description: The project is designed to help improve the efficiency, transparency, predictability and harmonisation of business regulations in South East Asia. This will be conducted by technical assistance missions, which will bring together policy expertise and practical experience to ensure more effective regulation in beneficiary countries. Specific training will take place in Vietnam and the Philippines. Supporting the development of more efficient regulations will strengthen the business environment for domestic and foreign firms, and assist in enhancing sustainable economic growth which will help reduce poverty. This will also generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Improving efficiency of business regulation in South East Asia through technical assistance, policy expertise and capacity building.
description: The project aims to improve business environments in ASEAN Member States. We are working with the OECD to assess laws and regulations in selected sectors and markets across ASEAN in support of the implementation of the ASEAN Competition Action Plan. This will result in better functioning markets and enhanced competition and productivity, with ensuing benefits to the poor and marginalised communities and new business creation. It will also look to reduce trade barriers and generate opportunities for international businesses. The project is part of the South East Asia Economic Reform programme that will bring benefits to British business in all sectors, by providing a more solid foundation for companies to invest and operate in the host countries [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Fostering inclusive growth and promoting sustainable business practices through the South East Asia Economic Reform programme
description: This project will enable institutions and systems in SE Asia to raise awareness of; and enforce; anti-corruption measures, in order to maximise the availability of resources for poverty eradication. The project involves working with the UN Development Programme to develop transparent systems in the public and private sectors, encourage sustainable business practices, strengthen the rule of law, and minimise the occurrence of bribes corruption practices that people, in particular women and marginalised communities, have to pay to access services. The project will improve the ease of doing business in the region, removing barriers and generating opportunities for British and international business. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting capital market development, enhancing accounting standards and addressing the challenges of financial crime and money laundering in South East Asia, as part of the ASEAN Economic Reform programme.
description: The project will support capital market development in South East Asia by diversifying sources of funding for business and governments in the region. It is designed to enhance bond market development (including Islamic Finance), FinTech regulatory development, accounting standards and address the challenges of financial crime and money laundering. This will also assist in enhancing sustainable economic growth, which will help poverty reduction. Improved standards will provide a more solid foundation for domestic and international companies to operate throughout the region and generate opportunities for international businesses including in the Financial Services sector, bringing potential benefits to British business where they are best placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Development and design of the Prosperity Fund Global Trade programme
description: Development and design of the Global Trade programme. The programme will look to provide technical assistance to facilitate free trade and open markets for ODA eligible Middle Income Countries (MIC),  and enable greater investment and interaction with global value chains to create jobs and prosperity, thus reducing poverty. The programme also aims to deliver wider economic growth through increased market access for international business, including from the UK, as well as building bilateral partnerships on trade related issues.

title: Administrative and technical costs of Prosperity Fund Global Trade Programme
description: Project and technical facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of Global Trade ODA project [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: South Africa Customs Union Capacity Building
description: The programme will focus primarily on removing non-tariff barriers to facilitate greater trade between South Africa Customs Unionmember states and Mozambique to reduce poverty by boosting regional trade flows. Through technical assistance and training, the programme will generate opportunities for international businesses in the Rule of Law, Energy and Low Carbon, Financial Services and Infrastructure sectors,and bring potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Improving intellectual property and regulatory standards in Brazil
description: Activity designed to promote strengthening of the Brazilian Intellectual property processes and improve regulatory standards. This sectoral programme will learn lessons from the focus countries and apply these to other parts of the portfolio to advance the SDGs and wider HMG objectives. This project will bring benefits to International and British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA eligible projects for Prosperity Fund Global Trade Programmes Economic Partnership Programme.

title: Programme to support Brazil's regulatory coherence
description: The programme will target regulatory coherence and convergence within the Brazilian economy. In removing this non-tariff barrier to trade, opportunities for trade in and out of Brazil can be expected. The programme will therefore achieve the Global Trade Programme's primary objective of a reduction in poverty, whilst also serving to increase global opportunities for trade, including for the UK.

title: Flexible Funding Programme. This will deploy world-leading experts with UK government officials, to deliver programmes to increase trade
description: Programme will deploy world-leading experts from private, public, academic and third sectors with UK govt. officials. The Flexible Funding programme is part of the Global Trade Programme (GTP) and will provide technical assistance and other support to increase free trade and open markets for Official Development Assistance-eligible Middle Income Countries, creating jobs and reducing poverty. The GTP will also deliver secondary benefits increasing market access for international businesses, including from the UK. This will generate opportunities for international businesses in the intellectual property, standards, customs and regulations sectors, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete

title: Global Trade Poverty Reduction Programme in Mexico
description: This programme will aim to increase levels of global trade by opening markets, addressing non-tariff barriers to trade, and increasing trade policy and negotiation capacity with resultant economic growth leading to reduction in poverty in Mexico.  This will increase opportunites for global business, including the UK.  [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line. description: This programme will aim to increase levels of global trade by opening markets, addressing non-tariff barriers to trade, and increasing trade policy and negotiation capacity with resultant economic growth leading to reduction in poverty in Vietnam. description: This programme will aim to increase levels of global trade by opening markets, addressing non-tariff barriers to trade, and increasing trade policy and negotiation capacity with  resultant economic growth leading to reduction in poverty in Turkey. title: Prosperity Fund Global Trade Programme Indonesia
description: This programme aims to boost global trade by opening markets, addressing non-tariff barriers to trade, and increasing trade policy and negotiation capacity in Indonesia. Its primary objective is to boost inclusive economic growth and reduce poverty.The programme will boost trade flows for the Indonesia economy. It will also generate opportunities for international businesses, bringing potential benefits to British businesses in sectors where they are well placed to compete.

title: Global Trade Programme to support developing countries to participate in trade of food by adhering to internationally recognised standards
description: The main objective of the 0.5m investment is to support the Global Trade Programme through improving standards by provision of technical assistance to eligible countries. This will help to remove non-tariff barriers in the form of food standards. This would increase the participation of these countries in international food trade, and improve health outcomes at a national level through better compliance with food safety requirements. It will also generate opportunities for international businesses in the food sector, bringing potential benefits to British businesses in sectors where they are best-placed to complete.  [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line. description: This study assesses Turkish financial markets to investigate opportunities for clear, evidence-based recommendations to assist in the design and development of the Turkey Prosperity Fund Financial Services business case. This data will strengthen and define specific interventions for programme delivery, maximising inclusive economic growth, the promotion of social and gender inclusion and overall poverty reduction. The programme will also generate commercial opportunities in the Financial Services sector for international businesses, bringing potential benefits to British companies in sectors where they are well placed to compete. title: Administrative Costs of ODA Programme
description: Programme facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and overseas resources as part of ODA programme.

title: Research to understand the culture of corruption in Latin America
description: Using UK expertise, the project ran three pilots looking at areas of corruption in public services and construction sectors across three Latin American countries. This worked to reduce corrupt practices and strengthen processes throughout the supply chain and scope how best the UK can develop support to other countries in these areas. This will help create a level playing field for international and British businesses.

title: Developing the Finance (Sukuk) Market in Turkey for Long Term Finance and Infrastructure Investments
description: The project aims to support the strengthening of capital markets and diversification of the financial sector in Turkey. It will identify key issues preventing the development of Finance Sukuk markets, which will help strengthen the ties between London and Istanbul in non-bank financial sectors and create opportunities for longer term UK financial services' sector involvement.

title: Supporting financial reform and economic development in Turkey
description: This project aims to support economic growth in Turkey by strengthening the Turkish pension system through expertise sharing.

title: Supporting the Development of the Turkish Asset Management Industry
description: The project aims to provide an analytical analysis of the Turkish asset management industry and priorities, which will foster diversification and improvement of the sector, by showcasing the UK's asset management experience.

title: Reducing Carbon Emissions of Industrial Facilities in the Southeast Anatolia Region of Turkey
description: The project aims to increase awareness in Turkey's South-Eastern Anatolia Region of the benefits of improved industrial energy efficiency and to pave the way for the application of energy conservation and carbon reduction opportunities in industrial premises. The project will facilitate expertise and knowledge transfer from the UK in relation to technologies for energy efficiency and provide links to UK businesses for future technology transfer opportunities, assisting sustainable economic development.

title: Assessment and Prioritisation of Smart Climate Change Mitigation Technologies in Turkish Cities - Pilot Project in Izmir Karsiyaka Municipality
description: The project aims to strengthen the capacity of Izmir/Karsiyaka municipality to prioritise and implement smart GHG (greenhouse gas) emissions mitigation technologies, through technology and know-how transfer from the UK. This will accelerate implementation of climate strategy and action plans in Turkey's cities.

title: Strengthening the Energy Service Company market for energy efficiency in Turkey
description: The project will help develop a well-functioning Energy Service Company (ESCO) market in Turkey, in line with the UK model. This will lead to improved energy efficiency, greenhouse gas emission reductions, job creation and increased competitiveness.

title: Developing a Legal, Technical and Commercial Roadmap for Supporting Offshore Wind Investments in Turkey
description: The project aims to strengthen the capacity of the General Directorate of Renewable Energy, Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources, and other relevant Turkish Government agencies to set the regulatory framework for offshore wind energy investments. It will prepare universities and the private sector for the development of offshore wind energy in Turkey through know-how transfer from the UK.

title: Strengthening the Transparency of the Private Sector in Turkey through a Business Integrity Country Agenda (BICA)
description: The project aims to create a model which will strengthen the transparency and accountability of the Turkish private sector, and increase business integrity and ease of doing business. This will in turn improve access for foreign businesses, including from the UK.

title: Promotion of Business Ethics and Transparency of Small and Medium-sized Enterprises in Turkey
description: The project aims to increase the ease of doing business in Turkey, levelling the playing field for all foreign businesses, including from the UK, through awareness-raising and capacity building in the representative sectoral organisations for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) in Turkey.

title: Supporting prosperity through better commercialisation of intellectual property
description: This project will support prosperity and economic development by sharing expertise to enable Turkish academia to commercialise their intellectual property.

title: Capacity Building and Networking to Support UK Turkey Partnerships in Agricultural Technology
description: This project aims to increase innovative capacity and network formation in the agricultural technology sector in Turkey, by mobilising universities, research institutes, technoparks, technology transfer offices and the business community to develop a Turkish-British agricultural technology community.

title: Enhancing Science and Innovation Partnerships in Turkey
description: This project aims to support economic prosperity by developing Turkey's technological and scientific collaboration across a variety of sectors including UK-Turkey exchanges of knowledge and expertise among the public sector, private sector and academia.

title: Administrative Costs of Anti Corruption Prosperity Fund ODA programme
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of Global Anti Corruption ODA programme [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting the reform and development of Chinas pension sector
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise, and the UK model, to support China's pension reform. With an ageing population in China, there is a pressing need to develop a stronger pension framework. The project will build foundations for the Financial Services pillar of a China prosperity programme. The programme will work to promote financial sector reform though sharing policy and private sector expertise, and capacity building in the Chinese regulatory sector. It will look to generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Administrative costs of ODA projects for the Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme
description: Programme support costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects for the Commonwealth Marine Economies programme.

title: Development, inception and implementation of the Business Environment ODA programme
description: The programme is designed to support reforms that improve the business environment in a range ofODA eligible middle-income countries. Working with the World Bank it will look   to unlock inclusive growth, create jobs and help lift significant numbers out of poverty. It will also tackle gender specific business environment reforms in sectors with the most potential to affect womens employment.

title: Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme
description: Supporting Small Island Developing States of the Commonwealth to preserve and use their maritime resources to catalyse economic development in a sustainable way.

title: UK Lebanon TechHub  Strengthening Lebanese Stability through Job Creation in the Knowledge Economy
description: High levels of unemployment amongst young and tertiary-educated Lebanese are major drivers of instability in Lebanon. Risks to economic security are also high, and increasing. This project supports UK objectives through job creation in the Knowledge Economy sector. It does this by supporting the UK-Lebanon TechHub's plan to establish an R&D Centre to bolster Lebanon's knowledge creation, and to boost foreign investment and international trade with Lebanon.

title: Improve understanding and implementation of UN Against Corruption Convention (UNCAC)
description: In collaboration with the UN, run a series of regional workshops in East Africa and SE Asia on the UN Convention Against Corruption (UNCAC) to improve understanding and implementation.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Lagos, Nigeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA project in Lagos, Nigeria.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Abuja, Nigeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA project in Abuja, Nigeria.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Abuja, Nigeria
description: Project facilitation and administrative costs covering planning implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Abuja, Nigeria.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Lagos, Nigeria
description: Project facilitation and administrative costs covering planning implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Lagos, Nigeria.

title: Supporting the development of sustainable transport solutions in South Africa
description: To develop best practice guidance in transport planning for South African large events such as the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Durban. This will build on UK experiences, encouraging sustainable transport solutions to contribute to economic growth.

title: Integrating off-grid solutions to support South Africa's rural electrification programme.
description: To support the South African Department of Energy and Eskom in determining how off-grid electricity solutions can fit into South Africa's electrification programme, with a view to stimulating investment into the sector and accelerating rural electrification and promoting access to energy.

title: Introducing innovative small-scale waste-to-energy technology and business model to South Africa.
description: The project will open the power generation market in South Africa to small businesses, enabling them to operate small-scale waste-to-energy units on a commercial basis. It will lead to creation of green' jobs; increased power generation from renewable sources; and improved waste management.

title: Demonstrating a solution for smart electricity grid management.
description: Supporting electricity grid management with South African partners through a demonstration of how a UK technology can stabilise the supply/demand balance, increase grid capacity and control operating costs.

title: Development of renewable energy projects on mining impacted land and communities.
description: Rehabilitating former mining land in South Africa by demonstrating a model for community-based renewable energy projects. This will create jobs opportunities in former mining communities and help alleviate pressure on South Africa's electricity grid.

title: Development of a solar-hydro hybridization system in Kenya.
description: Development of systems and technology that will enable hybrid solar-hydroelectric power generation plants to be developed in Kenya with the ultimate aim of providing a continuous, predictable and renewable power resource.

title: Develop the technical and economic potential of renewable energy generation via anaerobic digestion in Kenya.
description: Research into the rate of anaerobic digestion in the raw materials for biogas with the aim of increasing the efficiency and reducing the cost of biogas in semi-arid land in Kenya.

title: Establishing an integrated planning and investment framework for Lamu Metropolitan City, Kenya.
description: Establishing a planning and investment framework for Lamu, Kenya to guide effective implementation of the LAPSSET (Lamu Port, South Sudan, Ethiopia Transport Corridor) Corridor Development.

title: Unlocking Kenya's Renewable Energy Potential
description: Developing Kenya's renewable energy sector to help deliver Kenya's vision 2030. This will be achieved through facilitating a partnership in which UK expertise will be shared.

title: Supporting South Africa's infrastructure needs
description: The project aims to support South Africa's infrastructure needs providing training for municipal leaders in public private partnership (PPPs). This will enable municipalities to develop and implement bankable infrastructure projects using blended finance from private, public and development sectors.

title: Enhancing urban planning capability in Angola
description: The project aims to support urban planning capability in Luanda by providing UK expertise in smart, sustainable urban planning; public-private partnerships and anti-corruption best practice.

title: Building the capacity of the City of Pemba, Mozambique to encourage sustainable urban investment.
description: The project aims to improve the Pemba City Council's knowledge of technical issues and ability to negotiate with investors in the extractives sector.

title: Scoping opportunities and needs for development and prosperity in the energy, transport and infrastructure sectors in Southern Africa.
description: Scoping opportunities and identifying needs for development in the energy, transport and infrastructure sectors in Southern Africa.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin Southern Africa.
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Southern Africa.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projectsin Southern Africa
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Southern Africa.

title: Physical and environmental condition survey of rural bridges in Tanzania
description: Sharing the condition of rural bridges on primary, secondary and tertiary roads with TANROADS (GoT Roads Agency) will enable the GoT to choose which bridges to repair/replace in order to maintain/increase access to market for agriculture products, access to education and healthcare.

title: OPEN CONTACTING IN WEST AFRICA: SCOPING STUDY
description: This scoping study will facilitate an inclusive assessment process with stakeholders to understand the current level of openness of contracting in West Africa (including Nigeria) stakeholder capacities to implement open contracting and opportunities for joint action between government, companies and civil society to solve procurement problems.

title: Anti-corruption secondment and training in Nigeria
description: The project will build on success of existing Anti-Corruption programmes and will deepen the National Crime Agency's work on corruption in Nigeria. The work is focused on providing technical assistance to key crime fighting agencies to improve the gathering of evidence and securing convictions.

title: Political advocacy for economic reform and development in Nigeria
description: Multiple strands of activity aimed at improving the quality of economic policy making, improving the business environment for growth and development, and building capacity in Nigeria to identify and tackle barriers to trade and investment. Work-strands include: assistance to develop a beneficial ownership register to increase transparency and tackle corruption; an initiative to promote trade, reduce corruption and improve cooperation between public and private stakeholders along trade routes in Nigeria's gateway state of Ogun; unlocking investment opportunities by reviewing private equity franchise investing in Nigeria; and mapping potential to improve business productivity through use of technology in the priority sectors of Agriculture and Education.

title: BUSINESS ENVIRONMENT AT STATE-LEVEL SCOPING STUDY
description: A scoping study to provide analysis of the business environment in Nigeria in selected states to identify the challenges and opportunities for business, providing recommendations on potential reforms to open up avenues for greater investment and growth.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects (UK)
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA project management.

title: Scoping Study for Africa Infrastructure Project Preparation Facility
description: Greater investment in infrastructure is needed to cope with the demands of a rising population and rapid urbanisation. The current funding gap is about $50 billion per year. The funding gap arises from a lack of projects that are sufficiently refined and prepared to be attractive for investment. There are many project preparation facilities in place with work undertaken to understand why they are not as effective as they could be. This project is seeking further analysis within the field of Infrastructure Project Preparation in Africa. The aim is to use the private sector to increase the number of projects that are ready for financing by bridging the expectations gap between the private and public sector.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA ProjectsIn Nigeria
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Nigeria

title: Promoting capital market development, integration and liberalisation through the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN)
description: The project is designed to deliver a programme of technical cooperation between the UK and the ASEAN Capital Markets Forum. This will support the financial sector reform, integration and economic development agenda in ASEAN through the sharing of UK expertise, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Promoting Green Growth and low carbon economic transition in South East Asia
description: The project is designed to encourage the adoption of low carbon growth policy and low carbon business in South East Asia by establishing a platform for policy makers and the private sector to engage.

title: Development Costs of ODA Projects in Asia Pacific Region
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Asia Pacific Region.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Asia Pacific Region
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation, monitoring and resources as part of ODA projects in the Asia Pacific Region.

title: Administrative and Monitoring Costs for Scoping Studies in Asia Pacific Region
description: The scoping studies aim to provide analysis of various thematic areas to help identify where the current constraints, challenges and opportunities lie, in view of better targeted future programme activity.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Asia Pacific Region
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in the Asia Pacific Region.

title: Argentina: Promote the adoption of open data practices to improve competitiveness in public procurement tenders at the Buenos Aires city government
description: To increase transparency, competitiveness and efficiency in the Buenos Aires City Government Procurement Process, increasing opportunities for businesses.

title: Argentina: Increase transparency in electoral campaign finance to reduce potential for corrupt practice
description: Identify and advocate policy measures to improve the regulation and transparency of political campaign financing as part of the Argentinean government's electoral reform bill.

title: Argentina: Increase awareness and adoption of transparency in extractive industries among government officials in key provinces
description: To increase awareness and adoption of transparency in extractive industries among government officials in key provinces.

title: Supporting regulatory reform in South East Asia to improve the business environment in the region and assist economic development
description: The project is designed to build capacity and provide expert UK government resource to assist in the development and delivery of regulatory reform initiatives to the South East Asia region. This will develop trade and investment opportunities for business, increase the transparency of regulatory environments and therefore create business environments in which international and domestic businesses can have confidence to trade, invest and grow.

title: Improving transparency and accountability in public infrastructure investment in South East Asia
description: The project is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of the Construction Sector Transparency Initiative (CoST), as an international accountability standard and practical tool that works to improve the business environment, increases competitiveness; levels the playing field, promotes regulatory and policy reforms; and mitigates corruption within public infrastructure investments in Indonesia, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam.

title: Supporting the development of infrastructure programmes in South East Asia to ensure they meet international standards and enable the confidence of international investors
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to transform the planning, preparation, evaluation and project initiation of South East Asian infrastructure programmes in accordance with world-class methodologies based on UK best practice. This will ensure that projects can be successfully brought to market, and provide bidding and advisory opportunities for international financiers and infrastructure players, including UK ones.

title: Supporting increased transparency and higher standards in infrastructure projects in South East Asia
description: The project is designed to support ASEAN governments in South East Asia by ensuring their effective use of highly skilled international transaction advisors in the project preparation phase, thereby enhancing the potential of the Public-Private Partnership/infrastructure pipeline. This will encourage increased international investment.

title: Supporting the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN) to strengthen private sector commitment to tackle corruption in South East Asia
description: The project is designed to enable ASEAN to support private sector groups and relevant stakeholders to tackle corruption effectively by promoting regional cooperation, joint advocacy, capacity building, and harmonisation of standards. This is expected to lead to ASEAN's implementation of a regional cooperation model, which will help create a level playing field for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the improvement of the Intellectual Property policy framework in the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN).
description: The project is designed to increase the respect and protection of intellectual property (IP) in South East Asia. Bringing IP policies to the same standard across the region, and more in line with international and global standards. This is expected to lead to the development of ASEAN-wide policies on trademark protection and other IP issues; as well as support innovation and productivity growth in the region. It is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of intellectual property rights (IPR) enforcement capabilities in South East Asia
description: The project is designed to implement several of the recommendations made in the 2015 China-South East Asia Counterfeiting Report and to develop the IPR enforcement capabilities of several major South East Asian countries.

title: Producing a Scoping Study for a South East Asia Future Cities Programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for a future Prosperity Fund programme on Future Cities in South East Asia.

title: Producing a Scoping Study for a South East Asia Low Carbon Programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for Prosperity Fund programme on low carbon development in South East Asia

title: Better Health Scoping
description: Scoping study to provide analysis to help identify where the current constraints, challenges and opportunities lie to develop a programme to improve health systems in targeted ODA-eligible countries.

title: Improving Trade Facilitation Indicators in Brazil to promote trade reforms and increased prosperity
description: Create a Trade Reform Plan for Brazil using performance indicators to identify trade efficiency gaps, paving the way for trade cost reductions and increase in imports and exports flows.

title: Creating a coherence model for Trade Regulations in Brazil to support a better business environment
description: Increase Brazilian capacity to facilitate investment and increase international trade flows by improving domestic regulatory measures (regulatory coherence), using UK as a model.

title: Improving the quality of public spending in Brazil through structured policy evaluation methodologies
description: The project will contribute to improved quality of public spending in Brazil by increasing its ability to evaluate the impact of fiscal policies and government spending policies on the private sector.

title: Increasing efficiency and performance of the Brazilian judiciary system in Brazil to support the fight against corruption
description: The project will increase efficiency in judiciary system management and foster better justice services in Brazil to combat organised crime, corruption and money laundering.

title: Brazil: Supporting a new Open Innovation policy in Health for the State of Sao Paulo and improving the business environment for new health technologies
description: This project will help deliver a more efficient public health system in So Paulo state through an open innovation approach, fostering entrepreneurship and developing public-private partnerships.

title: Teacher Training for Technical and Vocational Education in Brazil
description: This project will help strengthen delivery of vocational and technical education in Brazil's Federal Institutes in order to deploy a more skilled workforce to address the needs of industry, making Brazil more attractive for international companies.

title: English as a Foreign Language Programme: developing English and methodological skills for teachers to support better English language skills in Brazil
description: The project aims to provide an integrated approach to English as a Foreign Language (EFL) teacher training programme in public schools in 5 Brazilian State Governments (So Paulo, Minas Gerais, Mato Grosso, Paraba and Tocantis). This project will not only enhance the English proficiency of the public school teachers involved but also leverage the UK's global expertise in education to demonstrate that investment in EFL is an essential public policy for the country's development.

title: Energy Storage in Brazil: promoting low-carbon technology development through innovative regulation and public policies
description: The project will support development of low-carbon energy security in Brazil by equipping its electricity sector with storage technologies.

title: Oil & Gas Production and Operational Efficiency: increasing productivity and improving oil spills detection to promote sustainable sector growth in Brazil
description: This project will improve oil and gas sector efficiency, sustainability and transparency by maximizing operational efficiency for monitoring oil and gas spills, increasing compliance and reducing costs for both government and international companies.

title: Brazil: providing clear oil and gas decommissioning guidance to develop a strong regulatory framework, guide sustainable sector development and protect the environment
description: By providing guidance on oil and gas decommission to develop a regulatory framework, the project will help update the Brazilian offshore oil & gas regulatory framework on operational safety, environmental protection and cost effectiveness, setting clear decommissioning guidance for the industry. This will also make the sector more attractive for international companies.

title: Health Accelerator Programme: re-balancing primary healthcare policy in Recife
description: This project will support reform of primary care services in the city of Recife, improving access, responsiveness, quality and range of services, to make healthcare in Brazil more cost-effective and also attractive to foreign investment. This is through supporting local commissioners and clinicians by bringing together data collected in the city of Recife to accelerate the development of unplanned / urgent care services so that citizens can have their care provided locally.

title: Roadmap for Logistics Infrastructure Investments in Brazil: improving regulation to facilitate private sector investments and foster economic growth
description: This project will promote policy reform and private investment in logistics infrastructure by producing a roadmap for Brazil's logistics infrastructure regulatory framework, to facilitate private sector investments and foster economic growth.

title: Enabling Smart Cities in Brazil: supporting the expansion of intermodal transport with smart technologies to improve urban mobility
description: This project will provide the city of Belo Horizonte with enhanced smart cities capabilities by incorporating low-carbon and innovative UK-based technologies and establishing strategic partnerships with UK cities.

title: Enhancing Education, Health, and Mobility Infrastructure through Public-Private Partnerships in Brazil
description: The project supports the states of Minas Gerais and Bahia in Brazil in the development of Public Private Partnerships (PPPs) in the education, health and urban mobility sectors, by providing technical assistance before the competitive tendering procedure, resulting in a more favorable business environment for PPPs, with more transparency and efficiency, improved regulation and commercial integration.

title: Brazil Low Carbon Infrastructure Plan: developing a Green Bonds market in Brazil to leverage private finance for low carbon infrastructure
description: This project will support development of low-carbon and climate resilient infrastructure in Brazil by developing a Green Bonds market in Brazil to leverage private finance for low carbon infrastructure

title: Brazil: Sustainable Wastewater Management in Minas Gerais: providing international best practices on wastewater management to promote sustainability
description: This project will support Minas Gerais state government in the reform of its sewage system and implement new sustainable sanitation infrastructure, providing international best practices on wastewater management to promote sustainability, reducing environmental impacts and improving living conditions.

title: Enhancing urban planning capability in Myanmar
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to build an urban planning capability within Myanmar's Ministry of Construction to provide a framework for sustainable urban development and hence to enable economic growth. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Establishing an Aberdeen-Myanmar Energy Economy partnership
description: The project will help the Myanmar government and industry to learn from Aberdeen's success in developing into a world class sub-sea centre of excellence through knowledge exchange, training and capacity building initiatives. It will help Myanmar to develop its own Oil and Gas infrastructure and to enhance the capacity of its business community such that it can play an increasing role within Myanmar and in South East Asia.

title: Encouraging the liberalisation of the insurance sector in Myanmar
description: The project is designed to encourage the liberalisation of the insurance sector in Myanmar with the goal of stimulating economic growth through the creation of a competitive insurance market, subsequently driving social development and promoting cross-border trade through the protection of investors' assets and risks.

title: Helping Myanmar implement an Anti-Money Laundering strategy to improve regulation and strengthen robustness in the financial sector
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support Myanmar's Central Control Board on Money Laundering to achieve the rapid progress and reform that will be set out in the forthcoming National Anti-Money Laundering/Combating the Financing of Terrorism Strategy.

title: Assisting Myanmar in implementing the Paris Agreement on climate change by turning its Intended Nationally Determined Contribution commitment into action
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to develop transparent, measurable and action-orientated implementation plans to deliver the targets and activities identified in the Nationally Determined Contributions of Myanmar. This will increase private sector involvement, in particular in the low carbon energy sector, by identifying specific investment opportunities for investors and technology providers.

title: Developing effective green bond assessment and rating frameworks in China.
description: The project is designed to deliver, by September 2016, effective green bond assessment and rating frameworks for China, and assist implementation of them, in order to drive investment decisions that maximise the environmental benefit of every green bond denominated in Renminbi (RMB).

title: Promoting development of green principles in Chinese healthcare, including in infrastructure and service delivery to support sustainable healthcare
description: The project is designed to allow the Chinese government to draw upon UK experience to promote the development of green health and care systems which support intelligent, resilient and sustainable healthcare. It will achieve this by running provincial level pilot initiatives to strengthen the function of health management and promote green infrastructure, operation and service delivery. A final workshop will present to Chinese Ministries an overview of international case studies on sustainable healthcare, including from the UK, and will generate options for China's adoption of green principles in its healthcare systems.

title: Supporting China to increase capacity in international tax cooperation
description: The project is designed to enable Her Majesty's Revenue and Customs and China's State Administration of Taxation to work together through the Forum on Tax Administration (FTA), holding bilateral and multilateral Tax Administration discussions to drive forward G20 tax priorities and support China's joint role as G20 president and host of the FTA Plenary.

title: Supporting China's Research and Development capabilities through establishing an Innovation Gateway in Shanghai
description: The project is designed to build a platform that assists the local government and Research and Development base in Shanghai to facilitate academia-industry collaboration. By doing this, the project intends to make China's Research and Development more competitive internationally, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting Chinese efforts to re-use brownfield and marginal land for low carbon and renewable energy purposes
description: The project is designed to promote China-UK collaboration to evaluate and adapt innovative methodologies, in order that China can re-use brownfields and marginal land for low carbon and renewable energy purposes. This is intended to support the development of low-resource strategies for land management, decontamination of land, urban regeneration, and community enterprise for brownfield and marginal land areas. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Designing a power market protocol for China that enables better renewable energy integration
description: The project is designed to support China's orientation towards renewable energy by producing proposals for adoption by China's National Energy Administration. These include proposals, based on UK and US experience, for a market model, pricing mechanism and operation rules. The proposals will serve as a source of reference for China for its creation of a more competitive power market.

title: Strengthening China's evidence discovery procedure in intellectual property litigation
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK and EU experience to develop China's trademark system and brand management practice by working with its government and its legal and industrial sectors raising awareness and capacity building. This is intended to enhance the institutional environment for brand operations of companies operating in China, including UK ones. For example, they will be better-placed to protect their revenues and derive further income by licensing or sale of brand rights.

title: Supporting the national rollout of provincial level climate legislation in China
description: The project is designed to refine draft climate legislation in China by drawing on international best practice and feeding in key findings from four provinces that already have climate regulation - Jiangsu, Hubei, Shijiazhuang and Nanchang. The project will involve seminars in these four provinces to share practices and experience, plus the submission to the Chinese government of a final report that advises on national and provincial policy.

title: Supporting efforts to tackle antimicrobial resistance in rural Anhui, China.
description: The project is designed to trial (by producing, validating and promoting) a practical package ("ECROPS") against antimicrobial resistance in rural Anhui, China. It is intended that, in future years of programming, the package  if successful  will be evaluated and expanded in the province.

title: Supporting the adoption of a roadmap in Sichuan province on the development of alternative energy sources in China
description: The project is designed to support Sichuan's adoption of a roadmap to support its development of alternative energy sources. The implementer will produce recommendations to Sichuan's government on improving regulations for shale gas development. It is intended that this leads to Sichuan's adoption of the recommendations, leading to a national pilot project in 2-3 years time.

title: Promoting UK-China collaborations in areas such as co-productions and film exports, to support economic reform and diversification in China, thereby generating opportunities for international business, including from the UK
description: The project is designed to support the internationalisation of the Chinese film industry by enhancing UK-China collaborations particularly in areas such as co-productions and film exports. This will include improving policy skills, expertise and policy frameworks that support China's engagement in international markets. It is intended that UK and Chinese industries develop a relationship that fosters an increased understanding of each others' creative and commercial working practices. This will help facilitate co-productions more effectively and increase the competitiveness of Chinese films internationally, thereby promoting economic rebalancing in China and generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting policy in China by holding the Second UK-China Forum on Social Policy and Public Sector Reform
description: The project is designed to bring together influential officials, scholars and practitioners from China and the UK at a Second UK-China Forum on Social Policy and Public Sector Reform, in order to influence central government policy, social policy issues and public sector reform in line with China's 13th Five-Year Plan. The targeted policy areas include open data, civil contingency, public service delivery and government performance evaluation.

title: Supporting China's ability to monitor greenhouse gas emissions
description: The project is designed to improve China's monitoring of its greenhouse gas emissions, to encourage China's move to low carbon production, thereby decreasing the risk from Climate Change. This will be achieved by establishment of a set of indicators that will regularly provide government leaders with a clear assessment of the risk of following a high emissions pathway, and the priority actions needed to avoid it.

title: Supporting China's ability to monitor climate risks.
description: The project is designed to improve China's monitoring of climate risks, helping to develop China's markets in climate resilient infrastructure and insurance. This will be achieved by establishing a set of climate risk indicators that will regularly provide government leaders with a clearer assessment of risk than is currently available, thereby generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting public engagement and consultation on China's design and delivery of energy projects
description: The project is designed to share UK and international experience in developing more effective public engagement and consultation, in order to improve the planning and implementation of both China and UK energy projects. This will include sharing experience to improve government, regulators' and companies' ability to understand and address public hopes and concerns with regard to the delivery of energy infrastructure plans in China and the UK, through effective communication and engagement.

title: Supporting China's transition to low carbon energy by enhancing its government's capability to monitor energy statistics
description: The project is designed to increase knowledge and use  at both national and provincial government level in China - of best practice methodologies, and internationally-agreed concepts and definitions in energy statistics. It is intended that China's energy statistics capability is thereby enhanced, enabling China to monitor energy policy through its transition to low carbon. Doing so will align China's data collection with OECD countries, which will accelerate China's transition to low carbon growth.

title: Strengthening primary care capacity in China through training to help the health of the poor whilst creating openings for international and UK business
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to strengthen the training of Chinese GPs in paediatrics to improve their skills across diagnoses and treatments, in pilot cities. This project will enable primary care institutions to take on more responsibilities in dealing with child medical issues, relieving pressure on tertiary paediatric services. Chinese policy makers will use the pilot report to inform the establishment of tiered treatment guidelines. This is expected to generate commercial and collaborative opportunities for international entities, including UK ones.

title: Improving the efficiency of electricity markets in Yunnan, China
description: The project is designed to improve the efficiency of electricity markets in China, through a pilot project on reforming electricity wholesale and retail markets in Yunnan Province. In doing this, it will draw upon UK policy and market expertise to inform and accelerate Yunnan's power market pilot, facilitating the transition to low carbon of the world's largest power sector. This will generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Reducing greenhouse gas emissions in China by storage of carbon dioxide in depleted gas reservoirs.
description: The project is designed to use UK expertise to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by developing the storage of carbon dioxide in depleted gas reservoirs. It is intended that China's Ministry of Science and Technology adopts policy recommendations on such storage, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Sustaining the rapid growth of China's Green Bond Market
description: The project is designed to draw upon the UK's leadership in global financial markets to sustain the rapid growth of China's Green Bond Market, which involves proceeds of bonds being allocated to environmental projects, and contributes to reduction of emissions. It is intended to enhance the connection between China's domestic green bond market and the international market. It is also intended to establish green bonds as a tool for China to tap into international capital markets to finance low-carbon and climate resilient projects, which would open up opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Supporting China's positive engagement with the WTO and G20 to enhance the global trade environment
description: The project is designed to support China's adoption, by December 2016, of expert policy recommendations in the areas of WTO negotiations and the agenda of the 2016 G20 Summiton trade, investment and development, substantially advancing an open, rules-based world trading system and global economic governance.

title: Supporting China's development of standards for Smart Cities.
description: The project is designed to use UK expertise to support China's development of standards (compatible with UK ones) for Smart Cities. It is intended that China will draw upon UK expertise to set up strategic standards, encompassing a concept model, reference framework and applicable information communication technology indicators, supporting economic reform and growth in China, and generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Improving China's protection of intellectual property rights, including its copyright collective licensing system.
description: The project is designed to improve China's copyright collective licensing system and improve UK-China cooperation on dispute resolution. It is intended that, by January 2018, better resolution of disputes results in Chinese judges' increased awareness and consequent policy input to ongoing copyright reforms, thereby leading to higher revenues for Chinese and international creative industries companies (including UK ones) and individual creators.

title: Supporting the strengthening of competition policy in China
description: The project is designed to support China's National Development and Reform Commission to develop and adopt a policy framework and implementation path, in order to establish the mechanism of fair competition scrutiny. This is intended to create a better and fairer business environment in China, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting China's development of its regulatory regime for private equity and hedge funds
description: The project is designed to support the strengthening and refinement of China's hedge fund and private equity fund regulatory framework, in order to build a more robust financial system in China and encourage foreign participation in the Chinese private fund industry. In doing so, it is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting China to further develop and open up its commodities derivatives market, through an initial focus in Guangdong province
description: The project is designed to support China to further develop and open up its commodities derivatives market, though an initial focus on Guangdong province. It is intended that, by December 2017, Guangdong government will introduce practical plans aimed at the further opening of commodities futures, especially precious metals and non-ferrous metals, to international markets as part of the wider strategy of internationalising the RMB. This will benefit China and provide better access to Chinese capital markets for international (including UK) investors.

title: Supporting the development of the Chinese anti-money laundering framework
description: The project is designed to provide technical support to China's anti-money laundering framework in order to support preparation for the Financial Action Task Force Mutual Evaluation. This contributes to ensuring the integrity of China's financial system, help to provide a level playing for businesses, reduces risks and encourages investment from international firms.

title: Developing China's crowd-funding regulatory policy, to promote China's internet finance market growth
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK experiences and expertise to support China to improve its crowd-funding regulatory policy, and put in place a UK-China framework for crowd-funding cooperation, based on the practices of Guizhou province. The UK-China collaboration will build expertise and create links with key stakeholders in China's internet finance market, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting regulatory reform of the Shenzhen private equity market
description: The project is designed to promote regulatory reform of the Shenzhen private equity market. This supports China's drive to reform its economy under its 13th Five Year Plan, one focus of which is to address the fact that regulation has not kept pace with market development. If enacted, such reform can enable direction of finance in China towards the most innovative and efficient sectors of the economy, to support economic rebalancing, financial inclusion and poverty reduction, particularly for the growth of SMEs. The support is aimed at helping the Shenzhen government introduce a pilot plan with an aim to further broaden and deepen its private equity market through expanding quotas and relaxing regulatory restriction on foreign market participants.

title: Promoting the development of the market in Chinese local government debt
description: The project takes up an issue discussed in the 2015 UK-China Economic and Financial Dialogue regarding the development of China's local debt markets. It is designed to provide policy suggestions for the development of Measures for the Supervision and Administration of Local Government Debt Issuance in China to be issued by the Ministry of Finance in 2017, thereby generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Applying expertise to science and engineering teaching in China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to share innovative approaches in the teaching of academic and vocational STEM (Science Technology Education and Mathematics) education, based on successful methodologies developed in the UK, with leading Chinese teachers/schools and Ministries of Education/Science and Technology, thereby benefiting education in China and laying a foundation for long-term collaboration with the UK.

title: Researching population ageing to support the design of medical reimbursement policies in Shanghai
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to reveal the relationship between age and medical expenses, and the characteristics of end-of-life expenses among the elderly in Shanghai. Through undertaking a value for money' analysis to identify inappropriate resource use on elderly care in Shanghai, and learning lessons from the UK context, this project will provide a reference for policy design and implementation in Shanghai, both under the 13th Five-Year Plan and through guidance that the Shanghai Municipal Human Resources and Social Security Bureau is due to issue on the Elderly Care Social Security System by the end of 2016. Chinese adoption of UK proposals in the study has the potential to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Increasing awareness among Chinese stakeholders about enforcement of intellectual property rights
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK best practice to protect and enforce intellectual property (IP) rights among Chinese rights owners. A UK-China Intellectual Property conference in London will demonstrate UK policy designed to protect IP, which in turn will help support innovation and growth in the respective sectors.

title: Supporting enterprises in Chongqing, China to manage effective carbon reduction through emissions trading
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK experience and expertise to support Chongqing-based enterprises covered by China's national Emission Trading Scheme, so these enterprises establish their corporate-level carbon management system. In doing so, this is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Developing a human resources strategy for Chongqing's Free Trade Zone
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK experience to support the adoption of a Human Resources Strategy' by the Chongqing government's various human resources departments and Liangjiang New Area's governance structure. It is then intended that these entities will disseminate Chongqing's best practices to other Free Trade Zones in China. This will help open up the market for foreign professional training and qualification service providers, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Increasing Guangdong's competitiveness by supporting investment along the Maritime Silk Road
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK expertise to enhance Guangdong's overall competitiveness in overseas investment through: firstly, learning from models of industry regulation and risk control; and secondly, deeper collaboration with UK professional service providers.

title: Supporting Yangtze Delta Region cities with their climate change risk adaption plan
description: The project is designed to develop a climate change self-assessment tool to help Yangtze River Delta Region cities draw up climate change adaptation plans, supporting the efforts of these cities to be among China's National Development and Reform Commission's 30 demonstration cities for climate change adaptation. As the project is implemented, UK expertise on infrastructure policy and services may be accepted by Chinese policy makers, potentially generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.
