title: Supporting the incorporation of climate risk assessment in Shanghai's Water Supply Infrastructure Strategy
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK expertise to influence the Shanghai government's water sector asset investment policy, by providing a robust framework for Climate Change vulnerability assessment. There is potential for such assessment to be replicated to other regions of China. The project will also generate business opportunities for international businesses, including from the UK, to provide equipment, technology and consulting services to the Chinese authorities.

title: Promoting UK-China film collaborations that will build capacity in the Chinese TV industry and supporting the internationalisation of China's film industry, thereby generating opportunities for international business, including from the UK
description: The project is designed to draw upon the expertise of UK TV professionals so that the Chinese TV sector and relevant Chinese authorities learn a range of new skills, which will enable them to increase their commercial, creative and technical aptitude, enabling them to build capacity. They will build their knowledge and skills to help create an expanding, sustainable and vibrant sector, thereby promoting economic diversification in China and generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Increasing the understanding of stakeholders in Jiangsu, China of the commercial aspects of offshore wind electricity generation
description: The project is intended to increase the understanding of Jiangsu energy regulators and market stakeholders of offshore wind market conditions. This will be achieved through a series of reports that draw upon UK experience. The project will also explain UK policy and commercial solutions in Jiangsu, bolstering sustainable growth of China's largest offshore wind market, accelerating the low carbon transition, enhancing energy security, reducing global technology costs and generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Promoting the development of China's marine energy technology and utilisation
description: The project intends to draw upon UK expertise to promote the development of marine energy technology and utilisation. This will include policy recommendations to China to build a framework for commercialising marine energy technologies and standards. It is hoped that China will adopt the recommendations, establish a Marine Energy Centre, and tap the advantages of marine energy as a new source of renewable energy which can be consistently generated throughout the year. This would also promote creation of a new market and potential opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting China to develop a talent management database for greenhouse gas experts
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK expertise to assist China's development of a national training, qualification, and registration database for Greenhouse Gas experts, available to market participants. In doing so, it intends to upgrade China's knowledge base, help ensure that experts are properly qualified/certified, and further ensure the orderly operation of the national Emissions Trading Scheme through the scoping of a centralised talent management system by mid 2017.

title: Supporting independent verification of carbon emissions in Shanghai and neighbouring provinces in China
description: The project is designed to harness UK expertise to support the building of capacity for the independent verification of carbon emissions in Shanghai, as a pilot city for China's National Emissions Trading Scheme. This project will provide a solid model for neighbouring provinces to emulate and support the provision of expertise to create a strong, reliable, business friendly system, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of an Emissions Trading Scheme in South China
description: The project is designed to launch a Carbon Trading platform in south China by June 2017. This project will build on the UK's strong links to Guangdong, collaborate with provinces in the Pan Pearl River Delta, and bring in UK expertise to help all of Southern China build a strong, effective, interconnected carbon trading infrastructure, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting market development and regulatory reform in insurance in Guangdong Nansha Free Trade Zone, China.
description: The project is designed to deliver policy recommendations to the insurance market authorities on relaxing restrictions on foreign insurance companies, focusing on registration of institutions, personnel, and funds in Guangdong Nansha Free Trade Zone. This is expected to generate opportunities for international business, including from the UK.

title: Assisting the development and application of environmental risk assessment in China's green financial system
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to further drive the adaptation of natural capital valuation in China's financing and investment decisions by relevant governmental authorities and financial institutions in China's transition to a low carbon and sustainable economy.

title: Supporting the development of green finance projects in three Chinese cities
description: The project is designed to develop plans or regulations on green finance, assist with the establishment of a green financial system, and introduce green industrial and financial solutions, in three Chinese cities. This is intended to strengthen the development of China's green finance market.

title: Working with China to improve international cooperation on corruption cases
description: The project is designed to bring together practitioners from leading countries to influence China's G20 Presidency agenda of new solutions for improving international legal assistance in trans-border corruption cases, to be implemented by G20 as well as non-G20 countries. Increased transparency and integrity in trade such as through ensuring customs compliance and better internal controls, will help to improve the business environment which in turn benefits wider society.

title: Strengthening China's evidence discovery procedure in intellectual property litigation
description: The project is designed to support the protection of intellectual property (IP) rights in China, by the adoption by IP courts in China of policy to develop more effective  but proportionate  evidence discovery procedures in civil court cases, facilitating the determination of infringement of IP rights and calculation of compensatory damages, and benefiting domestic and international (including UK) IP owners.

title: Supporting China's development of its low-carbon automobile policy to reduce the rapid increase in Chinese vehicle emissions
description: The project is designed to draw on UK collaboration with the Chinese government to study the low-carbon regulations for China's rapidly growing automobile industry and produce a clear roadmap to reducing emissions across the industry. This will result in increasing demand for design and technology, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting China's development of a carbon emissions reduction roadmap for the Guangdong transport sector
description: The project is designed to draw upon UK expertise to secure the commitment, by the end of 2017, of Guangdong province to the Carbon Emissions Reduction Roadmap. This will set an ambitious target to reduce emissions in the transportation sector in the 13th Five Year Plan.

title: Preparing Guangdong's household carbon credit system for national and international adoption
description: The project is designed, through a review of international consumption-based carbon emission reduction reward systems, and the current pilots in Guangdong province, to produce general operating principles for an equivalent system in Guangdong, which can be replicated nationally and internationally. This will be produced for the Guangdong Development and Reform Commission and its pilot cities by March 2017. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Delivering a summit promoting UK-China collaboration on clean energy
description: The project is designed to enhance UK-China collaboration in energy grids and storage, offshore renewable energy sources and carbon reduction/energy efficiency. Through sharing of UK expertise, potential pipelines will be indentified, assisting the development of low carbon and greener energy systems in China.

title: Developing evidence-based care pathways for chronic disease in China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to inform and influence China's national and local health policies, by developing and implementing evidence-based guidance for care pathways in terms of chronic disease management, to improve and standardise quality of care. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Building capacity for community-based dementia care in Qingdao, China
description: This project is designed to draw on UK experience to inform forthcoming guidance on "Promoting Community Aged Care" in Qingdao, and policies under the 13th Five-Year Aged Care Plan in Qingdao, by June 2017. This will be done through study reports and capacity building. A comparative report on UK and Qingdao dementia care services is also being produced, which will be used to inform a public education campaign and policy recommendations. This will include proposals for a dementia care service model at the community level. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Promoting innovative financing of patient care in Zhejiang Province, China
description: The project is designed for Zhejiang Province to draw upon UK expertise to consider new patient care facilities using replicable delivery models and exemplars for innovative financing of patient care. A Supply and Demand' assessment of healthcare infrastructure requirements in Zhejiang will be produced and a pilot hospital identified to trial different financing models. This will provide an opportunity to participate in the redefinition of the patient referral policy, in Zhejiang and enable access to a new market estimated at 150 million, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting sustainable urbanisation in Kunming, China
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise in urban regeneration to inform Kunming government policy, by adopting policy recommendations (for example, on urban planning and regeneration, and in the digital and healthcare fields). It is further intended that the Kunming government will disseminate best practice from Kunming-Liverpool co-operation, as a result of the 3 year cooperation plan' being implemented and commercial links established by this project. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Strengthening the protection of intellectual property rights in China
description: The project is designed to develop an effective regime for addressing challenges to intellectual property (IP) protection in China, both online through e-commerce channels, and via offline networks which facilitate the trade in counterfeit products between China and ASEAN nations. A more effective regime will increased protection and help to contribute to a healthier business environment, innovation and related economic growth.

title: Improved absorption and management of waste water at airports in China
description: The project is designed to raise awareness of water management around major infrastructure projects through environmentally friendly designs. The primary focus will be Beijing's New Airport. The aim will be to help reduce the environmental impact, flood risks and minimise water consumption. The successful format can be used as a case study to repeat at other new airports and infrastructure developments ensuring efficient resource use and a reduced impact to surrounding populations.

title: Improving educational equipment standards in China
description: The project is designed to systematically analyse UK and Chinese education technology and equipment standards, and determine comparative advantage. This is intended to inform China's amendment of its education equipment standards for its 13th Five-Year Plan. It is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses including from the UK.

title: Supporting China's educational reform and facilitate UK-China education cooperation
description: The project is designed to draw on UK experience to deepen China's education reform and facilitate UK-China education cooperation. It will do this through setting up an education system pilot project in the fields of tourism and hospitality management, and cultural creativity, by June 2017. In doing so, it is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Developing a China Future School Assessment Guide to improve Chinese students' attainment and teachers' ability.
description: The project is designed to use UK leading models of student and teaching assessment to trial and evaluate the UK assessment model in Chinese schools. This has the aim of establishing assessment standards for students and teachers, leading to China's Ministry of Education incorporating the standards proposed.

title: Promoting the commercialisation of abandoned mine methane (AMM) recovery in China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to produce a policy framework for an abandoned mine methane commercial pilot, which will be shared with key policy makers and stakeholders in China (including coal companies). The project will bring together UK and Chinese companies, enabling further pilots in China, and the potential for commercial opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Improving understanding of the risks for investors and implications for policymakers of stranded coal-fired power assets in China
description: The project is designed to: (i) improve the understanding of financial institutions and regulators in China (such as the People's Bank of China and the China Banking Regulatory Commission) so they better understand the risks of stranded coal-fired generation assets and their precise exposure, so that they can shift capital away from such investments and take steps to manage the build-up of stranded asset risk in China's financial system; and (ii) support China's central government (e.g. the National Energy Administration and the National Development and Reform Commission) and the Jilin Provincial Government to better manage the political challenges, especially those in the electricity sector, associated with asset stranding and to formulate policies that can ensure a smoother transition away from coal-fired generation.

title: Developing a framework to analyse economic structural reform, to support China's economic transition  and improve the G20 structural reform analysis framework
description: This project is designed to improve the G20 structural reform analysis framework, particularly the quantitative analysis framework, and further improve the G20 structural reform agenda and assessment of reform efforts.

title: Supporting capacity building in the services sector in Beijing
description: The project is designed to strengthen the capacity and influence of the local Beijing government in this pilot opening of China's services market, by building capacity and expertise in the services sector through support for the China International Fair for Trade in Services. The intention is that this will eventually be replicated across the country, supporting China's long-term integration into global markets and transition to a service-orientated economy. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Improving the capacity of clinical microbiologists in China against the global threat of antimicrobial resistance
description: The project is designed to use UK expertise in clinical microbiology, to improve the capacity of clinical microbiologists in China. It is intended that antimicrobial stewardship will be implemented in China by March 2017.

title: Building capacity and expertise for digital healthcare in Xi'an district, China
description: The project is designed to draw on experience and best practice from Sheffield to build capacity and expertise for digital healthcare in Xi'an and Tongchuan in China. The UK-China collaboration will focus on digital healthcare innovation, in order to build expertise and create links with key stakeholders in China's digital healthcare market, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Researching better hospital support for integrated medical and social care for the elderly in China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise, through a series of UK-China collaborative activities, on integrated care research and development. It will include study reports and capacity building. This will help inform policy recommendations for China's National Committee on Ageing and the Ministry of Health in view of developing an improved integrated system for elderly requiring healthcare in China. This is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Promoting China's low carbon transition by mitigating the social and economic impacts of coal subsidy reform
description: The project is designed to share UK and international experience to support China's National Development and Reform Commission's implementation of policies to mitigate the social and economic impacts of coal subsidy reform in China, to reduce its use of coal and coal subsidies in order to accelerate its low carbon transition. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Increasing renewable energy in China through developing policies on market models for supporting energy storage
description: The project is designed to develop policies to support suitable market models for energy storage in China based on international best practice, enabling greater utilisation of renewable energy and creating new market opportunities in China's low carbon energy sector by June 2017, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Improving the credit bond rating system in China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK experience to improve the current credit bond rating system in China, to strengthen exchanges and cooperation between the bond markets in China and the UK, and to support the process of RMB internationalization. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Support the development of China's cross-border e-commerce regulatory framework in the Guangdong Free Trade Zone
description: The project is designed to draw on the best practice of UK e-commerce providers and government, to propose an innovative cross-border e-commerce regulatory approach, and support Guangdong Free Trade Zone. A clarification and harmonisation of rules as well as increased efficiency and transparency of its customs clearance, inspection and quarantine, will boost consumer confidence and encourage growth of local businesses. This is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development and impact of environmental, social and governance regulations through engagement with Chinese listed companies
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to raise awareness and capacity on climate reporting amongst the top 100 Chinese companies; assist the China Securities Regulatory Commission to accelerate its regulation on environmental, social and governance; and mainstream corporate climate change reporting in China.

title: Using China's G20 Presidency to promote women's entrepreneurship
description: The project is designed to use China's G20 Presidency to drive forward the further development of women's entrepreneurship education programmes, to increase women's economic participation in the long term.

title: Establish a Beijing Carbon Capture Utilisation Storage (CCUS) initiative to accelerate CCUS policy formulation, technology and knowledge transfer and commercialisation in China.
description: The project is designed to use UK expertise to establish the initial operation of the Beijing Carbon Capture Utilisation Storage (CCUS) Initiative; accelerate the policy-making process in China's National Development Reform Committee; enable technology and knowledge transfer; and help facilitate commercialisation of CCUS demonstration projects in China by March 2017.

title: Tackling energy conservation and environmental policy conflicts in Guangdong, China
description: The project is designed to support the Guangdong government, by the end of 2016, to take action to coordinate and integrate its currently segmented energy conservation and environmental policies. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones

title: Helping Chinese G20 Presidency contribute to global governance
description: The project, which involves the co-organisation of a forum by Chatham House and China's Counsellors Office of the State Council Forum, is designed to identify any remaining opportunities within G20 processes in the run up to the summit in Hangzhou in September 2016, and identify areas where UK-China cooperation could support the implementation of existing and new G20 agreements on global governance following the summit.

title: Capacity building in cities in East China, to help China's industrial upgrade and sustainable economic growth
description: The project is designed to support China's industrial upgrade and the sustainability of China's economic model. It intends to do this through new strategic collaborations between six cites in the Midlands (through the Midlands Engine for Growth') and cities in East China. These collaborations will be in areas such as automotives, healthcare, creativity, financial services, education and manufacturing and are expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including from the UK.

title: Promoting best practice on the green and low-carbon development of "Characteristic Small Towns" suggested by China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK experience to support China's Ministry of Housing and Urban and Rural Development to adopt green and low carbon policies and technologies in its planning for "Characteristic Small Towns". The envisaged timetable is for the Ministry to issue Case Studies, Policies and Assessment Methodologies by June 2017. Then for three small towns in China to adopt the policies, technologies and best practices by March 2017. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Developing transport connectivity in China's City Cluster in the Middle Reaches of the Yangtze River
description: The project is designed to use policies and best practice from the UK's Northern Powerhouse to develop transport connectivity in China's City Cluster in the Middle Reaches of the Yangtze River. By June 2017, it is intended that the National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Transport and Wuhan government will adopt integrated physical and digitally connected transport planning polices and measures, that reflect UK expertise. This is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Developing curatorial and business skills in China's museum sector to develop capacity in the cultural heritage sector and support China's transition to a service-orientated economy, generating opportunities for UK and international business
description: The project is designed draw on UK expertise to provide, by Feb 2017, capacity building to improve skills levels in China's museums sector in the target areas of curation and management. The project is also designed to promote UK-China collaborations and inform recommendations for policy approaches that can be implemented at a national level to improve commercial and creative sustainability in the sector. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting policy development for Chinese Free Trade Zones
description: The project is designed to introduce the UK's experience, by enabling the authorities of the Pilot Free Trade Zones (FTZs) in China to increase their knowledge of administering the FTZs and improve their policies on trade, investment, finance and business models in the Zones.

title: Supporting the development of policy in Hubei to facilitate the competitiveness of heavy industry in the transition to the new National Emissions Trading Scheme
description: The project is designed to develop policy recommendations to support the Hubei government's allocation of carbon credits to companies in a way that protects industrial competitiveness, helping pave the way for a sustainable national carbon market in China. This is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the economic transition of China's Northeast region through innovation, particularly in the field of intelligent and advanced manufacturing
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to promote innovation in Northeast China, particularly in the advanced manufacturing sector. It is intended that government officials, research institutions and businesses from Liaoning, Jilin, Heilongjiang and Inner Mongolia provinces, and the National Development and Reform Commission, will draw on UK experience. This will result in greater local collaboration and the effective implementation of policies that encourage innovation, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Strengthening skills and Intellectual Property protection in the creative sector in Jiangsu, China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK Intellectual Property expertise to introduce stakeholders in Jiangsu to best international practices in film and TV co-production, and prepare Jiangsu's practitioners to work at a strategic, global level with enhanced protection of intellectual property. Jiangsu's film and TV makers will build their knowledge and skills to help create an expanding and sustainable sector. The project will help to facilitate collaboration between the UK and Jiangsu on film and TV cooperation, generating opportunities between China and international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting Chinese local government adoption of sustainable urban development models
description: The project is designed to: (1) support Chinese local governments adoption of sustainable urban development models in their policy making on Smart Cities' and Sponge Cities' by using UK expertise and experience demonstrated in the road show; (2) support China's urban planners and developers to take the UK's low-carbon principles and specific know-how on low-carbon city development, and build city partnerships between the two countries. The collaboration is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Enhancing the growth of China's financial markets by developing cooperation models
description: The project is designed to enhance the growth of China's financial markets and add a futures element to the Shanghai-London Stock Connect, by proposing several options for cooperation models to the China Securities Regulation Commission, and demonstrating the suitability and feasibility of each model to the international and British market by the end of March 2017.

title: Enhancing cooperation in order to upgrade the capacities of China's regulatory and supervisory authorities
description: The project is designed to establish a mechanism for regular cooperation and dialogue between the UK and Chinese financial regulatory authorities - at working level, and in support of senior/VIP visits. It is also intended to lay the ground for long-term systematic financial cooperation between UK and China, in order to upgrade Chinese capacity in these areas.

title: Harmonising civil nuclear standards between China and the UK, in support of the delivery of China's 13th Five-Year Plan
description: The project is designed to harmonise civil nuclear standards between China and the UK through more mutual recognition. It will involve China's implementation of an adoption process, supporting structural reform, thereby reducing Greenhouse gas emissions, increasing energy security and providing opportunities for international businesses (including UK ones) in bilateral and third market trade and investment.

title: Improving flood control in Shanghai, China
description: The project is designed to support the design and evaluation of policies and strategies for flood risk reduction and disaster prevention in Shanghai through exchange of expertise and best practice. It will also provide scientific data and advice on simulation tools to improve Shanghai's sustainable urban planning.

title: Supporting innovation in passenger transportation emissions measurement
description: The project is designed to use UK expertise to build capacity through a workshop to improve the ability of Chinese partners - the National Development and Reform Commission and Ministry of Transport and their local affiliates - to measure and manage carbon emissions from passenger urban transportation. The collaboration will also generate opportunities for international businesses, including from the UK.

title: Supporting the improvement of the maritime arbitration service in Fujian Free Trade Zone, China
description: The project is designed to support the Fujian Free Trade Zone (FTZ) to issue policy, by the end of 2017, to release market access barriers for international companies in the field of commercial maritime legal service through the successful development of a new pilot in maritime arbitration policy and services. UK experience and best practice will be drawn upon to improve the capacity of Chinese stakeholders in the field of commercial maritime legal services, facilitating market access for international companies, including UK businesses, into the Fujian FTZ maritime legal services industry.

title: Facilitating sustainable agriculture development in China through enhanced sharing of knowledge
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to help China develop a comprehensive information sharing platform for promoting sustainable agriculture. This will improve information flow and openness among industries, academics and governments, and is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses including UK ones.

title: Identifying Carbon Capture Utilisation and Storage development opportunities in Xinjiang, China
description: The project is designed to support the Xinjiang Autonomous Region Development and Reform Commission to systematically assess and identify regional Carbon Capture Utilization and Storage (CCUS) development opportunities, and build capacity for CCUS development in Xinjiang.

title: Supporting China's development of natural gas market reform in Guangdong Province
description: The project is designed to showcase previous UK prosperity project outputs on China's energy and gas reform. It is intended that this will translate into a Guangdong government roadmap which draws on UK experiences of natural gas market reform, culminating in a workshop in Guangdong and a policy report.

title: Supporting the amendment of China's renewable energy law, to remove roadblocks to renewable energy development
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise so that, by March 2017, a bill is proposed to the National People's Congress, and legislative support is secured, for advancing key amendments to the Renewable Energy Law into China's 2018-2023 National Legislation Plan. The amendments are designed to mitigate bottlenecks slowing the development of China's renewable energy sector, in which international businesses, including UK ones, are accessing business opportunities.

title: Incentivising waste utilisation in infrastructure delivery in Wuhan, China
description: The project is designed to impart UK lessons on cross-industry utilisation of waste, to produce policy recommendations which are implemented by Wuhan Development Reform Commission. The recommendations will incentivise circular economy practices in the construction industry to utilise waste. This would generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Increasing levels of international best practice in technology transfer in China
description: The project is designed to embed increased levels of international best practice in technology transfer in China, through the creation of a highly skilled and strongly networked cohort of technology transfer professionals. It is intended that, by the end of 2016, a better environment for technology transfer will be created in China, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Increasing levels of international best practice in technology transfer in Guangdong
description: The project is designed to create a highly-skilled and strongly-networked cohort of Chinese technology transfer professionals who will share UK and international technology transfer practice in Guangdong province and more widely through China, generating opportunities for international businesses, including from the UK.

title: Supporting the implementation of China's National Action Plan on tackling antimicrobial resistance, by educating health workers
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support the Chinese government's adoption of best practice and proposals on a comprehensive implementation plan to establish suitable antimicrobial resistance (AMR) education and training programmes. The project will also develop AMR stewardships for healthcare students and healthcare professionals across China, a key area within China's National Action Plan on AMR.

title: Developing China's Museum infrastructure in order to increase the potential for international collaboration
description: The project is designed to enhance the sustainable development of museums across China through international collaboration involving policy makers, decision makers and professionals, leading to stronger business development skills that result in a more sustainable cultural sector. This is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting RMB internationalisation through the issuing of RMB-denominated infrastructure bonds in London, in the context of China's One Belt One Road Initiative
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise for a policy presentation to UK and Chinese authorities, which will provide policy analysis and recommendations on how issuance of infrastructure finance bonds in the London Offshore market could expand the international use of China's RMB currency and support the objectives of China's One Belt One Road Initiative.

title: Building capacity and supporting policy in china's cultural heritage sector supporting China's transition to a service orientated economy and its engagement with international markets
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to enhance China's cultural heritage sector through international collaboration involving policy makers, decision makers and professionals. It will involve conducting research, and running training programmes and study visits, in partnership with China's State Administration of Cultural Heritage and its Ministry of culture; and promoting UK-China collaborations. In doing so, it will develop and improve capabilities and skill levels of cultural heritage professionals. It will address some of the economic and social pressures facing Chinese cultural heritage driven by climate change, natural disasters, environmental changes and tourism development. The project is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Building the capacity of China's clothing design industry, supporting China's transition to a service-orientated economy and its engagement with international markets
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support economic reform in China's clothing and design industry through increased international collaboration involving industry professionals, associations and policy makers, making it more capable of operating in international markets. This will support the Chinese transition to a more service-orientated economy, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Building the capacity of China's Information and Communications Technology industry, including through best practice in intellectual property policy
description: The project is designed to enhance China's Information and Communications Technology (ICT) industry through skills development and increased international collaboration between industry professionals, associations and policy makers, making it more capable of operating in international markets. This will support the Chinese transition to a more service-oriented economy and is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Developing offshore RMB centres to accelerate China's internationalisation policy for its RMB currency
description: The project is designed to develop offshore Renminbi (RMB) centres by increasing issuance of RMB-denominated bonds in global foreign exchange trade centres, pushing forward the innovation of RMB-denominated financial derivatives.

title: Supporting China's City Clusters policy development and implementation
description: The project is designed to establish a structured partnership between UK and China on City Cluster collaboration that supports China in adopting UK sustainable urban development principles and policies. This has the potential to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Connecting China and the UK on the One Belt One Road' (OBOR) initiative in order to enhance the viability, sustainability and inclusiveness of OBOR projects
description: The project is designed to enhance the understanding of beneficiary countries in Central and South Asia of China's One Belt One Road vision, and identify several socioeconomic and commercially viable cooperation projects involving China, the UK and beneficiary countries in the China Pakistan Economic Corridor. This will increase inclusive and sustainable development in the countries along the routes, generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Facilitating Chinese cities' sustainable development by developing a guideline for China's urban regeneration planning
description: The project is designed to introduce and incorporate UK concepts of regeneration into China's Ecological Restoration and Urban Regeneration Initiative, by its Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, facilitating the development of more sustainable regeneration methodologies in Chinese cities. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of China's technological innovation infrastructure
description: The project is designed to enhance China's technology innovation environment through collaborative between China-UK companies. A UK-China TechHUB Boot Camp programme will help up skill local capability and capacity, provide examples of international expertise and best practice, as well as acting as a signpost mechanism for local funding sources, business and providers.

title: Supporting China's Free Trade Zone and supply side structural reform
description: The project is designed to provide comprehensive guidance to the Chinese government to help influence policy in furthering trade and investment within the Free Trade Zones (Tianjin and Guangdong in particular). The project also aims to help influence new supply side structural reforms that focus on cutting low-end supply while increasing high-end supply of goods and services by stimulating business through tax cuts, entrepreneurship and innovation. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Promoting the healthy development of emerging industries in China
description: The project is designed to draw on UK experience to design and deliver training programmes on emerging industries to at least 160 senior government officials/business leaders. This will enhance their capabilities to develop innovation policies for emerging industries in China, whose implementation is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones

title: Improving China's urban city environment through operationalising the UK-China Urbanisation Platform
description: The project is designed to ensure the UK-China Urbanisation Platform enters into full operation, in support of the UK-China City Cluster Overarching Partnership, and the UK-China Smart Cities Partnership, as well as planning in China. This will improve China's urban city environment and liveability by supporting the Chinese government's development of relevant policies, whose implementation is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of Smart Cities policy in China
description: The project is designed to support the Chinese government on Smart City policy development using UK's Smart City standard and experiences, creating opportunities for international businesses, including from the UK.

title: Foster green growth in China by addressing overcapacity in the steel and shipbuilding sectors through industrial restructuring and upgrading
description: The project is designed to support the Chinese government to incorporate international best practices in cleaning up heavy and highly polluting industries, and ensure decisive actions are taken to address excess capacity in the steel and shipbuilding sectors. This will incorporate a green growth perspective.

title: Strengthening primary care capacity in China through training of General Practitioners in Paediatrics to help China's economic development and the health of its poor, thereby generating opportunities for international business, including from the UK
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to strengthen the training of Chinese GPs in paediatrics to improve their skills across diagnoses and treatments, in pilot cities. This project will enable primary care institutions to take on more responsibilities in dealing with child medical issues, relieving pressure on tertiary paediatric services. Chinese policy makers will use the pilot report to inform the establishment of tiered treatment guidelines. This is expected to generate commercial and collaborative opportunities for international entities, including UK ones.

title: Impact assessment of strategic programme fund projects conducted in China
description: An impact assessment to establish the successful impacts and outcomes from previous strategic programme activity in China, helping to identify opportunities for future interventions.

title: Supporting the development of the New Energy Vehicle industry in China
description: The project is designed to share UK experience to support the development of the New Energy Vehicle Industry in China: firstly, on policies and incentives for charging facilities; secondly, on innovation and technology in vehicles. It is intended that recommendations will be put forward to the Chinese authorities proposing detailed planning of charging facilities and adoption of a technology roadmap. If taken up by China, international businesses, including UK ones, will be in a better position to understand Chinese policies and identify trade and investment opportunities.

title: Supporting China's strategic development of its technology and satellite industries to promote international innovation and collaboration
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support China's development of a roadmap that identifies specific challenges and opportunities in its emerging technology and satellites industries. This will include supporting China's strategic development of satellite applications and data management and sharing mechanisms. China's technology and satellite industries are ones that underpin almost all of China's development priorities, including agriculture, health care, climate change, monitoring air pollution, and urban development. The project is intended to open international, academic, industrial and government collaboration. It supports China's intention to move to a sustainable economic model led by innovation, in line with China's Five-year plan. It is also expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in China
description: Programme facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in China.

title: Designing a carbon budget framework to achieve greenhouse gas emission reduction targets in Chile
description: To use UK experience to design a framework to enable Chile to track its progress against its 2020 and 2030 greenhouse gas emissions targets and assess the potential for raising its targets in the future.

title: Tackling climate change in Chile: design of an evaluation mechanism for demonstrating energy and greenhouse gas savings
description: Assisting in transition to a low-carbon economy through design of a Measurement, Reporting and Verification (MRV) mechanism of energy and GHG savings from projects and activities promoted by the new Chilean Energy Efficiency Law.

title: Integrating low carbon emissions targets into the evaluation of public investment projects in Chile
description: To use UK expertise in emissions criteria in infrastructure projects to ensure that the social price of greenhouse gas emissions is included when evaluating the economic impact of public investment projects in Chile.

title: Promoting sustainable mining in Chile: development and delivery of Continued Professional Development (CPD) short courses for miners
description: Promotion of sustainable best practice in the Chilean mining sector through the development and delivery of CPD short courses for the Chilean mining industry.

title: Promoting sustainable mining in Chile: building capacity in mine tailings hazard management
description: Promotion of sustainable best practice in the Chilean mining sector through building the capacity of the Tailings Department of the National Service of Geology and Mining (SERNAGEOMIN), Chile Ministry of Mining, to understand, identify, assess and model the physical and chemical hazards.

title: Tackling climate change in Chile: Supporting the development of an energy 2050 calculator
description: To provide Chilean decision makers with advice and information on mitigation actions which can be implemented to reduce greenhouse gas emissions

title: Promoting clean energy in Chile: optimal management of Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) infrastructure and contracts in the Chile energy system
description: Support the National Energy Commission in the regulation update related to Liquefied Natural Gas infrastructure and contracts in the context of the Chilean power system to boost competition and optimal use of assets

title: Promoting sustainable mining in Chile: Using UK expertise to boost water and energy efficiency in Chilean mining.
description: Promotion of sustainable best practice in the Chilean mining sector, addressing the issue of efficient water and energy demand resources management for Chilean mining industry through modelling of water supply system and optimisation of its operation.

title: Promoting green finance in Chile: exploring the opportunities for green banks and bonds
description: This project will explore opportunities to establish public/private partnerships known as green banks, as well as opportunities to establish a Chilean "green bonds" market, with the potential for attracting international investment.

title: Promoting sustainable mining in Chile: remediation of massive mining wastes
description: Promotion of sustainable best practice in the Chilean mining sector through remediation measures of massive mining wastes.

title: Introduce best practices on the development of Public and Private Partnerships (PPPs) that benefit Colombian citizens and ensure openness on procurement processes
description: To increase the professional capacity of the PPP Agency via the training of its members and for these professionals to be able to implement the PPP projects and programs to be developed by the City of Medellin. By this training and exposure to international projects, it is expected that the Agency will be in a better position to take the projects to market both at national and international level.

title: Use of SMART technology to improve Bogota's mobility and facilitate institutional collaboration
description: To contribute to the construction of a smarter Bogota by sharing key transport and mobility information and facilitating institutional collaboration, thereby expanding economic impact and increasing opportunities for international investment.

title: Use of Big Data to strengthen urban development and public transport investment in Colombia
description: Strengthening the economic impact of public transport investments in Colombian cities by pioneering use of mobile phone data in Cali to inform urban development and public transport planning.

title: Rehabilitation of mercury-contaminated mining lands in Colombia for renewable energy and other self-sustaining re-use strategies
description: The project will deliver change by providing a range of science based strategies to rehabilitate land affected by soil mercury pollution in disadvantaged areas in Colombia and bring it back into productive use focusing on renewable energy opportunities and/or other services as most appropriate; supporting the goals of increasing regional stability, facilitating sustainable economic growth, harnessing innovation in particular for low carbon development, supporting OECD accession, and identifying possibilities for new community enterprise.

title: Roadmap for public-private participation in the forthcoming Green Growth Mission of Colombia
description: To develop a roadmap for public-private participation in the Green Growth Mission of Colombia and improve Colombia's competitiveness by increasing private sector understanding and leadership on green growth as part of the OECD agreements for a resilient-low carbon economy.

title: Enhancing the capability of Colombia to regulate offshore oil and gas major accident hazard
description: To enable the Colombian government regulators to implement a regulatory framework that reflects international best practice in the regulation of offshore major accident safety hazards, thereby making the sector more appealing to international investment.

title: Catalysing energy efficiency in the Colombian industrial sector: boosting waste heat recovery, optimization of processes, replacement of boilers
description: To help accelerate Colombia's transition to a low carbon economy by taking advantage of energy efficiency opportunities through the evaluation, adoption and implementation of approaches and technologies for heat recovery, optimisation of industrial processes, and boiler replacement, and achieving scalability through the identification of financing opportunities.

title: New technologies for waste treatment and energy generation that helps accelerate Colombia's transition to a low carbon economy
description: This project will accelerate Colombia's transition to a low carbon economy by identifying the most feasible, and environmentally friendly methods and technologies suitable for waste treatment and energy generation, enabling to divert more of the residual waste that still exist away from the landfill and to capture renewable energy, and also, ensuring that the residual waste being used has the right renewable content and is matched with a plant that is efficient enough at converting waste to energy.

title: Introduce sustainable waste management to the Pacific Region of Colombia delivering a model that can be replicated across the country
description: Introduce sustainable waste management systems in Guapi and Nuqui, and develop a toolkit that can be used by other Municipalities in Colombia. The project's primary aim will be to address the urgent need to put in place appropriate waste collection and disposal measures whilst, in parallel, developing a medium term strategy focused on improving recycling/composting and treatment of residual waste to reduce landfill disposal. UK expertise will be showcased to main decision makers in the region and at National Level through the Ministry of Housing and Presidency programmes for poverty alleviation.

title: Promoting the development of smart grids by implementing Advanced Metering Infrastructure in Colombia
description: Structuring a programme for the implementation of Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI), including its associated ownership structure, for the Colombian electricity sector in order to facilitate integration of renewable energy technology at optimal cost, provide new services to customers and further the development of smart cities.

title: Scoping funds to support future development and welfare programming in Colombia
description: Scoping project opportunities to deliver significant primary and secondary benefit in the following areas: Education; Health; Mining; Financial Services; Energy; and Business Environment and Trade.

title: Scoping opportunities to unlock economic opportunities in Colombias post-conflict regions
description: This project involves a scoping study to inform the development, implementation and investment of the Prosperity Fund Colombia programme.

title: Scoping study for the future Global Trade Programme interventions relating to intellectual property
description: Scoping study to develop a programme to support strengthening protection for the enforcement of intellectual property rights in targeted ODA-eligible countries to enable future international trade. This will ensure future interventions are well-focussed and targeted on priority countries.

title: Scoping study for the future Global Trade Programme interventions relating to regulatory reform
description: Scoping study to identify the barriers to regulatory reform and good regulatory practice in targeted ODA eligible countries and develop interventions to improve regulatory reform and support the adoption of good regulatory practice. Improving the target counties ability to trade with the world (including UK), increasing their economic growth, employment and prosperity.

title: Scoping study for the future Global Trade Programme interventions relating to developing standards and quality of infrastructure
description: A scoping study to support the development of a programme that will help with the adoption of standards and quality infrastructure in targeted ODA eligible countries and to improve conditions and capability for international trade.

title: Scoping study for the future Global Trade Programme interventions relating to customs procedures and standards
description: A scoping study to develop a programme to support the development and access to international trade through the adoption of streamlined customs procedures and standards and to tackle corruption at seaports in targeted ODA-eligible countries.

title: Scoping study in the Eastern Europe and Central Asia Region to provide analysis for possible future programme interventions
description: A scoping study to provide analysis into possible project activity to improve the business environment in Ukraine, Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Georgia and Turkmenistan.

title: Scoping study to provide analysis for a low carbon energy transformation programme
description: Scoping study to help develop an ODA-eligible programme to support the low carbon transition in targeted developing countries and identify associated commerical benefits.

title: Scoping study to provide analysis for a global future cities programme
description: Scoping study to develop a programme to improve the planning and management of cities in targeted ODA-eligible countries.

title: Establishing the South East Asian Marine Energy Centre in Indonesia to enable a long-term sustainable strategy for marine energy in SE Asia
description: The project is designed to create a multi-national, multi-stakeholder platform involving the implementation of innovative practices that drives policy and capacity building to an international standard, as part of a long-term, comprehensive marine renewable energy programme, in Indonesia and beyond. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting regulatory reform by evaluating the implementation of business licensing deregulation in regions of Indonesia
description: This project supports effective implementation of economic policy packages. It provided training on streamlining of business licensing and evaluated implementation in six major business cities in Indonesia. Streamlining will reduce costs to business, opening market opportunities including for UK companies.

title: Producing a legal review to inform and analyse trade regulations in Indonesia, including on import-export procedures
description: The project is designed to produce a legal review, to identify and analyse potential problems on trade-related regulations in Indonesia, particularly on export-import procedures, and provide recommendations or propose solutions for improvement.

title: Supporting the development of a regulatory framework for renewable energy independent power producers in Indonesia
description: The project is designed to help Indonesia achieve its clean energy targets by supporting the development of a framework for a regulation on renewable energy independent power producers. This should lead to the generation of opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones, throughout the renewable energy supply chain (e.g. project management, engineering) and across sectors (e.g. marine, solar, geothermal) as the market in Indonesia develops.

title: Promoting integrity and legal transparency in the Indonesian maritime sector
description: The project is designed to promote integrity and legal transparency in the Indonesian maritime sector via a single point of contact at ports who will act as concierge for businesses and navigate the system on their behalf. This will remove barriers such as facilitation payments, and improve the ease of doing business for UK companies operating in Indonesia. The project will specifically target the port of Tanjung Priok and one additional port in Indonesia, and build on the work and methodology from phase one of the project.

title: Supporting Indonesia to develop its geothermal market, to assist the development of sustainable and clean energy
description: The project is designed to assist the Indonesian Ministry of Energy develop revised geothermal policies that will stabilise and open up the geothermal market, increasing economic growth, reducing climate change emissions, and generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Developing the Indonesian government bond primary dealer system and the domestic currency government bond market.
description: The project is designed to assist Indonesia's Ministry of Finance to develop a sound primary dealers system and recommend measures to promote the domestic repo markets. When implemented, the result is expected to be fairer, more transparent and robust Indonesian Rupiah (IDR) denominated government bond markets, which have improved liquidity and efficiency. This would result in lower systemic risk in the financial sector and accelerate the development of the Indonesian economy.

title: Supporting the improvement of Public Sector Accounting Standards in Indonesia
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise through a Government Auditors & Finance Officer capacity building programme in International Public Sector Accounting Standards. This will improve transparency, reduce corruption and enhance the prospects for companies in public procurement and infrastructure projects by aligning public sector accounting in Indonesia with international and UK standards.

title: Promote corporate governance and accountability programme in Kazakhstan
description: Engaging with Kazakhstani stakeholders to develop a corporate governance and accountability programme for the financial sector to open up opportunities for Kazakhstan and international business.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects

title: Supporting Malaysia to help meet its international climate change obligations
description: The project is designed to establish an effective road map for the implementation of the Intended National Determined Contributions including the necessary readiness programme for the adoption of the Paris Agreement. It will do this by developing a set of strategic policy inputs and recommendations to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment.

title: Supporting Malaysia to establish a low carbon city and green growth strategy for Greater Kuala Lumpur
description: The project is designed to catalyse low carbon transformation and green growth in key Greater Kuala Lumpur municipalities, by drawing on UK expertise to establish a low carbon city and green growth strategy. This will assist sustainable development and is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Developing a strategic UK-Malaysia collaboration to internationalise the Malaysian Finance Sector
description: The project is designed to support Malaysian ambitions to internationalise its Finance sector by exploring areas of co-operation. This will include creating a UK-Malaysia Finance working group focussing on key issues, including capital market development, insurance as well as broader financial and related professional services.

title: Establishing a Policy Framework to scale up Combined Heat and Power deployment in Malaysia
description: The project is designed to draw on local and international evidence to work with stakeholders in Malaysia and UK (including EPU, Energy Commission, Gas Malaysia, Federation of Malaysian Manufacturers, industries, equipment providers and banks) to demonstrate the opportunities for deployment of Combined Heat and Power in Malaysia and provide the evidence for the most favourable policy landscape to support this transition.

title: Supporting the development of transport solutions for Iskandar Regional Development Authority in Malaysia
description: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise in Smart Cities to support the Iskandar Region's sustainable transport policies and disseminate its results to other regions in Malaysia, mainly Melaka. This will assist the economic development of the southern business region in Malaysia and generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Improving Malaysia's business environment by tackling corruption and strengthening transparency
description: The project is designed to create a more market-friendly business environment in Malaysia by increasing support for legal reforms needed to tackle corruption and by increasing the amount of information related to government procurement that is available to businesses and the public.

title: Building the capacity of Malaysian law enforcement to tackle corruption
description: The project is designed to build the capacity of Malaysian law enforcement through the conduct of a training programme that will increase the agencies' knowledge and ability in profiling and evaluating truth and credibility. This will ultimately change perceptions, improve market access and create a levelled playing field' for international businesses, including UK ones, further addressing corruption's detrimental impact particularly on unfair business tendering or the smuggling of contraband, counterfeit goods.

title: Promoting urban energy reform in Mexico
description: The project will select one city (in consultation with government, business, NGO and other stakeholders) located in the Gulf of Mexico region to develop a Local Economic Development Action Plan intended to attract and retain financial resources, activities, jobs, and human capital derived from Federal Energy Reforms and translate them into a low-carbon sustainable urban development model, financially supported by a diversified economy and fostering long-term structural investments by March 2017.

title: Developing Future Cities in Mexico through UK-Mexico Knowledge Exchange Hubs, boosting businesses through match-making platforms for UK and Mexican SMEs
description: This project establishes Knowledge Exchange Hubs between Mexico and the UK working with King's College London, the National University of Mexico (UNAM) and the Mexico City government organisation LabCDMX. The programme will improve social behaviour and quality in education in line with Smart Cities best practices within Mexico City by March 2017, as well as linking UK and Mexico SMEs in the priority areas of road traffic safety, mobility and air quality. In turn this is designed to open new opportunities for UK and other businesses to introduce new services and technology to this sector.

title: Strengthen Mexico's capacity in the treatment of childhood cancer
description: The project will improve the Mexican Healthcare System's decision making policies in line with Smart Cities solutions by granting people access to digital tools for early detection and treatment of childhood cancer. This digital platform will help gather the necessary information to identify the training and equipment needs for private and public hospitals, creating opportunities to introduce UK experience and technology into this area. It will map institutional capability and indentify priorities for long-term international investment.

title: Improving Mexico's low carbon transportation systems
description: The project will assist Mexico City's Government will improve the delivery of effective and efficient low carbon urban mobility solutions through adoption of smart transport innovations and data use, such as Integrated Transport Systems (ITS), real time traffic control centres, traffic safety interventions, passenger information systems and open data. This will open the market to UK and other technology providers for this sector.

title: Support development of first comprehensive waste management strategy to improve Mexico's waste-to-energy and resource recovery capacity
description: This pilot project in Guadalajara will support the development of the first comprehensive, cost-effective, and sustainable waste management strategy in Mexico , the second largest metropolitan area in the country, and generate a road map for waste-to-energy and other resource recovery projects. This will further open the fertile opportunities for international business in this sector across the country.

title: Improving Mexico's ability to move to a low carbon economy through applying best practices
description: To support Mexican states' efforts to reduce their carbon footprint using UK best practice. The project will support state governments in their bid to lead by example by developing energy efficiency and other carbon reduction measures across their own estate of buildings, vehicle fleets and operational activities. The programme will support the delivery of credible and robust Carbon Management Plans (CMPs). This follows the proven methodology from the highly impactful and well received Low Carbon States pilot project with the State Governments of Jalisco and Tabasco (funded by the FCO's Prosperity Fund and delivered by the Carbon Trust in 2014/15). It opens the market in each state under the project to UK and other businesses wishing to enter the market.

title: Promoting Mexico's low carbon energy sector through the application of methodologies and tools.
description: To mobilise investment and research capacity in clean technologies in Mexico by supporting the Mexican Ministry of Energy (SENER) and the Mexican Centres of Innovation and Energy (CEMIEs) to create a suite of methodological tools. This will allow them to engage effectively with the private sector, prioritise technology-level initiatives and unlock green growth and sustainable development for Mexico through low carbon innovation. The programme will complement the roadmaps currently being prepared by the Mexican Institute of Petroleum and will open up opportunities for UK technology and research to enter the Mexican market.

title: Supporting a low carbon economy in Mexico through the promotion of best practice in the energy efficiency of buildings
description: The project aims to share UK best practice to empower Mexican cities to become low carbon hubs through the understanding of their main sources of emissions and simultaneously, offering them solutions in the implementation of the energy efficiency code in buildings. This will open the market for UK certifying bodies as well as UK business coming into the sector with new technologies.

title: Building capability and capacity in Mexico for the future needs of the energy industry and a low carbon economy
description: To design a set of strategies by March 2017 that will help the States of Campeche and Tamaulipas to have a roadmap for the development of the capability and capacity required by future market demands in the energy industry. This will improve the business environment in these states making it more attractive for international companies to do business there.

title: Assessing the potential of biomass energy as part of Mexico's energy mix in support of a low carbon economy
description: The project will assess potential cases for biomass energy production of new and existing processes in order to replace fossil fuels in Mexico, supporting the Ministry of Energy's development goals. It will identify potential synergies with UK and open opportunities for international companies with expertise and technology in this area to work in Mexico.

title: Promoting innovative financing options, including Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs), to finance energy efficiency projects and help move Mexico to a low carbon economy
description: Programme designed to foster the transition to a low-carbon economy, in the context of the Mexican energy reform, through the implementation of energy efficiency projects in areas related to health, education and/or other strategic public services using innovative contracting mechanisms such as Public Private Partnerships (PPPs) to increase green private investment. This project will also improve the Mexican economy and social welfare by boosting productivity and helping state governments to overcome budgetary constraints. The pilot project is to be implemented in benefit of the Jalisco's State Government. Carbon Trust's list of trusted technology providers will bring opportunities for UK and other businesses to enter this sector.

title: Developing a more effective oil and gas sector in Mexico by improving health and safety standards
description: The project is designed to build capacity and with UK expertise improve the effectiveness of Mexico's Regulators on issues around major accident hazards in the energy sector. Improvement of health and safety standards in the offshore oil and gas (and the construction sector) in Mexico by March 2017. This will not only bring UK expertise and consultancy opportunities but will also improve the general business environment for UK businesses wishing to work in this crucial sector.

title: Fostering local electricity generation for better energy supply in Mexico
description: The project will prepare a "2030 distributed generation roadmap" to foster the development and adoption of public policy for distributed generation in Mexico and accelerate its use at residential, commercial, and small and medium-size company level. This will open up the Mexican market, including to UK best practice and experience as well as UK technologies to be used in the sector.

title: Support improvement of Mexican regulation in the transportation and storage of hydrocarbons
description: The project is designed to support the Energy Regulatory Commission (CRE) to improve the regulation of transportation and storage of hydrocarbons, refined products and petrochemicals using UK expertise. This will allow the creation of a competitive market and achieve the development of infrastructure to support it improving the business environment and making it more attractive to UK companies wishing to work in Mexico.

title: Improving Mexico's Energy Storage capacity to boost renewable energy integration and foster the transition to a low carbon economy
description: The project will develop a framework to allow the building of energy storage capacity needed to integrate sources of renewable energy into the power grid effectively and achieve the Federal Government's clean energy goals in Mexico. This will also open up the renewable energy sector to UK and other businesses wishing to work in Mexico.

title: Building capability and capacity in Mexico's oil and gas sector to maximise benefits of energy reform
description: The project aims to build a comprehensive workforce development framework to address the skills gaps identified by the Ministry of Energy of Mexico (SENER). Using British expertise and experiences to ensure an improved business environment in the energy sector.

title: Support improvement of English language teaching in Mexico's primary schools
description: Support the development of English language education in Mexico by through UK methodology and by enhancing and certifying teachers in four states in Mexico.

title: Supporting educational reform in Mexico for an emerging market workforce
description: To support the fundamental reform of a nationwide curriculum and capacity building for Mexico's Ministry of Education.

title: Developing education evaluation techniques in Mexico through UK expertise.
description: Reinforcement of the school autonomy principle in Mexico, building on a bridging project by the UK's Quality Assurance Agency scoping visit identifying future collaboration.

title: Improving crime investigation by developing police technical capacities in the Mexican criminal justice system
description: The project will provide federal, local and municipal police institutions in Mexico with specific guidelines and a methodology to continuously evaluate and improve their crime investigation capacities.

title: Promoting anti-corruption mechanisms in Mexican law enforcement agencies
description: The project will develop a model to tackle corruption within the police at federal and state level. By the end of the project, three Memorandums of Understanding will be signed with State governors in order for them to commit to implement an anti-corruption model.

title: Improving public safety in Mexico through community policing pilot
description: The project will assist the Mexican government in the pilot implementation of the new Proximity Police Model. It will build capacity and provide learning for its future expansion, helping to reduce corruption and increase security

title: Improving institutional responsibilities in the reformed system in Mexico by promoting anti-corruption measures
description: Strengthening Mexican institutions to achieve maximum impact of the recently created National Anticorruption System. Key project activities comprise a mixture of: review of existing strategies, policies and procedures, bespoke capacity building and targeted consultancy activities to facilitate the implementation of the best practices endorsed. The proposed programme was requested to GovRisk by local stakeholder in order to ensure that a new Audit Quality Control Unit in accordance with international best practices, and a new best practice whistleblower system for public servants.

title: Increasing transparency in Mexico through the use of an open data start-up hub
description: The project will help deliver economic growth and transparency through data driven innovation. It will create simultaneous data innovation competitions in Mexico and the UK and connect businesses.

title: Promoting prosperity through open government as part of the Open Government Partnership
description: Helping three municipalities in Mexico develop and adopt an open government strategy. Implementing transparency, accountability and participation action plans driven by technology and citizen engagement

title: Tackling corruption in Mexico through the introduction of digital procurement processes
description: The project provides a free-access digital platform (Social Witness 2.0) and a mobile application, which will provide different stakeholders with two layers of information, increasing openness and transparency in procurement processes. Through this platform, key data contained among different public information systems will be identified and analysed in order to structure it as open data. This will allow interoperability among different information systems and the development of a set of technological tools. These tools aim to broaden independent procurement oversight.

title: Improving Mexico's capital markets by promoting new models in the crowdfunding markets
description: Adopting UK models and using UK expertise into the Mexican crowdfunding market will increase access to finance for SME's building a more robust economy to meet new global challenges. The new financial solutions created will help improve the broader private capital markets in Mexico by March 2017.

title: Improving Mexico's economic potential through greater understanding and use of Public-Private-Partnerships
description: A diagnostic analysis of Mexico's Public-Private-Partnership (PPP) environment and guidelines to increase institutional awareness and capacity to support this financing method at regional, state and municipal levels. The project will showcase regional examples and UK expertise with a view to opening opportunities for international companies, including from the UK.

title: Development of a climate finance hub to stimulate Mexico's low carbon economy
description: This will create a climate finance hub to develop financial instruments to support Mexico's transition to a low carbon economy.
