The project will work with UK and Mexican private and public sectors to create new and replicable trading methodologies for Mexico's financial markets. These markets will then be able to interact more easily with the international financial markets.

title: Support Mexican rule of law through implementation of criminal statistics audit model
description: To promote a legal framework that will institutionalise a sustainable audit model of criminal statistics in Mexico helping build rule of law capability.

title: Improving the justice system in Mexico by strengthening the framework for public defenders
description: Using UK expertise to improve the professionalism and autonomy of public defenders, strengthening the right to an effective defence and oral trial practice under the new adversarial system.

title: Increasing financial inclusion across the poorest communities by piloting mobile financial technology in Mexico
description: A pilot will provide financial inclusion in marginalised communities within Mexico's largest social development programme. The project will provide an insight into the habits and needs of Mexico's most marginalised and vulnerable in order to produce better public policy. In turn this will open new opportunities for UK and other business to engage with wider sectors of society in Mexico increasing market access.

title: Mexico: Scoping opportunities in Jalisco and Nuevo Leon
description: Scoping will identify current constraints and opportunities for future interventions in three strands of Mexico's Prosperity focus: Business Environment, Energy and Future Cities, in the Mexican regions outside of the capital.This will result in interventions tailored to deliver focussed primary benefit and as a consequence have the potential to also generate a secondary benefit - increased opportunities for international businesses.

title: Promoting best practice sharing in deepwater oil and gas exploration and development in Mexico
description: Showcase UK capabilities across the supply chain in developing oil & gas deepwater projects which Mexico is starting to carry out as a result of their Energy Reform programme.

title: Promoting marine and run off river energy to increase energy diversity in Peru
description: To inform Peruvian Government of potential for marine and run off river resources to further Peru's sustainable energy diversity and provide concrete recommendations for next steps, including use of UK expertise.

title: Promoting investment in renewable energy in Peru
description: This project will identify and address the legal and fiscal barriers to investment in renewable energy in Peru, map the potential for low cost, locally appropriate technologies, and specify pilot initiatives for quick implementation in rural areas, thus creating a market including for UK companies.

title: Improve health standards in Peru by developing a National Blood Service pilot
description: To show practically how a safe and adequate supply of blood components and related services could be made available in Peru, including using UK expertise, reducing mortality from a lack of blood in surgical and emergency facilities.

title: Facilitating the distribution of household renewable energy technologies in Peru
description: To increase clean energy usage in the Loreto region, Peru and develop income opportunities for Peruvians via a scalable pilot of a micro-distribution model for renewable energy technologies, including market-leading British brands, using a trained network of community agents. This will help enable low income families to meet their energy needs.

title: Providing scalable solutions to energy access in rural areas in Peru
description: To increase rural electification rates in remote areas of Peru by demonstrating a variety of off-grid applications for integrated solar energy storage systems, including those developed in the UK, providing a scalable solution to this barrier to economic development.

title: Improving connection of mobile healthcare facilities in rural Peru, extending the reach of healthcare facilities to remote areas and offering opportunities for the UK and international business
description: To improve healthcare provision in remote areas via enhanced connectivity in mobile healthcare facilities. This will help to improve responsiveness, quality and range of services in poorer remote areas and allow patients and practitioners access to better medical information. The project will provide opportunities for UK and international business within the medical sector through the use of new health technologies.

title: Improve Tuberculosis control in rural areas of Peru via mobile laboratories
description: To deliver a portable TB laboratory to reduce TB prevalence in remote areas, and demonstrate effectiveness of this type of mobile clinic to meet Peru's rural healthcare needs.

title: Developing a model sustainable home for low-income populations helping to tackle poverty in Peru
description: Develop a model domestic dwelling that is safe, cheap and sustainable and can be deployed nationally to tackle a severe shortage of sustainable housing in Peru's poorer urban areas, including using UK innovation.

title: Improving governance, quality assurance, leadership and internationalisation in Peruvian Higher Education
description: Drive improvement in Peruvian Higher Education through technical assistance and training for the education regulator and upskilling researchers and leaders, including through building closer ties to world-class UK institutions.

title: Support the regional implementation of Peru's national English Language Policy
description: To increase Peru's competitiveness and capability through supporting the implementation of its national English Language Policy in different regions of the country, drawing on UK best practice.

title: Transforming English Language Teaching in Peru
description: Increase standards of English language education in Peru by authoring a revised Initial Teacher Education programme for all Year 1 & 2 trainees and Year 3 English specialists, together with development of teacher Monitoring and Evaluation instruments for use in the school system, including showcasing UK expertise in this sector.

title: Promoting energy efficiency and sustainability in Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SME) in priority sectors in Peru
description: Delivery of a scalable pilot programme with clusters of Peruvian SMEs to identify key market failures and overcome known barriers around lack of awareness, access to finance and public-private collaboration in the provision of clean, sustainable energy solutions, increasing energy efficiency in Peru and providing opportunities for suppliers, including from the UK.

title: Support technical education in rural Peru across Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education
description: To increase demand in technological careers in Lima and Ica regions in Peru by delivering innovative and inspirational technology training based on STEM Education Programme to poorest and rural zones high school's students via the design, delivery and management of a mobile laboratory, based on UK expertise and promoting UK best practice.

title: Help Peru maximise its investment in hosting the Pan-American Games to bring lasting social, economic, urban and environmental legacy, helping to foster economic growth while providing opportunities for UK and international business
description: The project will help ensure a social, economic and environmental legacy to the Lima 2019 Pan-American Games, drawing on UK knowledge and experience at London 2012 and Glasgow 2014. The project will help to ensure sustainable development and inclusive economic growth are outcomes from the delivery of a clearly articulated legacy vision. Opportunities will also be created for UK and international businesses.

title: Improving heart disease diagnosis systems in Peru
description: To make diagnosis of heart disease more accurate and cheaper for patients and doctors in Peru by introducing innovative, low-cost Magnetic Resonance Imaging diagnosis technologies and expertise from the UK.

title: Central Administrative Costs of ODA Programme
description: Central programme facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA programme.

title: Supporting the Philippines to enhance transparency and integrity through increased reporting and evidence gathering of corruption
description: The project is designed to create, by February 2017, a crowd sourcing platform and social media campaign that will reach more than five million people, get 100,000 people to pledge to report corrupt acts, generate at least 2,000 citizen reports of bribery and other forms of corruption, and provide evidence for the filing of administrative or criminal cases; leading to greater transparency and integrity in government.

title: Supporting the delivery of a lower carbon and more secure energy future for the Philippines
description: The project is designed to establish a coalition of government and energy stakeholders to develop an energy policy roadmap to support the use of liquefied natural gas as the economic, energy-secure and low-carbon solution to the Philippines' power needs in the immediate future. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of a judicial framework for the Philippines' first National Competition Policy
description: The project is designed to support the Philippines to set in place its first National Policy for Competition. Its successful implementation hinges heavily on setting the necessary judicial framework, developed through bilateral exchange between the Supreme Court of the Philippines and the UK counterpart competition agency, with training of relevant judicial bodies; thus levelling the economic playing field among local and foreign players through competitive policies in key sectors and boosting sustainable and inclusive growth in the country.

title: Promoting economic growth in the Philippines by creating new mechanisms to increase international business participation in Public Private Partnership projects
description: The project is designed to, by 2019, promote the use of alternative mechanisms and an innovative framework to increase foreign investors' participation in Philippine infrastructure projects by at least P7 billion and make the Philippine PPP market more globally competitive, in view of the limitations on foreign equity ownership set in the Philippine constitution.

title: Building capacity to reduce corruption and improve the business environment in the Philippines
description: The project supports and builds the continued effective anti-corruption interventions by the Office of the Ombudsman that improve the Philippine investment climate and overall country competitiveness, particularly through capacity building workshops and development of official modules on standard practices involving investigation and prosecution of graft and corruption cases, in close partnership with the National Integrity Centre.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in India
description: Programme facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in India.

title: Supporting Chinese innovation in business
description: This project is designed to work with Chinese and UK stakeholders, to identify business-led innovation priorities to help address China's socio-economic challenges. This will support China's intention to move to a sustainable economic model led by innovation, in line with its Five-Year Plan, and will generate opportunities for international business, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of China's legal system to help improve the business environment
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to strengthen the process of legal and judicial reform in China in a manner that helps to promote the rule of law as well as improve the business environment. It will do this by developing a new UK-China legal and judicial cooperation mechanism which will enable both sides to address common legal and judicial challenges arising from economic development and the advance of technology. This will generate opportunities for international business, including UK ones in the legal and judicial sector.

title: Promote understanding and cooperation in China of the UK's common law legal system
description: This project is designed to promote understanding of the UK's common law legal systems and enhance legal cooperation with leading Chinese experts. This will advance the rule of law overall as well as enable a series of new specialist projects as part of a UK-led Rule of Law for Prosperity Programme. This programme will foster joint work with China that will support more sustainable national development and stable economic growth, generating opportunities for international business, including UK ones.

title: Producing a scoping study for a rule of law programme in China
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on supporting and strengthening the rule of law in China.

title: Supporting the development of China's international legal capacity
description: The project is designed to enhance engagement with an increasingly influential community of Chinese international law scholars who are involved in advising the Chinese government on a wide range of international law issues. These issues include international trade law and international dispute settlement processes. This will improve the business environment in China, bringing benefit to international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the improvement of Chinese financing for infrastructure projects
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to help Chinese policy makers adopt improved methods for financing infrastructure projects This will generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting China to improve compliance with international and local standards in infrastructure investment projects.
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to help China improve compliance with international standards in infrastructure in third countries in China's One Belt One Road (OBOR) initiative. This will help create sustainable infrastructure in OBOR countries; and generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Producing a Scoping Study for a China life science and healthcare programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on life science and healthcare in China.

title: Supporting the delivery of vocational education in Ningbo, China
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support the city of Ningbo to set up a framework to support the delivery of vocational education in two key priority skills areas  Advanced Manufacturing and Port Logistics. This will generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Promoting UK-China collaborations to build China's workforce skills in the visual and broadcast industries, supporting China's move to a sustainable economic model led by innovation, generating opportunities for UK and international business
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to help China reform its system of education qualifications and Continuous Professional Development in its visual and broadcast industries. It will support China's intention to move to a sustainable economic model led by innovation, in line with its five year plan, and is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Strengthening the enabling environment for financing and concession development in China
description: The project is designed to draw on international best practice (including UK experience) to recommend ways in which China might strengthen its system of financing and concession in infrastructure work. This will also deepen awareness of the legal and regulatory environment among the development and reform commissions of local governments, entrepreneurs and other market participants.

title: Promoting UK-China collaborations to enhance the employability and enterprise skills of Chinese graduates, supporting China's move to a sustainable economic model led by innovation
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to help Chinese graduates enhance their employability and enterprise skills, including through online training and support. This will help drive economic growth in China, supporting China's intention to move to a sustainable economic model led by innovation, in line with its five year plan. This is also intended to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones

title: Supporting the implementation of a national apprenticeship framework in China
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise in Technical and Vocational Education and Training to contribute to a national global standard apprenticeship framework in China, with enhanced competency based teaching and learning and industry engagement. This will support China's intention to move to a sustainable economic model led by innovation, in line with its Five-Year Plan, and will generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of entrepreneurial and networking skills in China
description: This project is designed to implement a successful UK-China joint student enterprise pilot programme and recommend a strategy for broader roll-out and implementation. This will contribute to China's economic growth and strengthen relationships between the UK and China.

title: Producing a Scoping Study for a China low carbon programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on low carbon development in China.

title: Producing a Scoping Study to explore collaboration opportunities with China in developing a capital markets policy programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on developing a capital markets policy programme in China.

title: Producing a Scoping Study to explore collaboration opportunities with China in developing an asset management policy programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on developing an asset management policy programme in China.

title: Producing a Scoping Study to explore collaboration opportunities with China in developing an Insurance policy programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on developing an Insurance policy programme in China.

title: Producing a Scoping Study to explore collaboration opportunities with China in developing a Fintech policy programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on developing a Fintech policy programme in China.

title: Producing a scoping study for an early years education sector programme within China
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on the early years education sector within China.

title: Producing a scoping study on possible collaboration in the Chinese Aerospace sector
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource to collaborate in the Chinese aerospace sector.

title: Producing a scoping study for a Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Maths education programme in China
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Maths education in China.

title: Fostering cooperation on infrastructure and utilities and their investment and financing by way of concession between China and UK (Part B)
description: The project aims to will have strengthened Chinese knowledge of infrastructure investment and policy dialogues between the participants within the area of infrastructure and utilities, and their investment and financing by way of concession. It will establish and strengthen the related legal and market systems, improving the sustainability, quality and efficiency of public services, and promote steady and sustainable economic growth.

title: Producing a Scoping Study for a China Sustainable Infrastructure programme
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for use of future Prosperity Fund resource for a Prosperity Fund programme on creating a UK-China Sustainable Infrastructure Programme in China and third countries.

title: Development of China programme business case
description: Activity to improve the design of future programming by informing the development of interventions that better target the primary purpose and the secondary benefits of the Prosperity Fund. Ensuring the programme targets on the priority sectors and delivers value for money.

title: Producing a Scoping Study for a future programme on education development in South East Asia
description: The project is designed to scope the opportunities for a future Prosperity Fund programme on education development in South East Asia

title: Improving transparency and preventing corruption in public procurement in Thailand
description: The project is designed to promote good governance and a competitive business environment in Thailand by preventing corruption in government contracts and improving professionalism in public procurement. It is expected that this will level the playing field for international businesses looking to invest, including UK ones.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Turkey
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Turkey

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in Turkey
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Turkey

title: Strengthening the enforcement of Intellectual Property Rights in Vietnam
description: This project is designed to increase the effectiveness of intellectual property rights enforcement in Vietnam, to reduce IPR infringements, deter production of and trade in counterfeit and to create a healthy business environment for enterprises. It will do this by enhancing the capacity of enforcement agencies; building the legal basis for Market Surveillance; strengthening the cooperative relationship between enforcement agencies and the private sector; increasing the cooperative relationship among relevant agencies; and increasing the awareness of enterprises and authorities.

title: Improving the business investment environment in Vietnam through supporting the implementation of foreign arbitral awards
description: The project is designed to enhance the capability of authorities and stakeholders in Vietnam, including its Ministry of Justice, to support Vietnam's effective implementation of the 1958 New York Convention on Recognition and Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards (FAAs) and increase successful recognition of FAAs generating opportunities for international business including UK companies. This will involve Vietnam establishing an Action Plan and a cooperating, collaborating and monitoring mechanism

title: Promoting the application of international standards of business integrity in Vietnam
description: The project is designed to promote the application of international business integrity standards to business associations and groups of businesses in Vietnam through the support for anti-corruption solutions and engagement with public and private stakeholders drawing on Transparency International's experience in promoting business collective action in other ASEAN countries, in order to help improve the business environment, including for international businesses in Vietnam.

title: Supporting Vietnam to meet its international obligation in reducing green house gas emission in line with Paris Accord.
description: The project will draw on UK expertise to provide hands-on technical support to the Vietnamese government over the next three years, by assisting the inventory compilation team and associated Ministries/Agencies to meet international climate change through the implementation of the National Greenhouse Gas Inventory System, as mandated by the Prime Minister, generating opportunities for low carbon investment from UK financial institutions and companies

title: Supporting Southern-Vietnam Solar Photovoltaic Development to enable improved energy efficiency and reduced costs for business
description: The project is designed to provide assistance and technical support for industrial and commercial businesses to increase rooftop solar capacity in Ho Chi Minh City, Binh Duong, Dong Nai, and Long An to 1,200kW by December 2018. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the development of Vietnam's capital market and Public Private Partnership financing framework.
description: The project is designed to support the development of financial markets in Vietnam through improvements in the policy and regulatory environment for government and corporate bonds facilitating both domestic and international investor participation (including the UK). It will improvd management of the Viability Gap Funding scheme, part of the Memorandum of Understanding between the UK government and Vietnamese Ministry of Finance and create a favourable business climate for companies operating in Vietnam. The Public Private Partnership framework will increase opportunities for UK companies to participate in large infrastructure projects and enhance quality and transparency of those projects.

title: Supporting Vietnam to prepare the required legal frameworks to implement free trade agreements and benefit from trade liberalisation.
description: The project is designed to improve Vietnam's trade and investment framework by reviewing it against the requirements of forthcoming comprehensive free trade agreements and providing comprehensive and accurate information on the ASEAN Economic Community (AEC) trade policy. With a more liberal and AEC-integrated market, Vietnam will become beneficial destination and meaningful hub to AEC for UK trader and investors.

title: Building the capacity of Small and Medium Enterprises to resist corruption in Vietnam
description: The project is designed for a local anti-corruption education programme to provide Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) with practical means to strengthen their resistance to corruption, implement the best international compliance standards in their business operations, and develop opportunities for collective action, thereby encouraging competition, growth, and business confidence as well as opening up benefits and opportunities to UK companies that have SMEs in their supply chains.

title: Strengthening the capacity of the Supreme People's Court of Vietnam in handling foreign commercial cases and requests
description: The project is designed to strengthen skills in handling foreign commercial disputes and requests on enforcement of foreign court judgments and arbitral awards. It will provide training courses on international experiences and national provisions and dissemination of court precedents on international commercial disputes. Supporting the improved quality of resolutions on foreign commercial disputes and creating favourable conditions for foreign business communities (including UK business).

title: Supporting Vietnam to meet its international climate change obligations by accelerating implementation of priority energy sector actions.
description: The project is designed to support the Government of Vietnam to accelerate the implementation of the priority energy sector actions (including policies and measures) of its Intended Nationally Determined Contribution ahead of 2020, by outlining the costs, benefits and implementation strategy for key measures that drive renewable energy and energy efficiency. This is expected to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Design and development of China Programme
description: Activity to improve the design of future programming by informing the development of interventions that better target the primary purpose and the secondary benefits of the Prosperity Fund. Ensuring the programme targets on the priority sectors and delivers value for money.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in China
description: Programme facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in China.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in China
description: Programme facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in China.

title: Global Forum on Asset recovery
description: This project has supported the Global Forum on Asset Recovery, which supports the return of stolen assets to legitimate governments. The first part of UK funding enabled the Forum to be established, with the following countries being the main focus; Nigeria, Sri Lanka, Ukraine and Tunisia. Further work will continue to facilitate technical cooperation in order to ensure the return of assets to these countries. Corruption disproportionally impacts British business ability to invest overseas. Tackling corruption is necessary to level the playing field for the UK. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Research to understand the culture of corruption in Latin America
description: Using UK expertise, the project ran three pilots looking at areas of corruption in public services and construction sectors across three Latin American countries. This worked to reduce corrupt practices and strengthen processes throughout the supply chain and scope how best the UK can develop support to other countries in these areas. This will help create a level playing field for international and British businesses. Corruption disproportionally impacts British business ability to invest overseas. Tackling corruption is necessary to level the playing field for the UK. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Supporting the promotion and development of effective protection of intellectual property rights in China
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to support the development of China's intellectual property system, including through online protection, traceability and copyright collective licensing. This project will lay groundwork for the Rule of Law pillar of a China programme to work towards a stronger rule of law including clearer judicial processes, dispute resolution and protection of intellectual property. This will work to generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies

title: Collaborating with Municipal Governments on Public-Private Partnerships to improve the effective delivery of infrastructure projects in China
description: This project is designed to support key municipal governments in China to develop Public-Private Partnership programmes and projects that enable the effective delivery of infrastructure projects. Infrastructure is vital to China's economic growth and poverty reduction. Through pilots, the project will identify opportunities for international, including UK, companies to partner with Chinese counterparts to deliver major projects, also laying the groundwork for the Infrastructure pillar of the China prosperity programme.

title: Scoping study to analyse gas infrastructure access and opportunities around pricing regulations reform in China
description: This project will scope activity on natural gas market reforms in China for the Low Carbon and Energy pillar of the forthcoming multiyear China Phase One prosperity programme. It seeks to research China's prioritisation of reforms and support the removal of the main barriers hindering China's attempt to increase the share of natural gas in its energy mix. By pursuing prosperity partnerships, it is also expected to generate opportunities for international business, including UK companies.

title: Scoping Study to assess the potential for partnerships to deliver infrastructure projects in developing countries along the Belt and Road corridor
description: This project is designed to promote prosperity partnerships and support the sustainability of China's contribution to economic growth in developing countries along the Belt and Road corridor. It will provide an evidence base for a report to determine priority regions and countries, including where the UK-China Infrastructure Alliance might set up satellite offices. This project will lay groundwork for the Infrastructure pillar of the forthcoming China prosperity programme. This pillar will promote the involvement of international best practice in design, engineering, financial, professional and legal services, and environmental and social standards in growth enhancing Chinese led projects.

title: The project will research the development of the New Energy Vehicle industry in China
description: This project is designed to respond to high Chinese demand for collaboration on New Energy Vehicle (NEV) policies, research and commercial opportunities. Via research and engagement, the project will define NEV activities for recommended implementation in the Clean Technology strand under the Energy/Low Carbon pillar of a China prosperity programme. The programme will match China's specific reform needs with energy and low carbon sector strengths, reducing global emissions by accelerating China's energy transition.

title: Promoting Chinas Alignment with International Standards for Animal Testing.
description: The project seeks to reform Chinas animal testing laws, associated regulations and codes, aligning them and Chinese industries practice with internationally-recognised standards, including the reduction of unnecessary animal testing in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals. This will help Chinas science policy to develop towards a more open environment for international innovation collaboration, in sectors which will drive future economic growth. This will also facilitate the removal of trade barriers, thus generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Financial Conduct Regulation: UK Principles, Experience and Implications for China
description: This project will develop and deliver a pilot training programme on financial conduct regulation with UK best practice. There are significant risks in the Chinese financial system and there is a pressing need to enhance regulatory capacity and frameworks to ensure the stability and sustainability of the Chinese financial system. This is not only of critical importance to China's domestic economy it is also of key interest to the global economy. The project is a foundation for the Financial Services pillar of a China prosperity programme. This pillar will work to promote financial sector reform though sharing policy and private sector expertise, and capacity building in the Chinese regulatory sector, to enable a transition to a more efficient, productive, inclusive economy.

title: Promoting infrastructure development in developing countries involved in the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) through stakeholder engagement workshops
description: This project is designed to bring together UK, Chinese and third country business and government stakeholders. It will contribute to the sustainable development of infrastructure projects in developing countries, primarily those involved in China's Belt and Road Initiative. The overall programme will lead to more productive, higher quality and greener overseas infrastructure investment that delivers social and economic benefits and contributes to poverty alleviation. It will also generate opportunities for international business, bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including; Rule of Law, Energy and Low Carbon, Financial Services and Infrastructure.

title: Strengthening UK-China infrastructure investment in developing countries as part of the Belt and Road Initiative
description: The project will include a High-Level stakeholder engagement roundtable and a Belt and Road Financing Workshop, to discuss obstacles to and recommendations for progressing infrastructure project delivery and financing along the Belt and Road, leveraging international expertise, best practices and methodologies. The project is designed to contribute to the sustainable development of infrastructure projects in developing countries, primarily along the Belt and Road (BRI) region. The overall programme will lead to more productive, higher quality and greener overseas infrastructure investment that delivers social and economic benefits and contributes to poverty alleviation. It will also generate opportunities for international business, Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including; Rule of Law, Energy and Low Carbon, Financial Services and Infrastructure.

title: Updating scoping study for a China healthcare programme
description: The project is designed to review and update the findings from a previous scoping study [project code: SCOCHP000008 ] to take account of developments in the sector. The updated study will scope the opportunities for a future Prosperity Fund programme on healthcare in China, Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete  including; Rule of Law, Energy and Low Carbon, Financial Services and Infrastructure.

title: Promoting transparency and compliance with international standards on anti-tax evasion and anti-money laundering in China
description: Through a three day forum this project is designed to facilitate dialogue between the public and private sectors and increase the knowledge of the financial industry and the wider corporate world on common reporting standards, offshore tax evasion, public private partnerships and wider anti-money laundering issues. Stronger regulation will assist in reducing tax evasion and money laundering and help improve poverty reduction and economic growth. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete  including; Rule of Law, Energy and Low Carbon, Financial Services and Infrastructure.

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in the Digital Access Programme
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in Digital Access [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative Costs of ODA Projects in India
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA projects in India [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Development and design of ODA programme in India
description: Development and facilitation costs to cover the design, research, consultations and preparations of the India ODA programme

title: Supporting inclusive growth through a review of opportunities and experiences of India UK collaboration
description: Analysis of the success and challenges of previous partnerships and explore the future collaboration between India and the UK. The aim of the project is to identify opportunities to support inclusive urban growth in India and open up market opportunities for international business and investment, bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including, energy and low carbon; urban and smart cities; ease of doing business; financial services; and skills.

title: Strengthening Green Leadership in India through assessment of current opportunities and possible opportunities for scaling up of low carbon approaches.
description: The project will assess factors that constrain and enable corporate action on low carbon approaches in India. The project will recommend how Indian businesses can scale up low carbon approaches (particularly renewable energy and energy efficiency solutions). This will provide Indian companies with a roadmap for enhancing their strategic Green Leadership and their contribution to achieving India's climate change targets (Nationally Determined Contributions). Helping Indian businesses to create green jobs,  stabilise Indias energy security, and reduce Indias climate change impact through improving energy efficiency and expanding their use of renewable energy. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including, energy and low carbon; urban and smart cities; ease of doing business; financial services; and skills.

title: Global Infrastructure programme staff costs for Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy in Vietnam.  The programme will facilitate better development, & operation of major infrastructure projects.
description: Vietnam project Staff costs for Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy costs for the Global Infrastructure Programme, a Prosperity Fund programme designed to boost infrastructure investment and markets for ODA-eligible middle income countries. The Programme will facilitate better development, design, finance, procurement and operation of major infrastructure projects and programmes. Delivery of the Programme will unlock economic opportunities, increase prosperity and reduce poverty in partner countries whilst enhancing opportunities for international, including UK, business. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete.

title: Administrative Costs of Prosperity Fund Renewable Energy and Regulatory Reform in Indonesia
description: Project facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA programme in Indonesia. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Prosperity Fund Mexico Administration Costs
description: Administration overheads for running the Prosperity Fund in Mexico

title: Promoting investment in the Mexican energy market by building institutional capacity to support efficient and effective regulation.
description: A series of scoping studies that will research opportunities to support the continued development of three key aspects of the new Mexican energy market: recommendations for an efficient and effective Clean Energy Certificates market; best practices to improve and maximize the benefits of the tender processes for High Voltage Direct Current electricity transmission lines; and a set of policy recommendations to increase energy efficiency in transport. Better energy regulation will improve the efficiency of the system, reducing prices and improving accessibility for the poorest. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Developing a sustainable skills strategy for energy sector regulators in Mexico
description: This project aims to contribute to the development of a sustainable leadership skills training strategy for Mexican regulatory institutions, through the delivery of a pilot training programme using UK expertise, as well as the provision of a detailed plan for its subsequent rollout. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Building capacity and empowering health and safety regulators in the Mexican energy sector.
description: Through the use of UK regulatory expertise, this project will work closely with Mexican energy regulatory institutions in order to empower them with increased capacity and knowledge to support the adequate enforcement of health and safety regulations in the new energy Market. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Supporting Mexican cities in the implementation of Building Information Modelling (BIM), Low Emission Vehicles and Local Urban Sustainable plans to foster urban development and innovation.
description: By the end of March 2018, this project will aim to have standardised BIM implementation in Mexico to improve the logistics of the infrastructure sector. UK expertise in future cities will also help the project support the development and structure of a low emission vehicles strategy and urban sustainable mobility plans in 3 key Mexican cities, helping reduce pollution and congestion for the benefit of wide Mexican society. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Increasing financial inclusion in Mexico by supporting female beneficiaries of Mexicos social development programme to move from cash to digital banking channels.
description: The project will deliver a first wave of transitions to digital transfers as part of a Randomised Control Trial.  It will feed into the design of a protocol that will increase the adoption of digital bank transfers for Mexicos largest social development programme, targeting financial access and inclusion for Mexicos poorest women.  Moving to digital bank transfers mean that these beneficiaries (generally women in poverty) will avoid losses via corruption or insecurity, and receive the education to understand how to use their accounts.  Which will increase their inclusion in the financial sector, helping them access other financial products in the long-term and reduce informality rates, while helping the financial services market grow sustainably across the country. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Improving the Mexico's financial services sector through the development of 1) an open banking standard and 2) green finance in Mexico at national and subnational levels
description: The Project aims to increase depth, coverage and consumer choice in Mexicos Financial Services sector through the development of a roadmap for the adoption of an Open Banking Standard in Mexico; and to support the consolidation of the local environmental capital markets in Mexico, which will contribute towards Mexicos implementation of its Climate Change agenda. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Promoting best practices on the implementation of an efficient and inclusive Digital Governance through the development of a National Artificial Intelligence Strategy in Mexico.
description:
Promoting best practices on the implementation of an efficient and inclusive Digital Governance through the development of a National Artificial Intelligence Strategy in Mexico.
By the end of March 2018 this project will encourage the implementation of a Digital Governance Policy in Mexico through the design of a national artificial intelligence strategy, learning from UK best practice. The strategy will support the improvement of public services through the use of new technologies with the objective of boosting economic and social development, especially for those in poverty. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Developing a roadmap for capacity building and institutional strengthening of law enforcement agencies working in community policing and criminal investigation skills.
description: Creating a coordination mechanism that will provide Mexican Authorities with the skills and capacities to implement National Anti-Corruption Systems at the State level. This will support Mexican States to deliver anti-corruption measures, resulting in better more effective public services with the objective of boosting economic and social development especially for those in poverty. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Open Data as tool to reduce corruption in the Energy Sector in Mexico
description: Promoting a data driven culture in policy making by designing a pilot that will identify data gaps that will contribute to identifying corruption in the Energy Sector in Mexico. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Capacity building to implement local Anti-Corruption Systems through peer to peer evaluations
description: Creating a coordination mechanism that will provide Mexican Authorities with the skills and capacities to implement National Anti-Corruption Systems at the subnational level. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Developing anti Bribery Protocols to reduce Corruption in Mexico
description: This project will provide recommendations, using UK best practices in anti-corruptions that could be incorporated into the proposal for the Anti-Bribery Protocols in Mexico. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete including Energy, Future Cities, Business Environment and Financial Services.

title: Departmental Central Administrative Costs of ODA Programme
description: Central programme facilitation costs covering planning, implementation and resources as part of ODA programmes. [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line.  You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up other identifier information.]

title: Administrative costs of Prosperity Fund Low Carbon Energy Programme in South East Asia

title: Strengthening anti money laundering regulations in Myanmar
description: The FCO is working with an NGO in the delivery of the project that is designed to provide technical assistance to strengthen Myanmar's Anti-Money Laundering regulations ahead of and during its next Financial Action Taskforce in-country assessment. Stronger regulations will reduce money laundering and help improve economic growth and reduce poverty reduction. Bringing benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete, including Business Environment and Ease of Doing Business.

title: Brazil: Scoping funds to support future development and welfare opportunities in Brazil
description: The scoping study will provide economic analysis of the priority areas of development and welfare in Brazil. This will help identify the immediate and longer-term requirements for Brazil helping to direct future policy and programme activity.

title: Establishing a platform for safety testing of cosmetics in China to eliminate unnecessary animal testing and align with international norms
description: This project is designed to draw on UK expertise to establish a platform for the safe testing of cosmetics in China, which eliminates unnecessary animal testing. It is intended that, by 2018, China's cosmetic regulators will be engaged in economic and trade policy coordination with the UK and will begin reform of China's regulations, toward alternative approaches to ones involving animal testing. This is expected to lead to an improvement in the sustainability of industry growth, and facilitate the removal of trade barriers, thus generating opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Embedding international standards for the ethical use of research on animals in China.
description: The project is designed to encourage collaboration between UK and Chinese scientists, so that by 2018 there will be UK-China compatibility of animal welfare standards, as well as an ethical review, developed in collaboration with the China Rural Technology Development Centre, the Chinese Association for Laboratory Animal Sciences and the Development Research Centre of the State Council. Revised Chinese regulations and standards of animal welfare will meet international standards and subsequently significantly promote scientific collaborations between China and international businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting China to join the OECD Mutual Acceptance of Data system to reduce unnecessary animal testing
description: The project is designed to strengthen China's domestic institutions (Ministries, etc.) through harmonisation with international data acceptance standards for the testing of human medicines in animals. This will remove trade barriers, improving China's economic development and ease of access to internationally (including UK) produced pharmaceuticals, and end expensive and unnecessary duplication of animal testing. This is also expected to generate opportunities for international pharmaceutical businesses, including UK ones.

title: Supporting the enhancement of Indonesia's legal and institutional framework to counter corruption
description: The project is designed to provide technical assistance to enhance the legal and institutional framework for fighting and preventing corruption affecting and involving the private sector in Indonesia. International businesses, including UK ones, are expected to benefit from this.

title: Establishing Monitoring and Evaluation mechanisms for the Cross-government Prosperity Fund
description: To design and procure monitoring and evaluation systems for the Prosperity Fund. This will provide specialist skills to programmes and enable effective portfolio management at Fund level. We will use this system to help drive value for money and effective delivery of the Fund's objectives
